New SearchLogin PagePosition DescriptionGraphic Design InternEmployment TypeUp to 40 Hours per WeekLocation NameCorporate OfficeLocation City and StateSt. Louis, MOApply Now  Position:                               Graphic Design Intern ‰ÛÒ Summer 2017Reports to:                            Lead Graphic DesignerAre you a Difference Maker?  The Dierbergs Difference starts with you!Dierbergs Markets is currently looking to add a talented Graphic Design Intern to our creative team for the summer! Our summer intern will be responsible for design and production support of advertising materials for print, web, email, social media and in-store signage.What you need:Must be enrolled in 3rd or 4th year of accredited college/universityMust be pursing degree in Graphic Design or related fieldExperience working on a Mac and Adobe Creative SuiteA successful candidate will be:Team-orientedOrganizedDetail-orientedAbility to perform multiple tasks simultaneouslyAble to quickly adapt to changing prioritiesWhat you‰Ûªll gain:Opportunity to gain hands on experience in a corporate advertising department, supporting a strong and established St. Louis brandChance to hone in on your design skills and learn from a great team with a number of years in the industryPaid Internship ‰ÛÒ Weekly Pay!Work hours:  8am-5pm Mon ‰ÛÒ Fri (can be flexible)    BackEmail Apply Now

Home Jobs Digital Media Intern ‰ÛÒ Nonprofit Marketing Search Jobs Login - Development Indianapolis, IN, USA Internship Email Me This Job Are you visually creative but analytical too? Do you thrive on the fast pace of social media marketing? Do you care about the reason behind your work? If so, check out this opportunity at Children's Bureau, Inc., one of Indiana's most progressive nonprofits, working to protect children and preserve families.  We're looking for a motivated designer/wordsmith to produce content for four social media platforms (Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn). This intern works with the Children's Bureau's communications content strategist to educate and engage multiple audiences. "Interning with Children's Bureau was a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience working for a nonprofit while simultaneously giving back to my community. Collaborating in a fun, team atmosphere enhanced my knowledge of social media, event planning, corporate relations, and ultimately provided me with the skills necessary to start my career." ‰ÛÒ Jessica Almon, 2015 Children's Bureau Intern   WHAT YOU'LL DO Plan/implement weekly social media content Create graphics for use in social media, website and more Track/report social media metrics Updates and SEO for childrensbureau.org Assist with creating/scheduling email campaigns Collaborate with other interns WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR  The successful candidate will: Be an excellent writer, detail oriented, efficient and willing to learn Be able to think creatively and strategically at a fast pace Have good organizational skills, integrity and great follow through Minimum of intermediate design skills with a knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (emphasis on Photoshop/InDesign/Illustrator) Basic HTML, CSS, or experience with WordPress a plus Knowledge of video editing software a plus  THE FINE PRINT 40 hours per week Must have access to reliable transportation Language requirements: Fluent written and spoken English This is a paid internship with a stipend awarded at the end of 12 weeks.   Children's Bureau is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally-protected status. Employment Listings EspaÌ±ol Marketing Co-Op/Intern Tracking Code 606-241 Job Description Overview ‰ÛÒ GCP Applied Technologies Construction Products is comprised of two businesses:   Specialty Construction Chemicals (SCC): A worldwide supplier of products for the construction industry with a goal of offering customers a compelling mix of products, services and technologies that are differentiated, offer sustainable value and reduce cost.   Specialty Building Materials (SBM): Our products are used to protect and enhance building structures in commercial construction markets globally. Market access is primarily through either distributors who supply contractor/applicators or directly to specialty applicators.   Corporate Headquarters is Cambridge, MA Easily accessible to public transportation On site fitness club Subsidized Cafeteria     Job Description   One Year Internship beginning June 2017 We are looking for individuals to identify, scope-out, and determine actions to support strategic growth initiatives in programs highly visible to upper management. The co-op will support directly the Global Marketing Director to:   Assesses global marketplace dynamics, barriers and opportunities; Understand product line financial, P&Ls, accounting and business operations to maximize gross and operating margins; Set marketing vision and articulate 3-year strategic plans to establish organizational objectives (Strategy Plan); Develop and articulate the annual global marketing business plans and budgets to deliver profitable growth and maximize global market opportunities (Operating plan); Improve business performance tracking tools and dashboards Establish clear and quantifiable performance indicators for marketing programs Support other projects as required for marketing and General Managers Required Skills Qualifications:   The candidate should be pursing an MBA and have completed course work in marketing and/or finance. Strong analytical, project management, organizational and communication skills required. Skills in working with Microsoft Office and other analytical tools are required. Knowledge of SAP and a technical background and/or experience in the construction industry would be a plus.   Job Location Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular Apply   Connect Who do you know at GCP Applied Technologies Share Return To Job Listings  å© 2017 GCP Applied Technologies Inc.

Summer Internship Opportunities Location: NJ - Mahwah Department: Jaguar Land Rover Marketing & Sales Description Jaguar Land Rover North America‰Ûªs summer internship program is a great opportunity for college students entering their junior or senior year, or who are currently in a graduate school program, to gain hands-on experience in the exciting world of the automotive industry!  This is a great opportunity for personal growth and development from a business and learning perspective.   Details of the program:         The program is open only to students at a Junior or Senior level in their Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree program, or who are enrolled in a Graduate School program.         This is a summer internship (running form June through August 2017), and the successful intern must be able and willing to commit to the full length of the program.         Intern is asked to work for 40 hours per week in the Mahwah, NJ office (Business hours are Monday through Friday 8:30 AM ‰ÛÒ 5:30 PM).     Outline of Role: We are currently have three summer openings, one in each of the following departments: Customer Relationships & Insights Finance Commercial Aftersales/Business Analytics   The successful interns will gain hands-on experience and exposure to how our business runs.  Supporting our teams on special projects and initiatives that impact customer experience, customer retention, business strategy.  Interns will perform analysis of data, and prepare reports and make recommendations.  Interns will assist with monthly national and regional reporting, and verification of data, and work with his/her respective team on how to improve processes and performance.   These internships will provide an opportunity to develop business acumen, leadership, and project management skills, as well as develop analytical and reporting skills.   Key Criteria for Role: Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in progress (Junior or Senior), or pursuing a graduate studies degree (in Business, Marketing, Finance, or related discipline); 3.0 GPA or higher; Intermediate to advanced Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills, and previous data manipulation experience is a plus; Strong communication and presentation skills; High level of professionalism; Detail-oriented, self-starter, strong work ethic, team player,  ability to build rapport and communicate confidently; Self-starter and ability to work independently or with teams as required; Ability to leverage insights to draw sound conclusions and translate them into actionable recommendations.   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Home Search openings Search results Current page Job details     Job details   Job 1 of 1 Submit to Job   Save to cart   View similar jobs   Position Title B2B Strategic Marketing Intern Auto req ID 7982BR Company Momentive Performance Materials Inc. Location US NY Waterford Country USA Function Marketing Company Overview Based in Waterford, New York, Momentive Performance Materials Inc. is a global leader in silicones, quartz and advanced materials, with a 70-year heritage of innovation and being first to market with performance applications that improve everyday life. Our solutions are found in products that touch nearly every facet of modern living and we work closely with some of the biggest brands in B2B and consumer worlds, covering a broad range of markets - from aerospace and automotive, to building and construction, personal care, and electronics. Momentive materials are found in products that touch nearly every facet of modern living. At Momentive, we believe that leadership begins with integrity, ethics and environmentally sound operations. When you work for Momentive, you are partnering with a company that is not only focused on delivering value but on doing it in a safe, ethical and environmentally responsible manner. Company Distinction This exciting opportunity is part of Momentive Performance Materials Inc. Position Overview Momentive Performance Materials is currently accepting applications for our 2017 Summer Internship Program! The 2017 Summer Internship Program is designed to expose students to the many facets of business and culture within Momentive. Interns will have the opportunity to work on project-based, real work assignments that directly align with their educational experiences. If you are seeking an internship in an innovative, challenging, and growing environment this opportunity may be for you!     This person will assist our Americas Electronics Commercial team by analyzing, evaluating, and developing strategy for our ‰ÛÏIndustrial Retail‰Û Distributors.  He or she will be expected to evaluate these distributor‰Ûªs business capability, strategy, web site, product and service portfolio, ‰ÛÏgo to‰Û marketing strategy, sales performance, and price offering.  He or she will also be expected to work with our Commercial team on a cross-functional basis to learn our history and processes with them, and later articulate a cross-functional strategy that supports all functions at the end of the assignment.  Goal of their project will be to create a ‰ÛÏworld class‰Û B2B strategy that supports all stakeholders to grow Industrial Retail Distributors 2X their current rate.   Job Responsibilities Commercial Marketing via B2B relationships Distribution Sales Product Knowledge Technical Transactional and Value Chain (position for growth) Price Management Evaluate pricing in the market vs competition Articulate future price actions in support of growth Evaluate Sales performance Evaluate Channel Partners based on ‰ÛÏcost to serve‰Û, scalability, etc Competencies Strategic Marketing ‰ÛÒ How to grow in a complex Business to Business (B2B) environment via strategic planning developed from fact-based decisions/ assessments Understanding of how Distributors support the value chain and how to position them Ability to quickly learn from leaders in our commercial, cross-functional teams ‰ÛÒ perspective(s), needs, how they align to each other Ability to analyze commercial data and present back to stakeholders Ability to evaluate growth potential via web site analysis, surveys to distributors, price offering assessments Ability to develop and communicate a strategic marketing plan that conveys a strategy, desired outcome and specific tasks to get there Minimum Qualifications Junior or Senior in an undergraduate degree program Other We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, minority status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability or any characteristic protected by law. In order to be considered for this position candidates are required to submit an application for employment through our career site, be at least 18 years of age, willing to take a drug test and submit to a background investigation as part of the selection process. Candidates are required to have unrestricted authorization to work in the United States. If currently an employee of the Company, you must have current satisfactory work performance and in most cases, have been in your current role 18 months. Disclaimer: We are not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms/employment agencies for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee about this position. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee of the Company via email, the Internet or in any other form and/or method without a valid written search firm agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of the Company; no fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by the Company as a result of the unsolicited referral or through other means. #HACKYOURLIFE is all about helping people build their dream life by teaching them “the basics” that they either never learned, or they forgot how to apply to keep their life moving forward in a positive way.#HACKYOURLIFE is a brand new startup company that is recruiting several individuals as interns, with the drive and the talents to do the digital marketing for our business. These talents can range anywhere from personal assistant, graphic design, copywriting, web page creation skills, to blogging, podcast creation, video production and social media message promotion.If any of the following below describes you, then you may be perfect for this internship:Your talents have not been properly recognized by your previous employers, and you’ve probably had quite a few jobs in your recent past. You are ambitious and want to make your mark in this world by making a difference in people’s lives. You know that if the right opportunity presented itself, you would gladly jump aboard to learn what you needed to make that possible.You know you need money to take care of your needs and wants, but money is a secondary motivation for you. In fact you would work a second job that paid you what you need, and work for free if you found the right opportunity. You realize that many people pay money for college and then never use that education. Given the choice, you would rather get your education through a mentor who could guide you to making the sums of money you need and want in order to live a life of meaning.Does this sound like you? Send your resume to us for our consideration immediately!For more information and to apply for this position, please click on the link below:https://monte-bateman.clickfunnels.com/squeeze-pageynw1ktc9Job Type: Internship

Narrative Description:The Social Media Content Coordinator works with the Social Media Account Manager, Strategy Manager and Strategists to develop social programs and content for 451 Marketing’s clients. The role requires the ability to manage multiple, concurrent projects and initiatives while maintaining a positive attitude and energy.The Social Media Content Coordinator will serve as a full-time community manager for 2-4 brands, including monitoring all social properties, creating unique and engaging content, designing social media imagery, and assisting in building social media promotions and other initiatives. The Social Media Content Coordinator must have strong creative and professional writing skills and will work with the team to brainstorm and create social initiatives to grow the assigned communities.Responsibilities:Act as a community manager for 451 Marketing clients’ social media platformsCreate daily content for multiple social media platforms across different industry verticalsBuild social media creative imagery for daily contentMeasure and optimize content based on analyticsAssist in developing social media program initiatives to improve community size and engagementCommunicate with team on a daily basis to maintain awareness of updates and offeringsFind and implement new social strategies, tools and tactics as they developBecome fully immersed in the clients’ brand and cultureDelegate responsibilities to social media interns as neededCandidate Objectives & Job Specifications/Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree (marketing or related field preferred)Experience in a marketing role or internship preferredOutstanding written and verbal communication skillsExperience with Photoshop and other graphic design programsExceptional sense of creativityStrong familiarity with the business applications of social media platforms, including; Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, Google+, Instagram and moreAbility to ask questions and learn new skills quickly on the job; be a self-starterExcellent organizational skills with the ability to handle and prioritize multiple projectsMotivation to take responsibility and ensure successful outcomes across activities; be a driven team playerProficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel)Basic html and video production skills a plus*External and internal applicants, as well as position incumbents who become disabled as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act must be able to perform the essential job functions (as listed) either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation to be determined by management on a case by case basis.451 Marketing is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity. Applicants for employment and employees are reviewed on their individual qualifications for a position. Under no circumstances will 451 Marketing discriminate against qualified persons on the basis of race, color, religious creed, retaliation, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity/expression, disability, mental illness, genetics, choice of health insurance, marital status, age, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited under applicable lawJob Type: Full-timeJob Location:Boston, MARequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Social Media: 1 yearSocial Media Marketing: 1 yearMarketing: 1 year

We are looking for an enthusiastic Content Marketing Intern to provide creative ideas and support to our digital marketing team. A2 Advertising is an agency focused on the grocery store market with an office in Kansas City (West Bottoms). You will have duties in development and administration of content marketing, including social media and video production.As our Content Marketing Intern, you will collaborate with our digital marketing team in all stages of marketing campaigns. Your insightful contribution will help develop, expand and maintain our channels and platforms.This internship will help you acquire and expand your content marketing skills and provide you with knowledge of various digital strategies. Ultimately, you will gain broad experience in an agency environment and will become prepared to enter any fast-paced workplace.ResponsibilitiesSchedule social media posts on Facebook, Twitter and InstagramWork with social media coordinators to create and curate engaging content for grocery store customersCreate short food and recipe videos for use on social media pages for grocers nationwideAssist in preparing promotional presentationsPerform research and analysis activitiesSupport the digital marketing team in daily administrative tasksRequirementsJunior or Senior currently enrolled in program for Broadcast, Multimedia Communications, Public Relations, Journalism or related fieldStrong desire to learn along with professional driveSolid understanding of storytelling in marketing and/or journalismSkills in video editing using Premiere Pro or similar softwareWorking knowledge of social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram)Competent in Microsoft OfficePassion for the marketing industry and its best practicesThis is a paid part-time role. We are seeking an intern with 15-20 hours of availability during office hours (8:30am-5:30pm) weekly, beginning in May 2017. Ideally, we are seeking an intern who wishes to continue through the school year.Please send your resume, cover letter, and portfolio link (optional). Please, no phone calls.Job Type: Internship

ABH Pharma is a startup nutraceutical vitamin manufacturing facility located in Brentwood Suffolk County. We partnered with 20+ year old ABH Natures Products manufacturing facility to provide best-in-industry customer support, sales, and marketing. Since our first year here we have tripled sales and are rapidly expanding.Currently we are seeking a full-time digital marketing manager to assist the CMO in daily marketing tasks.We want to start off with a Paid Full-Time Internship for 1 Month, leading into a full-time position.Job duties:Devising strategies to drive online traffic to the company website.Tracking conversion rates and making improvements to the website.Developing and managing digital marketing campaignsUtilising a range of techniques including paid search, SEO and PPC.Overseeing the social media strategy for the company.Managing online brand and product campaigns to raise brand awareness.Managing the redesign of the company website.Improving the usability, design, content and conversion of the company websiteResponsibility for planning and budgetary control of all digital marketingEvaluating customer research, market conditions and competitor data.Review new technologies and keep the company at the forefront of developments in digital marketing.Requirements of the roleBachelor degree in Marketing.Qualified member of the CIM or equivalent.Experience managing PPC, SEO and Affiliate programmes.Strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategy and best practice.Experience in ecommerce, SEO, PPC, Email marketing, and social media.Previous experience in a similar digital marketing role.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $36,000.00 /yearRequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Marketing: 1 year

DescriptionSr. Vice President of Intellectual and Developmental Disability Services (IDD)Reports To: Chief Operating Officer (COO)SUMMARY OF PROFESSIONAL FUNCTION:The Senior Vice President (SVP) of Intellectual and Developmental Disability Services provides strategic leadership of a diverse service delivery system and business development to the organizations residential, day habilitation, vocational, community habilitation, service coordination, self-direction, nursing, and other OPWDD related services. The Sr. Vice President of Intellectual and Developmental Disability Services is responsible for quality outcomes for the people we support and the Agency’s financial health and success through leading the Agency’s Senior and Middle program leadership to ensure high quality, effective, viable, and profitable services.The SVP is responsible for leadership planning and implementation of a diverse array of services and supports designed to ensure that each person with special challenges reaches their highest potential and desired quality of life. The SVP leads a committed, knowledgeable and skilled team of professionals and support staff, developing a strong, dynamic and innovative workforce equipped to provide services with empathy, creativity, respect, knowledge and skill. Through the quality services provided individuals with special needs achieve their goals for employment and living, thus enriching the lives of these individuals, their families, and the community.The SVP ensures compliance with all current laws, regulations, and industry standards with a keen focus on using data to make informed decisions that foster quality improvement. The SVP plans and secures service expansion opportunities to meet the needs of individuals and families and the community and supports the operations of the organization. The SVP is also responsible for proposal and budget development, accomplishment of Corporate Plan strategies, key performance indicators and outcomes, Corporate Compliance, Utilization Management, staff retention and development, and living and actively promoting the Vision, Mission and Values of the Agency. The SVP cultivates and maintains relationships with key community, regulatory and political leaders and markets the services, while seeking out and securing business development opportunities. The SVP negotiates and administers contracts related to service delivery under the guidance of the Chief Operating Officer.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSEstablishes and monitors agency goals and progress as outlined in the yearly Corporate Plan.Collaborates in the agency budgeting and planning process to ensure agency meets financial goals. This includes staffing plan to implement corporate strategic plan and new program development.Review, on a continuous basis, the general business climate for the agency to expand program areas and develop new business opportunities within the IDD service system, ensures excellent internal and external customer service, and maintains existing relationships with vendors.Develops and implements policies and procedures designed to promote agency philosophy within and outside the agency the agency and to build a positive agency image.Assist in the in the process of attaining higher agency productivity by analyzing organizational structure and systems, identifying resources required and communicating with pertinent program managers on the supporting strategies and needs involving agency strategies.Attend training or state mandated sessions associated with carry out regulations, trends and changing service delivery models to people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.Collaborates and ensures required habilitation and other plans are in place and followed to support consumers’ quality of life including following incident review process ensuring that all events are reported, investigated and corrective actions are determined and implemented to improve quality of service delivery.Leads review and administration of quality outcomes data through CQL POMs and the use of Evidence Based Practices including a trauma informed approach to working with individuals and families.Has demonstrated experience and expertise supporting teams that serve clinically complex individuals. Is aware of the industry best practices and Evidence Based Practice models, such as ABA, Trauma Informed interventions.SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITIES:1. Leadership: Oversees: 24-hour Residential houses, Community and Supervised apartments, Day habilitation, Service Coordination, Supported employment, Community Pre-vocational, Self-Direction, Community Habilitation, Individual Support Services, Respite Services and Nursing. Activities with the assistance of the following teams of Middle, Senior and Executive leadership, and as designated by the Chief Operating Officer.2. 800.303.6346 | CONTACT US LOGIN Planning Consolidation Discovery Back to AdaptiveInsights.com Product Marketing Intern Job Category: Marketing Location: Palo Alto, CA Type of Position: Intern Description Internship Program Summary: Adaptive Insights Internship Program provides university-level students with an opportunity to experience working in a corporate environment, while utilizing subjects and skills learned in school and applying them to real-world applications.  This is an exciting and enriching program, located at our headquarters office in Palo Alto, California in the heart of Silicon Valley.  In addition to working in their assigned departments, interns will also participate in weekly educational seminars focusing on career development, such as resume writing skills and how to run an effective meeting.  Additionally, team outings and events will provide interns a chance to network and bond with their Adaptive teammates, management, executive staff, and other interns.  Our internships are not just a job, but an experience.  We are looking for individuals who want to grow, learn, and collaborate with the best and brightest that make up Adaptive Insights and potentially stay on or come back to work for Adaptive Insights!  Duration: June 12th ‰ÛÒ August 18th, 2017 (~40 hours/week)   Role & Responsibilities: The Product Marketing Intern will report to the Vice President of Product Marketing. This paid intern position is an integral member of the team whose primary role is to define and execute Adaptive Insights‰Ûª product marketing strategy across horizontal solutions areas and industry verticals. This role will support projects across our product suite, including awareness and thought leadership, content for demand generation, sales enablement, and product strategy.   Assist in research projects for target market and industry Assist in the development and rollout of product marketing initiatives, including market entry Assist in the development of content and messaging for key target customer personas Support demand generation with proactive content Research and analyze key competitors   What you will learn/experience in this role:  At Adaptive Insights, you may join as an intern but once you walk in the door you‰Ûªre considered a bona fide member of our marketing team. You will learn entry-level skills in product marketing, from competitive intelligence to product launches. You will be included in team meetings, be responsible for work that supports others, own your projects/initiatives, and you‰Ûªll have the opportunity to grow your skillset and career based on your professional interests.   Qualifications: Rising Junior or Senior with an emphasis in Marketing Excellent communication skills: oral and written Research skills PowerPoint presentation creation Organizational skills Ability to meet new people and inspire them to collaborate Curiosity and a passion for learning Self-starter and ability to meet deadlines Desire to complete tasks on time with quality     Are you a returning applicant? Consultant internship position (San Francisco - USA) - Life Sciences Consulting Industry. We prefer for this person to start as soon as they can.Adivo Associates is an international consulting firm with eleven worldwide locations.Industry segments that Adivo serves include Fortune 500 Biopharmaceutical, Medical Device, Healthcare IT, Imaging and Diagnostic companies as well as financial service companies that invest in these industry segments.Adivo knows markets.All work at Adivo begins with our deep understanding of global and local markets, market segments and channels as well as customer segments and behaviors. From that basis, we identify unmet needs, size opportunities and assist our clients in addressing these through innovation and product development. Our engagements include corporate planning and strategy, innovation and design consulting, M&A and licensing due diligence, asset screens and product portfolio analytics. We have broad and deep expertise in strategy, market assessments, market entry/access strategies, competitive intelligence, pricing and reimbursement, and marketing communication support for product development and launch environments.Job descriptionAs a consultant intern with Adivo Associates you will be part of multi-national consulting projects within the healthcare industry:Collaborate in the fulfillment of consulting projects with special focus on global markets. This will require working closely with other consultants and project managers located in any of our global offices.Conduct primary research with healthcare professionals, industry players as well as industry associations and national agencies.Conduct secondary research of large data sets from various data sources.Collaborate in the analysis of quantitative and qualitative data for the development of financial models (i.e. eNPV), market models, economic impact models, health-economic models, as well as product adoption and acceptance models.Develop market landscape presentations, market entry strategies, product positioning strategies, and others.Work to solve complex business problems.Participate in meetings and presentations to clients across the globe.Your backgroundExperience within the healthcare industry.Marketing, management consulting and/or market research, reimbursement/pricing expertise is a plus.Flexibility to work within a multi-cultural interdisciplinary team across various time zones.Fluent in English and preferably speak one or more foreign languages.Self-motivated with exceptional organizational skillsAdivo offers:Paid Consultant internship positionDynamic and multicultural work environmentAdivo is an equal opportunity employer.Job Location:San Francisco, CA

Home Search openings Search results Job details     Help Job details   Job 1 of 1 Apply to job   Save to cart    Auto req ID 836BR Business Unit Mlive Media Group Title Mlive Media Group / Advance Local Marketing Internship City Grand Rapids State Michigan Job Category Marketing Posting (Advertisement) Mlive Media Group / Advance Local Marketing Internship    PROGRAM OVERVIEW: Advance Local, one of the nation‰Ûªs leading media marketing companies, is seeking talented and motivated individuals for a Summer 2017 Internship Program with positions in Content, Sales and Marketing. This paid national talent development program extends to Advance Local‰Ûªs affiliate companies located throughout Alabama, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, Central New York, Ohio, Oregon, Staten Island and Pennsylvania. Participants in the program will be immersed in one location for 8 weeks and then come together in the New York City area with fellow interns from across the country.  The 2017 summer internship program is designed to be a springboard for talented individuals with demonstrated interest and skills in journalism, marketing or sales.  POSITION SUMMARY: The Advance Local Sales and Marketing intern will work alongside the digital sales and marketing team to develop multi-platform advertising solutions for our local and regional advertisers. This person will report directly to an Account Executive and will help craft proposals and support the fulfillment of campaigns. The position offers the opportunity to gain an in-depth knowledge of digital marketing solutions, and to work with talented and experienced sales and marketing professionals. The Sales and Marketing Intern will have the opportunity to make significant contributions to the local media group as well as the larger community.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Day-to-day tasks and projects may include, but are not limited to: Participate in team strategy meetings focused on identifying prospects and developing plans to grow business Join Account Executive on in-person and telephone client calls Work with sales staff on pre-call strategies and proposals Attend training seminars on, among other things, company‰Ûªs comprehensive digital solutions and its products Other responsibilities as necessary to support the sales and marketing team Complete a project that will be presented to fellow interns and Advance Local executive at the summit SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES Ideal candidates will be goal-oriented, self-motivated and will have strong problem-solving skills Must be a current Junior or Senior Excellent communication and presentation skills required Must be able to quickly learn and become adept at using new technology Ability to work under deadline pressure and appropriately prioritize tasks Microsoft Office proficiency Sales experience preferred   APPLICATIONS DUE: Tuesday January 31, 2017   INTERNSHIPS BEGIN: Monday June 5, 2017       WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS General office environment. Extensive computer use required. Some travel required.   Advance Local, one of the largest media groups in the U.S. reaching more than 40 million consumers through its 12 local news and information websites that rank #1 among local media in their respective markets, and more than 30 newspapers. Our affiliated websites and newspapers are well known for their award-winning journalism. Advance Local is part of Advance Publications, along with CondÌ© Nast and American City Business Journals.  Advance Local is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, physical or mental impairment, sexual orientation or any other category protected under federal, state or local law. Skip to contentLanguagesNYSE $37.11NewsroomLocationsOfficesAECOMPrimary MenuCareers  ?HOME > SEARCH OPENINGS > SEARCH RESULTS > JOB DETAILS  Job details  Job 1 of 1Apply to Job(s)   Send to friend   Save to cart   Requisition/Vacancy No. 147874BRPosition Title Tank Closure and Regulatory 2017 Student Summer Intern (LSE)Job Category Vacation Student / Internship / GraduateBusiness Line GovernmentCountry United States of AmericaState/Province/Region USA - South CarolinaCity AikenWhy Choose AECOM? AECOM is a premier, fully integrated professional and technical services firm positioned to design, build, finance and operate infrastructure assets around the world for public- and private-sector clients. With nearly 100,000 employees ‰ÛÓ including architects, engineers, designers, planners, scientists and management and construction services professionals ‰ÛÓ serving clients in over 150 countries around the world, AECOM is ranked as the #1 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazine‰Ûªs annual industry rankings, and has been recognized by Fortune magazine as a World‰Ûªs Most Admired Company. The firm is a leader in all of the key markets that it serves, including transportation, facilities, environmental, energy, oil and gas, water, high-rise buildings and government. AECOM provides a blend of global reach, local knowledge, innovation and technical excellence in delivering customized and creative solutions that meet the needs of clients‰Ûª projects. A Fortune 500 firm, AECOM companies, including URS Corporation and Hunt Construction Group, have annual revenue of approximately $19 billion. More information on AECOM and its services can be found at www.aecom.com.About the Business Line GovernmentAECOM works with national and local governments around the world to manage and support critical programs in the areas of defense, security and intelligence; energy and climate change; environmental cleanup and waste management; infrastructure development, protection and resilience; and international development. Our global operations and connected expertise enable us to provide cutting-edge, relevant and cost-effective solutions that help our clients safeguard and enrich society and the world we live in.Job Summary Provide support to Savannah River Remediation (SRR) as a Student Summer Intern Limited Service Employee (LSE) on the Savannah River Site (SRS), a US Department of Energy (DOE) facility in western South Carolina. This assignment is for the Tank Closure & Regulatory group.  The intern will work with project managers to learn the different aspects of project management. Several tank closure projects will be working during the summer of 2017. These projects will be in different phases of development so the intern can learn a project from inception, i.e. design, procurement, through the actual field work involving fabrication and installation. Some systems may be in the testing, start-up, and/or operational phases so the intern can also be involved in the actual testing and operations phases of a project. The intern should have basic computer skills, i.e. Microsoft Word and Excel. Microsoft Project and experience creating graphics using Microsoft products would be helpful.The intern will perform meaningful work in support of the organization.  Guidance will be provided using SRR processes and procedures.  Interns will prepare and present a final project to the SRR management team summarizing conclusions about the experience, impacts delivered and relevance for their future career.Additional Information:The internship will run for a 12 week period from May 15, 2017 until August 3, 2017. Housing is not provided but reasonable rentals are available through the University of South Carolina-Aiken student housing office. A 40 hour work week is set and scheduled by the individual departments.  SRS utilizes various work schedules including 5/8s (8 hours/day; five days per week), 4/10s (10 hours/day; four days per week), etc.  Each work day has a 30-minute lunch.  Interns will be paid a competitive hourly rate;  no summer interns will be assigned to shift work; overtime is not available;  Interns will be paid for site holidays (Memorial Day, July 4) as applicable. Assignments will be located in SRR facilities on the 300sq mile DOE site outside of Aiken SC.  Public transportation is not available and interns will be required to arrange their own transportation.   A valid Driver‰Ûªs License, Registration and proof of automobile insurance is required for driving on the Savannah River Site.If you are selected to participate in the SRR internship program, additional information will be requested such as:  SRR employment application, references and official transcripts.  You will be assigned to SRS General Employee Training and Drug and Alcohol test appointments before badging and commencement of assignment. Resumes should be submitted as early as possible and will be reviewed by the selection panel in January/February 2017.  All selected applicants will be contacted by March 1, 2017.  Please visit www.srremediation.com for more information. SRR is the Liquid Waste contractor at SRS and is comprised of a team of companies led by AECOM with partners Bechtel National, CH2M and Babcock & Wilcox. Critical subcontractors for the contract are AREVA, Energy Solutions and AECOM Professional Solutions. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow.AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. Production and Merchandising Internship - Portland, MaineAlaina Marie is a small handbag design company - nautically influenced and made in southern Maine. We design and manufacture handbags made from a marine-grade mesh - the same material that lobstermen and fishermen use in the commercial fishing industry to catch their prey. We take pride in the care and creativity that goes in to each and every bag, and we are always looking for individuals that share the same enthusiasm as we do to join our team.Why intern with Alaina Marie?Alaina Marie is a small but quickly growing design company. This close knit community will allow you to engage in many pillars of the business, while giving you the chance to expand your knowledge and understanding of design and entrepreneurship.Joining this team will help you build the experience necessary to continue a career in the fashion industry - whether that is in production, marketing, trend forecasting, networking, visual merchandising or customer service.DescriptionProduction and Merchandising Intern (full-time) - Alaina MarieJune 1st - August 31stPaid or for college creditThe Production and Merchandising Intern will be responsible for many aspects of this growing company; from developing client relationships, to visual merchandising, to production and trend forecasting. While interning with us, you will split your time between our storefront and production facility, which will allow for a well-rounded understanding of both business + design.What you’ll be doing:Visual merchandisingBuilding client relationshipsSupporting production managementInventory managementPresenting creative ideas + conceptsEvent planningOrder fulfillmentTrend forecastingQualifications:Must be a current college or high school studentStrong interest in design + entrepreneurshipPassion for the people, the process and the productMust love dogsJob Type: Full-timeRequired education:High school or equivalent

This is a paid internship (June - Aug 2017) based at Alamo Group's Gibson City, IL manufacturing location (RhinoAg).  The Marketing Intern will assist Alamo Group Inc.'s Agricultural Division, and RhinoAg in Gibson City in performing customer data analysis and marketing support projects.  Reporting to the RhinoAg Director of Sales & Marketing, and in collaboration with Alamo Group's North American Agricultural Division VP of Sales & Marketing, this intership is an excellent opportunity to gain valuable exposure to current practices and initiatives in marketing and customer support, and how effective marketing programs contribute to success in today's business environment.     The selected intern will also: Assist with the development of dealer and end-customer profiles for the Alamo Group Agricultural Division Interface directly with RhinoAg in Gibson City, IL as well as virtually with business unites in Iowa, Alabama and Saskatchewan Canada, to assist with development of dealer and customer profiles and maps Participate in web-based market research projects to support Ag Division business units Assist RhinoAg in planning, preparing and presentation of the 2017 Rhino Sales Meeting Assist RhinoAg sales representative or sales manager on one or more customer visits in presenting product marketing information or material Assist with routine monthly Ag Division reports as assigned Assist with other routine Ag Division marketing tasks as needs arise   The selected intern will have/be: Proficient with MS Office desktop computer applications; to include MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint Strong verbal and written communication skills Sound analytical skills with the ability to research and analyze material and formulate well supported conclusions and recommendations Able to multi-task, organize and prioritize work Able to reason and use good judgement Intern must reside within a reasonable commute to Gibson City, IL during the duration of the internship (relocation assistance is not provided)   Education and Experience: Intern must be enrolled as a full-time student in an accredited undergraduate program pursuing a bachelor's degree in business, marketing, agriculture or similar program; preferrably, the intern will have completed at least two (2) years of undergraduate study. Working Conditions: Work will primarily be performed in an office environment indoors with frequent sitting for extended periods of time; occassional lifting of up to 10 pounds may be required in the performance of administrative duties and marketing/sales tasks. InternshipDevelopment, Grants & Events AssistantAlbany Police Athletic League, Inc.DescriptionThe Albany Police Athletic League, Inc. (PAL) seeks a highly energetic and motivated Masters Student who has the interest and drive to work in the field of non-profit Development, Grants & Events Management. The Albany Police Athletic League shall hire said individual with flexible hours based on their school schedule and the needs of PAL.The following duties/responsibilities shall apply:Shall work closely with and report to the Executive Director who shall set forth priorities from the tasks listed below and in consideration of PAL’s needs.Shall be responsible for all grant aspects of the PAL program including research, preparation and submission of all government, private sector and foundation grants, tracking grant expenditures, preparing and disseminating all required and otherwise requested reports, creating program participation reports and contract reports. The Development, Grants and Event Manager shall make regular reports to the PAL Board of Directors both orally and in writing.Shall be responsible for working with the Executive Director processing corporate and foundation funding requests, general marketing, and assistance with event planning, coordination and execution. The Development, Grants and Events intern shall track all donations, both financial and in-kind providing written reports of activity.Shall work with PAL staff to identify and review all new program initiatives to determine appropriate funding and/or grant sources and meet with all potential funders and prepare all materials necessary for the financial stability of new and existing programs.Shall work with all PAL community partners and members of the Board of Directors to track on-going satisfaction with funded programs and to secure additional financial and general support for PAL programs.Must have excellent writing, communication and organizational skills and be able to work independently. Must be able to work with all vendors including media, printers, graphic designers, and others hired or contracted by PAL.Shall be responsible for all clerical and communications functions related to this position to include web site maintenance, social media communications, E-News drafting and distribution and will accept additional assignments, as needed, at the request of the Executive Director. This may require negotiated schedule flexibility and seasonal changes.Must have proficient computer skills and the ability to work with all accepted office software and social media outlets including, but not limited to Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Flipcause, Kid Trax, Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn with the expectation of learning other software packages, including, but not limited to, QuickBooks and Publisher.Must be able to interact with all PAL clients, parents and community members and may be called upon to participate in some activities that could require a minimal amount of physical activity.It is expected that the Development, Grants and Event Intern will maintain existing donor base while identifying with the ED and Board New partners.Must Possess a Valid New York State Driver’s License and have a reliable vehicle at their disposal during work hours.Periodic performance and competency review benchmarks will be established in concert with the successful Masters candidate to effectively measure the success of the position.Compensation for this position shall be as follows:The successful candidate and PAL ED shall agree upon the compensation for this position. The hourly wage range will be $15.00 - $21.00 and require a minimum of 25 hours weekly and not exceeding 40 hours weekly.Organizational Goal:Albany PAL is seeking to develop the above-proposed internship into a full time paid position. The successful Masters Intern would be assisting in the development of said position and thus eligible to interview for the full time position when created.Job Type: InternshipSalary: $15.00 to $21.00 /hourJob Location:Albany, NYRequired education:Bachelor'sRequired license or certification:Driver's License

JOB DESCRIPTION Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career! alligatortek is the leader in developing software applications to fuel growth. Over the last 20 years, we have helped our clients to gain market share and expand their businesses by developing desktop applications and building web browser-based solutions.   We are a fun-loving and entrepreneurial organization with a strong vision for the future. Our proud, passionate employees are committed to doing great things for clients. We are currently looking for a Marketing Intern that enjoys variety and challenging work in a dynamic environment. This is a paid internship.  **Due to the high amount of applications received, only highly qualified applicants will be contacted.**     Responsibilities * Identifying trends in the technology sphere, and aligning them to our business  * Performing analysis of marketing and sales data  * Seeking and analyzing competitor marketing and sales materials both on and offline  * Providing support to social media/blog efforts  * Engaging with marketing team on a regular basis to brainstorm ideas for new and innovative campaigns  * Researching industry-specific sites (blogs, forums, etc) for product reviews, customer comments, and other relevant marketing information. Where good people build rewarding careers.Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.Job DescriptionAllstate Insurance Company has an exciting opportunity for individuals interested in a career in Sales Leadership. The purpose of the Associate Sales Manager (precursor to the Field Sales Leader position) is to assist in the Distribution Support, Sales and Service of Allstate Insurance products. Working with Allstate agencies regarding product selection and consulting to increase sales, generate profitable premium growth and increase market share in the Financial Services and Property and Casualty areas. Field travel is required.The position is also responsible for expanding our “points of presence” in the marketplace by both recruiting new agency owners and sourcing licensed staff for the agencies in their markets. The person suited for this exciting opportunity should bring sales and recruiting experience with them. Also, enthusiasm and the willingness to learn is major component to the success of the position.The length of the distribution leadership development phase is based on the selected candidate's prior experience, development plan and market availability. The scope of the training period is to learn about company distribution practices and demonstrate the application and mastery of sales and leadership concepts:Phases of training to include;Recruiting/Sourcing new agent candidatesEducationSales Leadership WorkshopLicensing: Series 6, 26, and 63Mini-Market SalesJob Qualifications3 - 5 years in Territory Sales Leadership strongly preferredProperty & Casualty/Financial Services sales experience strongly preferred4-year college degree preferredProven track record for obtaining business results through the development of effective internal relationships within the distribution organization and across other business functionsStrong business knowledge and the ability to develop effective internal relationships across business functionsMicrosoft Office product proficiency requiredLife/Health and Property/Casualty Licenses preferredAbility to travel for business needsThe candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component.For jobs in San Francisco, please see the notice regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance .It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.

Home Search openings Search results Job details     Help Job details   Job 1 of 1 Submit to job   Send to friend   Save to cart    Company Name Altria Grp Distr Co Position Title Undergraduate Intern Digital and Marketing Services Sub-Function Consumer Engagement Discipline Customer Service /Call Center Marketing City Richmond State Virginia Requisition Number 16744BR Job Description Altria Group is a FORTUNE 200 company that owns the premier tobacco companies in the United States including Philip Morris USA, U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company, John Middleton and Nu Mark. The companies‰Ûª brands include Marlboro, Copenhagen, Skoal, Black & Mild, MarkTen and VERVE. Altria also owns Ste. Michelle Wine Estates, one of the country‰Ûªs top premium wine producers, and Philip Morris Capital Corporation, an investment company. Altria‰Ûªs mission is to own and develop financially disciplined businesses that are leaders in responsibly providing adult tobacco and wine consumers with superior branded products.  Altria Group Distribution Company‰Ûªs role is to provide sales, distribution and consumer engagement services for Altria‰Ûªs tobacco Operating Companies. Within this operating company, Digital and Marketing Services‰Ûª role is to define digital and marketing leadership and execute programs to achieve leadership for our Operating Companies' brands. We are currently seeking highly qualified undergraduate interns to join our Digital and Marketing Services department in Richmond, VA.  JOB DESCRIPTION Our 10-12 week summer intern program in Richmond, VA, provides students the opportunity to participate in on-the-job training, access to mentors, planned social events, and educational opportunities. Students will be assigned to work on a project that is relevant to a current business opportunity. Additionally, students will document their project work in a formal report and presentation to Senior Management at the conclusion of the internship program.  As a Digital and Marketing Services Undergraduate Intern with Altria Group Distribution Company, the student will be assigned to a specific business area within Digital and Marketing Services for purposes of learning, assessment, and ultimate contribution.  The business areas include: ‰Û¢ Digital Operations o Marketing Campaign Execution o Channel Management ‰Û¢ Marketing Services o Event Marketing o Customer Care Operations Projects may include: ‰Û¢ Develop and enhance marketing programs for adult tobacco consumer promotions including: one-to one digital marketing, email, mobile app, direct mail and experiential/event marketing ‰Û¢ Evaluate and recommend event marketing execution strategies ‰Û¢ Optimize performance of digital platforms and recommend enhancements for user experience ‰Û¢ Assess existing customer care infrastructure and propose consumer touch point improvements ‰Û¢ Analyze business/program performance and recommend enhancements for future programs Specific Skills To qualify for the undergraduate summer intern program, students must be enrolled as a rising senior in good academic standing at the time of the internship. Specifically, we are looking for students working towards a degree in Business, Liberal Arts, or Information Technology at the time of the internship. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 is strongly preferred. We are looking for students who plan time and resources efficiently and possess strong strategic, analytical, and creative thinking skills. In addition, successful candidates must demonstrate leadership, initiative, and accountability, as well as exhibit strong verbal and written communication skills.  Candidates must pass a drug-screen and background check prior to employment. A Housing Allowance is available for students who qualify.  HOW TO APPLY To apply for and be considered for this position, please go to the careers website for the Altria family of companies, www.cantbeattheexperience.com, and post your resume. Please note that we do not retain resumes submitted outside of our application process and in order to qualify for our internships or co-op assignments, you must be eligible to work full time within the United States without sponsorship. NOTE* Each Altria company is an equal opportunity employer. We consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other protected class. Do you want to work on something that has impact? Amazon looks for students who are effective leaders with the ability to motivate, mentor, and engage. We need leaders who will have ideas on how to improve our processes and who arenÕt afraid to innovate. We need leaders who will embrace all the responsibility we give them and excel! Internships at Amazon are your opportunity to get meaningful real-world experience in your field of study, whether that be Finance, HR, Supply Chain, Operations Management, Facilities Management or Safety Management. Not only will you get a feel for how you can put what you're learning in the classroom into practice, you will also get invaluable exposure to top industry leaders who are consistently raising the bar at the world's largest online retailer. Job Description: Interns will rotate through the groups within the Global Communications team: á Consumer business: consumer goods on the Web site- everything from books to consumer electronics, to consumables. á Device PR team Kindle, Fire Tablets, Amazon Echo, Fire TV. á Amazon Video PR team: video content including our own originals. á Corporate Communications group: AmazonÕs corporate reputation. á Ops Communications group: Internal and external communications for our Fulfillment Centers, Customer service and innovations like Prime Air (Drones) and Prime Now. á And, potentially, AWS PR group, leading the way in cloud computing. Interns will likely have the opportunity to travel. We hold a media event in New York City each summer, and will likely have a few premiere events for Amazon Studios in Los Angeles. The opportunity to work on events like these is priceless. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS á Open to juniors and rising seniors á Any academic major Ð Diversity Encouraged! á 3.3 cumulative GPA PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS á Strong desire to learn along with professional drive á Excellent verbal and written communication skills á Experience working in fast-paced environment á Passion for the PR industry and its best practices

The Amazon.com Selection Economics team is looking for a new Sr. manager to lead a strategically important software development team in our growing Austin, TX Software Development Center. This position has high-level visibility, research and development responsibility, and spans disciplines including Computer Science and Economics. Ideal candidates will have experience leading software teams with a Mathematics or Economics focus.Watch this short video for more on SCOT: http://bit.ly/amazon-scotSelection Economics team owns the selection plan and management for all of Amazon retail programs, include Prime Now, Bookstores, Amazon Fresh and others. We also own the systems to improve the profitability of our “unlimited” Amazon selections. We build the machine learning systems to calculate the completed assortment plan and maximize the customer experience by taking the amazon internal data and the competitors' data into the consideration.You will be responsible for building the system and the automating the process, collaborating with other senior research and software development leaders at the company, and providing scalable software implementations of your team's systems.Responsibilities include the following:prioritization and planning of projects and featuresmonitoring, validation, and operation of production servicescareer management and development of reportsAmazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual OrientationBasic QualificationsBachelor of Science in Computer Science, Econometrics, Statistics, or related research field10+ years of experience in software development/engineering and/or research fields10+ years of engineering management experience5+ years of experience managing development managersExperience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systemsExperience recruiting, hiring, and managing a teamPreferred QualificationsExperience leading research-oriented software development teams.Understanding of system architecture and experience with large distributed systems. Experience in forecasting, causal effect modeling, quantitative finance, and/or econometrics.Experience leading managers of software development teamsThis leader must be technically credible to lead a team of world class software engineers and development managers and be able to make the right design decisions and technology choices.He or she must be able to balance technical leadership with good business judgment.Delivering the right product with a scalable engineering design under tight timelines is an essential skill.Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.Experience communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy.

Apply Now Sales and Channel Marketing Intern - Summer 2017 at Anki (View all jobs) San Francisco, CA Engineered to think. In a world‰Û_ where science fiction is constantly making promises that actual science can‰Ûªt deliver. Where phone booths don‰Ûªt teleport themselves, and zero calorie beer has yet to exist. One company had the courage to stand up and say, ‰ÛÏHey! Science! Where‰Ûªs my jetpack?‰Û Hi. We‰Ûªre Anki. When our Co-Founders Boris, Mark and Hanns met in the Ph.D program at Carnegie Mellon‰Ûªs Robotics Institute, they didn‰Ûªt dream about artificial intelligence that sends you speeding tickets in the mail, or shrink wraps shrink-wrap. They were united by a shared habit of saying ‰ÛÏHey, wouldn‰Ûªt it be cool if...?‰Û then actually making that cool thing happen.  Now, we know what you‰Ûªre thinking: we‰Ûªre just another all black-wearing, white cat-stroking bunch of weirdos designing laser-powered panini machines in an underground lair somewhere. Nope. Anki is made up of non-crazy people building crazy-cool AI and robotics that are reinventing physical entertainment. Sound crazy? Maybe. But crazy-in-a-good-way. Maybe that‰Ûªs why Apple CEO Tim Cook introduced our first product, Anki Drive, in his keynote at WWDC in June 2013. And why top-tier VC‰Ûªs including Andreessen Horowitz, Index Ventures, and Two Sigma trust us with their money. Anki is taking years of fancy research and incomprehensible 1‰Ûªs and 0‰Ûªs and turning them into exciting things that people actually want. Things they want real bad. Things they didn‰Ûªt even think could exist. Imagine impossible interactive experiences. Imagine video games in real life. Imagine jetpacks. And we‰Ûªre just getting started.  Excited? Us too. Visit the Anki website and find us on Facebook and YouTube to find out more about Anki - the future of consumer robotics and entertainment.  Job Description We are seeking a Sales & Channel Marketing Intern to support our team on a variety of strategic projects as we gear up for our peak Holiday season. This candidate will become an essential part of our team, with a unique opportunity to make a real, meaningful impact on our business. They will also gain invaluable experience in working with some of the largest retailers in the United States, including Amazon, Toys R Us, Target, Best Buy, and Apple. Duties and Responsibilities Conduct assortment planning and competitive analysis Conduct store categorization analysis for all brick & mortar retailers Inventory and purchase order management Product forecasting Assist in the execution of all channel marketing activities for holiday (retail website refresh, banner creation, email/print graphics, in-store signage, etc.) Must-Have Qualifications Strengths: Manages execution; detail-oriented Analytical; problem solver Driven; self-starter Excellent verbal and written communication skills Collaborative; can effectively work with varying teams/people Flexibility and prioritization, we are a start-up and tasks fly in faster than the Nerf darts in our office, you‰Ûªll need to use strong judgement to navigate the incoming and prioritize appropriately Skills: Microsoft Excel, Key Note, and Word (need to have) Adobe Photoshop (nice to have) Currently a Junior pursuing a degree in Sales, Marketing, Communications, Finance and/or Business Benefits Great San Francisco office with lots of light and great views, convenient to every mode of mass transit ‰ÛÒ on wheels, on rails and on water Innovative start-up where you‰Ûªll help shape the culture and have a huge impact Free daily catered lunches, snacks and drinks You get to work on innovative products and challenging problems with some amazingly talented (and fun) people! TRAVEL REQUIRED  None    Nordson Corporation provides equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees. Marketing Communications Intern US-GA-Atlanta Apply View All Jobs Share This Job Job Description Aptean is a leading provider of mission critical enterprise software solutions. We build and acquire industry-focused solutions to support the evolving operational needs of our customers. Our solutions help nearly 5,000 organizations stay at the forefront of their industries by enabling them to operate more efficiently, thereby ensuring higher customer satisfaction. For more information, visit www.aptean.com. We are looking for versatile, hardworking, and talented interns with strong writing and analytical skills to begin immediately and work part or full-time. Marketing interns will be focused on supporting the global sales marketing communications initiatives.  Our interns will learn about content creation, receive hands-on mentoring, and develop a wide variety of communications, public relations, graphics and marketing materials in addition to providing sales support and CRM data analysis. Interns demonstrating high performance will be considered for future employment as entry-level positions become available. This is a paid position. Responsibilities could include Work with communications and marketing, supporting both internal and external communications. Assist with the development of content (blog posts, case studies, press releases and byline articles) as well as assist with graphic design. Assist with social media channels to post updates, gain new followers, and analyze trends that help us better engage with our customers and audiences. Provide support to sales functions including telephone inquiries, liaising with customer accounts and marketing, contact data hygiene, and responding to customer inquiries Evaluate customer and prospect data with our Pivotal CRM solution to ensure accuracy. Skills & Requirements Qualifications and Requirements Must have completed at least 1 year of undergraduate studies pursuing a Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Marketing or relevant discipline (PR/communications, business administration, digital marketing, product marketing, sales Excellent writing and editing skills with a high level of attention to detail ‰ÛÒ writing samples a plus Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver results while managing multiple projects. Self-starter with ability to work independently in a cross-functional environment where tight deadlines exist. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Ability to use Adobe Indesign/Photoshop would be an advantage Aptean, Inc., is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. In accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws No applicant for employment with Aptean shall be subjected to discrimination because of race, color, sex, national origin, religion, disability, age, covered military veteran status, reprisal for engaging in anti-discrimination activities, protected genetic information, sexual orientation or parental status.   #LI-JH1 Apply View All Jobs Careers @ Aptean Join a dynamic team of people who value excellence, quality and customer service. Looking for an exciting and challenging career? Aptean serves more than 10,000 customers from over 20 offices around the globe. Our fast-paced global business environment offers great opportunities to develop your skills and advance your career. You‰Ûªll join a motivated, high-caliber team dedicated to excellence in software and customer service. Aptean attracts a culturally diverse group of employees who have deep expertise in delivering world-class software solutions. You‰Ûªll work with motivated, high-caliber colleagues in a creative and ethical business environment. We deliver superior customer experiences that translate into real-world success. With a track record for product and service innovation, Aptean is a financially stable company with a commitment to market leadership in all the industry segments we serve. If you have experience in delivering, marketing, or selling complex enterprise software and information technology solutions, we want to meet you today. What We Value Most  Aptean uses its core values to guide its more than 1,500 global employees to serve every customer in every geography and market. Intelligence: Thinking and acting creatively, strategically and collaboratively to create better solutions and sound business practices. Intensity: Strong commitment to results. Going the extra mile, even when not required, to drive our long term success. Integrity: Ethics-based actions. Delivering on our commitments to our customers and each other in a transparent, fair, ethical and supportive fashion. Integration: The whole is greater than the sum of the parts. Inclusive, team-oriented, sharing success Aptean is an Equal Opportunity employer  Aptean is an Equal Opportunity employer and is proud to have a drug-free environment. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The ‰Û÷EEO is the Law poster‰Ûª is available here and the supplemental poster is here. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail at recruiting@aptean.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

barre3 All jobs ‰ Õ Earned Media Intern Earned Media Intern Portland, Oregon, United States DESCRIPTION WHO WE ARE: At barre3, our goal is to make the world a happier, healthier place. With more than 100 studios across the country, our innovative streaming barre3 Online workouts, our ever-growing index of barre3 recipes, and our inspiring digital magazine, we encourage people to embrace whole-body-health. What does that mean? Nourishing their body with exercise and delicious whole foods, and surrounding themselves with people who feed them‰ÛÓboth literally and figuratively. Understanding that striving for balance is a whole lot healthier than striving for perfection. Our ethos shines through in our home office. At barre3, community is everything, and you‰Ûªll see that in the collaborative and respectful way we work together.  THE OPPORTUNITY: Do you have a passion for social media and public relations? Love the idea of helping one of the best boutique fitness brand in the country grow and connect with their online community and national media followers? Barre3 is looking for an earned media intern to support the Social Media Manager and Communications Manager. Responsibilities: Daily community management. Developing social media reports and tracking key metrics. You‰Ûªll get hands-on experience running social media advertising campaigns. Posting all approved social media content and attending regular team meetings. Writing social media posts and brainstorming post ideas. Helping manage blogger relationships. Blogger research and outreach. Presenting social media trends and findings to the marketing team. Creating local and national media lists and tracking company coverage on a local and national level.
