Asphalt Manufacturing Internship or Co-OpBarrett Paving Materials’ New York Central Region is currently seeking candidates who are interested in a summer internship or co-op in the heavy highway/asphalt manufacturing industry. Ideal candidates will be between their Junior and Senior year of college or in their last year of a related trade or technical school. The program is 10 weeks long, and 40 hours per week from the months of June through August.With an increasing demand for qualified workers in all industries, it is important that our company does our part to attract the highest caliber of candidates from universities. While students at these universities receive classroom training and possibly even laboratory training in Hot Mix Asphalt Technology, there is a great deal of knowledge and experience that cannot be taught in the classroom. Cooperative education and internship programs in the HMA Industry are an effective way to educate future employees of the HMA Industry and hopefully attract other students that may not have considered a career in HMA- an industry engineering professors often forget about.Successful candidates will go through our comprehensive ten week rotational program, catching a glimpse all of the aspects of the HMA Manufacturing business. Internships here at Barrett will help to validate a student’s career choices, one way or the other, which is very important in helping one to choose the best career direction for themselves. A positive experience here at Barrett will encourage students to continue their education and hopefully enter the HMA Industry. Whether they go on to be employed by contractors, agencies, consultants or companies, an increased level of HMA knowledge in today’s youth will ultimately benefit the industry as a whole. That being said, the overall goal of the program is to recruit the best of the best students each year with the hope of retaining them for full-time positions with Barrett.Through the ten week program, we seek to create a remarkable and unparalleled learning experience for students, so that they will continue to think enthusiastically about the HMA industry. Each summer, we strive to ensure that students experience the benefits of working for a construction company that sees the value in its employees and safety over all else, and where they can gain valuable hands-on experience, working directly with the Plants Manager, Site Superintendents, Shop Manager, Heavy Diesel Mechanics and Heavy Equipment & Plant Operators.Barrett Paving Materials, a subsidiary of Barrett Industries Corporation, is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Women and minorities are always encouraged to apply.

column23: Welcome. You are not signed in. | My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Advanced Search | All Jobs Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Marketing ‰ÛÒ Strategy and Innovation Summer Intern - 17001HT  Description  Opportunity:  Our 10-week Summer Internship Program is an ideal way for both undergrad and graduate students to gain real-life work experience while learning what a career at Blue Shield of California can offer. Interns work on real-world projects and initiatives while being immersed in all aspects of our business. From interacting with senior leadership to visiting a neighborhood health clinic, interns will build a better understanding of the diversity and complexities of working in the dynamic world of health insurance. Our goal is to build a talent pipeline that will help us grow our company into the future.  Below is some information on the project this intern will be working on:  This particular BSC intern will receive detailed healthcare industry experience including strategy and innovation, product knowledge, competitive insights and regulatory agency exposure. Hands on experience will be geared towards Market Share and Market Analysis that supports BSC‰Ûªs ACO Growth Strategy, Self-Funded market expansion, and target market segment initiatives. In addition, the candidate will have opportunities to manage smaller projects including competitor scorecards while also being introduced to a variety of cross-functional team members and leaders within the Markets organization.  Exposure to a variety of tools and resources will be offered including but not limited to advanced development of Excel skills, introduction to Tableau, an understanding and usage of BSC Databases that drives inputs into formal business presentations that offer context and a means for actionable decision making by BSC leaders. Also, this particular intern will be provided an overview of the California regulatory filings [CDI and DMHC] both financial and product to gauge a broader understanding of the National and California market place along with the importance of Accountable Care Organizations and relevance of the Consumer to the future state of healthcare. Additional exposure will include understanding of the BSC Market Segments and how they are and will be used to support our Brand Strategy.  Primary deliverables will be a Market Share analysis and competitive scorecards including quantitative and qualitative analysis for Markets and Senior Leadership. The output will be suitable for presentation to quarterly executive strategy sessions including the Operating Committee and BSC Board Meetings.  This position directly supports BSC‰Ûªs growth and Brand strategy with an emphasis on expanding our ACO and Self-Funded membership while effectively differentiating Blue Shield from our competitors.     Qualifications  Candidate Profile and Requirements:  ‰Û¢ Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Healthcare Management, or a related field from an accredited college/university ‰Û¢ Minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA ‰Û¢ Proficiency in MS Excel - Pivot tables, VLookUp and IF statements knowledge required ‰Û¢ Experience with databases ‰Û¢ Proficiency with Tableau required ‰Û¢ Self-directed and highly curious ‰Û¢ Qualitative and quantitative analysis capabilities  Compensation:    Blue Shield of California offers Summer Interns a competitive compensation package. Housing and relocation assistance is not available.   External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest records and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability status and any other classification protected by Federal, State and local laws.  Job: Intern  Primary Location: United States of America-California-San Francisco  Organization: Markets  Schedule: Full-time  Job Posting: Feb 28, 2017, 5:01:04 PM       Blue Shield of California Homepage|Blue Shield of CA EEO Policy|Blue Shield of CA Privacy Policy|Technical Help å© Blue Shield of California 1999-2017. All rights reserved. Blue Shield of California is an independent member of the Blue Shield Association.

Regardless of the motion task that customers face anywhere in the world, they will always find a Bosch Rexroth team with the local experience and the appropriate know-how from more than 30 industries and all drive and control technologies. Our associates take on their customers‰Ûª challenges with passion and persistence until the right solution is found. This is what makes Bosch Rexroth a strong, reliable partner for Mobile Applications, Machinery Applications and Engineering and Factory Automation. As the Drive & Control Company, we develop, produce, and distribute our components and system solutions in over 80 countries. You‰Ûªll find our drive and control technology in a wide variety of applications: From excavators and tractors to CNC woodworking and metal-cutting machines. With a product portfolio that includes all technologies, as well as a comprehensive offering in service and support, Bosch Rexroth is an expert partner for the complete machine life cycle. Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office with a focus in Excel, Power Point, and Outlook. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Buffalo Wild Wings Wings Beer Sports Our Menu Promos Find a B-Dubs              BROWSE OPEN JOBS    SEARCH OPEN JOBS    EDIT YOUR PROFILE    VIEW APPLICATION STATUS  Job Details Apply On-line    Requisition Number 17-0212 Title Digital Experience Intern City Minneapolis State or Province MN Country United States Description Know what it‰Ûªs like to be in the stadium on game day? Then you know what it‰Ûªs like to work at Buffalo Wild Wings. It‰Ûªs fun. It‰Ûªs fast-paced. We‰Ûªre at the top of our game ‰ÛÒ and we want to keep it that way. So we‰Ûªre constantly upping the ante, providing the ultimate experience for our fans in our restaurants and in our Home Office. And, of course, it‰Ûªs our people that bring that experience to life.  GAME DAY  It's time to put all of your late night studying, tests and projects into play. From day one, you‰Ûªre charged with driving innovation and implementing ideas that will take the Buffalo Wild Wings Guest Experience to the next level. You will be responsible for creating and/or managing unique programs specific to the various segments of the Buffalo Wild Wings business: lunch, takeout, Happy Hour, late night and Single Day Events (such as National Chicken Wing Day). If that weren‰Ûªt cool enough, you‰Ûªll even have the opportunity to work on digital projects including web and mobile.    Requirements WE'LL PROVIDE THE PLAYBOOK, HERE'S WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE  ‰Û¢ You know the business. You are currently in your junior or senior year studying toward a bachelor's degree in Marketing, Management Information Systems, Business or similar. ‰Û¢ You're a team player. You're ready to jump in and help with projects in order to help meet the needs of the business. Even if it means eating the very last chicken wing. ‰Û¢ You show passion & commitment. You strive in a fast paced environment and are in it to win the game. If it were possible, you'd bleed black and yellow.  BRAG FACTOR  You'll be working for the hottest brand around and have tons of fun doing it. During our 12 week (June 5 ‰ÛÒ August 25), full-time intern program you'll be working straight out of our Home Office in Minneapolis, MN. What else is in it for you? You'll be working on projects that have an impact on business and learn what it takes to be one of the fastest growing restaurant companies in the country. With Fun being one of our core values, there's plenty to look forward to. Whether it's bowling with your fellow interns or cooler scooter races around the office, we can promise that there won't ever be a dull moment. C+C is looking for a highly motivated, outgoing intern to assist with work on various accounts. C+C is a “good guy” public relations and social marketing firm with offices in Seattle, Portland, Boston and Washington DC. Our motto is DO GOOD WORK!We work with clients that positively impact their communities by inspiring people to choose energy-efficient LEDs over traditional energy-sucking bulbs; opt for sustainable seafood; take public transit; save water; recycle; compost; protect shorelines; and carpool, to name a few causes. We work at the local, regional and national level, helping to develop and promote some of the most innovative and recognizable sustainability efforts in the nation. Along with executing top-notch social marketing and media relations campaigns, we also have expertise in video, creative services, social media, multicultural strategy and branding.As an intern, you will help assist with the planning, development and execution of communications plans; coordinating account logistics; various administrative tasks; and other public relations and marketing duties as assigned. Duties vary greatly, but will include writing, social media copy, research, developing media lists, tracking media coverage and event staffing. We are seeking organized, creative self-starters who are passionate about a particular cause or social issue.Our ideal interns have:A four-year degree (or pursuing)Demonstrated writing skillsBasic computer skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Ability to multi-task, work independently and be self-directedAn understanding of basic marketing and media relations conceptsUnderstanding of journalism industryStrong grasp on social media platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn and InstagramAbility to work in a rapidly moving environmentFlexibilityA sense of humorA valid driver’s license(Ability to operate company minivan without causing (major) dents)A writing test will be required for this positionWe are looking to hire an intern for a full-time position who is available now so please don’t apply if you aren’t available until summer. There will be future internships posted too! The position is paid $15 per hour.Please send resume and cover letter and reference SEA-Intern. Submissions without a cover letter will not be reviewed so take the time to tell us about yourself and why you would be a great fit for this internship.C+C is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We strive for diversity within our team and persons of color are encouraged to apply.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $15.00 /hourJob Location:Seattle, WARequired education:Bachelor'sRequired license or certification:drivers licence

C+C Seattle is looking for a motivated, highly organized Assistant Account Executive (AAE) to join our multicultural team. This person will be a “go getter” doing everything from running logistics for outreach and events, pitching media, educating the community in the field, to assisting with social media initiatives and campaign planning.The main functions of the position will be to support the multicultural team on their clients’ initiatives – whether it be organizing community outreach, going door-to-door, conducting research, writing website copy, loading Facebook ads, or procuring event supplies.The ideal AAE candidate will have experience working in an agency environment with some direct exposure to clients. This position will act in both support and lead roles depending on the project.The Assistant Account Executive’s duties will include:Working with C+C managers (and clients) to plan, implement and evaluate integrated multicultural marketing and PR campaignsAssist in the planning and execution of successful community outreach (events, door-to-door, community outreach)Working with internal account teams to meet client deadlinesCreating high-level reportsManaging production of creative projects and events (e.g., collateral materials, organizing staffing and training)Working with cross-functional creative and content teams, including sub-contractorsTracking and monitoring media coverageConducting secondary research on sometimes technical subject matterProcuring props for client TV segmentsThe successful candidate will have:Native fluency in Spanish and English in both verbal and written language.Experience or a strong interest in working on multicultural campaigns aimed at educating multicultural and multilingual communities on a variety of social issues.Experience in event planning and community grassroots outreachMad organizational, problem solving and multitasking chopsAmazing writing and translation skillsPrior work experience with community organizations is a plusPeople skills, patience, flexibility and a sense of humor are a must-haveBasic computer skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Ability and love of multi-taskingAbility to work in a rapidly moving environmentA four-year college degreeFlexibility – this position will require working events, sometimes on weekendsBenefits include:Competitive salary and benefitsAbout C+C:C+C is an award winning, boutique public relations and communications firm with offices in Seattle, Portland and Boston. Our motto is “Do Good Work” and we love creating innovative campaigns that make the world a better place. C+C has a big toolkit: advertising, media relations, guys in meat suits, blogging, snapchat, social, web banners, direct mail (yes, it’s still a thing), skywriting, flash mobs (just kidding), videos featuring zombies applying makeup, guys in banana suits, guys in Speedos on a trampoline, air cannons shooting t-shirts, videos featuring Kenny G, community events, going door to door, and whatever else it takes to get the job done.Join us. Work hard. Learn. Change the world. Have fun. Do Good Work. Send your resume and cover letter.C+C is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.Job Type: Full-timeJob Location:Seattle, WARequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Public Relations: 1 yearRequired language:Spanish and English, with both written and verbal fluency in both languagesRequired license or certification:Driver's Licence

Company: C+CJob Title: Assistant Account Executive – Boston OfficeWho we are:C+C is a social marketing firm that does good work for good clients – those that help make the world a better place through their environmental, energy efficiency, sustainability, health or sports greening initiatives.Who we are seeking:We’re seeking a motivated, highly organized Assistant Account Executive (AE). Company: C+CJob Title: Account ExecutiveJob Description:C+C Portland is looking for a motivated, highly organized Account Executive (AE) who will be a “Jack/Jill of All Trades” doing everything from online research to assisting with social media initiatives to pitching reporters. The main functions of the position will be supporting account teams on their clients’ behavior change campaigns – whether it be writing website copy, synthesizing Google analytics reports, loading and evaluating Facebook ads or supporting our multicultural outreach projects. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We strive for diversity within our team and persons of color are encouraged to apply.Job Type: Full-timeJob Location:Portland, ORRequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:PR Agency: 3 years

Carl Fischer Music is offering students or recent graduates the opportunity to enhance their resume with real work experience. We also assist many orchestras, ensembles and universities throughout the world with our music rental and custom print departments.We are seeking a general intern who is a recent graduate or a graduate student and has time to work 4 days per week to work on projects in various departments (Licensing & Copyright, Production, Marketing and Sales). This internship is not specifically for the duration of a single semester but supposed to be more long-term and is a paid internship ($11/hour). A successful internship may lead to a full-time position in the future if an opening becomes available. This is not intended to be a summer internship (although we do have a summer internship program as well - you can find more information on our website if you are interested in a summer internship).Successful candidates will be motivated and passionate about (classical) music and the arts, experienced in Microsoft Office applications (i.e. Excel and Word), possess excellent communication skills and the ability to learn new projects and procedures quickly. Please also include your availability during regular business hours (Mon-Fri, 9:00-5:00). We are looking for someone to start immediately.Required education:Bachelor's

CTD produces or distributes 10 first-run series and holds the largest distributed television library at 70,000 hours strong. Among CTD's critically-acclaimed programs are the #1 syndicated series Judge Judy; talk leader Dr. Phil; the #1 and #2 rated game shows Wheel of Fortune and Jeopardy!; the Emmy Award-winning talk shows Rachael Ray and The Doctors; the #1 and #2 newsmagazines Entertainment Tonight and Inside Edition, along with The Insider; court show Hot Bench; and popular off-network product, including the CSI and Star Trek franchises, Everybody Loves Raymond, Frasier, NCIS, Criminal Minds, NCIS: Los Angeles, The Good Wife, Blue Bloods, Hawaii Five-0, Hot in Cleveland and Undercover Boss. In addition, CTD handles the domestic television distribution of CBS News, CBS Films and Showtime. CTD is a unit of CBS Corp. DESCRIPTION: TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS POSITION, YOU MUST BE CURRENTLY ENROLLED IN AN ACCREDITED UNIVERSITY. CBS Television Distribution, the distributor of shows such as Wheel of Fortune, Jeopardy!, Entertainment Tonight and Judge Judy, is looking for bright, ambitious, hard-working interns for our Marketing department. WHAT YOU LEARN How a major distributor promotes its syndicated product. Exposure to all areas of promotion: print, internet, on-air and production. Interview with all departments at CBS Television Distribution to gain a different perspective (sales, media relations, research, finance, programming, HR) and understanding of the complete process involved with syndicated television. QUALIFICATIONS: The internship is on a Monday, Wednesday, Friday schedule from 9:00am - 5:30pm. Days and hours worked are not flexible. This internship opportunity is available to current students only. Must be able to submit letter from college/university verifying enrollment at the institution. CDM Smith provides lasting and integrated solutions in water, environment, transportation, energy and facilities to public and private clients worldwide. As a full-service consulting, engineering, construction, and operations firm, we deliver exceptional client service, quality results and enduring value across the entire project life cycle. Job Description CDM Smith's Denver Office is looking for a Marketing Intern to join our team! During this internship you will have a responsible role in the marketing and business development activities for one of the largest such firms in the world. As part of a dynamic marketing team that pursues project contracts with cities, towns and state agencies throughout the region, the intern will help research, write and edit effective qualifications statements and proposals, develop graphically oriented, compelling presentations, and assist closely with other marketing initiatives, such as quarterly newsletters, seminars and informative client emails. This individual would assist in the development and update of water marketing materials. Additionally, they would help create a database of marketing materials and increase the organization of where the materials are kept. Minimum Qualifications Enrolled and currently pursuing a Bachelors degree in English, Journalism, Marketing, Graphic Design, Communications or a related degree. 2 years of completed coursework, a strong academic record and some prior experience is preferred but not required. Experience with Adobde InDesign, Prezi, and PowerPoint is a plus. Assignment Category Fulltime-Temporary Amount of Travel Required 0% EEO Statement We attract the best people in the industry, supporting their efforts to learn and grow. We strive to create a challenging and progressive work environment. Cemstone Cemstone Marketing Summer Internship  Mendota Heights, MN   55120              About Us Founded by the Becken family in 1927, Cemstone offers truly integrated and sustainable concrete solutions for its customers in the Upper Midwest and across the country. When you work at Cemstone, you experience more than just a job. You earn a rewarding career, one that delivers an incredible opportunity to build a better future for yourself, strengthens us to become a better company, and fulfills your desire for challenge and growth. Job Summary Marketing Intern for Cemstone Products Company, Cemstone Ready Mix Inc, Cemstone Concrete Materials, Cemstone Supply, Dakota Aggregates and East Range Ready Mix, LLC.  Must have the ability to function in fast-paced team environment with sales representatives and managers to meet and exceed assigned goals for overall customer experience and company reputation. Professionally and effectively communicates by phone, prepares quotations and pricing documents, and performs other administration as follows: Assist in the creation and maintenance of marketing tools (i.e. signage, circulars, mock ups, e-mail campaigns, on line promotion, video etc.). Assist in the distribution or delivery of marketing materials. Assist with fulfillment of marketing projects (i.e. project profiles, website). Assist with execution of social media. Assist with the preparation and delivery of training materials. Assist with the organization and presentation of retail stores. Update web data content of online store. Prepare presentations. Keep accurate and timely records and files; maintain tracking report of public relations activity. Perform all tasks with meticulous attention to detail, proper formatting, and correct grammar. Perform all other duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications High School degree or equivalent required; business school or college experience preferred. Knowledge of the concrete industry desired. Must have 1 to 2 years of experience in photography. Photo cataloguing experience preferred. Ability to read and interpret documents and manuals; Ability to write various reports and correspondences; Ability to speak effectively to customers and/or employees of the organization; Excellent spelling, grammar and phone skills. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.  Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, multi-task and carefully proof their own work. Must be proficient in Adobe Suite, Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, basic Internet skills (including social media), etc. Must have the ability to learn and use new software systems quickly. ACI Certifications preferred. Terms and Conditions Internship duration: 3 months (June ‰ÛÒ August), full time employment; a reasonable compensation package will be provided. At the end of the internship term, prepare and present a fifteen-minute presentation to share the details of the internship experience. Closing If you are interested in becoming part of our team, please apply online today. We are committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities to all employees and applicants. EO M/F/Disability/Vet Employer. Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans.    View Company Information  To see other positions, click here.

We are looking for a Communications Intern . Reporting to the Product Manager, the Communications Intern would be involved in helping to shape the conversations and usage of technology in the criminal justice system. They would be responsible for editing written, audio, and video content, identifying interesting posts, assisting with interviewing experts, and helping to organize formal and informal convenings that will help support blog content. The person would get to cover a vast array of technology topics and work with stakeholders including policy-makers, program implementers, activists, community members, technologists, researchers, and vendors.Responsibilities may include:Working with the Center’s communication staff as neededWriting and copy-editing blogposts and doing simple editing of audio and video interviewsIdentifying and building relationships with stakeholders in New York City and across the United States who have diverse perspectives on technology in criminal justice reformCurating blogposts from guest writers, with the opportunity to write some original posts if desiredResearching current trends, including speaking to the Center’s own program staff, to identify new topics of conversationQualifications include:Excellent written communication skills, with a focus on blog-style writingFamiliarity with and interest in the criminal justice systemFamiliarity and interest in trends in technologyAbility to work well with a multi-disciplinary team in a criminal justice settingExcellent organizational skills and self-drivenExperience with, or interest in learning, editing audio and videoJob Type: InternshipSalary: $15.00 /hourJob Location:New York, NYRequired experience:Communications: 1 year

Internet Marketing Agency Paid Internship PositionJoin a successful Internet Marketing agency as we continue to grow rapidly.Chair 10 Marketing (www.chair10marketing.com) is an Internet marketing agency focused on providing expertise in the areas of SEM (Search Engine Marketing), SEO (Search Engine Optimization), reputation management, social media management and strategic Internet marketing planning. Based in Seattle, Washington, Chair 10 Marketing serves clients across the U.S. and Canada.We currently have an internship available with our agency. Chair 10 Marketing interns are a key part of our team, and experience tremendous learning as they contribute to the success of our clients. If you are interested in the dynamic world of Internet marketing, this is the position for you.The Position:> Internship will last 3 months, with potential option for extension> A great potential launch pad into a career of digital marketing> Looking for people with a passion for helping clients grow their businesses> You'll perform daily digital marketing related tasks while learning the fundamentals of Internet marketing. Your responsibilities will vary from day-to-day with projects ranging from writing blog posts, interviewing bloggers, local search marketing projects, SEO work, and pay-per-click tasks. If you like variety and challenge, you'll love this position.Qualifications:> Ability to work at least 25 hours per week (40 hour a week interns preferred)> You will work at our office in the Magnolia part of Seattle> You have a 4-year college degree or are in the process of obtaining one> Prefer an educational or professional background in marketing, data analysis, market research, finance, statistics, English, literature, or science, however, no specific major is required> Self-sufficient, driven worker> Well-versed in Excel> Proven writing skills> Your attention to detail is unmatched, you never drop the ball, and people love working with youNo phone calls please.Ample free parking at our office.To apply: Apply on Indeed with your resume. Also include in your Indeed cover letter 1 to 3 paragraphs on why you believe you are a good fit for this position.This is a paid internship position. The position pays the current City of Seattle minimum hourly wage.We look forward to your application!
column25: Paid Internship with Internet Marketing Agency

column23: Hello,I'm are currently looking for a Social Media Editor and Blog Writer/ Content Creator on my Team. This is a great opportunity to use your creative skills to create and edit content on a wide range of social media verticals for my e-commerce start up.This is definitely not your everyday social media internship/partnership, as I am focused on finding creative writer/editors that are either know how to interact with large audiences (think 100K to over a million viewers), or want to learn how to do that, This is unique as I am a Fashion Stylist that has worked in the industry for over 8 years, I moved to LA 3 weeks ago from NY so I can launch myself as a freelance stylist and blogger. I want someone who is as eager to have their own business in fashion and entertainment as I am. I have connection within LA and NY in the industry I just need to get my site polished and for someone to curate and post content daily to the website and social media platforms. You will be literally my partner in everything, we will do email marketing, marketing, product marketing, social media etc, we will attend and book shoots together, we will find content from any inspiration and we will network. Please take a look at my website and if you interested in building something together then lets chat. Please send over your resume and samples of previous work and why you would be interested in this. There is no pay to start but as money starts coming in you will always get paid. We can discuss the logistics if we find a good fit. please check out the website.www.chariityb.comJob Type: InternshipJob Location:Los Angeles, CA 90036Required education:High school or equivalentRequired experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 yearPhotoshop, photography, Fashion, Marketing and Writing: 1 year

HOMESign inSign upJobsCompaniesNetworkBlogEmployersBackPaid Spring Semester 2017 Internship - Marketing / Sales / AdvertisingCharity Advertising & Marketing PartnersRichardson, TX, United StatesFeb 16, 2017VIEWS: 306 Intern MarketingJOB DESCRIPTIONCharity Advertising & Marketing Partners is offering PAID internships in Marketing / Sales / Advertising!These are FALL / WINTER internships ONLY!  We will begin accepting applications for summer interns in April.  Candidates MUST be local DFW candidates to be considered, and MUST be available to begin working within TWO WEEKS of receiving an offer of employment.Our interns will gain valuable experience in the following areas:- Marketing, fundraising, and advertising- Basic marketing and advertising psychology- Interpersonal interaction (speaking directly to potential donors on behalf of our clients)- Public speaking and public relations- Organization and time management- Networking and professionalismBecause we are in the process of expanding, TOP interns will be given the opportunity to advance into leadership positions within our organization!- Learn how to manage a small team of others- Learn training and coaching techniques- Help coordinate events and establish relationships with venue contacts- Help out with social media and manage our company's brand- Represent our organization at networking events and regional/national conferences- Have access to our exclusive mentorship program and receive guidance from some of the top CEOs in our industry- Earn PAID travel opportunities to other exciting markets (Chicago, NYC, Miami, and more)- Participate in the hiring process, conduct interviews, and evaluate the qualifications of potential new hiresWe offer a FUN, POSITIVE atmosphere and a young, dynamic company culture!- Regular team outings - baseball games, karaoke, BBQs, Top Golf, and more!- A young, energetic CEO and a management team with an open-door policy- A welcoming, inclusive environment- A team comprised of young professionals from a variety of backgrounds - former college athletes, service industry professionals, law school graduates, and employees from six different continentsInterviews will be granted on a first-come basis, and applicants with immediate and open availability will be given preference.  We are looking to fill these positions ASAP, so APPLY TODAY to be considered for a role with our organization!Job Requirements: Requirements:- Must be a local DFW resident- Must be availale within two weeks of receiving an offer- Must have reliable transportation and be able to commute to the office on a daily basis- Must be fun, outgoing, and personable!- Must be williing to try new things and develop new skills- Must be able to work both individually and in groups- MUST be able to pass a background checkNO experience in sales, marketing, advertising, or fundraising is required, but experience in the following is strongly preferred: customer service, service industry, hospitality, restaurant, host, hostess, restaurant server, kitchen, line cook, bar manager, bartender, bartending, concierge, hotel, help desk, client relations, marketing, promotions, brand ambassador, public relations, events, event planning, event coordinating, event management, fundraising, charity, nonprofit, camp counselor, sports, sports marketing, advertising, marketing management, communications, retail, sales, retail sales, retail management, sales clerk, sales associate, keyholder, sales management, management, fast food, sports management, training, teaching, education, business, business development, marketing communications, product promotions, club promotion, club promoter, cocktail waitress, cocktail waiter, busser, general business, consulting, social media, social media marketing, social media advertising, business development, entrepreneurship, entrepreneur, leadership, public speaking, construction, general labor, internship, entry levelSpread the word...Share This Job on social-media below...Remember to tell them, you found this job on Jobmatic.comCharity Advertising & Marketing PartnersWe are a direct marketing firm dedicated to securing donations that help fund programs that fight poverty and educate children around the world. Charter NEX is the North American leader in engineering, extruding, and manufacturing high- performance, superior-quality monolayer, coextruded and barrier films for flexible packaging applications. Charter NEX blown and cast film products are ideal for industries such as food, foodservice, medical, agriculture, automotive, consumer goods, industrial, lawn and garden, and pet food.Employee Responsibilities:Charter NEX is seeking a Marketing or Graphic Design Intern to assist the Marketing team in the design and development of marketing collateral. He/she be responsible for editing and creating flyers, product guides, tradeshow displays, magazine ads, etc., as well as developing graphic and visual images. This position will report to the Market Analyst.Work with Marketing, Sales and Technical to create flyers, product guides, internal promotions and other marketing materials.Update existing marketing collateral.Develop graphics and visual images for product illustrations, logos and websites.Resize company ads to meet print specifications.Assist Marketing and Sales with changes to PowerPoint presentations.Assist Marketing and Sales with special projects as assigned.Requirements:Currently enrolled in a two- or four-year college program, majoring or minoring in Graphic Design, Graphic Communication or Marketing.Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator.Able to demonstrate graphic design skills with a strong portfolio.Able to work around 15 hours per week.Must be able to work during the school year and during the summerHow to apply:Please send in your resume. To learn more about our company, visit our website at www.charternex.comJob Type: InternshipSalary: $14.00 to $16.00 /hourRequired education:High school or equivalent

Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- by interning in CheggÕs Strategy group.   Organization: Strategy  The Strategy team is central to Chegg Ð We work closely with the C-team to develop and execute the companyÕs overall strategy. Our small team is comprised of analysts, strategists, thought leaders, relationship builders and deal makers. We help drive decisions around whether the company should buy, build or partner, and therefore manage CheggÕs M&A activities. We also conduct market and competitive research into education trends and areas of future opportunity. Most recently, our team led the acquisition of Imagine Easy Solutions, whose products include EasyBib, Citation Machine, and BibMe, among others.  Role:  Corporate Strategy Intern  WeÕre looking for a highly motivated intern to help our team and work on strategic projects in concert with the companyÕs business and product leaders.  On our Strategy team, you will conduct research in support of our strategic roadmap and work across a number of business units, including Career Services, Required Materials, and Learning Services.   Responsibilities:  Research EdTech trends to help determine areas of opportunity and further develop our thesis on the education market and its competitive landscape Analyze other education companies and make assessments regarding their potential as partners, competitors, investment candidates, or acquisition opportunities Support strategic initiatives such as international expansion, product and audience expansion, partnerships, and investment opportunities Partner with business and product leaders to develop business cases Present key findings and recommendations to executives Requirements:  A rising senior currently pursuing a bachelorÕs degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field from an accredited four-year college or university (with a graduation of no earlier than December 2017). Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder). Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California. Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer. Have the ability to work 40 hours per week. Strong analytical and communication skills Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams; interest in CheggÕs mission Ability to think critically and work autonomously in both well-defined and ambiguous project environments Nice to have:  Experience with market research and business analysis Demonstrated passion for education and technology Project or internship experience in investment banking, private equity, venture capital, or consulting Project or internship experience in the education industry Chegg out our intern program!  http://www.chegg.com/jobs/university  See what itÕs like to be a Chegg intern!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cp1m_ZtOT_4  Learn more about Chegg!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo  About Chegg  Chegg puts students first. As the leading connected learning platform, the company makes higher education more affordable, more accessible, and more successful for students. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com.

2017 SUMMER INTERNSHIP  Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through interning in User Experience (UX) Design.   Organization:  Product > UX Design The User Experience team lives within CheggÕs Product organization. The UX Research Team is part of the larger UX Group. We partner with CheggÕs Product Management, Engineering and Marketing organizations to do research that informs great user experiences.  Role:  UX Research Internship We do UX Research differently at Chegg! Instead of working by yourself or jumping from project to project, youÕll be an embedded member of one of our product groups. Working directly with your Research leader and using a variety of methodologies, youÕll plan, execute, evaluate and share insights from your UX Research. YouÕll work to optimize our customerÕs experience and turn insights into engaging, actionable recommendations that make a difference for our customers. You definitely wonÕt be writing reports and filing them away on a wiki!  Responsibilities:  Test mockups and prototypes of our products in our on-site research lab and in the Field Partner with UX Designers to create design solutions for our products based on customer data Use remote tools like UserTesting.com to get feedback on designs Compile and review research results and report key findings; make recommendations to Design, Product and Marketing based on those findings Conduct surveys of current and canceled customers; identify and explore product-related opportunities for improvement Engage with CheggÕs Summer College Interns frequently to gain insight into product design, user experience(s) as well as Student attitudes towards things like Tutoring. Requirements:        Currently pursuing a graduate level degree in Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, HCI, Education, Cognitive Science or other relevant fields (with a graduation date of no earlier than December 2017) Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week Ability to prioritize and manage work to adhere to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment Familiarity with user-centered design principles, careful attention to detail, as well as ability to grasp multiple product requirements Familiarity with analytics tools like Google Analytics Adept at user-centered research methodologies Curious and creative; enjoy complex issues and problem solving Ability to facilitate the rapid iterative design process Ability to blend both quantitative metrics and qualitative feedback into the product design process

Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through interning in Consumer Insights. Organization: Marketing Marketing teams are central to Chegg Ð communicating the value of our amazing products or services to customers.  Role:  Marketing Design Internship WeÕre looking for a highly motivated intern to work on the Marketing Design team. Responsibilities: Provide support to Marketing Design team & all marketing channels with ongoing creative needs Effectively communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale Concept & create artwork for social media, emails, banner advertising, and landing pages Organize and update creative assets, style guides and presentations Assist with design research, keeping up to date on latest design trends & best practices Participate in campaign planning, gathering student insights, testing concepts and exploring design solutions to market Chegg and drive customers to our products Requirements: Currently pursuing a BA, BFA, HCI, or other design-related degree (with a graduation of no earlier than December 2017) Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week Have an online portfolio Prior experience with visual design, creating graphics and a solid grasp of design concepts Comfortable working with Adobe Creative Suite (including Photoshop and Illustrator), Microsoft PowerPoint, Mac OS X platform Understand and can incorporate best practices & current trends in design and layout, and adapt designs for mobile formats Knowledge of student culture & current student lifestyle trends Motivated self-starter who takes initiative and is a quick learner Be willing to jump in & help out with all phases of the design process Ability to work autonomously and use critical thinking Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, organized Bonus if you have photography or have video editing skills (but not required!).

Your goal Ð to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through interning in Chegg Study.  Organization: Learning Services - Chegg Study  Chegg is an ed-tech company that helps students get into the right college, save money on their books, ace their classes and enter the workforce. Chegg Study, a leading product of the Chegg family, is a homework-help and learning solution that helps students get homework done, understand and deepen their knowledge, get better grades, and succeed in college. Role: Business Analytics Ð Intern  We are looking for an analytical, creative, and highly motivated intern with a passion for education to join our team. An intern on our team will investigate and derive insights from analyzing the customer funnel, engagement and retention. The intern will develop business cases for product or operations improvements that directly impact students. At the end of the internship, the intern will present to the team and other key stakeholders.   Responsibilities:   Work closely with the cross-functional team to understand business KPIs Provide recommendations for new features / changes to existing product Build detailed financial models to support business cases Conduct qualitative and quantitative research Present and interpret analytics findings and participate actively in discussions of results Must be persistent, creative and have strong team skills   Requirements: Currently pursuing a BS or advanced degree in a quantitative field (statistics, economics, business, or a related field) from an accredited four-year college or university (with a graduation of no earlier than December 2017) Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 10 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week   Strong analytics / SQL skills and attention to detail Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills  Ability to communicate ideas clearly Self-motivated; organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple product teams; interest in CheggÕs mission Ability to think critically and work autonomously Strong desire to learn!

Role:  Brand Marketing Internship WeÕre looking for a highly motivated intern to work on the Brand Marketing team. The Brand Marketing Team is responsible for bringing more awareness to Chegg products and services through creative content & campaigns. Responsibilities: Play a key role in the content development of Chegg Play, from contributing your own original content to working with other brand on current/future content partnerships. Create your own marketing campaign that elevates the Chegg brand by utilizing all marketing channels, and work cross-functionally with the team to execute. Work with design team to build out creative & copy, email team to design a dedicated email, and social team to create a campaign social media strategy. Support CheggÕs Fall semester back-to-school brand marketing campaigns. Work with design, social & email teams on back-to-school campaign strategy & assets. Support CheggÕs social media channels by assisting in content creation & tracking. Requirements: Currently pursuing a BA or BS in Marketing, Business, or related field from an accredited four year college or university (with a graduation of no earlier than December 2017) Enjoys writing and can create concise, professional content quickly Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) Experience with Photoshop, Fireworks, or other design programs a plus. Video or film creation experience a plus. Ability to work autonomously and use critical thinking Proven track record with high standards of professionalism Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to develop strong working relationships inside and outside Chegg Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, organized Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to meet multiple objectives in an entrepreneurial environment with little supervision Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder) Have the ability to intern in Santa Clara, California Have the ability to work for a continuous 12 weeks in the summer Have the ability to work 40 hours per week

Home Jobs Digital Media Intern ‰ÛÒ Corporate Fundraising Search Jobs Login - Development Indianapolis, IN, USA Internship Email Me This Job Are you a creative thinker who enjoys connecting people and maintaining relationships? Do you believe companies should give back to their communities? Are you willing to invest in the details for the success of a larger goal? If so, spend your summer getting professional experience at one of Indiana's most progressive nonprofits.           "Interning with Children's Bureau was a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience working for a nonprofit while simultaneously giving back to my community. Collaborating in a fun, team atmosphere enhanced my knowledge of social media, event planning, corporate relations, and ultimately provided me with the skills necessary to start my career." ‰ÛÒ Jessica Almon, 2015 Children's Bureau Intern   As a Children's Bureau intern, you can look forward to: Collaborating with other interns and supervisors in a fun, fast-paced environment Interfacing with a variety of stakeholders -- agency volunteers, corporate partners, clients, executive staff, donors, etc. Moving on with a wealth of experience in fundraising, digital communications, project management, relationship-building and stewardship A team that listens and is committed to your learning experience   Key Objectives: Design, schedule and track daily social media posts that highlight the companies that partner with Children's Bureau and their corporate social responsibility Use Adobe InDesign to create visually appealing, interactive review packets for partner companies Develop engaging content for email marketing Coordinate logistics for monthly Meet and Greet events and corporate networking Learn about Children's Bureau's corporate partners and invest in the relationships Contribute to preparations for signature fundraising event, the 20th annual Children's Bureau Celebrity Cook-Off Present your experience to Children's Bureau executives at the conclusion of your internship   What We're Looking For Use of good judgment and ability to maintain confidentiality Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with attention to detail Good organizational skills, integrity and excellent follow through Be actively enrolled in an accredited college or university as a junior or senior (in good standing) Minimum of intermediate design skills with Adobe Creative Suite (emphasis on InDesign/Photoshop) Enjoy learning and working as a team! The Fine Print 20 hours per week (full time consideration for the right applicant) Must have access to reliable transportation Language requirements: Fluent written and spoken English This is a paid internship with a stipend awarded at the end of 12 weeks   Children's Bureau is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally-protected status. The Photo Design Bar is staffed with Professional Photographers, Photoshop Specialists. Graphic Artists and Sales Associates to assist customers through all of their photo needs.A Sales Associate needs to have experience in sales and a friendly and warm personality to provide excellent service.Being a photographer or having an interest in digital photography, printing or desire to learn is a plus for this employment.$ 24,000 - $30,000 plus commission per year.Some part- time and intern positions available.A cover letter along with your resume and any link that describes you or your work does help in our decision for hiring.Job Type: Full-timeJob Location:Atlanta, GARequired experience:Retail Sales: 2 yearsSales: 2 years

Who we are: At Cinestate we produce feature films, publish books, create original audio programming, and pride ourselves on being an outlet for bold creators. The content we produced is fueled by the passion behind each and every one of our unique writers. We are seeking interns that share our passion for letting the creators do what they do best, create.Who we are looking for : We are seeking interns currently enrolled in college, especially those majoring in film, marketing or the arts. Our ideal candidates will have an interest in the entertainment and/or publishing business. We are looking for candidates with strong written and oral communication skills as well as task oriented self-starters.What you will do : The entertainment world is forever changing and so may your day to day. While here at Cinestate you will be exposed to many facets of the entertainment business. You will have the opportunity to work in different departments around Cinestate, including marketing, social media, publishing, film and office management. We love to work hard and have fun, you will have the opportunity to attend company events, screenings, lunches and more. Finally, you will have a final project due at the end of the program.What you will learn : Simply put you will learn valuable skills to prepare you for a career in publishing or film. You will work directly with key players of the indie publishing and film worlds daily and shadow the inner workings of a production and publishing house.What we want to accomplish : We want to give creators a voice and that all starts from within. Cinestate’s internship program wants to help grow the future of entertainment.* This is an unpaid internship for School credit.**To be considered for this internship we ask that you send in your resume and in lieu of cover letter please answer the following questions.Who are Cinestate’s founders and why do you want to work with them?What sets you apart from other candidates?Who are your favorite directors, what are your top 5 favorite films?What are your plans after graduation?Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Dallas, TX

Privacy PolicyJob Openings2017 Summer Internship Logistics Sales, Operations, & MarketingSales/Brokerage ‰ÛÒ CHICAGO, Illinois2017 Summer Internship (with possibility to lead to full salary plus commission role)Candidates must be graduating in 2017 or 2018Chicago, IL, Goose IslandAt Circle Logistics, you are not just a number, you are an invaluable part of our company. We strive to maintain the open culture, in which everyone is a hands-on contributor. A culture where everyone feels comfortable sharing ideas and opinions in a growing, financially stable company. You will be part of a forward-thinking team that designs and implements the logistic operations that efficiently run shipments around the world for major well-known clients.Job Overview:The purpose of this internship is to learn our business at the direction of a mentor- in Operations, Sales, and Marketing.  Daily activities will include assisting in our day to day operations,  data entry, booking, dispatching and tracking truckloads across North America, email marketing, lead generation and sales appointment dialing.Pay is flexible -  based on experience with:Marketing, Sales, or operations experience Freight Brokerage or Driver Dispatching     Customer Service Experience in a call center environmentAdvanced Data management experience  Sales Experience in any industry, with ability to find decision makers and use CRM software   This is an entry-level role. Successful candidates will be eligible to move to a salary plus commission role specifically dedicated to Sales, Operations, or Marketing based on successful demonstration of each role throughout the internship.Job DescriptionProactive management and coordination of freight at the direction of a mentorAssist with company newsletters, social media, surveys, and email campaignsManage daily shipments to ensure timely pick-up and deliveryCommunicate internally and externally to ensure customers expectations are exceededResolve transportation problems with urgency and professionalismLead generation and sales appointment dialing Desired Skills & ExperienceAbove average  to expert computer skills, proficient in excel (lookup, pivot tables, reports) - Google Drive, Basic Graphic Design, and Email Marketing a plusExcellent written and oral communication skillsAbility to thrive is fast paced working environmentWilling to be available after hours and weekends if neededStrong work ethic - someone willing to work hard to learn the business and build a long-term career at CircleOutgoing - has the energy and personality to engage others in person and over the phoneAbility to multitask and work on multiple projects at onceExcellent problem-solving skillsTime management ability to balance new customer hunting with supporting existing accountsTeam Player that enjoys helping the team be successful as much as the individual success!Company DescriptionCircle Logistics Inc is a full-service asset-based logistics company committed to providing value-added transportation solutions to our customers. We leverage our technology, industry savvy employees, and management experience to develop transportation solutions for high profile clients. If there is one thing we have learned in this business over the years, it‰Ûªs that personalized service, along with communication, is the most important aspects of our industry. It‰Ûªs the combination of industry savvy and individual attention that separates us from our competition.Circle Logistics believe in providing recognition for employees, rewards their accomplishments, and honors ongoing professional development. Circle Logistics starts all employees with a training program that offers hands-on logistics experience and sales knowledge education. During training, you will connect with existing clients and a variety of internal business lines to help set you up for long-term success. If you are enthusiastic, driven, highly motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, accelerate your career with Circle Logistics!  What Circle offers:A lively work environmentPaid training internshipFlexible start datesFlexible timing around your summer schedulePotential to be offered full-time role upon completion or graduationFamily-centered culture you are not just a number here, you are part of our familyApply for this JobApply for this JobLink to this job00LocationCHICAGO, IllinoisDepartmentSales/BrokerageEmployment TypeInternMinimum ExperienceEntry-levelCompensation$12-15/hr+ based on expPowered by

column23: 2017 Summer Golf Marketing Internship (Unpaid) | City and County of Denver Jobs page has loaded. Menu JOB OPPORTUNITIES Sign In City and County of Denver Jobs powered by NEOGOV å¨ 2017 Summer Golf Marketing Internship (Unpaid) APPLY Salary $0.00 Hourly Location Denver, CO Job Type Intern Department Parks and Recreation (DPR) Job Number TA0000 15501 Closing 3/19/2017 11:59 PM Mountain DESCRIPTION BENEFITS QUESTIONS About Us The secret is out: Denver is the nation's top place to live, work, and play. Being the best place to live isn't easy; maintaining such a reputation means we need the best people working for the residents of Denver. People who want to make a difference; people who want to give back; people who want to be at the heart of this city and have a hand in creating our future. When you join us, you will employ your unique skills to do important and meaningful work critical to the success of both your organization and the city as a whole. Be a part of the city that you love. Where Denver Works.  About Denver Golf: Denver Golf has eight convenient locations. Denver Golf has the largest municipal golf system in the Denver metro area: Four 18 hole regulation courses, one 27 hole regulation course, one 18 hole executive mountain course, two Par 3 courses, two miniature golf courses, six driving ranges including our signature water driving range, multiple practice facilities and more. Plus, we have the 2nd largest First Tee Junior Program in the country with The First Tee of Denver. About Our Job The City and County of Denver's Department of Recreation is seeking a Summer Golf Marketing Intern to join our team to gain experience working on special projects involving marketing, advertising, and events within our Golf division. This summer internship is unpaid and we are looking for a 25-35 hour/week commitment with some evening and weekend hours. The start date is flexible from April to June 2017.  As an intern, you will be responsible for: Tournament Program - Assisting with the tournament program by following up with new tournament inquiries Assisting on site with Denver Golf events: Denver City Amateur, Golf Socials, Ladies Golf  Working some nights and weekends facilitating events  About You In order to apply, please be sure you: Are currently enrolled in a college/university pursuing a degree in marketing/Advertising, Journalism, Golf, Communications or directly related field of study Have a valid driver's license, as this position requires driving Our ideal candidate will have: An interest or knowledge of golf An interest in sports marketing Completion of 60 credits of college/university coursework About Everything Else  Classification Title: Internships at City & County of Denver  Working Title:  Summer Golf Marketing Intern Agency:  Department of Parks and Recreation Recruiter: JC Pre-employment Screening: An offer of employment is contingent on the verification of credentials and other information required by law and City and County of Denver policies, including the successful completion of a background check. Candidates must pass a criminal background check and other verifications required for the position which may include, but are not limited to, employment and/or education verification, motor vehicle record check, drug test, and/or physical. The existence of a conviction does not automatically disqualify an individual from employment except where federal or state law or regulations prohibit employment of an individual with certain convictions. For more information about the selection and employment screening process, click here.  The City and County of Denver provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetic information, age, or any other status protected under federal, state, and/or local law.   Agency City and County of Denver Address 201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 412 Wellington E. Webb Municipal Office Building Denver, Colorado, 80202. Home About us What we do News & recognition Insights & ideas Global reach Join us Our people Professional development Open positions Intern, Consumer - Austin 27th Feb 2017 Reference: JOB6001 Location: Austin, United States Application deadline: 3 weeks 5 days 3 hours 55 minutes Cohn & Wolfe Internship Program   Why Cohn & Wolfe? Cohn & Wolfe is an award-winning, integrated brand communications agency within WPP, the world‰Ûªs largest media and communications services conglomerate. Guided by an internal mantra to "Dig Deeper, Imagine More," we work hard to deliver creative campaigns that are deeply grounded in consumer and marketplace insights, backed by a full-suite of strategic services to meet the needs of our clients. At Cohn & Wolfe Austin our roster of clients includes Twentieth Century Fox Home Entertainment, Applebee‰Ûªs, Alcon and SONIC Drive-In. The semester-long internship enables interns to support a variety of public relations and digital media activities while developing real-world skills for a future career in marketing communications.   Internship Responsibilities: The typical day for an intern will include any of the following: Conducting online research and analysis Researching companies and their industries Writing press materials Researching and compiling client coverage reports Building media lists and pitch plans Researching editorial opportunities Participating in company brainstorms Pitching to the media Assisting with media trainings and event preparation Qualifications: Strong research and writing skills as well as working knowledge of digital media practices Interest in public relations, communications, business/marketing, digital/social media, research, analytics, sociology and/or cultural trends Undergraduates at the sophomore level and above or graduate students in a related field Availability to work between 20 and 32 hours per week for the semester. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) Pay Rate: Paid internship   How to apply: The following information is required in order to be considered for an internship at Cohn & Wolfe: A cover letter expressing your interest and goals for the internship. Please limit to one page. Your resume. A one-page news release writing sample announcing your new position as a Cohn & Wolfe intern. This writing sample will enable us to learn more about your writing skills and creativity. There is no right or wrong answer. This is simply an opportunity for you to demonstrate your understanding of what a news release is and to showcase your writing ability. Please email all documents as attachments to Matthew Young at Matthew.Young@cohnwolfe.com Cohn & Wolfe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. VIEW OUR WEBSITE VIEW ALL JOBS Events/ Marketing Intern Los Angeles, CA Internship Student (College) Collab, Inc (collabcreators.com) is a Downtown LA based digital talent agency and entertainment studio and the leading independent network for multi-platform talent. Collab was started by veteran video creators to help make the lives of independent creators easier and to provide everything they need to succeed creatively and financially.  We specialize in working with mobile video creators and helping them build their audience and earnings across multiple platforms (YouTube, musical.ly, Instagram, Snapchat, Facebook, etc). Our network includes over 400 top social media creators with over 700 Million Followers.  We are also a digital studio that produces original shows for TV and digital platforms. Who we are looking for: Collab is currently seeking candidates to join our fast-growing company for a full or part time internship position. This person will be an integral part of the team and will assist in planning live events, including sponsorship activation, presence at digital conventions, presence at industry conferences, VIP events, and PR events. If you like organizing, planning, interacting with people, being creative and working on projects that change day to day, then this job is for you. The ideal candidate should display a high level of interest and focus on event planning and management. The position‰Ûªs duties will include: Support in logistical planning for digital conferences and coordination of sponsorship Help create brand messaging and training materials Help create program recaps and presentations Participate in creative brainstorms Research events, vendors, venues, permits, trends, etc. Book flights, hotels, etc. Develop and manage databases (event scheduling) Complete some administrative duties (phones, mailing, etc.) Job Requirements: Excellent writing and communication skills Strong organizational, multi-tasking skills, and research skills Ability to be creative, flexible and think ''outside the box'' Must be able to take initiative on projects and work independently If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, challenge yourself and others to be creative, and view this opportunity as not just a learning experience but possibly a step toward your future, please apply. Careers Home Search Jobs WHY CHOOSE COMCAST JOB OPPORTUNITIES CAMPUS PROGRAMS MILITARY AND VETERANS EVENTS LOCATIONS FAQs  Intern, Business to Business Sales Job ID: 153432 Livermore, CA Administrative Services Job Description Business Unit: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.      Job Summary:  There are many opportunities to learn and thrive at Comcast. A 10 week, fulltime internship with Comcast gives you meaningful work experience, programs for development and networking, competitive compensation and the opportunity to move into a fulltime career post-graduation. You will ..  - Gain knowledge and experience in B2B Sales  - Gain the opportunity to make an impact on Comcast's business and results  - Participate in developmental activities  - Network with leaders across multiple functions  - Receive a hands on experience and see the frontline aspects that make cable possible  Primary Responsibilities:  - Actively participates in development, thrives as a dynamic, proactive, and continuous learner  - Helps to improve Comcast's results through a project or series of work in B2B Sales  - Learns to identify leads, prospect and cold call  - Learns to develop proposals, enter data into databases and close a sale while delivering on our customer promise  - Shadows Business Account Executives  - Works on a local marketing event/project  Core Responsibilities:  - Opens, sorts, and distributes mail.  - Processes routine items and records.  - Answers phones and takes messages or provides information.  - Operates various office equipment.  - Assists with projects to ensure deadlines are met.  - Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.  - Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.  Education Level:  - High School or Equivalent  Years Experience:  - Generally requires 0-2 years related experience  Additional Requirements:  - Strong interest in the telecommunications, cable and media industries  - Desire to pursue a career in B2B Sales  - Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree from a U.S. College or University  - Academically enrolled the semester after your internship and graduating by Summer 2018  - Minimum 3.0 GPA  - Ability to relocate post-graduation if offered and accepted a fulltime position  - Authorization to work in the United States  Compliance: Comcast is an EEO/AA/Drug Free Workplace. DescriptionMulti Media Outside Sales RepresentativeCox Media Group is seeking a Multi Media Outside Sales Representative to represent our complete sales portfolio, spanning print, direct mail/direct marketing and digital media. This role will work for our super brand, Austin American Statesman (AAS); we are seeking an experienced field sales representative with digital and/or media knowledge.As a Sales Representative, you will be responsible for developing assigned markets; growing and increasing revenues from high potential prospects and existing accounts. Primary responsibility will be to achieve stated product revenue goals by applying audience based solutions to meet or exceed their clients’ needs.Why a career with Cox Media Group?1. WORK FOR AWARD-WINNING BRANDS. Our brands are among the best in the industry, often ranking number one in their market.2. BE YOURSELF. MAKE US BETTER. Innovation thrives in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage everyone to contribute their best ideas.3. WE INVEST IN OUR EMPLOYEES. Cox provides a generous benefits package that includes robust health benefits for spouses and domestic partners, paid time off, 401(k) and a pension for eligible employees.4. OUR PEOPLE ARE OUR MOST VALUABLE RESOURCE. Through career development, innovation summits, ongoing training and a commitment to hiring from within, our employees help define their own career paths.5. WE ARE COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE. Every CMG location actively volunteers or contributes financial and valuable publicity support to nonprofit partners.Role Responsibilities• Responsible for complete sales cycle including prospecting, presenting, closing & retaining business across the entire portfolio including print and digital products.• Responsible for growing business with existing accounts and diversifying client spend to entire product portfolio.• Assess customers/prospect’s needs and recommend most suitable application of products to satisfy stated needs.• Collaboratively work with the primary client contact to develop, present, close and execute audience based solutions across the portfolio. Communicate specific product specifications and processes to clients and internal partners to insure quality and timely execution of purchased products.• Identify and qualify customers and prospects having significant revenue generation potential for products.• Utilize a sales automation system to manage day-to-day activities and update management of such activity through system generated activity reports.• Demonstrate a level of digital competency and aptitude in new digital media including:o Mobile media (buying, planning and reporting tools)o Social media (buying, planning and reporting tools)o SEM (buying, planning and reporting tools)o Video/Audio (buying, planning and reporting tools)o Digital Services• Demonstrate success in multi-platform, multimedia, audience based selling solutions (including programmatic)• Demonstrate an understanding of the business offerings. Demonstrate an understanding of and remain current with the print and online media market.• May assist Sales Managers to develop other account executives in either digital or print knowledge, depending upon own expertise; and/or sells techniques.• May assist with training new Account Executives on the product portfolio and positioning of ad products.• Frequent local travel required.• May be assigned other duties as needed.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications• High School Diploma or equivalent experience.• Demonstrated record of success in a goal oriented, highly accountable environment.• Demonstrated record of success cold calling for new business• Minimum of 3-years advertising/sales experience• Prior traditional advertising sales experience• Knowledge of print media landscape including competitive publicationsPreferred Qualifications• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, a related field• 5 years advertising/sales experience• Prefer experience in one or more of following sales fields: digital product sales; digital services sales, digital and/or print media; direct marketing• Media sales industry knowledgeCox Media Group is an integrated broadcasting, publishing, direct marketing and digital media company that includes the national advertising rep firms of CoxReps. Additionally, CMG owns Cox Target Media, which operates Valpak, one of North America's leading direct marketing companies, and Savings.com, a leading online source for savings.The company's operations currently include 14 broadcast television stations and one local cable channel, more than 60 radio stations, six daily newspapers and more than a dozen non-daily publications, and more than 100 digital services.CMG currently operates in more than 30 media markets and reaches approximately 52 million Americans weekly, including more than 31 million TV viewers, more than 3.5 million print and online newspaper readers, and 14 million radio listeners.Cox Media Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer; Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled.For more information about Cox Media Group, please check us out online at http://www.coxmediagroup.comOrganization: Cox Media GroupPrimary Location: US-TX-Austin-305 S Congress AveOther Locations: Dallas,US,TX,,75201|Houston,US,TX,,77001|San Antonio,US,TX,,78201Employee Status: RegularJob Level: Individual ContributorShift: Day JobTravel: Yes, 5 % of the TimeSchedule: Full-timeUnposting Date: Ongoing
