DescriptionSUMMARY OF JOBBusiness/technology reporterThe American-Statesman is looking for an experienced, motivated reporter to cover a new, hybrid beat on our business/technology team.This position will be largely general-assignment based, with about half its time devoted to the Statesman’s 512Tech.com technology reporting team and half on other general business topics.Specific aspects of the beat will include: Telecommunications (phone and cable networks, data streaming); the digital marketing and advertising sector; the local and state auto industry; ride-hailing companies; food safety; and assisting in a secondary role on coverage of retail and entertainment topics. The reporter in this role will also assist as needed on other technology topics, and will sometimes help out on other beats, including real estate, development, regional/state economics and business/government issues.The position’s flexibility will provide great opportunities to seek out strong, interesting and unusual enterprise stories across a wide variety of topics.Obviously, teamwork, adaptability and a healthy curiosity about many topics will be key attributes for this position. The right candidate will also be comfortable telling stories in multiple ways across all our platforms, including digital, print and video – and they will be comfortable regularly blogging and building their brand through social media.The ideal candidate will also be able to communicate clearly with co-workers and managers, and be able to understand how their work – and their beat – fits into the bigger picture both of the Statesman’s business team and the newsroom as a whole.The Statesman’s business/technology team operates with a culture of collaboration; candidates with a lone-wolf style and an unwillingness to work closely with fellow business team reporters will not succeed on our team. We value reporters who are self-motivated, who seek out new challenges and who consistently hone their craft and learn new skillsESSENTIAL JOB RESULTS AND CRITERIAGenerate thoughtful, timely and practical story ideas that break news, identify trends, give context and insight to news events or issues, profile people and help readers cope with their day-to-day lives. Develop these ideas into stories that are accurate, compelling, well structured and delivered for publication by an agreed upon deadline. In addition, take assignments from originating editors and follow them through to publication in the same manner described above. Published work must be competitive with all other print and electronic information sources in Central Texas, including other newspapers, television and radio stations and Internet sources. Whether measuring through individual stories or as a body of work, the reporter’s published product should be of value to readers, improve the quality of the newspaper and meet the company’s goal of being the premiere source of news and information in the region.In addition to regular reporting duties, an Enterprise Reporter II provides consistent daily coverage and quality enterprise for the front page or major section front. Consistently demonstrates an ability to handle complex sourcing, writing and story organization.QualificationsQUALIFICATIONS:Minimum Education/Experience Some college and at least five years daily experience. This may include experience gained through school publications and internshipsKnowledge, Skills and AbilitiesShould understand the fundamentals and ethics of journalism, have a good eye for news and feature stories, and have a demonstrated ability to report and write news and feature stories. Should have the ability to establish relationships and get along with sources, peers and supervisors. Should be curious, open to varying points of view, observant, persistent, quick, accurate and balanced. Should be able to think visually. Should be well read and have a social conscience. Must be able to converse and write clearly in English. Must be able to gather and synthesize information to write accurate, timely, interesting, balanced and well structured stories on a daily, deadline basis. Must possess good writing, spelling, organizational and communication skills. Must be able to gather information using a wide range of techniques including face-to-face interviews, telephone conversations, e-mail messaging, the Internet research and standard hard-copy records searches. Must have the ability to establish relationships and get along with sources, peers and supervisors. Must be reliable and trustworthy. They should have the ability to solve fundamental math problems such as addition, subtraction and percentages. Knowledge of Texas, Central Texas and Austin is an advantage.OtherThe reporter will be given work schedules in advance. However, news assignments could require weekday hours, night hours, and weekend and holiday shifts. The reporter must be able to quickly get to various locations in Central Texas during the day and at night and must be available to travel, if required. Must have transportation and a valid driver's license.Preferred Education/Experience College journalism degree and six or more years daily newspaper reporting experience is preferred. Demonstrated ability to generate compelling, practical and publishable story ideas. Ability to develop and maintain sources of information. Demonstrated ability to write news, news feature, news analysis and feature stories, including personality profiles.Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesAll of the above, plus: Reporters should have a well-rounded educational background and life experience. They should have thorough understanding of how society works and have developed an expertise in the history, events, issues and trends in one or more areas of coverage. Knowledge of Texas, Central Texas and Austin is an advantage. The a bility to communicate in Spanish is an advantage.OtherThe reporter will be given work schedules in advance, but assignments could require weekday hours, night hours, and weekend and holiday shifts. The reporter must be able to quickly get to various locations in Central Texas during the day and at night and must be available to travel, if required. Must have transportation and a valid driver's license.Cox Media Group (CMG) is an integrated broadcasting, publishing, direct marketing and digital media company that also includes the National Advertising Platform businesses of CoxReps - the country’s biggest television rep firm - Gamut , and Videa . The company’s operations currently include 14 broadcast television stations; more than 60 radio stations; six daily newspapers, more than a dozen non-daily publications; and more than 100 digital sites and services, like Rare.us , Clark.com , Dawg Nation , SEC Country , Hookem.com , and All22 . CMG currently operates in more than 20 media markets and reaches approximately 52 million Americans weekly, including more than 31 million TV viewers, more than 3.5 million newspaper readers, and nearly 15 million radio listeners. For more information about Cox Media Group, please check us out online at www.coxmediagroup.com .Organization: Cox Media GroupPrimary Location: US-TX-Austin-305 S Congress AveEmployee Status: RegularJob Level: Individual ContributorShift: Day JobTravel: Yes, 5 % of the TimeSchedule: Full-timeUnposting Date: Ongoing

Ensure marketing assets are always up to date  Help with product merchandising on eCommerce site and other miscellaneous marketing tasks as required Promote strong sense of teamwork by working together effectively, respectfully and efficiently with all associates. Provide and support excellent service by exhibiting a positive attitude and enthusiasm toward the job and company to both internal and external customers in all forms of communication. Required Skills College Senior, recent graduate, or graduate student pursuing degree in related field Efficiently meet deadlines, be detail oriented, able to self organize and strong communication skills High attention to detail, process oriented, fast learner, self starter Tech Savvy Communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you Self-motivated, quick learner, and able to prioritize and multi-task effectively Ability to collaborate and work on a busy and dynamic team Solid written and verbal communication skills Desire to learn and implement principles of E-commerce and marketing Positive, enthusiastic attitude and a natural problem solver Knowledge of HTML and CSS helpful, but not required The job description and other aspects of the job listed on this job posting should not be construed to contain every function/responsibility that may be required to be performed by an associate in this job. Associates are required to perform other related functions as assigned. Home Products How To Media About DAP Careers Careers JOB OPENINGS BENEFITS LOCATIONS    MENU      APPLY Job Title Digital & Social Media Intern Date Posted 2/17/2017 Location Baltimore, MD Position Id EB-1831851752 Job Description We're looking for a student who'll work part-time as a Digital & Social Media Intern, with a love of DIY and Home Improvements a plus. The ideal candidate is familiar with web content management, digital communications, and marketing. Our department is fast paced and a can-do attitude is essential. The internship is a great opportunity to gain real world professional web project, content management, and social media content creation and coordination experience. The Digital & Social Media intern will discover the ins and outs of marketing while assisting with projects such as the optimization and content management of our website, social media campaigns, influencer marketing, and much more. Responsibilities may include: Assisting with content management (uploading content in to content management system, ensuring content meets brand standards) Creation of original social media content (blog posts, Facebook posts, etc.) as necessary and maintenance of digital content editorial calendar Optimization of brand website (writing SEO optimized copy including keywords, product descriptions and website copy as needed) Conducting competitive keyword research Regularly producing analytics reports tracking progress towards internal goals Scheduling and coordination of social media content + partner blog posts Prior experience with social media/analytics is a must, as are strong writing skills and attention to detail Strategize new ways to reach core markets, staying up to date with emerging trends and styles across social platforms Supporting key retailers and our product content on their sites Assisting with creation of a new outreach/employee advocacy program‰ÛÓto include a Style Guide for advocates‰ÛÓthat we‰Ûªll be developing this summer Contribute both individually and as a team member in meetings and brainstorming sessions Update project plans, coordinate schedules and assist with project related tasks as needed Desired Skills & Qualifications (needed to perform the work): This position requires outstanding communication and computer skills as well as an in-depth understanding of the internet. Candidate must be self-motivated, mature, decisive, and possess an exceptionally strong attention to detail. The ability to communicate persuasively and with personality in writing is vital. The candidate must be highly proficient with social media, including: Instagram, Pinterest, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Tumblr, etc. Proficiency with scheduling tools like Sprout Social is ideal. This internship is geared towards students currently enrolled in a full time undergraduate or graduate degree program in marketing, communications, or a related field.Required  Qualifications: Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Experience using Instagram, Pinterest, Facebook, Twitter, etc. Ability to set and adhere to strict deadlines  Some experience with hand-coding HTML preferred Knowledge of Content Management Systems such as Drupal, Joomla, Word Press, Umbraco or other similar system Some knowledge of SEO ideal, but not required Some experience with video and imaging editing software preferred (i.e. Photoshop, Final Cut PRO, etc.) Ability to learn quickly An interest in or passion for DIY and Home Improvement  Semester:    Summer 2017 Schedule:    32 hours per week Compensation:   $12.00 per hour  EEO   Number of Openings 1 APPLY   Terms of Use & Privacy Policy | Contact Us | Dealer Info å© 2015 DAP Products Inc.

Day 7 Photography is a wedding photography studio based in Austin, Texas. With over 100 weddings photographed since 2011, we specialize in candid, natural, and organic photography for nature-inspired couples. Our goal is to tell powerful and compelling stories through photography.Even though thousands of beautiful pictures are taken, it is only about 10% of what goes into the work. In this hyper-competitive industry, it takes constant innovation, commitment to excellence, and a sharp mind for details. I am looking for someone with a marketing interest to help us do what we love doing, tell powerful stories by connecting with potential customers.As the marketing coordinator intern, your job will be to help connect prospective customers with Day 7 Photography. This internship will provide valuable insight to what a small business looks like on a daily basis. You will witness the glamor and the guts of a real business, as well as put to practice real-life marketing and advertising concepts.Your responsibilities will be:- Strengthen social media platforms- Develop social media marketing plans- Research the industry and gather key insights to the Austin market- Create and present a complete marketing plan- Learn how to maintain good SEO practices for any website- Create lists of representing key contacts- Design and create marketing materialsJob Type: InternshipJob Location:Austin, TX

Digital Marketing InternDeMarche Associates, Inc. is a leading financial research, investment consulting and investment management firm. Founded in 1974, DeMarche offers an array of services designed to help institutional trustees manage their organization’s endowments, pensions and private funds.If you are looking for a full-time paid summer internship in digital marketing, we’d like to hear from you. You must be a current college student enrolled in a local KC metro accredited university. Preference will be given to applicants who are a college junior, senior or graduate student enrolled in media marketing and web technology courses. This financial research internship is full-time for the period of June 1 through July 31 with hours 8:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Monday - Friday. This is a paid hourly position and is not eligible for other benefits or relocation.Duties involve contributing to digital marketing projects at the tactical level from start to finish involving hands-on experience optimizing campaigns, assessing traffic, nurturing existing campaigns, developing marketing materials and offering marketing suggestions.Qualifications, Skills and Experiences :High level of proficiency with the Microsoft 2010/2013 product suite for business: Advanced Word and Publisher, plus use of Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint.Ability to master new technical skills including Google applications.Graphic design experience is a plus.High level of interpersonal, verbal and written communications skills. The position requires demonstrated poise, tact and diplomacy.Ability to solve problems, multi-task, and produce results within due dates.Attention to detail, initiative to proofread, and reasonable speed in producing professional results.Must be able to summarize technical investment or economic material with narrative and graphics.Ability to work and produce results in a cubicle working amidst team members.A college major in marketing, technology or a combination thereof is preferred, but may be supplemented with comparable work experience.You must be capable of understanding financial subject matter sufficient to create, proof and edit technical presentations and web material.Creative thinking and confidence are necessary skills sets to succeed in this internship.Qualified applicants may apply with a resume. No phone calls, please. No agencies. DeMarche is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Visit us at www.demarche.comJob Type: Internship

Perfect for a recent graduate, soon-to-be graduate, or someone looking for an opportunity to grow in a new career.Mostly evening (approx 2:15pm to 10:15pm Mon-Thurs), with some Friday, Saturday, and Sunday shifts as needed.Position is approximately described as:- 20% updating and creating files, and other website and/or graphic design tasks- 40% customer service and administrative/retail tasks- 40% production, bindery, and/or fulfillment tasksApplicants must:- Be organized and extremely detail-oriented.- Possess above-average skills in Adobe InDesign.- Possess basic knowledge of all Creative Suite and Microsoft Office programs (Photoshop, Illustrator, Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher, etc).- Be able to type 40+ words per minute.- Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.- Have tremendous phone etiquette, confidently and politely communicating with a wide variety of customers in a professional setting.- Be able to consistently remain motivated and highly productive with limited supervision.- Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment.Daily duties would include, but are not limited to:- Updating and altering existing files.- Creating and/or designing graphics for use in both digital and print formats.- Entering job specs into ordering system, verifying for accuracy.- Answering phones, emails, and helping walk-in customers.-Coordinating the relationship between the production team and the customer - due dates, specs, questions, concerns, etc...- Assisting with other production, finishing, and/or fulfillment work as necessary.Compensation is dependent on the strength of the candidate's skills, prior experience, and overall flexibility/availability.Applicants will not be considered without a brief cover letter explaining their interest in the position, along with their resume.Job Type: Full-time

column23: PAID INTERNSHIP, NEW GRADUATES! PART TIME/ FULL TIMEAre you obsessed with finding and sharing stories online? Do your friends look to you on Facebook and Twitter for the latest trends and ideas? Are you an aspiring blogger looking to engage and influence readers? Dgs is based in Castle Rock, Colorado and is a premier company providing online customer acquisition to vast organizations. With over 800 employees worldwide and partnerships with some of the largest and most innovative companies in the US, we are looking to transform how the world discovers and promotes our client’s products and services.Dgs has a fast paced work environment and we seek talented employees who crave learning new skills and aren't afraid to tackle big projects. As an Intern you will get the opportunity to work with content from some of the largest industry brands, while networking with other marketing professionals. This is a perfect opportunity for candidates to gain more experience in writing for blogs, social media, and lead generation.Our ideal candidate is someone who walks into a room of people and can’t leave without making a few friends. Someone who is creative and thoughtful when interacting with online communities and building relationships. You should be able to develop engaging content to attract and retain customers. For this position, it’s also essential to be up-to-date with new technologies and marketing trends.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESEdit, create content for current and future SEO sites residential and commercial.Develop editorial calendar and design content marketing strategies for both short-term and long-term content goals.Undertake content marketing initiatives to achieve business targets.Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies. Identify trends and insights in the existing platforms, and optimize spend and performance based on the insights.Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests.Utilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points.Evaluate emerging technologies, while providing thoughtful and perspective for adoption where appropriate.Share content through various channels, ensuring strong web presence.Monitor competitors’ content marketing activities.Improving customer engagement and conversion on our websites.WHAT WE REQUIREKnowledge of strategic content optimization considering organic search visibility.Knowledge of writing for both Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and user engagement.Background in Marketing, Communication or other related discipline.Strong communication skills.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.Organized, with an ability to prioritize time-sensitive assignments.Creative and Flexible.Ability to interact, communicate and present ideas.Editorial mindset with an ability to predict audience preferences.Want to learn more about the company? Visit our website at dgsworld.com. Dinova is an innovative, proprietary marketplace connecting expense account diners to quality restaurants nationwide. Dinova influences $6B annually in business meals and entertainment expenses. Participating companies range from more than a million SMBs to hundreds of Fortune 500 enterprises, and its 14,000+ restaurant network includes local independents, national full-service and limited-service brands, encompassing all price levels and cuisines.Dinova is currently looking for Summer 2017 interns. This paid marketing/data research internship will entail research to enrich data for company prospects. This role requires knowledge of Microsoft Office, specifically Excel. The intern will make phone calls, learn to use CRM software for data entry, and work with other research personnel. The intern will report to the Director of Demand Generation.The position will begin May 8, 2017 – August 4, 2017Responsibilities: Data entry in Excel, online research, calling prospectsRequirements:This position has a requirement of professionalism, maturity within an office setting and a knowledge of Microsoft Office, specifically Excel. In many cases, the intern may be cold calling to obtain information and therefore needs to have some boldness to do so.Job Type: Internship

Direct Results Radio is seeking a Part-Time Paid Intern for our Venice, CA office. This is an exciting entry-level position where you will learn all facets of Audio Media, Direct Response, Promotion Marketing and more.As a new member of the marketing team you will assist staff members and be responsible for reporting, analytic, media-buying, customer service and business development. This is a ground floor opportunity with growth potential for the right candidate!INTERN POSITIONThis position is a fantastic opportunity to begin a career at Direct Results. Candidate will learn the power of AUDIO and DIRECT MARKETING and how to increase product and service sales by effectively reaching a target audience.Areas of Focus:Working with our clients to understand their customer, product, and long and short-term goals for advertising. Working with broadcast partners and the DIRECT RESULTS team to develop strategy. Planning and buying media and analyzing the response for ROI.Qualifications:One year college/work experience in media, advertising or marketing preferredCompensation:We offer you a friendly, fun work environment, the tools and opportunity to grow within our company. This is an entry level position. Please submit your resume with a cover letter for consideration.DIRECT RESULTS creates audio advertising campaigns that inspire consumers to take immediate action and drive them to respond. Every campaign is customized to precisely match the advertiser with key consumers and deliver a message to elicit action. Direct Results uses a state-of-the-art proprietary software program identifying broadcasters by 72 psychographics and lifestyle characteristics. The program catalogs all historic ROI data allowing DIRECT RESULTS to effectively pinpoint the target consumer. We specialize in "everything audio" and work in virtually every category including: health, beauty, diet, financial, business opportunity, entertainment, retail, political, travel, B to B and others.Join us!Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Los Angeles, CARequired experience:Marketing: 1 yearcollege/: 2 years

Talent Attraction is a big part of what we do here at DISHER, because passionate people are a central piece of the puzzle in making any organization work and perform well. It is our goal for you to obtain a rewarding career whether it‰Ûªs at DISHER or with one of our partnering companies. Take a look at our complete list of job openings here at DISHER and with other appealing companies we work with.   DISHER AND PARTNER POSITIONS Marketing Intern EMAIL IN SHARE Location: Zeeland, Michigan Date Posted: 01-30-2017 We are currently searching for a Marketing Intern to join our Discovery / Marketing Team for the summer of 2017.  About DISHER:  DISHER is a nationally-recognized product development and business consulting firm with offices in Zeeland and Ann Arbor, Michigan and Indianapolis, Indiana. Our team is highly technical and diversified, serving in a variety of markets including automotive, office furniture, alternative energy, and medical. Our capabilities span from napkin sketch through launch, providing numerous opportunities for us to partner with clients in product and process development. DISHER also assists clients with business solutions and Talent identification and attraction. Check out more about what we do at HTTP://WWW.DISHER.COM/ABOUT-US/     Responsibilities: Maintain and update the DISHER website and social media sites Assist in developing digital marketing assets including presentations and electronic marketing materials Assist our marketing and business development team in developing marketing strategies Help advance website content and functionality, including microsites and landing pages Help manage marketing key word campaigns Develop and distribute e-marketing including blogs, e-newsletters, and Linked In articles Manage and grow digital marketing mailing lists Review SEO analysis, conduct market research, and develop case studies Create monthly company email newsletters If experienced in graphic design, create internal materials as needed (name tags, invitations, business cards, etc.) Develop presentation materials and maintain product portfolio Organize files, samples, and display area Support events & other on-the-fly tasks Instigate nerf gun battles Coordinate and publish posts to DISHER‰Ûªs blog Need to be ready to jump in to assist your teammates  Requirements for this role:   Must currently be enrolled in a College or University as an upper-classmen in a communications or marketing program 6 months or more of experience in areas of Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field required Able to work on web content development and social media Graphic design skills a plus Adobe Creative Suite experience (Illustrator & InDesign in particular) preferred but not required Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and PPT required Ability to work independently and as part of our Discovery/Marketing team on a variety of projects as needed Marketing research experience desired Assist in creating design solutions that are aesthetically strong, thoughtful, and brand appropriate Knowledge of statistical analysis, ethnography, demographics, anthropology, and psychology a plus Able to conceptualize and design marketing print media, presentations, and additional visual communication designs Able to design files for review and printing Knowledge of Digital Marketing, including experience with E-Newsletters, Blogs, Key Word Campaigns, Microsites and Landing Pages preferred Experience with Google Analytics and Word Press preferred Must have a keen sense of urgency Must be effective in reloading a Nerf gun in the midst of an ambush Must have current and continuing right to work in the United States without sponsorship   To apply, click the following link, search job # 8038870, and attach resume with your application: HTTP://DISHERDESIGN.CATSONE.COM/CAREERS  The Culture: DISHER is truly and simply a cool place to work.  The teams are supportive, skilled, and passionate. Our culture is rooted in innovation and our mission is to make a positive difference for our teammates, our customers, and our community.  The work motto at DISHER tends to be, ‰ÛÏWork Hard - Play Hard.‰Û  The teams at DISHER are diligent with their projects and truly enjoy the company of their peers.  Hear more from DISHER team members at HTTP://DISHER.COM/ABOUT-US/CULTURE/         APPLY NOW DISHER HEADQUARTERS 201 West Washington Ave. Suite 230 Zeeland, MI 49464 DISHER EAST MICHIGAN OFFICE 3940 Ranchero Dr. Suite 150 Ann Arbor, MI 48108 JOB OPENINGS BLOG CONTACT MAKING A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE Subscribe to our monthly newsletter! å© 2016 DISHER | DEVELOPED BY SHINEFORTH

View Dashboard Web/Social Media Intern Apply Now Job ID 425272BR Location Houston, Texas, United States Job Posting Company Disney ABC Television Group Job Posting Area Disney ABC Television Group Date posted 02/10/2017 Job Description KTRK-TV, the ABC Owned station located in Houston, TX is accepting applications for a paid WEB/SOCIAL MEDIA INTERN for the summer semester. Internships are available to currently enrolled undergraduate college students in their junior or senior year pursuing careers in the television/media field and must receive college credit for the internship. The internship program is designed to provide students with an on-site educational experience that complements their academic studies. Interns will have an opportunity to observe and participate in the daily work and operations of a major market, television station. As an intern, you will turn content generated from multiple sources into comprehensive stories formatted for digital display in a fast-paced environment. The intern will interact with newsroom personnel to get text, video and images onto multiple digital platforms. Intern will make have hand in keeping station‰Ûªs various social media platforms active. You will have the opportunity to learn how to write, shoot, produce and edit news and programming promotions as well as create digital ads, social videos, and original content that keeps audiences engaged in our local news products. The ideal candidate will be a team player with a strong interest in creating and promoting local news. Non-linear editing knowledge and a thorough understanding and enjoyment of social media platforms are a tremendous plus. Applicants must be currently enrolled in college and will be required to supply written verification of eligibility to receive academic credit for the internship at the start of the internship. Hours will be scheduled around school and may vary and will include some weekend and early morning and evening hours. To be considered you must apply online at www.disneycareers.com , Job Req. #425272BR. Please upload a cover letter, your resume outlining other internships, degrees earned, work experience, related clubs and organizations, current major course of study, expected graduation date and extracurricular activities. Applicants must be currently enrolled in college and will be required to supply written verification of eligibility to receive academic credit for the internship at the start of the internship. VIEW OUR WEBSITE VIEW ALL JOBS Marketing Intern San Francisco, CA Internship Marketing Entry Level Doximity is changing how doctors communicate. We‰Ûªve built the largest network of physicians, with over 70% of US doctors as members, and we‰Ûªre just getting started. After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time. We believe that when doctors are connected, patients benefit and the healthcare system improves. As the eyes and ears of our users, the marketing team‰Ûªs responsibility is to deeply understand our clinicians‰Ûª challenges and strategically build marketing campaigns to meet their needs.  There are also opportunities to work with our BD and product teams with the goal of assisting with partnerships and integrations that will enhance product, grow membership and meet our strategic goals for 2017.  What you‰Ûªll do Build and track cross channel marketing strategies that reach every single clinician in the U.S. Drive and optimize our offline and online marketing initiatives. Support the company‰Ûªs market research and competitive positioning analysis to identify key competitors and potential partners with business development and product teams. Identify unique ways to drive member growth and expansion through product enhancements and business partnerships Characteristics that will help you succeed Passionate about improving the state of healthcare. Pre-med or currently in medical school is a plus. Articulate: Whether you‰Ûªre on the phone, or writing an email or crafting a product guide, you are eloquent and reflect the voice of the company (and adjust when needed). You have strong writing and editing skills. Your mantra is: Data or it didn‰Ûªt happen SQL knowledge is a plus. Healthcare or hospital experience preferred, but not required. MacGyver attitude: When something needs to get done, you are creative, persistent and resourceful. You do what it takes to GSD (get stuff done). Personable: Whether you‰Ûªre talking to businesses, colleagues or our beloved doctors (our users), you can hold your own. Perks Fully stocked kitchen, breakfast and catered lunch daily. CalTrain/Muni pass. All-company retreat in fun places like Beverly Hills and Lake Tahoe. Rooftop game room with a beautiful view of SF skyline. About Doximity Doximity is the leading online medical network with over 70% of U.S. doctors as members. Putting a dent in the inefficiencies of our $2.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system. VC-backed startup located in SoMa San Francisco. Strong revenues, real market traction. Launched by Jeff Tangney in 2011; Jeff previously founded healthcare pioneer Epocrates (NASDAQ: EPOC). After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time. Privacy Policy Job Openings Content Marketing Intern Marketing ‰ÛÒ Saint Charles, Missouri DSquared International LLC is a family owned ecommerce startup company based in the St. Louis area. The company was created to bring the finest consumer brands to customers by leveraging the power of the internet. At DSquared International, we decided to create a company based on the idea that there‰Ûªs more to life than punching a clock and collecting a paycheck. True fulfillment comes from achieving big goals and being a part of something bigger than yourself. Our people and our customers are our top priority. Without them, we would be nothing. We pride ourselves on our innovation, creativity, and willingness to try and possibly fail. All success comes on the other side of failure. We are committed to our fundamental core values: Fun, Passion, Integrity, Personal Growth, and Hard Work, which all center around Excellence ‰ÛÒ the true definition of our company‰Ûªs success. We are on a mission to create the best damn consumer products brands on the internet and ensure that our customers receive the best experience possible. Because of that vision, we are experiencing 3X year-over-year growth and focused on taking the company to $20M annual revenue in the next 5 years. Job Description We are looking for a qualified intern to join our marketing team. As a Content Marketing Intern at DSquared International, you will work directly with the marketing team to create social media and blog content strategies to drive traffic to our products on Amazon and our brand website. This intern should be prepared to work in a team environment where self initiative and an entrepreneurial spirit is both encouraged and highly expected. This internship will provide you with experience in various social media channels including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Pinterest. Who are you? DSquared International is looking for ambitious, adaptable, A-level players that are excited to work hard and create their definition of success. Everyone has different goals and dreams, and while we need your help to us reach ours, we‰Ûªre passionate about helping you reach yours. If you‰Ûªre boring‰Û_don‰Ûªt apply. We like to work with fun people that want to do something creative and BIG. Social media and content marketing require fresh new ideas that grab ATTENTION. If you‰Ûªre lazy‰Û_don‰Ûªt apply. Work should be a BLAST, but it‰Ûªs still work, and we expect a lot out of our people. We work HARD so we can play HARD. If you don‰Ûªt like to think for yourself and want everything handed to you on a silver platter‰Û_don‰Ûªt apply. In a startup environment, our primary marketing focus can change from one day to the next. You need to be a self-starter and be excited and hungry to learn more about digital marketing. If you‰Ûªre willing to invest time into your learning, you will become a kick ass marketer.  If you‰Ûªre a dreamer, that‰Ûªs looking for more than a traditional 9-to-5 and likes to get outside the box and do things a little bit differently than what is ‰ÛÏnormal‰Û or ‰ÛÏexpected‰Û, then DSquared International might be the right fit for you! The task at hand Responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to: Creating, implementing, and measuring Facebook, Instagram, Google, and Pinterest content campaigns to drive sales and generate leads Creating content marketing strategies designed to grow our social media following and increase traffic to our blog and website Improving Search Engine Optimization (SEO) for high value keywords by performing keyword research, creating blogs and content, and building links Assisting in the launch of new products on Amazon and our website The ideal candidate Strong communication and writing skills with attention to detail and ability to write concisely with a strong voice Strong technological savvy ‰ÛÒ 99% of what we do involves the computer. It‰Ûªs okay if you‰Ûªve never created a video, website, or blog before, but if you‰Ûªre intimidated by the idea of having to learn how, this probably isn‰Ûªt for you Experience using Facebook/Pinterest/Twitter/Instagram Experience using Photoshop or Canva to create digital content is a huge plus but not a requirement Demonstrated success in managing personal brand on social media Pursuing a degree in marketing, visual communications, art, or graphic design An appetite to eat challenges for breakfast and see opportunities and solutions in the face of those challenges An ability to carry out a concept from start to finish solo and as a part of a team A hunger to learn all things content marketing and take the risk to try something new without fear of ‰ÛÏfailing‰Û A smile and a sparking personality that will mesh well with the DSquared family  To apply, please submit a resume and cover letter. In your cover letter tell us why you think you'd be a good fit for DSquared International, your favorite social media platform and why, and the 3 things you are most passionate about. Send this job to a friend Summer Intern Location: Downers Grove, IL Department: Marketing Schedule: Full Time Shift: Day Shift Hours: 9am-5pm Job Details:   The mission of DuPage Medical Group is to enhance the physical well being of the patients we serve by continuing to provide the highest quality medical care available. We are tight-knit physician group that sets the industry standard and keeps ahead of the curve in the ever-changing field of healthcare.   We are looking for a detail oriented, compassionate individual that has exceptional customer service.   SUMMARY:            Think that working in the healthcare field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. This 8-10 week Summer Internship Program will allow students to apply their classroom knowledge in the world of health care.      ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:   Average daily assignments include but aren't limited to: Content creation for internal and external facing communication   Assist with writing and managing monthly consumer eNewsletters for DMG and affiliated brands   Manage collateral development process to completion   Data collection and analysis of e-communication efforts   Assist with event planning & activation (events may be after normal work hours on evenings and/or weekends)   Supporting social media and digital signage   Assist on video and photo shoots   Assist with organizing print and photo library filing system   Other duties as assigned     Requirements: Junior, senior or recent grad in marketing or a related field (e.g., English, Creative Writing, Marketing/Advertising, Communications)   Previous internship or related experience in marketing or communications is a plus   High standard of verbal communication   Should have a passion for writing   Ability to communicate in a professional manner with patients, consumers and community members   Must be computer savvy (working knowledge of Microsoft Office). Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite or video editing a plus.             KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Strong project management and writing skills      Knowledge and experience with multimedia content     Experience with social media and/or collaboration platforms Ability to problem solve, prioritize, organize and multitask     Self-starter, highly motivated and able to work with a minimum of supervision                                  EDUCATION and / or CERTIFICATION/LICENSURE: Bachelor's degree coursework related to requirements described above.      PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS: Sitting for long periods of time, standing, bending, stooping, stretching for files and supplies, occasional lifting of papers, files, etc. of up to 30 pounds.  Requires vision correctable to 20/20 and hearing in the normal range for face-to-face and telephone contacts.  Also requires hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, switchboard, telephone, calculator, photocopier, fax machine, and other related office equipment.  Entails prolonged use of the telephone and computer.  Walking is required throughout the day.     Click Here to Apply Online  Current Employees Click Here to Apply Online    back to top

column23: JOB TITLE: Communications InternshipREPORTS TO: Marketing and Communications Manager, Operations DepartmentJOB FUNCTION:The Intern will support E-470’s Communications team by providing direct assistance to the Marketing and Communications Manager, the Marketing Coordinator, the Operations Coordinator, the graphic designer and the PR consultants.DUTIES:Execute planned marketing and advertising activitiesAssist with the execution of all social media effortsManage the YouTube Channel video update projectManage the company’s YouTube channel, LinkedIn and Instagram accountsManage the member jurisdiction sponsorship activitiesAssist with the analysis and research for marketing effortsAssist with E-470 events and other activitiesContribute to other communication efforts such as public relations, newsletters, community relations, monthly E-470 customer messaging and website updatesAssist with public relations and educational programs related to E-470’s support of US 36, I-25 and the I-70 Express Lanes projects*REQUIREMENTS:Student completing 3rd year/entering 4th year of an undergraduate program leading to a degree related to communications, marketing, advertising or journalism. Easy Ice seeks bright, friendly and energetic undergraduate Sales-Marketing Interns to join their team in Marquette, Michigan . All candidates must have a strong desire to learn and a passion for continuous improvement. The Intern position is full-time during the summer of 2017.In this role, you will support the Sales Representatives to ensure prompt communication with customers and proper documentation to maximize sales potential. This position also assists in several national marketing initiatives, working closely with the Marketing Director. As an Easy Ice Intern, you are an enthusiastic individual who is able to assist the Sales Representatives in establishing new accounts and will work closely with them to secure the first order while building a lasting business relationship with our customers. This position requires a person that strives to assist in the growth of a rapidly expanding company and has the passion to understand the sales process from start to finish for Inside Sales and Corporate Sales accounts.WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:Currently enrolled in a college Marketing, Business or related field.You possess exceptional verbal and written communication skills.You are able to collect data and prepare reports.You are relentlessly curious, tech savvy and enjoy solving problems.You work effectively with employees in various departments of the company.You possess strong phone skills and the ability to project a pleasant tone.You can prioritize while working in a fast-paced environment.You possess working knowledge of computer programs (Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook) and multi-line phone systems.You are organized, energetic and reliable.You are self-motivated, disciplined and work well individually and as a team member.You have a desire to continually increase your knowledge of the industries we serve and products, services and processes our company can produce.NO PHONE CALLS or WALK-INS PLEASE.APPLY ONLINE AT http://www.easyice.com/sales-and-marketing-intern/(Please note: resumes submitted by clicking “Apply Now” are NOT reviewed)DEADLINE TO APPLY: March 31, 2017LEARN MORE ABOUT EASY ICE AT easyice.comJob Type: InternshipSalary: $10.00 /hourRequired education:High school or equivalent

About eBooks2go:eBooks2go offers unique solutions to publishers and authors in the United States, India and the Asia Pacific region. For publishers, our services include providing eBook Conversion services, global distribution, Royalty reporting and e-commerce solutions. We have developed our own CMS (Content Management System) to sell online Print / eBook editions . For authors, we provide a wide variety of services including file conversions, eBook distribution, cover designs, and even marketing assistance. It is our mission to become the official one-stop shop for everyone’s self-publishing needs.About this Job:eBooks2go is a fast growing hybrid publisher located in Schaumburg, IL looking for a Sales/Marketing Intern.Responsibilities:- Making phone calls and sending emails to distribution channels and outreach to new clients.- Assisting with book distribution and circulation.- Quoting and estimating.- Research accounts online and assisting team on new projects.- Media outreach and promotional outreach.- Brainstorm with the team regarding campaign ideas.Qualifications:- Must be comfortable with telephone interactions; making and receiving calls.- Passion for customer focused sales.- Deadline-driven. Works with a sense of urgency.- Strong phone skills and etiquette.- Confident verbal, written, and illustrate communication skills.- Strong Organizational skills and accountability.- able to meet deadlines and keep managing team informed of progress.- Previous Internship experience in the book industry or publishing preferred.- Majoring in Marketing, Communications, or Business degree.- Energetic, creative and eager to learn.eBooks2go is looking for applicants for a Sales/Marketing Intern position, a go getter! Qualified candidates are recent college graduates or enrolled in a college program who possess strong communication and written skills, the ability to multi-task, and a passion for the publishing industry. Other preferred experience includes fluency in social media platforms such as LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter. 20 hours a week. Monday thru Friday between the hours of 10 am and2 pm. The hourly stipend is currently $11.00 per hour.Job Type: InternshipSalary: $11.00 /hour

column21: Edgewood Center for Children and Families
column23: Newsletter Signup Search DONATE NOW Referrals Press Contact Us home / who we are / careers Select Language‰Ð_ marketing & communications internship ‰ÛÒ paid` - san francisco The Marketing & Communications Internship is a paid position reporting to the Director of Marketing and Communications in San Francisco. This is a wonderful opportunity to develop high level communication and marketing skills that can influence, and educate the public about children's mental health, while helping to increase Edgewood's brand awareness with supporters and the public. Description: Edgewood Center for Children and Families is a nonprofit that helps children, youth, and their families who have suffered from abuse, neglect, trauma, and other mental health issues. Edgewood has been serving the Bay Area since 1851 and is one of the oldest children's charities in the western US. In 2016, Edgewood helped more than 9,000 youth and their families by providing a variety of programs and services including Residential, Crisis Stabilization, School and Community-based, and Preventative and Intervention programs. Learn more at Edgewood.org. Responsibilities: - Write effective copy, excelling in correct spelling, punctuation, and grammar.  - Develop stories for a variety of communication mediums including website, e-newsletter, and printed collateral.  - Use alternate forms of communication (including graphic arts), resulting in improved interactions.  - Edit and proof other team members work and provide constructive feedback.  - Social media experience.  - Back-end website knowledge a plus. Requirements: - Possess skills at initiating innovative ideas, unifying team members, and judging correctly what will appeal to target audiences.  - Prefer challenges that involve communication, are people-oriented, promote networking and socializing, and include roles that call for imagination. - Be able to work at the campus headquarters in San Francisco  - Be able to commit 80 hours a month - Provide relevant writing samples and references Skills: Required - Microsoft Word, Social Media, Marketing Communications, Desktop Publishing, Photo Editing, Video Camera, Multimedia Journalism Preferred - Website Administration   Job Details Reference # 14320 Posted on Feb 27, 2017 Closes on Location(s) San Francisco , California Department Development Career level Entry Level Hours/Status Part-time More details (document) Apply now! Edible Oils Marketing Intern Apply for this Position  CFM Management is the hiring arm of foodguys. We are seeking a talented, versatile and down-to-earth marketing intern for the summer of 2017. In this position you will be supporting a Senior Sales Rep that specifically works with edible oils. When we say Edible you may not think what we mean. We mean Avocado Oil, Coconut Oil, Olive Oil, GMO free Canola Oil, etc, you know, all the stuff you cook with. It‰Ûªs okay if you thought something different. Be sure to check out our website to understand our branding, http://foodguys.com and http://cfm-management.com. We‰Ûªve got a couple videos on youtube (you can click through from CFM), and an Instagram page at https://www.instagram.com/foodguyspdx/. So let your marketing skills go to work, and then apply. This would be a great position for someone specifically studying the graphic arts side of marketing, who has completed their junior year, or has recently walked, but is receiving their diploma in the fall. What will you be doing? The stuff listed here, maybe not in this order, but you will touch all these processes: Create marketing material specific to edible oils Start the conversation, and keep it going via Social Media Basic Point of Sale (POS) layout and design Design labels using existing templates, and in keeping with food label guidelines Write blogs, record vlogs Update, make minor changes to a WordPress site Keep records of social media successes Develop basic marketing campaigns Handle marketing related paperwork; copy, scan, etc. Perform basic administrative support to Sr. Sales Rep Represent company at social functions, as needed Take professional level pictures of products What are we looking for? Recently completed third year of Marketing with a concentration in visual arts and/or graphic design Previous marketing internship helpful, but not required Experience running social media for another entity highly preferred (local bands and other types of grass roots experience is welcome) Experience writing web based content Experience writing print based content What are the knowledge, skills and abilities you need? Mostly things listed below, but don‰Ûªt be dissuaded if you are missing one or two. Unless it‰Ûªs Adobe Creative Suite, we really need you to have a solid understanding of Illustrator, with 80-90% of the following: Excellent MS Office Suite skills Ability to learn the technical side of foods, with a special interest in edible oils Knowledge of food industry helpful Ability to attend events that may happen outside the scope of normal business hours Ability to use a DSLR, and set up professional looking photo shoots Ability to work Monday through Friday 7:30 to 4:30 Ability to travel to customer sites with Sr. Sales Representative Ability to act as professional representative of company, sometimes outside of regular business hours All offers contingent upon the successful completion of a drug test and background check.  Location: Wilsonville, OR Job code: MktInt022117 Get Updates Are you interested in hearing about new opportunities at CFM Management, Inc. in real time? Enter your email address below to be notified automatically when new positions are posted. Updates provided by HiringThing Know someone who'd be great for this role? column23: Steps to Apply: Any application without all 3 parts will be rejected-Resume or CV-Link to Portfolio or body of work-Cover Letter- Please describe your experience with EDM and what it means to you, and its relation to your passion as a designer.Top Reasons to Work with Us:-We're featured as one of the best companies ever on Shark Tank (March 2015- Deal with Mark Cuban & Daymond John)-Join the #189 fastest growing private company according to Inc. Magazine 5000-Featured on: Rolling Stone, Yahoo Finance, Inc. Magazine, Business Insider, CNBC, MTV, ABC's --Shark Tank, LA Weekly, MSN, and more-Enjoy the autonomy/flexibility to be creative in a highly driven environment.-Become an integral part of a core internal team with lots of room for advancement.-Great culture. Our headquarters is an environment where everyone is driven to make the company and themselves successful. We love our EDM and we love the energy around here!About the Position: Graphic Design InternWe are looking for a creative, innovative student with a passion for EDM fashion and culture to join our team, expand their skillset, and continue their passion for art and design. If you're looking for a fast-paced working environment where you will be exposed to many different types of media projects, this internship is for you. This position offers the opportunity to work with influential people in the EDM community through various artistic outlets on a wide variety of projects, beautifully catered to our favorite industry.In this position, you will work with our close-knit team of EDM enthusiasts who have a passion for their job. The Emazing Group is a pivotal force in the industry and helps set the standard of artistic excellence.You will have the opportunity to be involved and work with our marketing department, photoshoots, new and upcoming apparel, never-before-seen products, and a limitless array of projects that are constantly expanding your skillset and passions.This is an unpaid internship position but could potentially last longer. The right candidate will have some experience with all items listed below and must have the ability to work on a PC Platform.Job Requirements:-Interest in learning more about graphic design, illustration, photo editing, and apparel design.-Interest in EDM culture and our brands-Knowledge of the EDM industry and culture-Knowledge and experience with Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator-Must be willing to come into our office at least 20 hours per week (or to meet specific school qualifications)-Strong communication skills (verbal and written) and a strong attention to detail-Must be able to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment-Strong work ethic- must be able to work overtime on projects with tight deadlines-Able to work independently to complete tasks-Must have proper time management and organizational skills-Some photo editing and or apparel paneling experience a plus! +++What's In It for You:Internship Credit:The opportunity to work with and learn from the leading culture and lifestyle brand team in the EDM festival market!Job Type: InternshipSalary: $0.00 /yearRequired education:High school or equivalentRequired experience:Graphic Design: 1 year

column23: Company DescriptionEmbrace Pet Insurance is an industry pack leader. This Ohio-based company makes the needs of pet parents a priority and strives to offer them the best product and service in a personal, but professional, manner.As an employer, Embrace understands the value of work/life balance and creates a culture in which employees are celebrated for their accomplishments both in and outside the office. The atmosphere, for both policyholders and employees, is one bred from open and honest communication in correlation with Embrace’s Core Values (which can be found here: http://www.embracepetinsurance.com/about-us/core-values).Embrace has been recognized by the Plain Dealer as one of “Northeast Ohio's Top Workplaces” and is a five-time winner of the NorthCoast 99, a program that recognizes 99 workplaces for top talent in NE Ohio.Job DescriptionWe are seeking a paid Social Media and Communications Intern for our Cleveland office to assist our Marketing Department with our social media and website content. Gain valuable insight into a growing Marketing Department while putting your strong organizational skills to good use. This is a 3 month paid internship from March through May 2017. No college credit is offered.ResponsibilitiesGenerate, edit, publish, and share daily content that builds Embrace’s social communities and encourages engagementSet up and optimize company pages within each platform to increase the visibility of company’s social contentModerate all user-generated content in line with the policies for each communityCapture and analyze the appropriate social data/metrics and insightsWork with Customer Care Team to provide assistance to pet parents and policyholders contacting us via our social channelsCopywriting/editing/proofreading for Embrace’s marketing materialsAssistance with tagging, organization, and review of content for Embrace’s websiteQualificationsBachelor’s degree or major in marketing or communication preferredExperience managing social mediaJob Type: InternshipSalary: $12.00 /hour

The intern will work closely with brand, sales, and product management teams to develop & help execute a comprehensive product launch plan.   Key responsibilities include: Support developing & executing strategic GTM & Marketing Programs tied to corporate initiatives for product launch and channel partners Develop and maintain GTM & marketing calendars Owning and managing projects aligned to the development of customer specific commercial and marketing programs that integrate the brand and customers‰Ûª goals in support of the brand commercial plan.  Basic Qualifications MBA student with an emphasis in Marketing. 2-3 years previous experience in commercial organization. Ability to manage multiple projects Strong collaboration skills    About Emerson Imagine being surrounded by more than 110,000 intelligent, driven and passionate innovators all working toward the same goal‰ÛÓto create groundbreaking solutions that leave our world in a better place than we found it. Our diverse and inclusive team combines technology and engineering in a wide range of industrial, commercial, and consumer markets.  This exciting environment is what you‰Ûªll discover at Emerson, a Fortune 500 company with $22.3 billion in sales and facilities in 141 countries. Together, we‰Ûªre changing the world, and we have all the resources to help you achieve your professional goals.  Whether you‰Ûªre an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring options or recently received your MBA degree, you‰Ûªll find a variety of opportunities at Emerson. Explore them now and join us in doing what‰Ûªs never been done before.  White-Rodgers, a business unit of Emerson Commercial & Residential Solutions, is headquartered in St. Louis, MO and is an industry leader in home energy management and comfort control. Our products monitor and control appliances that account for approximately 60% of the energy consumed in the average US household. By networking our products to the cloud, we are discovering new ways to help our customers reduce energy consumption, save money, and maintain comfort. And because our technology touches so much of the residential energy profile, our solutions are positioned to make a significant impact on our nation‰Ûªs carbon footprint. If you want to be part of a collaborative, high energy, fast paced team, where your contributions can make a real impact on the world ‰ÛÒ you have just found the place!  Work Authorization No calls or agencies please. Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. JOB SEARCH CAREERS SIGN IN/REGISTER in Share Summer 2017 Intern - Integrated Marketing TX - Corporate Corporate Your Role Fossil Group is looking for an intern to join our Digital Marketing team this summer.  You will have an opportunity to work on the Fossil, Misfit or Skagen brand. This intern will work directly with the brand marketing team to gain experience in digital, social, channel, and partnership marketing. The candidate will have heavy involvement in competitive/industry auditing and high-impact seasonal launch activities for the brand, managing all aspects of campaign asset trafficking.  As an intern, you will work alongside your team on a variety of projects. Your experience as an intern at Fossil is both educational and fun, while keeping you connected with your mentor, manager, and fellow interns.  You will gain exposure to company leaders through roundtables, your final project showcase, and other company functions.   All intern positions are at Fossil‰Ûªs headquarters based in Richardson, Texas. Applicants need to be willing to relocate during the course of the internship and provide their own transportation and accommodations to complete a 40 hour work week. This is a paid internship. Your Skills Aligning with Fossil‰Ûªs core values, we are looking for someone who: åá      Develops strong partnerships across our organization åá      Brings a positive, service-oriented approach to work åá      Is driven by creating unique and efficient solutions for business challenges åá      Can articulate thoughts clearly as well as listen to and considers others‰Ûª ideas åá      Is passionate about their contribution to Fossil åá      Has a great time at work and encourages others to do the same  Required Skills and Experience: Rising Senior or MBA student currently enrolled in an accredited university majoring in Marketing, Communication or relevant major Strong in analytical (math) Minimum 3.0 GPA Software skills strongly preferred: Microsoft Office (specifically Excel), Google Enterprise Strong written and verbal communication skills Refined presentation skills Desire to work in a fast paced environment while handling multiple projects Interest in fashion and proficient in social media Familiarity with Adaptly, Quantcast, Doubleclick is a plus Brand Highlights Fossil is an American watch and lifestyle brand inspired by all things curious. Since 1984, we‰Ûªve been a creative collaborative focused on authentic design, craftsmanship, and storytelling. Fossil has grown to offer watches, bags, jewelry, eyewear, and most recently wearables. With more than 400 retail stores, 4,000 wholesale locations and 13,000 employees worldwide, passion drives our curiosity and inspires us to always ask, ‰ÛÏwhat‰Ûªs next?‰Û Get To Know Us Fossil Group is a global retailer specializing in the design, innovation and marketing of fashion lifestyle and accessory products. This portfolio includes adidas, Armani Exchange, Burberry, Diesel, DKNY, Emporio Armani, Karl Lagerfeld, Marc by Marc Jacobs, Michael Kors, Michele, Relic, Tory Burch and Zodiac. Plans; coordinates; and conducts training and related instructional programs for customer personnel.Conducts training sessions and assists in evaluating the effectiveness of training activities.Coordinates logistics for instruction events; including scheduling classes; reserving classrooms; and preparing workstations.Maintains records of training activities; participant progress; and program effectiveness.May participate in the development and establishment of course content and objectives.Updates course documentation as needed to ensure timeliness and relevance.Provides guidance and work leadership to less experienced instructors.Maintains current knowledge of relevant technologies as assigned.Participates in special projects as required.EducationAssociates Degree; or the equivalent combination of education; technical certifications or training; or work/military experience.Qualifications 5-8 years of directly related experience in course instruction.GENERAL SUMMARY: (Scope; Summary and Impact of Job) Lead Firearms Instructors (LFIs) are the first point of contact for Federal Flight Deck Officers when they arrive at the training venue; are responsible for checking them in; verifying weapons and credentials; conducting training and overseeing the course of fire at the gun-range. They are responsible for ensuring the safety of all personnel on the range and securing SSI and SPII information during and after requalification sessions.JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead Firearms Instructors (LFIs) are the first point of contact at the training venue for Federal Flight Deck Officers (FFDO) and is the on-site training manager for the program. LFIs conduct all classroom instruction; delivering the approved TSA training and safety brief; introducing and describing new equipment; and ensuring all students understand and sign the safety briefing. The LFI ensures a minimum number of SFIs are present to maintain an instructor/student ratio of 1:6 for each training session. The LFI must ensure a sufficient inventory of training supplies is on-hand at the training venue to support monthly requalification sessions. The LFI is expected to maintain positive control of the training environment from the moment students arrive at the venue to the moment they depart. Upon students? arrival; the LFIs must verify weapons and credentials of each FFDO before training commences by visual inspection. The LFI is responsible for ensuring proper scoring of targets; completion of applicable administrative forms; and collection of training data. The LFI is required sign and certify qualification scores for all FFDOs attempting to qualify. Failure of an FFDO to qualify also means that an authorized FAMS Representative and/or LFI takes custody of the unloaded weapon; transport device (lockbox); credential and other equipment for return to TSA/FAMS. If no authorized FAMS representative is present to receive the equipment; the LFI shall make immediate verbal notification to the FFDO Program Office in order to make the appropriate arrangements to return equipment and credentials. The LFI must keep all Sensitive Security Information (SSI) and Sensitive Personally Identifying Information (SPII) secured appropriately both during and after a re-qualification session in compliance with the TSA MD 2100.2; Privacy and Information Collection Policy and TSA MD 1400.3 TSA Information Security Policy. The LFI is oversees time keeping of all SFI labor hours. The LFI must comply with internal compliance training eventsEDUCATION / EQUIVALENT TRAINING: Current or former federal law enforcement agent; officer; or civilian employee having completed a recognized federal firearm instructor training program deemed acceptable by the TSA/FAMS. Examples of a recognized federal firearms instructor programs include; but are not limited to; certified instructor graduates of FLETC Firearms Instructor Training program (FITP); FAMS Firearms Instructor Training Program; FBI/DEA Firearms Instructor Training Program; United States Postal Inspectors Firearms Instructor Training Program or equivalent federal training program. All LFIs must successfully complete a 2-3 days firearms re-qualification training program under the technical direction of the SAC; FAMS Training Division; and the FFDO Program Office. Areas of instruction shall include; but not to be limited to; the re-qualification course(s) of fire; procedural requirements for conducting the re-qualification session; and use of a GFE Automatic External Defibrillator (AED); and basic first aid. EXPERIENCE: 5 years of firearms training experienceUNIQUE/ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Working Conditions The work is typically performed at an indoor or outdoor gun range. Employees will be required to handle weapons and ammunition in the course of their duties. Exposure to high volumes of noise due to the firing of weapons will occur and employees are required to wear hearing protection in the form of foam ear plugs as well as external hearing protection. Exposure to expelled gun-powder as a result of fired ammunition is expected; and the employees must wash hands after handling ammunition. Work may require some physical effort in the handling of light materials; boxes; or equipment. *This position requires applicants to successfully complete the security application and pass a background investigation clearance prior to starting.*As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors.With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services.GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Architect - Level IIDoes our profile fit you?The Architect-Level II position will be an excellent opportunity for you if one of these 3 scenarios fits:You’d like to relocate to Nashville and you already have a good breadth of experience in healthcare.You’re with a small commercial architectural firm (not necessarily healthcare) in Nashville and you’d like be more integrally involved in larger, more complex projects where you’d have more direct client engagement.You’re with a larger architectural firm in Nashville and your role and upward mobility is limited by the hierarchy rather than your potential.QualifcationsBachelor of Architecture (BArch) minimumIntermediate Revit expertise and capabilities is required.Must have at minimum experience as a project coordinator or job captain on commercial projects.Proven to be well organized, calm and focused in meeting deadlines, experienced in managing multiple commercial projects and skilled at building strong relationships with clients, vendors and internal project teams.Why might this opportunity be right for you?Lead Top Healthcare Projects - We’re one of the smallest firms that successfully competes with much larger firms to work on some of the most sought after clients and projects in healthcare.Depth of Project Experience – Only a handful of firms get to work on the healthcare projects that we do and with most you won’t get the same level of client engagement nor project leadership opportunities.Future Growth – We simply don’t have the hierarchy to stifle your growth, pigeon hole you or keep you in the background on projects.Have a True Voice and Impact – We truly value input from all experience levels within our firm and act upon it. For example, our emerging professionals group led the way to dramatically changing work space layout which made for a happier and more productive environment. This may help explain why our average tenures exceeds 17 years.Great Benefits – Strong salary and bonuses with excellent 401K contributions, profit sharing, very good health insurance, paid dental, life and disability, paid AIA membership dues, ARE exam paid for interns and generous vacation/personal day’s policy.Your day as an Architect at GTGEach day varies based on the phase of projects with some days more focused on client meetings, vendor meetings etc. while others are more focused on leading the team through the various project phases and challenges.Travel - Expect 1 – 2 nights every other week.You will contribute your own skills and knowledge to a variety of projects, involving:Comprehensive Architectural ProcessCodes and Agency ReviewsGraphic Design and Document ProductionMarketing and OutreachPlanning DevelopmentWhat may impact your day at GTG the most is the level of involvement and collaboration you’ll experience as part of our team. We know that nothing saps an individual or team’s energy and happiness more quickly than suffering through big egos. We truly value everyone in our firm in a way that you’ll likely feel the first time you visit us.Please feel free to visit us at gouldturner.com to learn more about our story.Job Type: Full-timeRequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Revit: 1 yearof daily design or technical development of projects: 6 years
column25: Architect Level II*BArch/Revit req'd*Opp to Lead Sought After Nat'l Project

column23: ENG SIGN IN Go To Job Search SHARE APPLY Posted On02/17/2017 MARKETING INTERN Lawrence, KS, US   About the Job  Grandstand is a custom screenprinting company that specializes in Glassware, Apparel, Promotional Items and Creative Services. Our commitment to quality, service and innovation set us apart. If you have a strong attention to detail and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, we want you to join our team. Primary Accountability: The Marketing Intern assists the marketing department in the development and implementation of all marketing campaigns and advertising. The Marketing Intern will also work in a fast-paced team environment, and will complete the internship having gained a broad experience in various aspects of marketing. Major Duties: Performs research and tagging of marketing segmentation. Creates creative content for products and marketing campaigns. Assists with product photo and video development. Collaborates with the marketing department with design and development of marketing campaigns. Assists with the distribution and the delivery of marketing materials. Assists with the preparation and delivery of sales training materials. Provides support to social media efforts. Performs additional duties as assigned. Qualifications: Undergraduate student majoring in Communications, Marketing, Creative Writing, Advertising and/or Business is required. Writing samples required. Ability to effectively communicate, present information and respond to questions, both verbal and written. Exceptional knowledge in Microsoft Office is required. Experience with the Web and Social Media, along with Adobe Creative Suite is preferred. Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness. Demonstrated poise, tact, and diplomacy with the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information and situations. Physical Demands: Ability to sit for extended periods of time. Ability to read computer screens and mail, talk and hear on the phone or in person, and operate basic office equipment. Ability to type/enter data in computer, open cabinet drawers to file or retrieve information. Ability to lift up to 25 pounds. Work Environment: Professional and deadline-oriented environment in an office setting. Interaction with staff and customers.
