Interning with Grant Ventures affords you a unique opportunity to gain experience working for various start-ups across multiple business sectors. Each venture has seen rapid growth since inception, which allows for unique experiences and personal growth. Please find each entities descriptions below:Infused PR and Events, LLC is a full-service public/media relations and event planning company specializing in branding, community relations, media relations and event logistics for events. This includes event design and décor, securing of sponsorship dollars, sponsorship fulfillment, and staffing. www.infusedpr.comFlash Delivery, a start-up that launched in November 2013 specializes in restaurant and grocery delivery in Metro Detroit. Flash Delivery offers our hungry, convenience-minded customers the food they want at the location they want, when they want it – with an uncompromising quality, service, and value. The company is based in Detroit and its goal is to assist with filling the food delivery void that exists in Detroit. www.flashdeliverymi.com.Holiday Helpers 2 You is a pop-up gift-wrapping and personal shopping service located in Metro Detroit. Holiday Helpers works with a wide variety of clients ranging from corporations to residential communities to provide gift wrapping and personal shopping as a convenience to families, employees, and residents. We offer an array of services, including but not limited to: corporate pop-up shops, pickup & delivery, gift assembly, and personal shopping services.www.holidayhelpers2you.com.Various projects and duties to be performed are:Developing media listsWriting and editing press releasesPitching stories to mediaContributing to brainstorming sessionsAttending client meetingsAssisting with strategic planning with the development of the companiesDay-of/event execution and staffingAssisting with business development functions – identifying networking opportunities,researching, contacts, etc.Planning and day-of execution of special eventsStudying and staying on top of media trends; specifically, social media and SEOSocial media managementAttending networking/professional development eventsCommunity relations programming developmentAssisting with business development and proposal writingProviding input on websites - - working with graphic designerDeveloping list of feature stories to pitchPR plan development of wedding “arm” of Infused PR & EventsOrganization/administrative dutiesSpeaking engagement managementAdditional responsibilities to be determinedRequirements1-2 prior PR/event planning internship(s) or equivalent courseworkPrior media pitching experience (written)Knowledge and experience with AP StyleStrong written and verbal communicationsStrong knowledge of social media platforms and trendsStrong understanding of client confidentiality. Will be required to sign a confidentialityagreement.Writing samples (3 – different styles of writing) will be requested upon interview. Writingsample can be class, volunteer or professional work.Internet access to perform work duties.Knowledgeable and experience with Microsoft Office and Google Docs.“Go-getter” attitude, high-level of self-esteem, confidence and poisePhysical ability to move up to 25 lbs and set-up for events10-20 hours/week to commit to internship (more during weeks when there’s events).Many duties required of the position can be done at home, however mileage reimbursement will be provided for days working in the Infused office, as well as other work-related expenses. The internship requires weekly conference calls and/or in-person meetings. The internship schedule is flexible and can be determined by agreed upon terms. The internship pays minimum wage with mileage reimbursement for the first 90 days, with a opportunity for employment (part-time) after 90-day review.Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Detroit, MI 48226Required education:AssociateRequired experience:Public Relations: 1 yearRequired license or certification:Driver's License

Our new name comes with a fresh brand identity and position, logo, messaging, website and communication platforms. We anticipate unveiling our new brand in March 2017.We are eager to welcome a communications professional to our spirited, proactive and motivated team and community to help us with these and other mission-critical initiatives.COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST (10-20 hours per week)Position DescriptionCollect, generate and drive content across multiple mediums and programs, i.e. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, website, e-newsletters and print newslettersTrack and manage social media posts, articles, and accomplishments for use in online and print communications (newsletter, emails etc.)Assist in designing and implementing social media campaignsAssist with media relations, including drafting press releases and talking points and organizing press eventsDraft monthly e-newsletter to members and supportersAct as main website administrator on a WordPress platformAssist in planning and executing events designed to increase community engagementTrack constituent engagement using Google AnalyticsManage CRM information and activityQualificationsAt least two years of communications and social media experience driving brand awareness, engagement and social media trafficBachelor's degree in communications or related field preferred (completed or in process)Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines while remaining detail orientedStrong writing skills and experienceExcellent interpersonal skills, ability to listen well and positively represent our organization and our missionStrong initiative and work ethic, ability to efficiently manage time and workloadProficiency in Microsoft Office, CMS (WordPress), graphic design software (such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or InDesign), CRM (Salsa, eTapestry or TrailBlazer) and email marketing services (MailChimp preferred)Ability to quickly learn and master new technologiesContinually stays educated on new industry standards, trends and technologiesWilling to be a flexible member of a passionate and effective team, available for occasional events and meetings outside of regular office hoursPassion for empowering children and adults with developmental disabilities to lead rich, active and self-directed livesCompensation and scheduleCompensation rate is $15-$20/hour depending upon experience level. Flexible schedule is expected to be 10-20 hours per week. Interns with relevant experience are welcome to apply.Job Type: Part-timeRequired education:Bachelor's

It‰Ûªs our objective to make everyone better at it: ourselves, our clients, our peers‰ÛÓthe entire industry. Founded just over 13 years ago, Hanapin has experienced year over year revenue growth since day 1. Our team is committed to being the PPC Agency of Experts by staying update-to-date in cutting-edge trends and providing unmatched service to our expanding client list. Not to mention, we also run the world's most popular PPC blog, PPC Hero, and PPC only conference, Hero Conf!   Job Description We are looking for a go-getting Marketing Communications Intern who is ready to learn a lot about the daily marketing efforts of a fast paced marketing agency! Are you ready to gain practical hands on experience in public relations and marketing? This position will work directly with our Sales Development Coordinator to give you experience in projects that produce high quality marketing materials and boost your writing skills in various formats. We want to help you develop vital skills and experience that will make you succeed in the future.  As our Marketing Communications Intern, you will get the opportunity to: Conduct research for our Public Relations and Sales efforts Provide copy-writing for the Hanapin Marketing website, press releases, social media, and our blog, PPC Hero Coordinate internal quarterly newsletters for our Team Assist with any special promotions or events that are hosted by the Marketing Department Utilize marketing tools to track potential clients Qualifications Able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week on-site at our office in Bloomington, IN during normal business hours: Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm Excellent written and verbal skills Comfortable learning new platforms including email marketing, public relations databases, and social media Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs Some college required with preference for candidates pursuing marketing, public relations, or communications degrees Additional Information To be considered for this position, you must apply through the following link and submit a formal cover letter: http://hanapinmarketing.applytojob.com/apply/RUEZWJuQxv/Marketing-Communications-Intern?source=SR In your cover letter, be sure to include the below information: A short, but sweet bio / introduction. Why this internship at Hanapin interests you What you hope to gain during an internship with us Let us know how you learned about Hanapin and the internship  This internship is unpaid, but we are happy to help you receive college credit in accordance with the required guidelines of your college or university. We are currently hiring for Summer 2017 interns. Thank you for your interest in Hanapin Marketing and best of luck!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Hanley Wood is the premier media, information, and marketing services company serving the residential and commercial housing and construction industry.  The Digital Content Internship Program is an opportunity for smart, motivated individuals to gain meaningful experience in content production and journalism. Digital Content Interns will be exposed to many aspects of our business and play a meaningful role in our editorial operations. This program is a unique opportunity to gain valuable insight and experience with a dynamic digital media company.  Participants will gain important insights into the media and publishing world, and overall will enjoy a fun and worthwhile experience.   Each position will offer 30-40 hours per week Ð specific hours are flexible within our core business hours (8:30AM Ð 5:30PM).    The Digital Content intern should possess exceptional writing and editing skills and strong analytic skills.  Meticulous attention to detail and factual accuracy are crucial skills in this role.  Responsibilities will include compiling news stories and profiles, researching story leads, writing, and fact-checking.   This individual should also have experience using blogs and social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube.  He/she may also be responsible for generating traffic, increase loyalty, encourage word of mouth promotion, and make connections with online audience.   Responsibilities will include:  Writing succinct, intelligent, creative, and cogent copy that drives traffic to Hanley Wood websites Expanding content using online social media platforms Conducting web research to find interesting products and story ideas Fact-checking page proofs for phone numbers, websites, etc. Overseeing the editing, testing, and deployment of e-newsletters.  Community Management: managing day-to-day community management, audience engagement, page and content moderation, and general outreach Research: conducting basic research in order to engage the community and investigate any trending activities within the community Surveying readers on issues and themes via telephone Conducting research and interviews, compiling art, managing special projects Attend daily Scrum meetings Administrative duties, as needed All qualified program participants will possess the following Skills, Education, and Experience: BachelorÕs degree in Journalism, English, Art, or a related field required.  Recent college graduates preferred.  College seniors will also be considered for the program. Ability to accurately understand scope of assigned projects, clientsÕ goals and requirements, and budgets through meetings, taking notes, and asking questions Demonstrated research, writing, and telephone skills Ability to adhere to all deadlines Excellent communications skills Strong sense of professionalism Ability to multi-task and manage projects and stories simultaneously Organized self-starter with a positive attitude Desire to broaden knowledge of emerging technologies Adeptness using digital technologies to engage with immediate environment and initiate change Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, web browser use, and Google Docs Strong presence on social media platforms including (but not limited to) Facebook and Twitter preferred Must display the maturity required to work in a casual, informal office setting

OUTSTANDING INTERNS WANTEDSummer 2017IF CUBICLE LIFE ISN’T FOR YOU…JOIN THE CLUBMaking premium flip flops as unique as the people who wear them, Hari Mari’s a fast-growing Texas-based flop brand with a retail presence in close to 400 boutique, outdoor, surf, running, yoga & luxury hotel shops across 36 US states, the Bahamas & Canada…all in addition to its own on-line store, HariMari.com.Born out of a futile search for signs of color & comfort in a sea of decidedly uncomfortable black & brown flip flops, Hari Mari launched in 2012 with a simple goal – bring color & comfort back to flip flops, and help a lot of brave & deserving kids at the same time. That’s why we donate $3 for every pair purchased to help children in the US battling pediatric cancer. We call it Flops Fighting Cancer.Currently, Hari Mari’s fielding applications for 5 Summer internship positions, looking for energetic, talented, outgoing, and above all else, FUN individuals interested in marketing, apparel/fashion design, merchandising, media relations, blogging, sales, graphic design, and of course, philanthropy, to join our entrepreneurial team.Serving as one of the brand’s Summer 2017 class participants, interns will participate in a variety of aspects related to growing the Hari Mari brand within the team’s “all hands on deck” work atmosphere.Internship responsibilities & areas of rotational focus might include:-Assist with blogger relations and content creation for Hari Mari- -Develop & execute on targeted marketing & grassroots communications activities-Assist in growing & planning Hari Mari’s philanthropic footprint-Help develop & build Hari Mari's university-level communications program-Conduct nation-wide retail industry & market researchIf cubicle life doesn’t blow your hair back, and you’re interested in a hands-on brand-building experience with a quick-rising Texas-based flip flop company, submit an application, before the spots are filled, and let us know why you think you'd be a good fit for Hari Mari.The Hari Mari Team208 South Haskell AvenueDallas, TX 75226(214)-637-2700Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Dallas, TXRequired education:High school or equivalent

The Hartford Marathon Foundation (HMF) is seeking a dedicated college student searching for a unique summer/fall internship experience in sport and event management. Interns will have the opportunity to work with the HMF staff in conceptualizing, planning, marketing and executing the 2017 schedule of events. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to; volunteer management, community outreach, event logistics coordination, set-up and break-down of race equipment, and interaction with participants. Interns will assist on a variety of projects throughout the program.The Hartford Marathon Foundation is in its 24th year and is recognized as the foremost organizer of running, biking and swimming events in Southern New England. The flagship event is the Eversource Hartford Marathon and Half Marathon, with over 30 other races from March to December. A Hartford Marathon Foundation internship will teach students the elements required to produce world-class athletic events.Requirements:Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to manage several projects simultaneously; proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook, and a dedicated, energetic work ethic are required for the position. Interns must be prepared to perform physical labor, able to lift 50 pounds, work outside regardless of weather conditions, and be able to provide their own transportation.Location:The internship will take place at the HMF office; 41 Sequin Drive, Glastonbury, Connecticut. “Field Work” at HMF events will take place at various locations throughout Connecticut and the surrounding states.Time Commitment & Compensation:Students are expected to commit 15 to 20 hours per week throughout the internship. Students must be willing and able to commit to the entire summer/fall race schedule (see below). HMF realizes that candidates may have additional job constraints, and these conflicts will be addressed on a case by case basis. Time spent on “Field Work” (working and preparing for events) will be compensated at the rate of $15 per hour. “Field Work” will take place predominantly on weekends; typically beginning early in the morning, any mileage expenses will be reimbursed. The time spent in the office will be unpaid as part of the internship. Students will have flexibility in setting their in-office schedules. Students are eligible for course credit throughout the internship.For more information, please visit: hartfordmarathon.com/employment/Job Type: InternshipSalary: $15.00 /hourJob Location:Glastonbury, CT 06033

Corporate Learning | Harvard Business Review | Higher Education  Job Title: Marketing Intern Department: Higher Education Employment Type: Full Time Office Location: Brighton, MA Date Posted: 2/10/2017 Job Number: JO-1702-900 Share | | Email this job  Harvard Business Publishing's summer internship program provides students who have a passion for learning with real world business experience through meaningful work; a general understanding of the publishing business; and functional knowledge and skills through ownership of projects. The ten-week program runs June 5, 2017 through August 11, 2017. Students work full-time and receive a stipend at the end of the program.  Harvard Business Publishing is a wholly-owned, not-for-profit subsidiary of Harvard University. We are media company with the mission to create products and services that educate a business audience about best management practices and leadership development. We publish books, magazines, blogs, and cases; sponsor webinars; and develop e-learning programs, simulations, podcasts, apps and learning solutions. Our authors are the leading thinkers and visionaries on the art, science, and practice of management. We are an equal opportunity employer.'  The Marketing Intern will gain experience with product marketing research, web site content, customer data, event planning and promotion, and production/scheduling. As a member of the Higher Education's (HE) marketing team, the intern will have a hands-on role in contributing to the group‰Ûªs active summer marketing schedule. The intern will report to the Marketing Communications Manager, Higher Education.  Responsibilities:  Marketing Tools, Metadata, and More: Customer data: Learn the basics of Salesforce.com (our customer relationship management database) in order to support Higher Ed‰Ûªs mission to improve accuracy of the customer data that drives our marketing campaigns. Specifically, the intern will understand the structure of our database of business instructors, and contribute to more targeted marketing efforts through projects that include, researching and tagging customers as targets for marketing campaigns. Reorganize, update, and build an online archive of curriculum maps. These maps are an invaluable tool for our sales reps. Update metadata on Item Detail Pages (IDPs) based on edits found by proofreaders Website resources: Help uncover areas that need to be fixed in PDF guides used by customers, specifically content maps. Make sure branding is correct and that only currently available content is referenced. Event Planning & Management Simulation webinars: Work with product marketing managers to approve/reject webinar attendees. Also update our CRM system with the attendee information to improve customer data. In support of seminars and conferences, aid in materials aggregation, shipping, and participant administration. This requires assembling folders, gathering display pieces, packing, lifting boxes, labeling, and shipping. Maintain adequate quantities of print collateral (brochures and sell sheets) in-house Organize, collect, and compile data from Case Method Teaching Seminars (domestic & international) Assist with catering orders and room/space reservations for several events. Help coordinate a local seminar produced by HBP and held on the Harvard Business School campus.   Research Research available literature regarding teaching and learning online using case studies. Research will be shared with Marketing and Product Design & Delivery teams. Requirements: Currently pursuing a bachelor's or associate‰Ûªs degree in marketing or related field Proficiency with MS Excel, Word & PowerPoint Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM tool a plus Strong communication and research skills Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task A can-do spirit     Apply for the Marketing Intern position  CAREERS SEARCH OPEN JOBS Submit Resume-General Interest Corporate Learning | Harvard Business Review | Higher Education Privacy Policy | Copyright Information | Trademark Policy Copyright å© 2013 Harvard Business School Publishing. All rights reserved. Harvard Business Publishing is an affiliate of Harvard Business School.

That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way. About Us Benefits Choose an Organization Home > HealthPartners > Job Posting Job Posting  Share this Job Communications Intern - Corporate Communications Department Job Apply now  Job Description:  Looking for an excellent opportunity to hone your public relations and communications skills? HealthPartners Communications is seeking a Communications Intern with awesome writing skills, and a strong interest in public relations, internal communications, and/or social media.  At HealthPartners, you‰Ûªll find a culture where we live our values of excellence, compassion, integrity and most importantly, partnership. By working together, we will improve health, create exceptional experiences for those we serve and make care and coverage more affordable.  RESPONSIBILITIES: ‰Û¢ Create and edit content for channels that are both for internal and external audiences. This could include writing blogs, social media content, internal newsletter articles, internal memos, and other types of content; and creating videos and digital content that can be shared internally and externally. ‰Û¢ Contribute to communications planning for internal partners to help them reach their goals. ‰Û¢ Write and distribute news releases, media pitches, follow-up with reporters and media contacts, prepare background information for interviews, maintain media lists and editorial calendars, and assist with interview processes. ‰Û¢ Support the management of organization-owned social channels, including Twitter, Facebook and Instagram. This would include posting blog posts, posting organic content, creating paid Facebook and Instagram ads, monitoring and responding to comments, and compiling results to show the impact and reach of those channels.  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: ‰Û¢ Strong writing skills ‰Û¢ A recent graduate of a communications, journalism, public relations, or related program ‰Û¢ Previous internship experience ‰Û¢ Interest in health care field a plus  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: ‰Û¢ Previous experience managing social media channels, including monitoring and responding to comments, using Facebook Ad Manger and Facebook analytics tools ‰Û¢ Previous media relations experience, including writing press releases, pitching reporters and assisting with interview processes.  OTHER DETAILS: ‰Û¢ 40 hours per week; six month commitment is requested ‰Û¢ Individual will work at the HealthPartners office building in Bloomington, but may travel to other locations in the organization as appropriate ‰Û¢ $12/hour wage  HealthPartners is recognized nationally for providing outstanding care and experience for patients and members. For more information and to apply go to www.healthpartners.com/careers and search for job ID #42756.  Additional Information:  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. About UsWe are a boutique fashion and entertainment public relations firm specializing in creative product placement and celebrity marketing. We represent emerging fashion designers and established brands as well as build awareness in the fashion and entertainment industry. Located in West Hollywood, we focus on developing strong relationships in the entertainment industry and providing clients with direct access to today’s top celebrities. We secure placement for our clients in all facets of media including magazines, newspapers, television, and websites nationwide.We offer services such as customized PR plans, celebrity placement, editorial placement (magazine, newspaper, web, and television), trade and retailer relations, events, press kit creation, and lookbook development.QualificationsUniversity junior or senior (absolutely required), preferably majoring in Graphic Design or related fieldWorking knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including InDesign and PhotoshopYour own laptopProficient with Google Drive and efficient file sharingBeing handy with crafts, embroidery, sewing or art techniques is a huge plus!Knowledge of clothing and product distribution and terminology is also a huge plus!Communication : We regard you as a vital part of our team. Therefore, we need you to be actively checking e-mails and be responsive and prompt. Additionally, you will be expected to let a point person know when you are done with a task, and, at the end of the day, just let us know what we've accomplished and what still needs to be completed.Organization : We need you to be detail-oriented! It is vital to the operation of our firm. Please ensure all work submitted is clean and well-formatted as well as grammatically correct. We also need physical orderliness. Our studio is open to clients, and it is essential that we keep it aesthetically pleasing and clean.Professionalism : We need you to be on time and alert. Please make time for your commute and parking considerations. We work with multiple beauty and fashion brands as well as reputable clientele and industry professionals, so we expect you to be well-groomed as well. Furthermore, always be upfront--if you cannot come in or an emergency occurs, just let us know ahead of time. Finally, this is a no-drama workplace. Leave personal issues at home, please.Goal-Oriented : We cannot reiterate enough--this isn't a coffee run internship. You will own your projects and everything you do. If there is something you want to try or learn, we will happily guide you. You get what you put in.We hope you'll consider applying!Please note that this is an unpaid internship for college credit.Job Type: InternshipRequired education:High school or equivalent

Hershey HOME THIS IS HERSHEY PRODUCTS FOOD PHILOSOPHY RESPONSIBILITY NEWS CENTER INVESTORS CAREERS Enter job title or location Search Intern, Category Strategy and Insights (CVS Office: Cumberland, RI) Cumberland, Rhode Island, United States Share via Facebook Share via Twitter Share via LinkedIn Share via Email Share via GooglePlus Add To Job Cart Button Apply Now Button Position summary Job Location:  Cumberland, RI   Summary:  We are seeking top talent that has a passion for winning and making a difference.  Intern, Category Strategy and Insights Co-Op position at Hershey provides a launch pad for our future sales leaders.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with our customers, analyze customer and shopper insights to build selling stories, and develop your business acumen skills.   CSI is a mix of sales, marketing, and marketing research ‰ÛÒ Our CSI department researches and analyzes data to understand the present and utilize that information to impact the future. Some of the ways a CSI Manager influences the marketplace is by making strategic recommendations on: item assortment, product placement, promotions, and pricing.   As a CSI intern, you will have the opportunity to work with the following departments: Category Development, Sales, Marketing and Shopper Insights.   Responsibilities ‰Û¢ Develop fact-based analysis of customer business trends utilizing a variety of data sources. ‰Û¢ Utilize all appropriate Hershey business systems (Nielsen, Space Management, etc.) and other account sales information to identify key selling opportunities for market/account. ‰Û¢ Assist in the market analysis of scan and sales data to design programs with Key Accounts. ‰Û¢ Analyze sales information regarding key category programs and promotions. ‰Û¢ Identify and develop productive new processes to enhance Hershey‰Ûªs Category Management and Sales functions. ‰Û¢ Work with other departments within Hershey‰Ûªs sales organization to determine efficient ways to disseminate this information.   Qualifications ‰Û¢ A current undergraduate junior or rising senior with a 3.0 cumulative GPA or higher (preference is 3.2 or higher). ‰Û¢ Majors in Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, and Economics are highly preferred, but others will be considered ‰Û¢ Demonstrated leadership and academic achievement in student and extracurricular activities ‰Û¢ High level of integrity ‰Û¢ Energy and passion for winning ‰Û¢ Adaptability and ability to work independently ‰Û¢ Professional communication skills ‰Û¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving ability ‰Û¢ Customer service orientation Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including:  Excel, PowerPoint, Word ‰Û¢ Effective planning and organizing skills ‰Û¢ Some travel may be required ‰Û¢ Previous internship and/or sales experience is a plus     Work Schedule ‰Û¢ Student must be able to work 20-25 hours/ week during the school year (during business hours) and 35-40 hours/week during the summer. ‰Û¢ This position will begin as soon possible. Duration of the internship is dependent upon the student‰Ûªs availability and performance, with the goal to finish upon the student‰Ûªs graduation. Successful interns could be offered full-time, entry level Sales positions with The Hershey Company.   The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. column23: Looking for an internship where you’ll become a better creative while gaining important hands-on experience? Be sure to check us out at HEXBUG! Known for our world famous toys and machines – we aim to amaze. Everything from robotic insects and animals, to remote control stunt-worthy fingerboards, come directly from the ingenious minds of HEXBUG engineers. Innovation is a staple of our everyday. We constantly strive to push the limits of technology to create, improve and revolutionize our products, leaving our own unique stamp on the world. So if you think outside the box, you’re one of us. And if you live outside of the box, we’d love to meet you.Located out of Greenville, Texas (40 miles outside of Dallas) - HEXBUG is an upbeat, colorful, atmosphere where no two days are alike. Whether we’re brainstorming products, rolling out a brand new social media campaign, crafting one-of-a-kind packaging, or generating online content, it’s a team effort. We act as one but value individuality. In short, you’ll be able to practice and hone in your special skill set while contributing to the larger picture as both an intern and an asset.We are a tight group of passionate designers and we are looking for talent that fits well with our team. We work on packaging, branding, web, 3D, social media and TV commercials. This is a place of creativity and fun. Our philosophy is work hard and play hard. We are not a rubber stamp type of company...We encourage individuality. If you fit this description...please contact us.Responsibilities:-Concepting for new or existing brands social media-Brainstorming with our team developing post for social media-Photography-Photo editing-Blogging-Boosting and promoting social media-Creating Post using the Adobe SuiteSkills:-Passion for Social Media-Knowledge of Adobe suite ( photoshop, illustrator, indesign, etc.)-Knowledge of wordpress, instagram, twitter, facebook, pintrest-Sketching-Concepting-Works well with others-Willing to learn-Open attitude-Can handle fast past environment-Keep Deadlines-Being Flexible-Smile-Awesomeness-Video editing is a plusYou can also view what we do here:HEXBUG.combehance.net/hexbuginstagram.com/hexbug/youtube.com/user/hexbugtvtwitter.com/hexbugwww.facebook.com/hexbug/Job Type: InternshipRequired education:AssociateRequired experience:personal activity on social networks: 3 yearsAdobe Suite: 2 years

column23: Looking for an internship where you’ll become a better creative while gaining important hands-on experience? Be sure to check us out at HEXBUG! Known for our world famous toys and machines – we aim to amaze. Everything from robotic insects and animals, to remote control stunt-worthy fingerboards, come directly from the ingenious minds of HEXBUG engineers. Innovation is a staple of our everyday. We constantly strive to push the limits of technology to create, improve and revolutionize our products, leaving our own unique stamp on the world. So if you think outside the box, you’re one of us. And if you live outside of the box, we’d love to meet you.Located out of Greenville, Texas (40 miles outside of Dallas) - HEXBUG is an upbeat, colorful, atmosphere where no two days are alike. Whether we’re brainstorming products, rolling out a brand new social media campaign, crafting one-of-a-kind packaging, or generating online content, it’s a team effort. We act as one but value individuality. In short, you’ll be able to practice and hone in your special skill set while contributing to the larger picture as both an intern and an asset.We are a tight group of passionate designers and we are looking for talent that fits well with our team. We work on packaging, branding, web, 3D, social media and TV commercials. This is a place of creativity and fun. Our philosophy is work hard and play hard. We are not a rubber stamp type of company...We encourage individuality. If you fit this description...please contact us.Responsibilities:-Concepting for new or existing brands-Designing packaging for our brands-Nonstructed mockups for presentation-Designing and manipulating dielines-Brainstorming with our team-Developing ads-Photography-Photo editingSkills:-Knowledge of Adobe suite ( photoshop, illustrator, indesign, etc.)-Sketching-Concepting-Open attitude-Can handle fast past environment-Keep Deadlines-Being Flexible-Smile-AwesomenessYou can also view what we do here:HEXBUG.combehance.net/hexbuginstagram.com/hexbug/youtube.com/user/hexbugtvtwitter.com/hexbugwww.facebook.com/hexbug/Job Type: InternshipRequired education:AssociateRequired experience:Adobe Indesign: 1 yearAdobe Illustrator: 3 yearsAdobe Photoshop: 1 year

The Highlands Ranch Metro District is currently accepting applications for a seasonal Community Relations Intern position. This is a wonderful hands-on opportunity for a responsible, eager, motivated, and detail-oriented student with excellent communication skills to work with our Community Relations staff during the summer. The intern will gain experience in community relations and will have the opportunity to become personally involved in a fun and rewarding internship with a local government in an innovative community.The person in this position will work thirty to forty hours per week for nine weeks from approximately spring 2017 through early August 2017. Some evenings and weekend hours, as well as working events outdoors, will be required to participate in special events and meetings.Primary responsibilities include:Assist with the planning, promotion, and execution of several community eventsWrite and edit press releases, articles for the newsletter and e-newsletter, Web site content, and copy for other promotional/informational documentsShoot photos at events and capture photos of visitors to parks in the communityResearch background information and interview individuals for articlesPerform various administrative duties, including, but not limited to bulk mailings, copying, and delivering brochures and flyersDesign and layout various brochures and fliersOther duties as assignedApplicants for this position must be a college junior or senior enrolled in a degree program in Public Relations, Communications, Marketing, English or related field with a minimum 3.0 GPA. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must. Knowledge of Word, Excel, and Outlook are also required. Experience in desktop publishing is a plus. Must be able to lift 30 pounds and work outdoors in various weather conditions at events. You must also have reliable transportation and an acceptable motor vehicle record.Please submit your application to: Highlands Ranch Metro District, Attn: Human Resources, 62 West Plaza Drive, Highlands Ranch, CO 80129. Applications are available on our website at – http://highlandsranch.org/jobsMinimum starting salary is $10.50 per hour.Applications will be accepted until this position has been filled.Posting No. 2017-012March 2, 2017Job Type: Internship

This is an amazing opportunity for creative, friendly and ambitious college students....Highrise Pet Care is a Chicago-based start-up which delivers the best in-home care to pets, including dog walking, pet sitting and grooming. We need amazingly passionate people to help with our mission of providing the best care to our clients' pets.The person chosen for the Marketing Internship will work directly with the CEO. No coffee making. No making copies. You will have a huge hand in everything we do from Social Media, Advertising, Client Acquisition, and PR. Do you love spending time on Facebook, Instagram and Snapchat? Do you love dogs & cats? So do we!This is a non-paid internship with an incredible opportunity to gain real world experience. We are looking for amazingly outgoing and fun candidates that are excited to learn what it takes to start a start-up. If you're as excited about marketing and pets as we are, we'd love to hear from you!The internship runs approximately 10 weeks from late May to early August, depending on your schedule. This internship is located in the heart of downtown Chicago and is only open to undergraduate and graduate students.To apply, please send your resume accompanied with a cover letter. We look forward to hearing from you!Job Type: Internship

Do you want to build your marketing skills?   You‰Ûªve come to the right place! HDS offers a unique and collaborative culture which empowers all of our employees to be innovative and creative.   Our internships will give you the opportunity to work on meaningful projects while encouraging you to network with senior leaders, interns and other peers.   Hitachi Data Systems (HDS) has been ranked a Best Place to Work for Millennials and we are looking for smart, motivated, and eager to learn students to join our HDS family!   As a Marketing Intern in the Content Marketing team, you will: Increase and develop your fundamental marketing skills. Participate in content creation across different kinds of mediums. Manage end-to-end lifecycle of the content including developing content and pushing through production process. Interact with cross functional teams to develop timelines and communications for new content and web pages, attend calls and escalate schedule slippage, scope changes. Interact with marketing vendors Be responsible for increasing promotion of buyer‰Ûªs journey content on HDS.com, HitachiInsights.com and microsites. Advance our case study content placement and promotion Identify assets not performing well and out-dated and continuously replenish with assistance of SMEs Create a cross-channel blog promotion process and implementation The Marketing intern will be expected to strategize and project manage their assigned projects and report up to the team on a weekly basis. Expectations are to master and become champion of HDS buyer‰Ûªs journey, content strategy, and web content governance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, place of origin, ethnic origin, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, genetic information, mental or physical disability, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable national, state, or local law. Flexible schedules available. Road Warrior Internship Summer 2017We are hiring interns for the following cities: Los Angeles, Denver, Atlanta, Chicago, Washington D.C., New York, Boston and Philadelphia. *Please specify the city or cities where you want to work in the email title.Honest Tea, the nation’s top-selling organic beverage company, in partnership with EventPro Strategies, is looking for sales and marketing minded undergraduate summer interns who can take the brand to the next level. This is a rapidly growing company with GREAT opportunities for hard-working, resourceful, hands-on interns who can act as ambassadors for the Honest Tea brand across the countryWe are looking for “road warriors” to promote Honest Beverages in retail stores and events as well as take part in our larger Marketing Campaigns including the National Honesty Index. Interns (a.k.a. Road Warriors) will be vital members of each local field marketing team. The will be working alongside our Regional Marketing Managers, learning about Honest Tea’s Field Marketing strategy and tactics.Marketing Responsibilities:Driving to all location sites within specific regionSetting up and breaking down all equipment required for each event/samplingPromoting the Honest Tea brand at each event/samplingIn-store samplingReporting resultsAid in overall management of local field marketing programDriving company vehiclesOverall Requirements:Ability to work long hours including nights and weekends.Must be able to do extended overnight travel – up to 2 weeks.Must be able to work a flexible 5-day workweek, usually Wednesday-Sunday, for the entire summer (10 weeks).Must be an Undergraduate student .Ability to lift 30 pounds at a time.Good driving record and daily access to a vehicle.A people person – Interns will be interacting with many of our consumers everyday.ENTHUSIASM, ENERGY, AND WILLINGNESS TO WORK HARD.We are hiring interns for the following cities: Los Angeles, Denver, Atlanta, Chicago, Washington D.C., New York, Boston and Philadelphia.Please include the following in your application:Cover letter including a statement telling us why you would make a great “road warrior.”ResumeThe city or cities* where you want to work in the email title. *You may apply for multiple locationsLos AngelesDenverAtlantaChicagoWashington D.C.New YorkBostonPhiladelphiaAbout Honest TeaAs a fast-growing company, Honest Tea is always on the lookout for energetic and enthusiastic people who can help grow the company. Employees must be flexible, able to work independently and share our commitment to social responsibility.Tour Managers will be employed by our staffing partner EventPro Strategies for all work on the Honest Tea program.About EventPro StrategiesEventPro Strategies (EPS) is a leading experiential marketing/event staffing agency. Since 1999, EPS has partnered with agencies and Fortune 500 brands throughout the U.S., Canada and internationally to staff and execute experiential marketing events and campaigns.EPS is an equal opportunity employer and offers benefits to full-time and part-time employees including, medical, dental, vision and Paid Time Off (PTO). All final candidates will be asked to complete a background check, including driving record, education, employment, and criminal records.No third party recruiters please!Job Type: Internship

column23: Online.HookedOnPhonics.comApps.HookedOnPhonics.comHookedOnPhonics.comThis is a FT paid internship for a senior or recent college graduate, which may become a permanent position.We are a successful developer and marketer of educational products and apps for young learners. While we have the advantage of a very well-known brand, our emerging app business gives us a start-up vibe. We seek a tech-savvy, marketing minded go-getter to join our small team as a Summer intern. You will support the Marketing Manager in many aspects of digital & mobile marketing, and gain valuable hands-on experience that only a startup environment can provide. This position will hopefully become permanent in the future, for which you’ll be well suited to fill.Under the Marketing Manager, you will Support day-to-day marketing activities including:Outreach and on-boarding, and optimization of new mobile and desktop network advertising partnersManagement of social acquisition campaigns across Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest etcManagement of SEM campaigns across search engines, app stores and youtubeHelp grow our influencer marketing campaigns and networkIdentify, evaluate and recommend emerging technologies across the full spectrum of digital and mobile marketing (acquisition, tracking, messaging, etc.)Creation and publishing email newsletter campaigns and landing pagesGenerating acquisition, and internal performance (KPI’s, ROI, Retention) reports gathering information from several sources including GA and Adwords.Creation and maintenance of spend tracking, and monthly budget documents.App store optimization (ASO) and Search Engine Optimization (SEO) activitiesUpdating and optimizing metadata.Requirements:Must be proficient in Office Suite. Must have solid writing skills. Knowledge of HTML is extremely helpful. Career interest in digital and mobile marketing. Must be an innovative and creative problem solver who is not afraid to suggest ideas.Job Type: InternshipRequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:digital or mobile marketing: 1 yearRequired license or certification:Authorized to work in the U.S.

Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Through our dedication to customer-centric innovation and strong partnerships, we have established end-to-end advantages in telecom networks, devices and cloud computing. We are committed to creating maximum value for telecom operators, enterprises and consumers by providing competitive solutions and services. Our products and solutions have been deployed in over 170 countries, serving more than one third of the world‰Ûªs population. Huawei has over 150,000 employees, approximately 70,000 of which are engaged in Research & development. Huawei operates a global network of 14 regional headquarters, 16 R&D Centers, 28 Innovation Centers jointly operated with customers, and 45 Training Centers. Huawei is leading the way by rethinking the future. From devices to telecom infrastructure to cloud computing and convergence solutions, we are rethinking every link in the chain with ICT based innovation to deliver a better future...faster. University Relations Intern Location: Champaign, IL (R&D) Req #: 8040 # of Openings: 1 Description Huawei is seeking a University Relations intern for its operation in the Research Park at the University of Illinois. This position reports to and is under direct supervision of the University Program Manager. Education/Experience: Master‰Ûªs student in communication, business, marketing, advertising, or similar. Previous recruiting and/or advertising or public relations experience (at least 1 year). Previous event management experience (at least 1 year). Experience in an academic institution or a technology company is preferred. Duties and Responsibilities: Assist in creating and distributing promotional materials for Huawei internships and full time job opportunities, as well as events and programs that are occurring in the Huawei Research Park site. Assist with project and program presentations, reports and other materials. Preparing for and working at recruitment opportunities for student and full time employees such as career fairs and networking events.   Assisting with logistics for events and programs, such as inventory management of promotional items, input on additional promotional items needed for programs, space evaluations and recommendations, gathering catering information and assisting with those decisions, and other logistics support. Assisting in implementing events by working registration, setting up for presentations, gathering presentation materials, handing out supplemental materials, and other support at events. Other duties as assigned. Approximate hours per week: 10-15 Availability: starting as soon as possible, through spring semester.   Huawei  Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Why work for us? In 2015, Huawei's revenue reached CNY395 billion (US$60.8 billion based on the year-end exchange rate), an increase of 37% (YOY) We invest in engineering and innovation - 70,000+ of our 150,000+ global employees work in R&D Globally ranked #1 for International Patent Submissions We continually invest heavily in global community involvement programs We support green energy - Lowered CO2 emissions by 13,000 tons via Huawei‰Ûªs green packaging solutions Engaged in over 100 research projects with 50+ Universities in the United States    Are you a returning applicant? We create amazing experiences that celebrate the best of entertainment and technology. We‰Ûªre looking for great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation, unconventional thinking and embracing fun. It‰Ûªs a mission that takes some serious smarts, intense curiosity and determination to be the best.  Come be part of the team that‰Ûªs powering play. SUMMARY Hulu‰Ûªs Marketing team is seeking a Content Marketing Intern who will be an exceptional addition to the Marketing team. Content Marketing is responsible creating and executing all series specific on and off channel campaigns. As a Summer Intern at Hulu, you will have a chance to interact will all facets of the business assisting with camping post analysis and owning ad hoc projects around subscriber viewership and consumption. This role is ideal for someone who wants to learn about the rapidly-changing entertainment business while developing their analytical skills. WHAT YOU‰ÛªLL DO Assist with the strategic development and implantation of all on channel promotional campaigns You will analyze historical viewership trends and work with PR, Social, Content and various other teams to determine launch dates for original and licensed series  Take on a major project to own and analyze throughout the summer alongside your day-to-day responsibilities and deliver the final results and recommendations of this project to the relevant business groups at the end of the internship WHAT TO BRING Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program Must be available full-time starting summer 2017 Strong Excel skills and a familiarity with large data sets or modeling preferred Attention to detail Strong organizational skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly present findings A passion for understanding motivations and drivers Familiarity with Hulu and a passion for TV and film are certainly a plus *LI-DNP Apply Save HULU About Us Executives Subscribe Now ADVERTISING Ad Products Ad Solutions Hulu Originals JOBS Positions Hulugan Life What Defines Hulu PRESS Originals News Brand Assets FOLLOW US Twitter Facebook Tumblr   YouTube Instagram Google+

Our superior quality products are used in a variety of applications from nutritional products to cheese, yogurt and other dairy based foods. FULL-TIME/PART-TIME Seasonal  SHIFT Days  DESCRIPTION DEPARTMENT: Marketing and SalesREPORTS TO:  Marketing ManagerFLSA STATUS: Non-exemptTIME PERIOD: 3 months, Summer 2017 JOB SUMMARY:Idaho Milk Products is seeking an intern majoring in Marketing or related field; preferably in Junior or Senior year to assist with Marketing initiatives in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and social media. The intern will work with members of the Corporate Social Responsibility Team to finalize, publish and distribute the 2017 Report. This internship will also develop a plan to use social media influencers in the fitness nutrition space using a pull strategy to expand the market for Milk Protein Concentrates and Isolates.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:Becomes very familiar with our major customers‰Ûª social responsibility initiatives and how ours fits within the framework of theirs.Assists in preparing CSR Report for publishing and works with to finalize production of CSR Report.Assists in writing introduction letter and works with Sales Team to distribute letter and CSR Report to customers.Crafts a plan outline for social media influencer campaign including a .Works with Sales to determine customers to work with on social media influencers campaign.Creates a list of potential social media influencers and makes recommendations for choosing influencer.Functions as a between customer and social media influencer.Contributes to Idaho dairy industry activities, or to health & wellness events or committees that can enhance job performance and industry knowledge.Keeps meticulous records to document all aspects of the work performed.Proofreads entire CSR report for any errors.Performs other duties and projects as assigned.  POSITION REQUIREMENTSJOB SPECIFICATIONS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Education:Required: Minimum of 1 year of work towards BS degree in Marketing, Business or other related field.Preferred: Junior or Senior standing towards BS degree or MS student in Marketing, Business or other related field.Experience, Skills and Abilities:Ability to review primary research data to build a presentation that highlights key information.Knowledge and understanding of fitness and nutrition in healthy lifestyles.Experience with a wide range of social media platforms with the to find social influencers within those platforms.Experienced analyzing information, highlighting relevant information and suggesting appropriate actions.Skilled at organization, prioritization and time management.Excellent MS Office skills including Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint. Experience with Adobe InDesign is a plus.Confirmed ability to work independently and meet defined deadlines.Solid written and oral communication skills.Able to write reports and prepare/deliver presentations.Creative, self-starter that enjoys building systems from the ground up.BENEFITS:Non-benefit eligible  EOE STATEMENT We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or other applicable protected classes.  THIS POSITION IS CURRENTLY ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS.Apply NowWE ALSO RECOMMENDOTHER JOBS WITHIN SAME CATEGORY-- None found --OTHER JOBS WITHIN 60 MILESElectrical/Instrumentation Technician in Jerome, IDPosted on: 1/30/2017[Apply Now]Packaging Assistant, Various Shifts (Days, Swing, Nights) in Jerome, IDPosted on: 12/14/2016[Apply Now]Production Supervisor, Night Shift in Jerome, IDPosted on: 2/14/2017[Apply Now]Evaporator Operator, Days in Jerome, IDPosted on: 2/15/2017[Apply Now]Separator Operator, Night Shift in Jerome, IDPosted on: 2/23/2017[Apply Now] AppOne.comTM   copyrightå©1999-2017 HR Services, Inc.Click here for technical assistance.

You are not signed in.|My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job SearchMy Jobpage Basic Search| Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Summer Intern- IEEE Xplore Platform Design, Marketing - MAR0000011B: TT01  Description   IEEE is the world's largest professional association dedicated to advancing technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity.  The IEEE Xploreå¨ digital library is a specialized website for finding and accessing scientific and technical content published by the IEEE and its publishing partners.  IEEE Xplore provides web access to over four-million full-text documents from some of the world's most highly cited publications in electrical engineering, computer science and electronics.   The intern selected for the 2017 Summer Internship Program will work with the IEEE Platform Design team responsible for business management and design of the IEEE Xplore platform.  This team leads and manages the IEEE Xplore release process and business prioritization for new capabilities, features, and functions.  They manage the site layout, the color scheme, on-screen elements, and the overall look and feel to maximize user engagement.  They keep track of market and technology trends, measure user activity and behaviors, and regularly listen to users to make sure IEEE Xplore is continuously evolving to meet their needs.   As a summer intern for IEEE Xplore Platform Design you will have an inside look at the day-to-day business management of a specialized website.  You will participate in the business analysis and documentation of new features and capabilities.  You will learn how to conceptualize the user experience and transform it into a compelling user interface design.  You will increase your knowledge of Google search rankings, web content management and presentation, competitive benchmarking, and user validation and usability testing. You will also acquire skills for preparing web analytics and usage statistics reports.  Responsibilities: Assist with documentation of business requirements and user experience process flowcharts for the development of new features and capabilities. Coordinate recruitment of participants and set up arrangements for ongoing user validation and usability testing. Assist with market research and competitive benchmarking of comparable online platforms, features and functionality. Analyze the findability of IEEE Xplore content in Google and other search services, and the user experience for linking to subscription-based content on IEEE Xplore. Assist with the preparation and management of informational content for IEEE Xplore. Present research findings to IEEE Platform Design team (and possibly other staff). Prepare Excel reports for web platform analytics and usage statistics. Assist in other platform design related activities and research projects as needed.    Qualifications   Education and experience: College junior or senior (as of Fall 2017) with strong academic performance ‰ÛÒ major in user experience design, marketing, communications, psychology, business, or liberal arts preferred.  Skills and other requirements: Basic understanding of websites and market research techniques. Ability to write and document in Microsoft Office tools (PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Visio) and Google Apps (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Drive). Strong planning and organization skills with an ability to prioritize and manage work, adhering to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment. Excellent communication and presentation skills, both oral and written. Strong qualitative and analytical skills. Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.  For information on work demands and conditions required for this position, please consult the reference document, ‰ÛÏPhysical, Mental, and Work Environment Standards for IEEE Positions.‰Û  This position is classified under Category  I ‰ÛÒ office positions. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer:  This job description outlines the general nature and key features performed by various positions that share the same job.  It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.  Nothing in this job description restricts management‰Ûªs right to assign or re-assign duties  to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodations or other business reasons. Sign InHome Energy Sales InternsDublin, OHApplyApply with LinkedInHome Energy Sales InternsJob SummaryThis is a paid internship and the perfect opportunity for you to lay the groundwork for your future by gaining real world experience in the energy industry with emphasis on both sales and marketing. We want you to get the most out of your summer with IGS.  As a result, we will give you ‰ÛÏhands-on‰Û sales training and experience.  You will learn the sales process from start to finish.  In addition, you will be given a marketing project that will have a lasting impact on the organization. As part of the team, you will accomplish the following:Use a consultative sales approach to generate business by selling natural gas, electricity and home protection products.Gain knowledge and expertise in a promising industry.  You will become familiar with a variety of products and pricing structures.  This includes watching the best in the business discover the right solutions for customers via consultative selling.Maintain sales records using sophisticated CRM technology.Contribute your own ideas to a designated marketing project/assignment to meet one of IGS‰Ûª business objectives.Create a positive brand experience by representing IGS in the community at marketing events.Forge lasting relationships with colleagues, including fellow interns.We offer:Competitive hourly rate of $12 per hour plus commission.Fun team challenges to build camaraderie. An assigned mentor to provide ongoing support, guidance and feedback.Involvement in community and intern events.We are not just looking for someone to work over the summer; we are looking for someone to ultimately join and grow with our team.Be prepared to demonstrate your:Dynamic personality and drive to succeedTime management skillsProficient written and oral communication skillsAbility to learn from your work and from that of others around youWillingness to roll up your sleeves in a collaborative team environmentRequirements:Actively enrolled in college.  Open to all majors and class levels.Valid driver‰Ûªs license.  Reliable form of personal transportation.Auto insurance that satisfies the minimum requirement for the State of Ohio.Ability to work 11 am to 8 pm during the week and occasional Saturdays from 9 am to 12 pm.ApplyApply with LinkedInPosted 3 Days AgoFull timeR552About UsIGS is a leader in the energy industry advocating for an engaged society seeking positive change in the way customers manage and consume our energy resources. With 27 years of experience, the company provides the following to over one million customers across the country: natural gas, electricity, and home protection products (through IGS Energy); power generation solutions off the grid (through IGS Generation); clean, domestic alternative fueling options (through IGS CNG Services); and solar solutions (through IGS Solar). An IKEA co-worker’s main task is to maximise sales and profitability in his/her area of responsibility using knowledge of the IKEA product range, local market conditions and the needs of customers. No other position in the IKEA store is more hands-on in terms of customer contact. Together with thousands of colleagues around the world you will help to ensure the continued global success of the IKEA Concept – a concept that serves millions of satisfied customers each day.YOUR ASSIGNMENT Your tasks will include:Maximising sales and profitability by ensuring your area of responsibility is clean, tidy, fully stocked and correctly priced. You also ensure your products are in perfect condition at all times.Being passionate about the products you sell and actively learning about their features and benefits. You then want to share this knowledge with customers and colleagues.Actively approaching customers who you see need additional help, and advising them on the best solutions for their homes in order to sell more.Preparing your area of responsibility for stock replenishment and next day’s business.Understanding your department’s action plans, and supporting the goals and targets set by your manager.YOUR PROFILE Your knowledge, skills and experience include:You are confident about approaching and talking to people in a polite and friendly manner.You are enthusiastic about working with others in a team.You have a flexible approach to work and are open to change.You have an interest in home furnishing and people’s everyday life at home.You can prioritise and organise your own work to make efficient use of your time.GROWING TOGETHER IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global marketplace. And as the world’s leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.Additional Information :These are part-time positions working a guaranteed 20-31 hours per week. Must be able to work nights, weekends and public holidays. Starting pay is $14.82 with promotional opportunities available.Key Skills, abilities and experience needed for the positions:•Motivated and inspired by the IKEA Values.•Service minded and always keep the guest/customer in focus•Enthusiastic about working with others in a team•Good attention to details and the ability to prioritize and organize individual work duties in order to make the most efficient us of available time available.•Follow food handling, health, safety, hygiene and sanitation regulations and guidelines.•Provide visitors with a position shopping/dining experience by ensuring guest/customer convenience standards are met or exceeded.IKEA provides a comprehensive benefits package to help you achieve your personal and wellness goals including:•Health and Rx insurance – rated at Platinum and Gold (Medical and Rx is available for those co-workers who work 20+ hours per week)•Dental insurance•Vision – free for full time co-workers, slight cost share for part time co-workers•Health and Dependent care FSA’s•Company paid and Voluntary Life Insurance•Tuition reimbursement•401(k) with Company Match•Loyalty Bonus towards Retirement – TACK program•EAP•Short and Long term disability (Short and long term disability is available for co-workers who work 20+ hours per week)Other great benefits include:•Work/life balance•Generous PTO and paid sick time•Store discount•Training and development•Meal discount***International co-workers wishing to apply for this position should have the legal right to work in the US, or be in possession of a valid work visa.Job ID275900BRRemoval Date03/13/2017

HelpJob detailsinShare1   Job 1 of 1               Job Title Marketing Internship: Consumer Behavior AnalystLocation Minneapolis ( Bloomington )Country U.S.A.Work Area Marketing / CommunicationFull Time - Part Time Part TimeJob Type InternshipImageBody Copy We‰Ûªre looking for someone to take everything they‰Ûªve learned to a whole new level of doing in support of the IKEA ambition to be the leader in life at home.About the jobABOUT THE JOB You match IKEA home furnishing solutions to the needs and dreams of our customers. Plan, organize, and conduct interviews and analysis of the targeted customer segment's living situations (traditional university students) through visits to on campus housing, apartments, and house-sharing arrangements. With the support of IKEA staff and resources, you collect data about life at home for the traditional college student consumer segment; data may include information about living situations, room dimensions, home furnishing needs, tastes and preferences. After collecting data, you prepare a proposal using the IKEA 'Insight to Action' work method to to increase the understanding of the local market segment in the IKEA Twin Cities retail store, enabling staff to take action and create inspirational solutions relevant to the segment's needs and desires.YOUR ASSIGNMENT Your tasks will include:Create a proposed marketing strategy for recruitment of respondents from the targeted market segment for interviews and observations of living situationsUtilize the IKEA software to prepare interview teams for conducting home visits; establishing relevant interview questions, you coordinate with the IKEA Business partners to arrange for staff and resources to conduct the visitCommunicate and prepare the respondent for the interviews and observations; support the team in the home visit interview and observations by collecting data and insightsCompile the findings from interviews and observations and compare to relevant market data to create data trends. Provide analysis to store business partners for quick insights.Identifying trends and priorities within the segment, you transfer the learnings gathered from the home visit interviews to your IKEA business partnersCommunicate the home furnishing needs and desires in the targeted living situation through a formal presentation and written proposal to aid the IKEA business partners in developing relevant solutions in the local marketYOUR PROFILE Your knowledge, skills and experience include:You are working towards a degree in Marketing, Communication, Public Relations, Business Administration or a related field of studyYou have experience conducting research, interviewing research subjects, documenting observations, and preparing and delivering project presentationsYou have a strong interest in and knowledge of home furnishings, living situations, and the consumer/buyer in the purchase decisionGROWING TOGETHER IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global marketplace. And as the world‰Ûªs leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.Additional Information :PAID INTERNSHIP Targeted start dates: April 15 or April 29, 2017Anticipated weekly scheduled hours range:up to 20 hours weekly from position start through Mayup to 30 hours weekly from May through internship completion July/AugustYour Total Rewards Offer includes:15% discount for product purchaseSubsidized monthly mass transitTraining and developmentthe opportunity be involved in community projects that are People+Planet positiveOther perks such as Pet insuranceJob ID 275637BRBoiler Plate At IKEA, we see coworkers sharing from day one. We know it is a diversity of ideas that leads to real breakthroughs. Share your big ideas where everyone wants to hear them!Removal Date 03/10/2017              IKEA is an equal opportunity employerIKEA US participates in the E-Verify Program

We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.How this team works:Our Sales force helps transform the hiring process by providing companies an easy and effective way to find the right fit for every hire.We support our sales team with career development and Dale Carnegie Leadership Award-winning training from day one. Every month, over 200 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. Simply put, we empower hiring companies who help people get jobs around the globe.How this job works:Are you a rising college senior seeking an opportunity that will provide you with invaluable skills, impactful work and real-world experience? This is the perfect opportunity for a self-starter to work among some of the highest performing sales executives at the world’s #1 job site. The right candidate will possess excellent attention to detail, strong communication skills, and an interest in sales and the tech industry.With a history of hiring interns for full-time employment, successful interns will have the opportunity to interview upon completion of internship.How you work:ResponsibilitiesSupport Indeed's day-to-day Sales effortsCommunicate with new business leads and learn to effectively sell pay-per-click (PPC) advertising over the phone and via webinarCollaborate with our Client Services and Technology teamsMaintain and update critical information in our CRM systemConduct heavy market researchWork on sales focused projects as assignedLearn the various parts of Indeed’s businessServe as a brand representative for Indeed on your campusRequirementsInternship Program is 10+ weeks long (May - August)Qualified candidates will be available for a Monday, May 30th start dateInternship is full-time, qualified candidates will be available for 40 hours/weekTo apply, candidates must be currently enrolled, taking classes, and pursuing a Bachelor’s degree within an accredited college or university in the United StatesEligible candidates will have a graduation date between December 2017 and May 2018All majors may applyOutstanding written, verbal, and presentation skillsHighly motivated self-starterAbility to work independently, as well as part of a teamInterest in Sales, competitive, goal-driven and metrics centricWeb-savvy with a proficiency in web researchExperience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Google DocsPreferred QualificationsKnowledge of pay-per-click (PPC) advertising

column23: Marketing Internships Internships | Kirkland, WA, United States Apply Send Jobvite INRIX is hiring four exceptional Marketing interns interested in obtaining practical work experience for the summer of 2017. Marketing internships will take place in our Kirkland office. You will work closely with mentors from the team and have exposure to many areas of the business. You‰Ûªll gain a hands-on education and develop your marketing skills. Available Marketing Internships 1. Sales and customer marketing: You‰Ûªll work across various teams and verticals to develop go-to-market campaigns with a focus on updating the collateral and decks Must be a PowerPoint guru, with expert level ability to develop compelling presentations  2. Develop and execute a social media plan You‰Ûªll identify relevant social communities for each of the industries we sell to and research areas of interest. You will develop and execute a plan to insert INRIX themes, messages and benefits in a way that positively contributes to the community and builds INRIX‰Ûªs thought leadership position Must have extensive knowledge of social media platforms including LinkedIn, blogs, digital communities Strong writing and communications skills are essential   3. Integrated marketing campaigns Research the audience for each of our product offerings and identify how to reach them (what do they read, associations they belong to, where are they online, etc.) Compile the ways to reach them (association lists, websites they frequent, keywords, etc.) Must have strong research skills and a willingness to find groups, build lists, etc. Knowledge of how to interact with salesforce.com is a plus   4. Competitive Benchmarking You will conduct a competitive assessment of our key competitors by researching and benchmarking their value propositions, key metrics and more Experience with competitive assessment, benchmarking and value propositions Strategic marketing knowledge and skills   INRIX is the global leader in connected car services and movement analytics, a new approach that leverages big data and the cloud to help manage urban mobility. By aggregating a variety of sources and applying intelligence, INRIX delivers comprehensive data and solutions to help move people, cities and businesses forward. Our partners are automakers, governments, mobile operators, developers, advertisers, as well as enterprises large and small. We are literally everywhere with over 450 customers across 60 countries.  INRIX is a privately held company headquartered in Kirkland with offices around the globe. If the student is seeking college credit for the internship, it is the responsibility of the intern to ensure that college internship requirements are met by the program.  All internships are based in our Kirkland, WA office. INRIX does not offer housing or relocation assistance for interns. Pay is dependent on year in school and experience.
