Internships - Product Planning & Marketing Location: NJ - Mahwah Department: Jaguar Land Rover Marketing & Sales Description Jaguar Land Rover North America‰Ûªs internship program is a great opportunity for college students entering their junior or senior year, or who are currently in a graduate school program, to gain hands-on experience in the exciting world of the automotive industry!  This is a great opportunity for personal growth and development from a business and learning perspective.   Details of the program:         The program is open only to students at a Junior or Senior level in their Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree program, or who are enrolled in a Graduate School program.         The Internship is for a full year, June 2017 to May 2018, and the successful intern must be able and willing to commit to the full length of the program.         Intern is asked to work for 25-29 hours per week during business hours in the Mahwah, NJ office (Business hours are Monday through Friday 8:30 AM ‰ÛÒ 5:30 PM, and the intern‰Ûªs actual daily schedule will work around their class schedule).   Departments:  Product Planning and Marketing/Brand Strategy Departments Location:   Mahwah, New Jersey We currently have two internships available - one in our Product Planning area, the other concentrating on Brand Strategy & Launch within our Marketing Department. Outline of Roles: These internships will provide an opportunity to develop business acumen, leadership, and project management skills, as well as develop analytical and reporting skills.   Intern will be responsible for supporting team members in a variety of tasks and project areas, including: Pulling data sets, investigating competitive offerings, and project support for strategic decision making.   Assisting in the development and execution of go-to-market plans, by conducting cross-functional analysis and  reporting. Supporting the team on various project for the expanding product line Key Criteria for Role: Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in progress (Junior or Senior), or pursuing a graduate studies degree (Marketing, Business, or related discipline preferred); 3.0 GPA or higher; Intermediate to advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, and previous data manipulation experience; Previous marketing and analytics experience or coursework; Strong communication and presentation skills; High level of professionalism; Detail-oriented, self-starter, strong work ethic, team player,  ability to build rapport and communicate confidently; Ability to leverage insights to draw sound conclusions and translate them into actionable recommendations. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Jaguar Land Rover North America, LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. The Jenesis Milan Agency provides effective marketing, branding, promotions, and endorsement solutions to athletes, entertainers, and organizations worldwide. Our vision is to assist artists, businesses, athletes and entertainers alike in taking their companies and careers to the next level by utilizing our collective knowledge, skills, abilities and experiences to establish them in their respective industries and build on their lifetimes of hard work in perfecting their trade. Our goal is to help everyone we encounter to become their better selves both inside and outside the spotlight. Our desire is for every client to create brand longevity and earning potential for the days long after their physical work ends. Overall Objective: To assist the Marketing Manager in maintaining marketing strategies and to execute the tactical activities associated with the overall marketing plan to optimize sales. Our internship is a 3 to 4 month program requiring up to 20 hours a week. Overall this internship is an excellent opportunity to gain real world business marketing experience. Interns will have an opportunity to work closely with the founder and CEO of Jenesis Milan Agency to learn the necessary skills required to start, manage or become an executive in a business. A position will only be offered to those we have an interest in hiring at the end of the internship. To learn more about Jenesis Milan, visit www.jenesismilan.com.Responsibilities: Create signage, newsletters, email campaigns, online promotions, etc. - Provide support to social media efforts to target new audiences. - Assist with special events to promote company clients and increase visibility. In addition to researching for endorsement opportunities. - Research and analyze competitor marketing and print materials. - Collaborate on team presentations for management and clients.Requirements: Pursuing a Bachelors Degree in Marketing - Possess excellent written and verbal communication and customer service skills. - Possess creativity, flexibility, variety, and growth potential. - Should be open-minded, a fast learner, enthusiastic, and adaptable.Note: Unpaid InternshipJob Type: Internship

Job search Kodak Home PageAbout KodakKodak Careers Main Page Sign in/Register in Share Event Marketing Intern 18818BR Marketing / Branding USA - NY - Rochester Position Description Summer Intern - Event Marketing Internship   Kodak is looking for an Event Marketing Intern with sales, marketing and organizational skill; the Ideal candidate is a current student pursuing a Bachelor's in Marketing.  The scope of the project you will be working on is:  Eastman Business Park is one of the largest industrial parks in the world encompassing 1,200 acres.  That‰Ûªs 50% bigger than New York City‰Ûªs Central Park.  In terms of building space, the Park is home to 16 million square feet of manufacturing, distribution, office, laboratory, clean room, recreational and conference space.  That‰Ûªs 2.5 times more space under roof than the Pentagon. Ninety-five companies call Eastman Business Park home today.  That‰Ûªs up from 85 a year ago, and our goal is to attract ten more in 2017.  Over 6,000 people work in the Park and over $4 billion in manufacturing revenue is generated by companies like Kodak, Carestream, Ortho Clinical Diagnostics, Harris, LiDestri Food and Drink, Kodak Alaris and Columbia Care.   As big as we are, we have a lot of room to grow.  From our 2,000 seat theater where we will have a new venue manager, a new marquee and renovations to the lobby to the new energy storage center where eight companies are building batteries that will help reduce our dependence on fossil fuels we are in growth mode.   We are adding new tenants and expanding the footprints of existing tenants.  One of the most important things any employer looks for when choosing a location for a manufacturing operation is talent.  They want to know that as soon as they set up shop, they will be able to hire top quality talent at a competitive wage.  And beyond that, they want to know that as they grow they will be able to obtain the skills they need.  This means we need to work with local schools and colleges, companies and business associations to build a pipeline of talent.  One of the ways Eastman Business Park supports this is by hosting the annual MFG DAY event.  In 2016 over 400 high school students attended a half day program at the Park to learn about TODAY‰Ûªs manufacturing careers.  We had a presentation with high impact video, a panel of recent graduates who are embarking on a manufacturing career, a panel of managers from employers and an interview with a very successful business man who now owns his own manufacturing company.  The event also had exhibitors from 10 different organizations, including employers, educators and associations. We plan to do it again in 2017 and need a skilled organizer and marketer to develop the plans, coordinate among the entities, and make sure the event comes off smoothly.  That‰Ûªs why, for this role, we would like to hire an intern with sales, marketing and organizational skills.   Management of this single, large project will give the candidate a great experience and great resume material.      Position Type Coop - Intern Experience Level Coop / Intern Minimum Education Level High School Diploma or GED Date Posted 28-Feb-2017 Apply to job Save Share EEO/Privacy Policy

We are seeking creative, curious, and intelligent people to join our ranks. Our company was founded on the power of a good idea. And we know that good ideas can only come from people. Because of this, we believe that self-managed people are our greatest resource and pride ourselves on our outstanding culture to support them. See us in action on YouTube!!!!!Responsibilities:åá Interacting with the global marketing team to define the requirements of various design projects, including creative briefs, deadlines, and measurable goalsåá Designing and/or editing a wide variety marketing collateralåá Assisting designers, copy writers, and other members of the marketing team with design projectsåá Working with business stakeholders on customer-facing presentationsRequirements:åá Completed at least 2 years in a degree-seeking program at an accredited institution of higher learning, focused on graphic designåá Well-developed skills in the fundamentals of design and the tools of the trade, including Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Microsoft Office Suiteåá The ability to help manage the production of work through the necessary approval processåá A deadline-driven focusåá Excellent communication skillsåá Ability to manage multiple projects and timelinesåá Passion for learning about B2B marketing, business challenges, project management, and designåá Ability to work independently with strict deadlinesåá Ability to take in, process and act upon feedbackåá Have great attention to detail and a streak of curiosityåá Awareness of current design trends for print and digital space, desktop and mobile platformsEOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled*LI-MD1

The internship requires candidates to attend weekly staff meetings, services, leadership training, and other church events. Previous volunteer experience is preferred, but not required for acceptance as an intern. The primary requirement is a genuine desire to be involved in full-time ministry.Lake Hills Church is a new church that launched the fall of 2016 in Groveland, FL. Pastors Micky and Tenille Johnson were on staff at 7 Hills Church in Florence, KY for the last 10 years. During this time, the church grew from a few hundred to over 5,000 in weekly attendance. Micky’s role as Executive Pastor and Tenille’s role as Associate Director provided them with priceless experience that is now being used to build a life-giving church in Central Florida.We are now accepting applications for intern positions that will begin March 18, 2017. Intern candidates should be between the ages of 17 and 25. A total of seven positions will be available. Intern positions will require a 20-hour commitment each week, while still allowing flexibility to work part-time or take college courses. If you feel you would like to one day work for a church or be involved in ministry this is an excellent opportunity for you. This on the job experience will be a valuable asset for those who are accepted. We are currently looking for interns in the following areas:MusiciansVocalistsVideo productionSound/lighting operatorsChildren’sYouth MinistryFacilities/set-upThe internship is a non-paid position. After completing six months, interns are eligible for both contracted positions and regular positions as roles become available.BEFORE YOU APPLYVisit our website at www.lakehills.church and learn more about the type of church God has called us to become. Here you will find links to our social media sites as well.If you would like to apply, please follow the link (or copy and paste the link) below and fill out this online application: https://lakehillsch.wufoo.com/forms/lake-hills-church-intern-application/HELPFUL LINKSOur Beliefs - http://www.lakehills.church/what-we-believe/About Us - http://www.lakehills.church/#aboutOur Home/Supporting Church - http://www.7hillschurch.tv/Affiliated With - http://www.arcchurches.com/Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Groveland, FL

Join the Ultimate Babe Cave experience as we launch near Grand Valley State University! We are looking for a creative, forward thinking, and social marketing intern. Do you love social media? Love people? Know your way around Facebook, Instagram and Snapchat? We are looking for you! This position will allow you to be completely hands on, try your ideas and fully see the outcome it has on the salon in real time.This is a paid internship. Hourly and bonus commission.Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Allendale, MI

Find Opportunities U.S. English Sign In Summer Intern - Sales/Marketing - MPP (2 positions) Operations Apply now Posted: March 2, 2017 Full-Time Pittsburgh, PA, United States Who we are: LANXESS is a leading specialty chemicals company with sales of EUR 7.9 billion in 2015 and roughly 16,200 employees in 29 countries. The company is currently represented at 52 production sites worldwide. The core business of LANXESS is the development, manufacturing and marketing of plastics, rubber, intermediates and specialty chemicals. LANXESS is a member of the leading sustainability indices Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI World and DJSI Europe) and FTSE4Good. LANXESS Corporation offers an extensive internship program where undergraduate and graduate level talent work across various company functions to gain valuable hands-on experience in a fast-paced corporate environment.   As a Summer Intern Sales/Marketing in our MPP (Materials Protection Products) Business unit you will be one of two interns - one sales oriented  and one technical, chemical engineer desirable, to complete market studies and applications analysis for market areas like Water treatment and Plastics applications. You will perform the following tasks: Conduct market research and data analysis for relevant application fields (e.g polymer emulsions, paints & coatings); Present an executive summary related to market research Prepare competition analysis and benchmarking information Research company profile of potential customers Maintain key account profile management Conduct cold calling of prospect customers In order to accomplish this you must have:  Completed your sophomore year or higher in Business Administration with a major in marketing; Engineering or Chemistry with a minimum of a 3.0 GPA Experience in data analysis and presentation Excel data managing, pivot tables and graph design Powerpoint presentations Communications skills both written and phone Sales and/or marketing background or training Technical understanding in marketing and market data trends    Must include a resume.   LANXESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status or disability.   Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor‰Ûªs legal duty to furnish information. Interested in learning more about LANXESS?

Are you a highly motivated, hard working self-starter with a solid grasp of social media and here's the best part... willing to gain valuable experience for very little compensation (i.e. $10 per hour)? If this sounds too good to be true, consider coming on board the Lead365 National Conference team. Our mission is to develop collegiate leaders and those who serve them through an annual conference hosted in Orlando every fall (www.lead365.org) Immediate opening for interns!The qualified student needs to be responsible and willing to complete marketing tasks in a timely fashion. The conference is only 3 years old, therefore the intern needs to know how to make "cold calls," update databases (skilled in excel), pull together or edit video to use as marketing, coordinate events (or follow up on instructions), and go with the flow doing tasks as needed. If you have any experience with graphic design programs and hosting webinars (or the brain power and desire to research how to do it and pull it off - all the better!This position reports directly to the executive director who works quickly, likes to have a positive work environment, and have fun while getting the work done. Many projects and marketing requests are time sensitive. The number one outcome of this internship position is registration acquisition (a fancy term for "getting bodies in the seats"). It's almost March so it's time to get cracking!Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Boston, MARequired experience:Marketing: 1 year

Our Social Media Marketing Team is responsible for the all important task of building awareness of our brand. They are our contact with the communities around us. They work through the social media channels with to help assure our marketing efforts are making the biggest impact. We believe if you are going to be a part of a community, you should be a part of it. That is why the majority of our marketing efforts are in programs that directly impact our communities, our marketing department makes all of this possible.In Addition to building brand awareness and streamling our marketing, part of your responsibilities would be to work with the recruiting department to post adds on our social media channels.Job Type: InternshipSalary: $10.00 to $15.00 /hourJob Location:Austin, TX 78759Required education:Associate

Lehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified IT Senior Business Systems Analyst – JD Edwards. This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas.Under the general guidance of the Business Systems Manager – JDE, this position will provide a high level of functional and business process expertise in the research, development, and support of JDE EnterpriseOne 9.0 functionality. Primary responsibilities will include providing user support, gathering user requirements, configuring the system for new functionality, and ensuring that the system is kept current with patches and updates. This position will primarily be responsible for supporting the GL/AP/AR, maintenance, capital asset management, procurement, security, and inventory modules of JDE. The successful candidate to fill this position will have 7 plus years of JDE Financials/Accounting experience, strong analytical skills, and excellent verbal and written communication skills.Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, the global market leader in aggregates with leading positions in cement, concrete and other downstream activities. Following the acquisition of Italcementi, the Company employs some 63,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in around 60 countries.Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Veteran / DisabledESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES and TASKSActively participates in cross-functional groups to solve problems.Provides 2nd and 3rd level JDE support to end users.Works with developers to create and test new system functionality.Researches, coordinates, and tests JDE software patches, updates, and fixes.Partners with business users to coordinate application and testing of system patches and enhancements.Creates technical specifications for developers.Installs and configures applications.Acts as a liaison with vendors and consultants to address support activities.Develops documentation to improve the use and availability of applications.Provides expert level support and maintenance of core software functionality and technology components.Provides expert knowledge of business line process flows and procedures to junior analysts.Identifies, develops, and initiates innovations and solutions where precedents and procedures may not exist. Works cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes.Leads and mentors junior analysts in resolving the more complex technical issues.Maintains a shareable library of system documentation and practices.Up to 10% travel may be required.Required to be on-call when assigned.Performs other job-related duties as assigned.Works to de-complicate processes and systems, including master data management improvement projects.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSMinimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree.Minimum of 6 years of experience in an information technology environment.Minimum of 4 years of experience as a business analyst.Extensive experience working in project teams, with ability to effectively lead project management staff.Knowledge of prevalent IT methodologies, management practices, architectures, system development lifecycles and best practices.Strong analytical ability.Experience with M&A activity involving JD Edwards EnterpriseOne system.Expertise in both business and configuration knowledge for functional areas.Strong communications skills, including presentation and facilitation ability. Must have the ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing.Business process viewpoint with integration impact.Requires project management skills; designs solutions for internal/external clients.Considered a subject matter expert resource for others.May have knowledge of more than one professional discipline.May require awareness of external trends and best practices.High level of expertise JDE General Ledger, Security, Inventory, Procurement, and core setup/configuration like AAIs, DBAs, and business processes.High level of knowledge of JDE file and application structure.Experience performing upgrades involving JDE EnterpriseOne 9.0 or greater.Strong analytical skills.Detailed knowledge of core software data structures, infrastructure components (LAN / WAN / Client / Server), database, data flows and reporting techniques.Proven experience in troubleshooting, testing and quality assurance techniques.Proficient in the development of documentation to support functional specifications, data flows, etc.Keen interest in new technologies and the vision to identify opportunities for improving business processes.Proficient in MS Office, Project and Visio.COMPETENCIESCommitment and engagement through high level of work ethic and utilization of abilities for the best of the company.Internal and external customer and market management.Performance and result management.Demonstrated openness to change, flexibility, and adaptability.Establish trust and relationships.Entrepreneurial management (i.e. consideration of long-term risks and opportunities).Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.Ability to motivate teams and simultaneously manage several projects.Demonstrated drive and initiative.Strong strategic thinking, problem solving, and decision making skills.Persuasion and negotiation skills.Sustainable management (i.e. compliance with laws and regulations).Professional competence (i.e. knowledge of the industry and cross-functional understanding.Bachelor’s degree in Information MIS, Information Technology, Engineering, or other related field.Minimum 7-10 years of relevant IT work experience.7 plus years of JDE experienceBENEFITS & COMPENSATIONWe know that our employees are critical to our overall success. We are dedicated to investing in their future to maintain long-term relationships for lasting commitments. We offer a comprehensive package of compensation and benefits programs which are regularly reviewed to maintain them at competitive levels.Salary will be commensurate with your work experience and relevant skills.No Search Firms please.HP123

Apply Now Product Marketing Intern at LifeDojo (View all jobs) San Francisco This opportunity is a PAID INTERNSHIP for the Spring of 2017. As a Product Marketing Intern on LifeDojo's fast-growing team, you will make important and lasting contributions to creating our brand and voice. You‰Ûªll work with our CEO and Marketing Director, engage directly with our users, and use your sharp intuition, research and critical thinking skills to help us create engaging content and user experiences. You'll work on projects like these: Crafting messaging for product and marketing emails Engaging with our users and assisting with user requests Researching topics like nutrition and fitness to find the best resources and apps available Helping us continually improve many aspects of our product About us: LifeDojo is a fast-growing, venture-backed digital health startup focused on improving employee health one habit at a time. The result? Employers save on healthcare costs, improve productivity and transform their culture, while we get to alleviate the suffering of millions. It‰Ûªs a pretty sweet gig. About you: You're pro-active and curious, you take direction and feedback well and always bring your own creative energy to the table. You have an active personal interest in health, wellbeing, fitness, healthy eating and nutrition, mindfulness, mental resilience and healthy living in general. Marketing Paid Internship (Part — Time)Our growing International company would like to bring on a Marketing Intern for a year long internship.The successful candidate will be enrolled full-time in a major university or college and studying marketing or communications. We’re looking for a driven, ambitious individual who wants to create a career in marketing, social media and content marketing. We’re offering a flexible schedule. We provide training, guidance and support, as well as the opportunity to experience the industry from the inside and gain valuable work experience. Build your portfolio of work and establish employment reference with us and Apply Today!The intern will report directly to the Communications and Marketing Manager and will also work closely with the marketing team assisting with Marketing for 4 countries (United States, Canada, Mexico and Brazil).Duration: Spring, Summer, Fall 2017. Opportunity to extend and/or convert to full time employment after graduation depending on availability of open roles.Hours: 25 hours per weekGoals & ObjectivesGoals:To gain experience in design, implementation, and evaluation of marketing programs.To understand the marketing/promotion process and program delivery for corporate and network marketing.To observe interpersonal and organizational dynamics.Objectives:To participate in routine department functions (i.e. staff meetings, etc.).To participate in program planning meetings and follow-up assignments.Review curriculum and materials used in marketing promotion programs.To provide research and benchmarking in select marketing topic areas.Assist in network marketing promotion delivery which includes: being part of Lyoness Business presentations.Observe a corporate office operation.Enhance written and verbal communication skills.Assist in program development.To attend one professional meeting.Marketing Intern skillsEnrollment in a Bachelor’s degree program requiredExcellent written communication skillsStrong creativityAbility to work both independently and as part of a teamStrong attention to detailFamiliarity with social media strategies and platformsAbility to multi-task and take initiativeFlexible work scheduleHardworking and dedicated outlookAbility to take direction and absorb information quicklyExperience with content creation a plus, even if not professionallyPlace of InternshipFort Lauderdale, FL — United States (We are located on Las Olas Blvd. in the heart of Downtown Fort Lauderdale)Application InstructionsTo be considered, your application must include the following:ResumeCover LetterOur Business:Lyoness America Inc. is a global loyalty rewards program dedicated to providing a rewarding and mutually beneficial relationship between their unparalleled community of international shoppers and merchants. A free Lyoness membership provides shoppers with exclusive benefits from online shopping, gift card purchases, the Lyoness cash back card and mobile cash back with over 24,000 merchants at more than 150,000 locations!"Cash back with every purchase" is a desire that has fueled the worldwide growth of Lyoness. Starting in Europe, Lyoness has rapidly grown into a successful worldwide shopping community with offices on all continents! Lyoness has 40 plus regional offices in 40 plus countries.We do not only aspire an economical balance, but a social (Child & Family Foundation) and ecological (Greenfinity Foundation) one too! The Lyoness philosophy embodies our unique business model that unites our members, merchants, and community for the benefit of all. "Shop together, Benefit together, Do good together."Our PeopleThe team at Lyoness constitutes a truly diverse and global work environment. We blend our unique backgrounds, cultures, experiences and skills for one united goal - the Lyoness community! As we continue to grow our worldwide shopping network, we have the opportunity to learn from one another while knowing that our combined efforts also benefit our two Lyoness foundations.Why Lyoness?Your career prospects are endless with Lyoness. We are a growing company and are adding to our team around the world. With offices on all continents and positions including logistics, customer service, marketing, and more, there are new opportunities being created every day. At Lyoness, we believe that every member of the team is essential to our success.At Lyoness, we are committed to unlocking the full potential within our employees. Our team is our greatest asset, and we want to give them the tools necessary to succeed. By providing the right motivation and encouraging creativity, we have seen the results our team can achieve.Top 5 reasons to work for LyonessExciting career opportunities with growth potentialEver-changing challenges in an internationally expanding companyCross-culture diversity inspires an environment of respect and appreciationEmployee input and collaboration results in a sense of ownershipLyoness encourages team building and personal growth for all of our employeesJob Type: InternshipRequired education:High school or equivalent

The Manager communicates directly with the Founder, and while collaborative decisions are preferred, final decisions rest with the Founder.Ø Project Management & Artist LiaisonManager is the primary point-of-contact for all projects initiated by the organization, as well as all projects brought into the organization via artists. Projects may include shows at the studio, as well as those which are sponsored by the organization, but held at outdoor or supplemental locations.Manager is the primary point-of-contact for all artists brought in to work at the studio. Once an artist is secure, the Manager is artist’s liaison for all questions related to logistics for load-in and load-out, all communications related to artists work while it’s under this organization’s umbrella, and constant oversight of the artist while he/she is working in the studio.Ø Identifying New ArtistsManager maintains a constant pulse on and knowledge of artists, keeping an eye out for artists whose work fits the criteria of work this organization supports.Manager regularly reports to the Founder with a complete presentation of the potential artists for the studio space (this includes proactive research on those artists, gallery/studio/installation visits, online investigation/research, etc)Ø Studio/Venue ManagementManager is responsible for the day-to-day running and upkeep of the organization’s artist studio space, as well as its use as a venue.Ø Staff ManagementManager is responsible for the daily management of staff members/interns, and is at all times familiar with their workloads and responsibilities (this includes website oversight, social media + external communications, event coordination, space logistics), ensuring a seamless transition and effective coverage of all work at all times. Manager also oversees all volunteers/docents and any/all work with partner organizations, as needed.(More detailed job description available to candidates selected to interview for the position)Necessary Qualities and Skills:Calm and friendly disposition in the workplacePoised and professional communicator (both in-person, and written). Mariners Church is a thriving community. We’re ordinary people from all backgrounds, and life experiences, courageously trusting Him to do the extraordinary. Simply put, we’re trusting Him to do what we can’t – heal, transform, renew, forgive, provide and sustain . Through our stories, He is glorified, lives are changed, and our communities are impacted.Mariners is a family of churches with five campuses throughout Orange County. Each weekend experience is a unique expression of the mission and values of Mariners Church, and consists of a lead teaching pastor, support staff, and teams of dedicated volunteers. God is moving in the hearts of the people in our church community, creating dreams and planting ideas . We’d love for you to be a part of it.Our summer internship program is designed to provide you with opportunities for spiritual, vocational, and personal development while giving you hands-on ministry experience working alongside Mariners Church pastors and staff.Application ProcessCandidates will be required to submit Internship Application, along with a resume and cover letter explaining why they are interested in this program and why they should be chosen. Interns can also submit examples of their work in the desired discipline (i.e. graphic design samples, leading worship, teaching, etc.)Selected candidates will be interviewed by ministry leaders and candidates will be notified of the selection decision.Find An InternshipUse the following link to access the available internships. The internship will begin with an orientation on Thursday, June 22nd and end with a celebration goodbye barbeque on Sunday, August 20th. No, they are unpaid internshipsCan I get college credit? If your college or university offers credit for internship opportunities, we will work with your counselors and/or professors to meet those requirementsCan I intern during the school year? Yes! We can work with you to design an individualized internship experience if you would like to intern during the school yearJob Type: InternshipSalary: $0.00 /hour

Market Research Intern - 2017 Location: Cambridge, MA Department: Job Code: 820 # of openings: 1 Description Market Strategies International is a market research consultancy with deep expertise in consumer & retail, energy, financial services, healthcare, technology and telecommunications. We blend primary research with data from our syndicated, benchmarking and self-funded studies as well as Big Data to provide clients with the most complete and accurate insights needed to make confident business decisions. Market Strategies‰Ûª research specialties include brand, communications, CX, product development and segmentation. Our syndicated products, known as Cogent Reports, help clients understand the market environment, explore industry trends and monitor their brand and products within the competitive landscape. Founded in 1989, Market Strategies is one of the largest market research firms in the world. We are headquartered in Livonia, MI with regional offices throughout the US. We are currently seeking an Intern for our Cambridge, MA office.  The Market Research Intern will assist our research teams with tasks during phases of the project lifecycle, including survey design, questionnaire development, ensuring data quality, analysis, and report development.    This is a paid, temporary Internship estimated to last a few months, or as long as business needs require.  The Intern will work daily on a full-time (40 hour week) schedule.  Current students will be considered as long as classes are outside of working hours.   Earning credit hours for current educational studies possible: student required to set expectations for what is needed.   Qualifications: Must have 1 year academic and/or practical experience with survey or market research methodologies. Must demonstrate knowledge of basic statistics, research procedures, and survey methodology. Successful completion of coursework in graduate-level statistics and survey methodology helpful. Must have experience working with a data analysis package (SPSS preferred). Moderate to Advanced-level Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills. Must be able to handle multiple project assignments simultaneously. Must have excellent use of time management.  Must show strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Must be self-motivated, and possess a desire to work in market research with data and numbers. Must exhibit high ethical standards. Must have above average communication skills (written and verbal). Able to work effectively within a team-oriented, highly collaborative environment. EEO/AA EMPLOYER M/F/V/D   Previous Applicants: Email: Password:  If you do not remember your password click here. We are looking for an energetic, outgoing, and highly motivated Junior or Senior college student who wants incredible hands-on experience for the spring ’17 semester or longer and an opportunity to make money, establish relationships and build their resume. Here at Marshall Reddick Real Estate, we like to work hard and play hard in a fast paced, fun, and rapidly changing real estate environment. responsibilities of the Manager, Public Safety Support Services in their absence. Responding to sales leads (both email and phone). Check email and voicemail communication. Maintain database lists. Assist in Sales Blitz preparation. Assists with the scheduling and management of client site inspections. Schedule and organize meetings, prepare material for weekly team meetings. Assist in managing CNET with Sales Manager. Work with Sales Manager to maintain caterer Right of Entry, Alcohol documentation and processes. Create and follow-up with contracts and payments. Book travel, submit vacation requests and expense reports. Prepare, collect and follow-up on catering invoices. Assist with the preparation of client entertainment functions. Consult and assist Sales Manager with media preparation for Marketing Department and proposals when needed. Spreadsheet, budgeting and report preparation. Manage day to day projects to assist Sales Manager in generating additional revenue. Coordinate with Convention Center Sales Assistant as needed. Maintain incoming and outgoing documentation log. Oversee Interns on assigned projects.Supporting the Senior Event Manager: Provide administrative services, such as monitoring and ordering supplies, maintaining the files, and managing the general filing system. Provides a full range of administrative and operations support for the client. Set up scheduling and management of client site inspections, and planning meetings. Serves as back-up support during times while EMs are out of the office (HSW – In house events as needed). Maintains calendar and monitors appointments, through daily review, prioritizing and arranging meetings, conferences and appointments. Works with preferred caterers in making sure all documentation is submitted for alcohol permits and collecting 10% catering invoice for each caterer. Assists with preparation for staff meetings and production meetings. Attend staff meetings at 10:00am and production meetings 2x a month. Send Event Management welcome packet once event is assigned. Manage vendor lists and assist in making sure clients receive lists of preferred vendors when asked. Performs other related tasks and duties as assigned. Check email and voicemail (direction of the senior event manager). Event coordination of small short-term events scheduled within 2 weeks. Coordinate with other departments to ensure successful events and assist with venue management requests. Using computer-aided design software (i.e. Social Tables), prepares meeting room diagrams and floor plans (under supervision of SEM).S* *KILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES Skills required to develop sales/marketing tools. Possesses excellent analytical skills. Detail-oriented and highly organized. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to express ideas and convey information effectively, both orally and in writing. Ability to make decisions with minimal supervision and sound judgment unilaterally. Ability to perform sales research regarding convention/hospitality-related topics. Demonstrated success in organizing and planning events requiring attention to multiple details. Ability to work within assigned priorities and Center's rules, regulations, policies and procedures. Problem-solves, resolves issues, communicate with tact, and work with grace under pressure. Ability to work extended hours under varying work schedules and frequently meet rigid deadlines with little lead time. Ability to work a flexible schedule, including days, evenings, nights, weekends and holidays.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Ability to read instructions, directions, letters, memos and other written materials. Ability to converse orally and utilize standard telephones and two-way radios to receive and communicate information with staff and clients. Ability to walk 2.3 million square foot building.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing, Business Administration or a closely related field, or equivalent experience. 2-3 years of experience in sales, preferably in convention, exposition, or hotel industryJob Type: We aim to carry brands that are socially conscious, unique, and playful.Modern Mija is currently looking for Advertising, Marketing, Design or Communication Majors to intern for our store.This intern needs to be skilled in Social Media, Flat Lay Photography, Photoshop, Creative Writing, Design, etc.Preferred experience working as/with Shopify, Event Planning, Marketing, Advertising, Merchandising, Brand Ambassador, SEOThe ideal candidate will be a self starter, computer and technology savvy, takes initiative, works well with a team, innovative, creative, conceptual thinker, have strong design skills, be able to work varied internship hours (9-15) week, upbeat, playful, fun & stylish!Send resumes with link to your social media page(s) and a vision board to portray your personal style and interests! We want to see a sample of who you are and your design skills.Kansas City locals only please.Responsibilities- Utilizes social media to engage with a community of fans/followers online- Coordinates online marketing and advertising campaigns- Collaborates with internal departments on projects and assignments- Demonstrates interest in social media and how media and communication strategies can continuously engage the online community-Plans and executes flat lay photography shoots of merchandise to share on online sales and social media channels-Assist management with other store functions such as merchandising, fashion show and photoshoot planning, industry research on up and coming lines, influencers, etc.-Website maintenance-Liaison for brand ambassadors-Assist with SEO strategies and techniquesRequirements- Possesses skills in writing, presentation, interpersonal relations, and customer management - Performs well in environment that values creativity, flexibility, and variety- Exhibits personal qualities, such as open-mindedness, enthusiasm, and adaptability- Prefers challenges, fast pace, new ideas, future focus, and unstructured environment-Strong attention to detail and eye for designJob Type: InternshipJob Location:Kansas City, MORequired experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 year

Location US NY Tarrytown Country USA Function Marketing Company Overview Based in Waterford, New York, Momentive Performance Materials Inc. is a global leader in silicones, quartz and advanced materials, with a 70-year heritage of innovation and being first to market with performance applications that improve everyday life. Our solutions are found in products that touch nearly every facet of modern living and we work closely with some of the biggest brands in B2B and consumer worlds, covering a broad range of markets - from aerospace and automotive, to building and construction, personal care, and electronics. Momentive materials are found in products that touch nearly every facet of modern living. At Momentive, we believe that leadership begins with integrity, ethics and environmentally sound operations. When you work for Momentive, you are partnering with a company that is not only focused on delivering value but on doing it in a safe, ethical and environmentally responsible manner. Company Distinction This exciting opportunity is part of Momentive Performance Materials Inc. Position Overview Momentive Performance Materials is currently accepting applications for our 2017 Summer Internship Program! The 2017 Summer Internship Program is designed to expose students to the many facets of business and culture within Momentive. Interns will have the opportunity to work on project-based, real work assignments that directly align with their educational experiences. If you are seeking an internship in an innovative, challenging, and growing environment this opportunity may be for you!     The Personal Care Marketing Intern position will support the Specialty Fluids segment of Momentive Performance Materials‰Ûª Silicones business. This position requires laboratory support in the area of Personal and Home Care applications. The intern will work under the direction of an Application Development Engineer.   Job Responsibilities The Marketing Intern will be responsible for making laboratory scale personal and home care formulations containing Momentive products. The formulations will be assigned to the Intern by the supervising Application Development Engineer‰Ûªs or a person in personal care technical support team. The intern is expected to keep a laboratory notebook, which will include records of experimental procedures, observations, etc.  The Intern is also expected to comply with Momentive‰Ûªs Safety and EHS policies, which include attendance at the site Safety Meetings and Information meetings and participation in monthly lab safety walkthroughs.  In addition, the Intern will begin compiling a database of competitive materials for future formulation work within OSHA‰Ûªs GHS guidelines. A market research project related to a home care discipline may be asked of the summer intern, those details will be outlined but the supervising Application Development Engineer.   Minimum Qualifications Degree necessary or relevant: Undergraduate student studying chemistry or cosmetic chemistry.   Other We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, minority status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability or any characteristic protected by law. In order to be considered for this position candidates are required to submit an application for employment through our career site, be at least 18 years of age, willing to take a drug test and submit to a background investigation as part of the selection process. Candidates are required to have unrestricted authorization to work in the United States. If currently an employee of the Company, you must have current satisfactory work performance and in most cases, have been in your current role 18 months. And it‰Ûªs our people who make this all happen. We are thinkers, risk-takers and problem solvers, working together to constantly challenge the status quo. If you share our commitment to ingenuity, creativity and innovation, we want you to help us define our world of tomorrow.  Position located at Motorola HQ in Chicago, IL.  Team and Culture Description:  Motorola Mobility, LLC., represents the entire Mobile Business Group (MBG) under it‰Ûªs parent company, Lenovo.  North America is a focus market for the company and the NA Marketing team supports all smartphone sales efforts in the U.S. and Canada, along with promoting company brand and community initiatives.  The NA Marketing Partnership intern will be responsible primarily for partnership strategy and activation in the U.S.  Scope of Responsibilities:  -Identify partnership prospects in key markets that fit within Moto‰Ûªs partnership criteria (Target Demographic, Brand Awareness, Android software penetration, industry and relationship with Moto‰Ûªs other carrier and retail customers, etc.).  -Monitor prospect interests and evaluate opportunities to make recommendations for pursuing, based on company sales goals and brand objectives.    -Support the NA partnership team with event strategy and all executions.    -Update NA partnership team weekly with status of activation plans, including budget tracking, event asset management + production and execution process.  -Produce and distribute event briefs and materials timely (i.e. shipping product, coordinating installations, hosting conference calls).  -Participate in product and event training to ensure clear objectives and event operations to event stakeholders, i.e. corporate staff, field reps., brand ambassadors, etc.  -Work on-site to capture consumer data during the event and photos for recap purposes.    -Must have flexibility in schedule to work day and evening.  -Provide event recaps for internal discussion within 24 hrs of the event  -Organize all NA Marketing event assets (props, product displays, uniforms, etc.).  -Support other members of the NA Marketing team, as needed (i.e. digital media support, retail / carrier marketing, merchandising and training efforts).      Motorola Mobility is an equal opportunity employer. Job Opportunity Job title : Summer Internship - PR Function : Communication Requisition Type : Internship Professional experience : Entry level Parent Brand : MSLGROUP Global Brand : MSLGROUP Agency : MSL Boston Country : United States Location : Boston Job Description: MSLGROUP Boston is currently seeking smart, innovative and passionate interns to participate in our summer 2017 internship program (Waltham, MA office)! You‰Ûªll receive extensive experience in the world of communications, and will be involved in executing integrated campaigns across multiple communications channels. Our interns have the opportunity to work in a variety of practice areas and represent some of the world's most powerful brands within healthcare, technology, healthcare IT, security and financial technology industries.  MSLGROUP is a leading global communications organization. We are trusted advisors to some of the world‰Ûªs biggest brands, helping them creatively engage with their audiences 24/7.  We have a rich heritage: Parisian traditions on the one hand, American culture on the other and a dynamic and rapidly growing Asian voice. That means versatility and flexibility are core markers in our DNA. Our multicultural heritage means we're comfortable in our skin in a communications world where old structures are collapsing, boundaries are blurring and innovative thinking reigns supreme.  Our people are innovators. If you can look at problems in new ways and come up with the solutions nobody had considered before, we will offer you the environment, the space and the inspiration to do so. You‰Ûªll be working alongside leading thinkers, with colleagues from around the globe. If you want to be part of the conversations that are shaping the world we live and work in, you‰Ûªll want to be here.  Duration: 8-12 weeks (June 2017 ‰ÛÒ August 2017) Pay: This is a full-time, paid internship. Assignment: You will be assigned to work a variety of account teams and projects. You will also work with your fellow Insiders on a competitive project (completing a PR/integrated marketing program for one of our clients). Mentor: A mentor will be appointed to guide you throughout the summer.  Sample of Daily Responsibilities: ‰Û¢ Daily monitoring of media for news and information about our clients. ‰Û¢ Development of media lists. ‰Û¢ Writing press releases, blogs, plans, fact sheets, pitch letters, case studies. ‰Û¢ Participating in brainstorming, office activities, staff meetings and client meetings as well as ensuring overall client satisfaction. ‰Û¢ Researching and assisting with program and presentation development for existing clients and new prospects. ‰Û¢ Participating in social networking for clients and follow influential bloggers/writers. ‰Û¢ Executing tactical elements of client programs from start to finish. ‰Û¢ Executing PR plans and tactical digital elements from start to finish. ‰Û¢ Social media community management, content creation, scheduling and strategy. ‰Û¢ Creation and execution of digital advertising plans across multiple platforms. ‰Û¢ Analysis and reporting from Google Analytics, Google AdWords and social media monitoring tools.  Additional Information:  Criteria for Applicants: ‰Û¢ Completed their junior year (rising seniors) or a recent graduate (December 2016 ‰ÛÒ May 2017) of undergraduate college. ‰Û¢ Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher. ‰Û¢ Solid media relations and excellent writing skills. ‰Û¢ Great attention to detail, enthusiasm, organization, and desire to be a team player. ‰Û¢ Creative thinker that is paying attention to what other brands and industries are doing. ‰Û¢ Creative storytelling capabilities. ‰Û¢ Proactive in following through with deadlines for media and clients. ‰Û¢ Works well in a team environment. ‰Û¢ A strong understanding of the relationship between traditional public relations and the use of current online/digital technology and social media. ‰Û¢ Baseline understanding of SEO, social media strategy and digital advertising; Excellent writing skills  About Us: MSLGROUP is Publicis Groupe‰Ûªs strategic communications and engagement group, advisors in all aspects of communication strategy: from consumer PR to financial communications, from public affairs to reputation management and from crisis communications to experiential marketing and events. With more than 3,500 people across close to 100 offices worldwide, MSLGROUP is also the largest PR network in Europe, fast-growing China and India. The group offers strategic planning and counsel, insight-guided thinking and big, compelling ideas ‰ÛÒ followed by thorough execution. www.mslgroup.com | Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn | YouTube | Slideshare | Pinterest   MSLGROUP is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. Munchkin Inc.Internship Program Graphic Design InternMunchkin is a fast-growing, industry-leading infant and toddler consumer products-company with 7 global offices generating over $300 million in annual sales. We are passionate, creative, believe in only making the best products, and we’re looking for team members who think big, move fast, work smart, and have a desire to do things better. We pride ourselves in hiring great people with the talent it takes to keep up with our growth. We invite you to explore the “About” page on our Website and help us rid the world of all things mundane!Internship ProgramMunchkin, Inc. is offering a challenging full-time paid internship for a stand-out student currently enrolled in a Graphic Design studies program. The objectives of the internship program are to:Provide talented students with challenging, real-world graphic design experience at an entrepreneurial, quickly growing companyAttract high caliber full-time employees to Munchkin from the intern classThe length of the internship is typically 10 weeks, and start and ending dates will be determined prior to the beginning of the internship by the department head and the intern. There are established standard pay rates for interns.Position SummaryReporting to an Art Director, this is a unique opportunity to receive project-based work that requires strategy, teamwork, ingenuity, and creativity, as well as tactical responsibilities that expose the intern first-hand to the experiences of a full-time Graphic Design professional at Munchkin Inc.Assist Brand Design Department in generating concepts, problem solving and design of new and current packaging, various marketing and sales materials.Work on all aspects of packaging including graphic layout, packaging structure concept, logo design, typography, print production and photography (including photo retouching and assisting at photo shoots).Work with Munchkin Branding Style Guide.QualificationsStrong typographyStrong conceptual skillsExperience with packaging design is a plusExceptional interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with people of all levels and in a team environmentExcellent verbal and written communication skillsMust be able to determine solutions, make sound judgments and carry out actions in an effective manner.Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects and prioritize work without missing critical deadlines.Strong presentation skills.Strong knowledge Adobe CS 6,Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign on Mac PlatformEducationQualified candidates will be actively enrolled and working towards a degree in Graphic Design and will have completed a minimum 2 years of undergraduate study at an accredited university.To ApplyIf you are interested in joining our team, please visit www.munchkin.com for more information and submit your resume https://cw.na1.hgncloud.com/munchkin/searchJobPostings.do.We regularly hold social functions to foster a genuine camaraderie that enhances teamwork. At company-wide award functions, we take time to recognize the talent and dedication of the people who make Munchkin such a standout place. Check out our website at www.munchkin.com for more information and open positions in the career section.Munchkin is an equal opportunity employer.Job Type: Internship

About MyCity Social:MyCity Social is a great place to advance your career. We've been in business for about 10 years and operate out of three offices in Florida. Starting as a magazine publishing company, we understand that all small businesses need a digital footprint that includes social media, newsletters, updated websites, blogs, SEO, etc. We strive to provide a work environment where each employee is looked at as a partner and not a number. We are now looking for an outstanding digital marketing intern to join our team and be part of our growing company.COMPENSATION :- Internship (non-paid)- Possible hire after internship (all interns that do a great job are hired)QUALIFICATIONS:Must be an active student from an accredited university who is majoring in Marketing, Public Relations, Communications or Advertising. This person should have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with extensive knowledge of Web and social media. PowerPoint, Word and Excel experience is a bonus and will be considered when choosing the best applicant for this internship position.RESPONSIBILITIES:The intern will learn by assisting a digital marketing expert that is active in the following projects: -Working with mentors to create ideas and strategies-Developing marketing strategies-Using CRMTo apply, please e-mail your resume to Indeed and we will respond to qualified applications.Job Type: InternshipRequired experience:Social Media: 1 yearSocial Media Marketing: 1 year

You are not signed in. | My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Advanced Search | Return to the home page Printable Format   Job Description  Internship - Marketing-24972 Description  Join National Heritage Academies (NHA) as a marketing intern for a summer opportunity. The available position will report directly to the marketing manager and will be responsible for speaking with potential parents and helping them to apply their child to our K-8th grade NHA schools as well as our 9th-12th grade PrepNet Schools. While working with the digital marketing team, there will also be opportunities to learn more about different markets and how to taylor your approach to each market we serve.   About Us NHA is a charter school management company that operates 80+ schools in 9 states. We are committed to our mission of ‰ÛÏchallenging each child to achieve‰Û_‰Û and we pride ourselves on our students‰Ûª ability to achieve high results in later education based on the foundations gained in grades K-8 at NHA.  In this role you will work out of our corporate headquarters (Service Center) located in Grand Rapids, Michigan. The NHA Service Center is where all the behind-the-scenes magic happens. Our 350 brilliant team members are brag-worthy. With a diverse group of departments like admissions, talent acquisition, facilities, legal services, and many more working together to provide top level back-office support. The Service Center is a place of bright colors, smiling faces, and opportunity. We like to gather for events such as the fall crocktoberfest cook-off, the sparkling Christmas party full of fun and unexplainable excitement, and our annual 5K Service Center fun run.  In This Role You will make an impact Gain valuable hands on experience Be paid  Your Role Making calls to families on waiting list; making attempts to get them to apply to another nearby options Working on projects that help the MA Team more effective. Examples of projects we will work on are: Data management: figuring out best time to call, conversion tracking, new process effectiveness. Also,Before/After Care PDF Project: Creating an information sheet to add to school websites to provide families with information on offerings Tour Scheduling: Scheduling applied families for tours with Admissions Representatives Screening/Appointment Setting for MA‰Ûªs: checking for interest before MA‰Ûªs call to do application    Requirements Enrolled in a Marketing/Communications degree program Experience with Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Microsoft Dynamics preferred Ability to multitask and absorb information quickly Familiar with social media strategies and platforms Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to adapt and talk to people from different backgrounds/segments   To learn more about our core values, please click here.  National Heritage Academies is an equal opportunity employer.   Job Individual Contributor Primary LocationMI-Grand Rapids-NHA Service Center Organization NHA Service Center Schedule Part-time Unposting Date Ongoing Public Referral Bonus  Recruiter BREE STINSON Refer a friend for this job Tell us about a friend who might be interested in this job. All privacy rights will be protected. Refer a friend

Job DescriptionA fast-growing internet marketing company is looking to add an energetic, team-oriented intern to our brand marketing group. The ideal candidate has strong communication skills and is interested in working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. This is a great chance to build real-world skills on the job, and learn about internet marketing in one of today’s most exciting industries. This is a paid internship, requiring a commitment to work 20 hours a week. We are looking for someone to start immediately and work in-office (sorry, not a remote position).Your RoleThe marketing communications intern role will include some or all of the following functions, but may not be limited to these.Support the brand marketing manager with writing tasks as neededPerform research for content marketing programs and topicsAssist with writing updated website contentAssist with developing ebooksUpdate schedules and calendars as neededHelp develop and write new blog postsAssist with editing and proofing of various projectsAssist with some social media ads or posts as neededAssist with writing and/or researching case studiesRequirementsBasic Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel; PowerPoint and Adobe Suite are a “plus”)Basic understanding of SEO and digital marketing helpfulVery strong writer with desire to further develop current skill levelMust be a good proofreaderClose attention to detailQuick learner and able to adapt to changing prioritiesComfortable with social media platforms including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, PinterestFlexible, able to multi-task and keep organizedPositive upbeat attitudeIf you’re ready to learn about marketing communications in a professional, dynamic team environment, and you have a desire to make a contribution while you learn, this is a great opportunity to take a step forward.Please respond to this job posting with a cover letter, resume, and 2-3 writing samples. Tell us a bit about yourself, be creative!Job Type: Part-timeSalary: $12.00 /hourJob Location:Westlake Village, CA 91361Required education:AssociateRequired experience:Marketing-related or writing: 1 year

ABOUT US SOLUTIONS CASE STUDIES RESOURCES BLOG Free Consultation Join the New Breed Team Inbound Marketing Intern We‰Ûªre in search of a college student or recent college grad to join our team as an Inbound Marketing Intern. We want someone with a strong drive to GSD and contribute to our growth. Our best interns don‰Ûªt consider themselves interns at all - they‰Ûªre members of our team. We‰Ûªre looking for someone who is prepared to take on serious responsibilities and get hands-on experience learning the ins-and-outs of a high-growth company.   In this role, you will be responsible for learning how to deliver high quality inbound deliverables (KPIs, website and blog analytics, reporting, campaigns) to address our customers‰Ûª business challenges and marketing objectives. In this role, you will: Aid in the coordination of inbound campaigns and strategies Learn inbound best practices, with the strategic intent of delivering high quality inbound assets Help to identify customer‰Ûªs business objectives, challenges, and key success metrics Work with Inbound Marketing Strategist to provide recommendations based on marketing analytics and inbound assessment to address key business and marketing challenges Work with Inbound Marketing Strategist to develop inbound performance reports to analyze and monitor inbound strategy effectiveness Work with Inbound Marketing Strategist to perform portal audits to identify areas of opportunity Work company wide to provide continuing assistance with inbound marketing activities Project coordinate to ensure scope and budget are met Be responsible for creating project schedules, coordinating deliverables, and facilitating resources for your portfolio of B2B technology companies. Learn how to develop lasting relationships with retainer customers to ensure ongoing service Serve as a brand enthusiast for New Breed suite of products and solutions  You need to: Have quantitative skills and ability to communicate digestible user stories Have the interest in learning current inbound marketing and sales strategies, best practices, and associated resources Have an innate, scrappy and entrepreneurial drive to GSD in a fast moving startup environment where things can change quickly Have self motivation, self awareness, self discipline, self improvement, use good judgment, positive energy, willingness to help others Have the ability to adapt and create proactive change Identify optimal process efficiencies Align with New Breed‰Ûªs Culture Code Have a 3.0 GPA and above Have the availability to work for a minimum of 20 hours a week. Full-time availability is desired. Please specify availability within your cover letter You should have: A love for Marketing and a drive to learn more The interest to write and blog Researched inbound marketing on your own, and you get it An analytical mind and have a thing for numbers Ambition and the desire to work hard Street smarts Emotional intelligence Thrive in a fast paced, cross functional environment Strong listening skills Tons of energy, passion, humor, compassion, and enthusiasm Superior communication skills and presentation skills Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills Pluses: Experience in Marketing Software Your own blog First Name Last Name Email* Phone Number Sample Work Upload Cover Letter (PDF) Upload Your Resume (PDF) Other Thoughts You'd Like to Share Other comments such as expertise /past client work, or really anything else you would like us to know! ‰ÛÏ To see this group of people who are insanely driven and thriving in a company where they can have autonomy to solve for the customer, is an inspiration.‰Û VIEW OUR CULTURE CODE >> Browse All of Our Open Positions If this role isn't for you, take a look at our other open positions to find one that better suits your skillset. You are organized, detailed, and service oriented. You do well in a fun team environment and want to be part of a winning team....Come have it all! We believe in promoting from within, and hire intelligence and ambition over experience and long resumes. Our office is fun and flexible. It's young and vibrant. Imagine whiteboards on walls, ESPN playing in background, Twizzlers and peanut butter pretzels on demand. Company branded hoodies are the norm, and neck ties hardly exist. We celebrate holidays in the office and make generous time for our friends and family. Thanksgiving potluck office dinners, followed by extra days off to celebrate with family. Fun Holiday decorating, followed by a full week off to celebrate with family in December. All of that said, we do get real work done too and are really winning.The Communications Intern will be responsible for supporting the development and execution of strategic marketing initiatives on behalf of New Home Star under the direction of the Marketing Manager. Tasks will include:Proofreading various communication assetsSocial media content creation and schedulingEmail campaign composition and set-upOptimized blog content creation, editing, and uploadingOperational support tasks as assignedIf the above sounds like you, and you’re ready to join a team of hard-working, hard-playing young professionals in creating something truly special, we want to hear from you!Job Type: Internship

Marketing and Sales Interns will assist with promotion events, community events, group initiatives, game days, and other duties as assigned. Lizard‰Ûªs internships are part-time and allow students the opportunity to gain valuable work experience within a professional sports organization through hands on experience. The Lizards accept applications from students presently enrolled in a college program. Internships are unpaid and students are REQUIRED to receive college credit. All interns, regardless of department, are expected to assist with general office duties as needed such as answering telephones, filing, mailing prizes to fans, etc. A successful applicant will demonstrate strong organizational skills along with initiative, resourcefulness, and an ability to collaborate with fellow team members for the achievement of department goals. Noom Inc., a leader in mobile health coaching, combines the power of technology with the empathy of real human coaches to deliver successful behavior change at scale. Our mobile applications cover chronic/pre-chronic disease (diabetes, hypertension, and obesity to name a few), reaching more than 45 million users worldwide, and transforming millions of lives. The Growth Hacking team is at the forefront of this mission, tackling one of the hardest challenges in healthcare today: getting people to take that initial (and biggest!) step towards living a healthier lifestyle. This is where you come in.The growth engineer we are seeking will be a marketing and engineering hybrid. You will be working directly with our cofounder to understand how consumers discover and adopt our products, and will be translating ideas and mock-ups into code that works. Your code will directly impact how we increase user conversion every step of the way, moving the needle on acquisition, engagement and retention metrics. You will be working with a highly cross-functional team that covers engineering, content and digital marketing, UX/UI testing, and data analysis, and learn the approaches used by the best tech companies to grow their business by 10x and beyond.The growth team moves very quickly, and you’ll be exposed to new challenges on a daily basis. This is an ideal role for someone who has either started in marketing and evolved into tech or vice versa, and you will have the opportunity to build your skills in both.What We’re Looking For:* A hacker mindset and a passion for working with numbers and data * Previous experience in a technical role, whether as an intern or full-time employee * Experience with, and interest in, Javascript, Python, SQL, HTML5, CSS * Good communicator: comfortable explaining technical problems in-person and in-writing * A team player: you enjoy collaboration, and teaching people new concepts * Sense of responsibility and ownership over your work * Willingness to learn a lot of new technical and growth concepts quickly
