Our mobile applications cover chronic/pre-chronic disease (diabetes, hypertension, and obesity to name a few), reaching more than 45 million users worldwide, and transforming millions of lives. The Growth Hacking team is at the forefront of this mission, tackling one of the hardest challenges in healthcare today: getting people to take that initial (and biggest!) step towards living a healthier lifestyle. This is where you come in.The growth engineer we are seeking will be a marketing and engineering hybrid. You will be working directly with our cofounder to understand how consumers discover and adopt our products, and will be translating ideas and mock-ups into code that works. Your code will directly impact how we increase user conversion every step of the way, moving the needle on acquisition, engagement and retention metrics. You will be working with a highly cross-functional team that covers engineering, content and digital marketing, UX/UI testing, and data analysis, and learn the approaches used by the best tech companies to grow their business by 10x and beyond.The growth team moves very quickly, and you’ll be exposed to new challenges on a daily basis. This is an ideal role for someone who has either started in marketing and evolved into tech or vice versa, and you will have the opportunity to build your skills in both.What We’re Looking For:* A hacker mindset and a passion for working with numbers and data * Previous experience in a technical role, whether as an intern or full-time employee * Experience with, and interest in, Javascript, Python, SQL, HTML5, CSS * Good communicator: comfortable explaining technical problems in-person and in-writing * A team player: you enjoy collaboration, and teaching people new concepts * Sense of responsibility and ownership over your work * Willingness to learn a lot of new technical and growth concepts quickly

Job SummaryThe Supplier Development Engineer is responsible for driving exceptional supplier performance thus creating a world-class supply base that exceeds expectations for the business group and the global Supply Chain team. Specific focus will be supplier analysis, development activities, production support, part qualifications, improvement activities, corrective actions, project management and new product introductions to ensure component parts and assemblies are consistently manufactured in total compliance to specified requirements. Simultaneously and in conjunction with the Supply Chain Group, this position will support the balanced improvement of quality, cost and service, all while operating within Nordson's Lean manufacturing principles.Essential Job Duties and ResponsibilitiesDevelop the supplier's ability to support Nordson's Lean Six Sigma manufacturing principles and problem avoidance processes through the use of best in class quality, delivery and lead-time performance processes.Lead & project manage cross functional teams domestically and internationally for key supply chain initiatives.Drive a systematic problem solving, process improvement, and value enhancement approach utilizing Lean Six Sigma (DMAIC) principles in collaboration with suppliers & Nordson.Assure supplier's corrective and preventive action plans are developed and executed in compliance with Nordson 8D expectations. Report on the status of corrective actions, as required, to manufacturing, business group and executive management.Perform supplier QMS on-site assessments and assistance visits for supplier selection, to improve supplier performance, and achieve Nordson's balanced improvement objectives.Develop and implement (APQP) Advanced Product Quality Planning (i.e. PPAP, PFMEA, Process Flow, Control Plan) for new and existing purchase parts.Support and coordinate the new product activities and direction to optimize the transition from new product development to production.Function as a technical liaison between suppliers, engineering, SCM group, business group, and manufacturing sites, to resolve supplier related issues.Track the supplier's performance indicators, based on their scorecards and rankings, to facilitate and develop the supply base's ability to consistently meet or exceed our defined expectations.Support and utilize the Supply Chain activities and direction on supplier development, risk management, reduction and consolidation.Provide direction to receiving inspection including procurement of tools to enhance measurement capability.Other duties as assigned.Education and Experience RequirementsBachelor's degree in Engineering or other technical related field required.Six Sigma Black Belt certification preferred.Minimum 5-10 years of experience in quality engineering, related engineering field, or supply chain required.Skills and AbilitiesExperience with Lean Manufacturing in a production environment, working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma processes & tools; ASQ certification preferred.Able to work in a multinational and multicultural environment.High level of audit and problem solving skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively at any level.Ability to work in a fast paced environment with competing priorities; ability to multi-task.Coaching/Training experience beneficial.Working Conditions and Physical DemandsOffice environment. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Travel RequiredEstimated 20-35% Domestic & InternationalNordson Corporation provides equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees. No person is to be discriminated against in any aspect of the employment relationship due to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment drug screening and background/criminal check, consistent with applicable laws.

Due to the nature of our business, candidates must be over 21 years of age to apply.To apply please include a cover letter, resume, and three references who can substantiate your work ethic or design abilities. Materials must be received by Monday, March 20, 2017.  Applicants invited for interview will be asked to bring a portfolio of their design work. Summer Intern, Integrated Marketing New York, NYFull-time Company Description OppenheimerFunds values the talented and diverse workforce we‰Ûªve cultivated over the years. Our nearly 60-year history includes a strong tradition of providing innovative investment ideas and a world-class experience for the individuals, institutions and financial advisors we serve. Our strong foundation is built on collaboration, creativity, and the extraordinary people who play an integral role in our success every day. Job Description The Client Insights team within the OppenheimerFunds Marketing organization plays an integral role providing critical client insights and marketing effectiveness measurement. The intern should expect to receive significant exposure and hands-on, practical experience working with a multi-channel integrated marketing team and brand and advertising team, participating in the development of new research-driven marketing collateral, data gathering and research to inform marketing strategy and data gathering, analysis and presentation of marketing campaign results data. RESPONSIBILITIES & DELIVERABLES This position will help conduct primary research within various client segments, evaluate internal and external data sources to enhance marketing effectiveness measurement, and gather secondary competitor research and marketing insights. The ideal candidate would possess a passion for marketing and research and ability to work on several projects simultaneously. This individual will have a broad exposure in the organization, so s/he must be comfortable working across business areas, both within and outside of the Marketing team. Support Marketing Client Insights team throughout all phases of the research project cycle: project scoping, questionnaire development, survey fielding and data collection, data analysis and reporting Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop actionable research projects that will answer key marketing questions and inform marketing collateral and thought leadership development Develop working relationships with external research partners Catalogue standard industry research tapped for marketing plans on the broad market place or specific areas of interest to the business Help with refinement and automation of marketing and advertising impact reporting Review and consolidation of internal marketing material web properties Help with integrating editorial and channel reporting Help develop research-driven marketing content/copy   Qualifications To be considered for an internship, students must be undergraduates entering their senior year or currently pursuing a graduate level degree.  Education curriculum should include a combination of courses in marketing, statistics, communications, social science, market research Highly proficient with MS Excel and comfortable analyzing various types of data; experience with statistical software (R, SPSS) a big plus Proficiency in other MS Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, etc.) Basic knowledge of market research methodologies, experience conducting research a plus Ability to turn data-based findings into actionable insights and create a coherent story Detail orientated with excellent oral and written skills Highly motivated and desire to learn about Marketing and Research Professional demeanor and ability to interface effectively with internal and external partners Ability to multi-task and work on several projects at once Curiosity and deep desire to learn Additional Information We are a dynamic firm that values teamwork and collaboration, and true to our history, we encourage independent thinking and provide ample opportunities for our people to stand out and make a difference. With offices in New York, Denver, Rochester and Dallas, we work hard to turn our unconventional wisdom into value for investors and pursue excellent results for ourselves and our firm. Learn more about the culture and opportunities at OppenheimerFunds here: https://careers.oppenheimerfunds.com OppenheimerFunds and its subsidiaries and affiliates provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to age, color, disability, gender, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, physical or mental disability, genetic predisposition or carrier status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law in all employment functions including recruitment, evaluation, selection, promotion, compensation, benefits, training, and termination of employment. Note that this posting is intended for individual applicants. As a result, we are looking for dynamic, results driven Sales Interns to help drive our business and image going forward. As a Sales intern at Stryker, you will:  ‰Û¢ Put the customer first, and gain valuable experience as a result ‰Û¢ Gain exposure to multiple product lines and marketing functions ‰Û¢ Be part of one of Fortune Magazine‰Ûªs Top 100 companies to work for ‰Û¢ Implement new ideas, be constantly challenged, and develop your skills  Sales Interns will have an exciting opportunity to complete projects for various teams within the Sales department. RE YOU READY TO WORK AT OWNERS.COM?Are you interested in joining a progressive and growing our marketing initiatives?Are you looking for a career in a department that treats you like an adult but lets you have fun like a kid?Would you like to work at one of the fastest growing companies in the country?If so, nice to meet you; We are Owners.com! We are looking for a Marketing Intern who wants to launch their career in corporate marketing with a cutting edge online disruptor in the growing real estate field.We have both spring and summer internships available.If you are a person who likes to say “I can’t do that” or “that’s not my job” – then you can stop reading. We are looking for a top-performing, people-focused individuals to exceed our expectations.WHAT YOU GET TO DOLots of writing - compile information and submit information to nominate us for awards across a variety of categoriesWriting content about real estate to help drive traffic to our websiteWork independently to find ways to spread the word about what we're doing and nominate us for awardsWork with marketing teams to develop social campaigns, schedules, strategies and contentManage technology systems for job distribution, email and other marketing initiativesWHAT ABOUT YOU?No experience necessary and ANY major is okay (THIS AN INTERNSHIP)You have some foundational knowledge of marketing, public relations or social media - lots of ways to learn this before you get to usYou are exceptionally creative and technology savvyYou have a sense of urgency and endless amounts of energyYou have a passion for finding better solutions - our team is empowered to make things amazing!You have exceptional intelligence and people skills - the magic combo!WORKING AT OWNERS.COM ADVANTAGES:$8-10/ hour for 20-40 hours per weekSpring or Summer SemesterFree snacks, and coffee!Lots of employee engagement activities (differs by location but examples include family baseball games, happy hour, bowling, trips to the zoo and other fun team-building activities)Opportunities to join our community service initiatives, including Habitat for HumanityEmployee Discounts on movie tickets, Verizon cell phone service, Microsoft Office, and more!OUR CORE VALUESFor our employees, customers, and shareholders, we commit to…Act With Integrity – exhibit unwavering integrity, compliance and ethical conduct at all timesEnergize People – enable exceptional people to energize their teams and drive resultsEmpower Innovation – reward the relentless creation of innovative and compliant solutions and generate value for our customersExceed Customer Expectations – execute world-class solutions to deliver value and delight our customersWin as a Team – embrace the passion, and power of our global teams to win as “One-Altisource”Enrich Communities – create positive impacts for the communities where we live and serveAre you up to the challenge? What are you waiting for? Apply today!Job Type: InternshipSalary: $8.00 to $10.00 /hour

Paladin is searching for a Copywriter for our client, a Fortune 500 Financial Services organization. We’re looking for someone who can write headlines and clear, straightforward copy. We are seeking a User Experience Architect (UXA) in Austin, Texas.Brief Description of the RoleThe User Experience Architect (UXA) is responsible for delivering human-centered design thinking services focused on the complexities of customer activities within the financial services industry. UXAs work alongside other agency creatives, developers, content strategists, QA professionals, and project managers to provide unique solutions. In their daily work, UXAs provide a balance of the following: consultation, design ideation, task analysis, research analysis, site mapping, web metrics analysis, specification, user testing, wireframing, storyboarding, sketching, flow modeling, digital prototyping, and presentation delivery.As part of the UX team, the UXA is one of the company’s primary advocates for user needs. This specifically includes improving wayfinding, easing comprehension, and designing provisions to help customers take action. The UXA is most involved at the outset of a project—as user needs and business requirements are being analyzed and defined—but also plays a consultative role throughout, validating the execution of design plans, advocating for consistency, and helping set the stage for new customer experiences. The culmination of UX skills expected for this role will deliver recommendations grounded in evidence-based findings and applied psychology.The ideal candidate will have an understanding of human-centered design and Lean UX, which allows them to determine which deliverables within a given project are required to achieve a successful outcome.Qualifications We place a premium on:Work samples that show evidence of design problem solving, UX strategy, and modeling of user needsExperience collaborating with internal partners and/or third-party vendors to gather data and ensure the feasibility of work (considering technology, platforms, and infrastructure constraints)Experience reviewing website analytics, setting up remote testing studies, observing and/or reviewing third-party qualitative findings, and applying them to improve user engagement and conversionAbility to interpret and synthesize research findings for project teams and leadershipFinancial institution or similar vertical subject matter expertiseBackground and essential skills:BA/BFA in a related field1+ years as a UX Architect or a related role, such as a UX Specialist, Design Researcher, Human Factors Specialist, or Human-Computer Interaction SpecialistProven ability to collaborate across disciplines, synthesize multichannel feedback, and present work effectively to clientsPassion for refining and sharing subject matter expertise, knowledge, and best practices across teams and channelsExperience working within a diversely skilled agency or research or marketing services environment where coordination between roles is imperativeNice to have:Ability to collaborate with business partners in the effective use of web analytics and user analysis to improve the user experienceUnderstanding of testing methodologies and toolsUnderstanding of information taxonomy, wayfinding SEO, and methods to improve web performance and content authorityExperience working within the constraints of content management systems, analytics systems, and tag management systems

column21: Panasonic Automotive Systems Company of America
column23: Panasonic Automotive Systems OUR TEAMS ABOUT US CAREERS BLOG SIGN IN Submit your information for this opportunity Apply Now                                          Marketing Intern About Us:   Panasonic Automotive Systems Company of America (PASA) is a global supplier to Automotive Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM's) around the world.  Our clients include Ford, GM, Chrysler, Daimler, Fiat, Tesla, Honda, Toyota, Nissan and many others.  In serving our customers, we don't just strive to put tomorrow's technology on the road ‰ÛÒ we pride ourselves on recruiting the brightest and best to do it. If you possess that rare combination of vision and passion, joining our team is probably the closest you'll ever get to a dream come true. Get a peek inside life at Panasonic and learn more about the city where Panasonic Automotive is headquartered.   Are you an innovator that strives to do things differently?   Panasonic Automotive is looking for undergraduate students excited about innovating cutting-edge technology and who like to see their projects come to life in the real world. We are looking for students to assist our Marketing and Commuications Department of Panasonic Automotive in a variety of challenging assignments.     Job Responsibilities May Include:   Coordinate, craft and deploy employee communications Assist in the coordination of customer technology events (e.g. gather/ship products, communicate and manage product/specialist schedules and logistics, etc.) Update event calendars and planning documents for monthly Managers' Meetings and provide weekly department updates on upcoming events/activities Develop ideas for brand content that will enhance customer awareness and opinion of the brand; content specific to website, social, sales presentations, etc.  Review and refresh customer sales presentations as needed Draft external communications announcements including executive messaging for media engagement (e.g. press release, social media posts, etc.) Scan global media database for relevant Panasonic and competitive news; weekly report out to Marketing & Communications department  Qualifications: Required Experience:   Must be a Junior and above pursuing a 4-year degree in Marketing or a related field Must meet the university's requirements for participating in the co-op/internship program Must be enrolled as a student during the semester in which the co-op/internship will occur Computer proficiency in various social media and MS Office applications Bilingual in Japanese/English preferred Must have a thirst for knowledge and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment Ability to work independently and as part of a team Strong organizational skills with an ability to prioritize time sensitive assignments Excellent written and verbal communications skills Interest in the automotive industry is a plus   Positions are available for students to work at our Farmington Hills, MI location.   Panasonic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.  Pre-employment drug testing is required. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Automotive Systems of America.   Location/Division: Panasonic Automotive Systems Corporation of America, 37101 Corporate Dr, Farmington Hills, MI 48331, USA Job Requisition: 1600336 Share Opportunity: Share link: http://careers.panasonic-automotive.com/careers/position/marketing-intern SHARE ON: å© 2017 Panasonic. All Rights Reserved. Powered by Ascendify. Panasonic endeavors to make Panasonic Career Center accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact: pasajobs@us.panasonic.com.

Consumer Insights Intern ROAD CREW SUMMER INTERNSHIP | NEW YORK, NY, UNITED STATES   At Pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. People‰ÛÓthe listeners, the artists, and our employees‰ÛÓare at the center of our mission and everything we do. Actually, employees at Pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. Collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we‰Ûªre looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. Be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. Discover your future at Pandora. The Intern will support the Pandora advertising sales team by providing analysis on behavioral and attitudinal trends; not just in the music industry, but also in the major advertising categories we play in. They should have a firm understanding of survey techniques and be comfortable reading and manipulating data.  They should be gifted at interpreting information into digestible insights for audiences of various data-comprehension levels, and communicating findings clearly and concisely.   What‰Ûªs in it for you: Get to know new research methodologies and their applications to business Experience managing an in-house research panel of 50,000 listeners, and speak to them on a weekly basis Training in a myriad of 3rd party data sources, including Nielsen, comScore, eMarketer, U.S. Census data, and other data resources Design and project manage primary research from start to finish (stakeholder kick-off, survey design, distribution, data extraction and analysis, debrief and presentation) Work with various departments (Marketing, Strategy, Sales, Business Development) and understand their functions Get exposure to other research and data functions, including ‰ÛÏbig data‰Û Analytics, Advertising Effectiveness, Measurement and Reporting Understand how research can be an effective tool in business cases and pitches, both internally and externally  To land this gig, you will need: Currently enrolled student majoring in Business, Marketing, Statistics, Economics, Sociology, or Psychology Strong Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint) Experience with syndicated research tools (Nielsen, comScore) a plus Experience with data analysis software (SPSS, Q) or experience with querying languages a plus The ability to craft a story with data Must love music! NYC or LA (Santa Monica) based  Pandora is committed to diversity in its workforce. Pandora is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status. Women and people of color are encouraged to apply. Pandora is also a VEVRAA federal contractor. Pandora requests priority referrals of protected veterans from each ESDS, as required by regulation. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to disability@pandora.com.

En EspaÌ±ol Payment Locations Help Sign in Marketing Intern We are searching for a creative thinker with an analytical, ‰ÛÏget it done‰Û attitude to join our fast-paced B2B marketing team as B2B Marketing Intern. In this role, you will manage projects from concept to execution and coordinate administrative functions in the planning and execution of marketing strategies. As a marketing intern, your work will touch upon a variety of functions, from market research and creative planning, to advertising and event promotions across multiple channels. Through the duration of your internship, you will be exposed to current marketing trends and tactics in the fintech industry. You will have the opportunity to see your results in action through our various marketing campaigns. Job Description: ‰Û¢ Perform market analysis and competitive research ‰Û¢ Assist in developing and executing marketing campaigns (e.g. social media, digital ads, email, web) ‰Û¢ Manage the organization and execution of marketing events and tradeshows under direction ‰Û¢ Conduct research on buyer personas and customer journey ‰Û¢ Support the marketing team in daily administrative tasks ‰Û¢ Manage and update company database and customer relationship management systems (CRM) Requirements: ‰Û¢ Current enrollment in college, preferably a rising Junior or Senior ‰Û¢ Proactive thinker, passion for marketing and strong desire to learn ‰Û¢ Good understanding of different marketing techniques ‰Û¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills ‰Û¢ Excellent knowledge of MS Office ‰Û¢ Familiarity with marketing computer software and online applications (e.g. CRM tools, Online analytics) ‰Û¢ Passion for the B2B marketing industry and its best practices ‰Û¢ Proficiency and interest in social media content generation: Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook Perks and Incentives: ‰Û¢ Competitive salary ‰Û¢ Catered lunches and fully stocked kitchen ‰Û¢ Flexible work schedule (work from home on specific days of the week) ‰Û¢ Fun, collaborative, vibrant culture ‰Û¢ Frequent interaction with our executive team ‰Û¢ Ping pong challenges & Basketball Wednesdays More about the Company: www.paynearme.com We‰Ûªre Thinkers, Makers and Imagineers And we are reimagining how cash is used in the digital economy and making people‰Ûªs lives simpler in the process. Join us as we‰Ûªre building an exciting company and delivering services that impact people‰Ûªs lives. The PayNearMe family is led by a team of experts from the payments, mobile and retail IT worlds. We exist to build affordably-priced, innovative products that make it easier for consumers to conduct financial transactions and for businesses to serve those consumers. PayNearMe began in 2009 with the goal of giving cash users the same convenience that debit and credit card users enjoy when paying bills and making online purchases. Today, we offer a network of 30,000 retail locations such as 7-Eleven and Family Dollar, where consumers can make cash payments for everything from utilities and child support payments to bike share membership. If this position fits your skills and background, send your resume to jobs@paynearme.com and let us know why you can make a difference. Intern will support the presentation of consistent visual branding and style.ResponsibilitiesAssist in the design, layout, and preparation of key materials to support the PCAOB missionHelp to produce shareable content for print and digital useBrainstorm on how to visualize complex auditing concepts and issuesConduct research and analysis of design and style ideasDraft and update Board communication materials and databases, requiring strong organizational skills and attention to detailRequirementsQualificationsUndergraduate (junior or senior level) or graduate student, studying graphic arts  Proficient in social media platformsStrong written and oral communication skillsProficient in Microsoft Office suite, including PowerPoint and Word, Adobe Creative Suite, including InDesign and Photoshop, and Microsoft OfficeProofreading and copyediting skills highly desirableMust be a person of unquestionable integrityMust be reliable and self-motivatedMust be energetic, bright, and enthusiasticMust be organized and meet deadlinesMust work as a team memberMust be flexible and solve problems independentlyOur ValuesThe PCAOB encourages a spirit of cooperation and teamwork, and fosters an environment of professional growth where employees can exercise their leadership ability, creativity, technical competence, and public interest focus in helping the PCAOB fulfill its mission.Our MissionThe PCAOB is a nonprofit corporation established by Congress to oversee the audits of public companies in order to protect the interests of investors and further the public interest in the preparation of informative, accurate and independent audit reports. Nonprofit Management Internship (fundraising, communications, volunteer coordination, and more)Through this eight week, part-time internship at Peninsula Family Service, you will gain hands-on experience in all the behind-the-scenes aspects of running a nonprofit. You'll learn about fundraising, marketing, grant writing, and coordinating volunteers. If you're a self-starter who's interested in a career in the nonprofit field and passionate about breaking the cycle of poverty, this could be the perfect internship for you! About Peninsula Family Service: Founded in 1950, Peninsula Family Service's mission is to strengthen our community by providing children, families and older adults the support and tools to realize their full potential and lead healthy, stable lives. Our organization now serves four Bay Area counties and stands hundreds strong, comprising a vast network of staff, board members, advisors, donors, volunteers, and partners who support 12,000 individuals each year. We are one of the largest providers of early childhood education in San Mateo County, addressing the academic achievement gap for nearly 500 children at nine centers. Through Financial Empowerment Programs, we deliver employment services and asset building tools to assist low income parents and individuals in their efforts to be financially stable. Our services for older adults promote wellness and independence. We envision a community where opportunity, financial stability, and wellness are secured for all.To learn more, please visit our website: www.peninsulafamilyservice.orgInternship Requirements:Currently enrolled college studentHighly organizedExcited about Peninsula Family Service's missionAttention to detailProficiency in Microsoft Office programsStrong writing and communication skillsAt the end of your internship, you will be expected to prepare a report summarizing key findings from a project of your choice and your recommendations for strategic next steps.How to apply to our internships: To apply for a summer internship, please send us a current resume reflecting any relevant experiences and skills, as well as a cover letter explaining what you will bring to the position and what you hope to gain as an intern. If you would like to focus on marketing/communications, fundraising/development, or volunteer coordination, please indicate your preference and explain why in your cover letter.All materials should be sent via email to Grants and Evaluation Coordinator, Elissa Stankiewicz by responding to this posting. Please reference "Nonprofit Management Internship" in the subject line of your email.Job Type: Internship

Job Description Sign In|New User Previous Job Next Job   Job Details Job Title Marketing Communications Intern Job ID 113134 Location US - Wisconsin Full/Part Time Full-Time Favorite Job Regular/Temporary Temporary Pentair Overview  Pentair is an S&P 500 diversified industrial company with $7 billion in revenue and 30,000 employees worldwide. A global leader, Pentair provides solutions to help its customers manage water use, deliver safe and sustainable energy, meet the world's increasing demand for food, and support, maintain and protect critical processes. Organized as four global businesses which include Valves & Controls, Flow & Filtration Solutions, Water Quality Systems and Technical Solutions, the company operates as One Pentair, driven by purpose, led by vision, guided by process, and united by its Win Right Values.  Business Unit Overview  Pentair Water Quality Systems is a leader in water solutions which improve the quality of life for people around the world.  Our equipment and solutions are found in swimming pools and spas, aquaculture farms, laboratories, water purification and sanitation systems, foodservice operations, and in other applications. We offer design and consulting services and our advanced water technologies are used across a wide number of industries including industrial, residential, commercial, municipal,  aquaponics, aquatic life support systems, irrigation and flood control, wastewater, and more.   Job Summary  POSITION PURPOSE The Marketing Communications Intern is responsible for entry level marketing support to designated members of the Marketing and Sales Teams within the Pentair Water Purification group. The intern will support marketing and sales projects that involve: planning, developing, producing, delivering and maintaining products, programs, promotional and other marketing literature, training materials, catalogs and price lists.   ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Support marketing projects that involve: planning, developing, producing and delivering of both print- and electronic-based internal and external communications. Support marketing services projects including, but not limited to: trade shows, photography, graphics, dealer programs, trade advertising, public relations, and newsletters. Manage and maintain website content. Prepare written materials including some marketing copy, business communications, reports and presentation scripts. Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Marketing, Sales and Customer Service teams, customer/dealer and vendor contacts.  Job Requirements & Skills  EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: Pursuing a 4 year degree in Marketing or other business related field. JOB REQUIREMENTS Skill in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook Basic knowledge of  sales and marketing principles Detail oriented and accurate Must have demonstrated the ability to work independently with minimal supervision and complete projects on schedule and on budget Analyze, organize, and problem solve frequently and efficiently Ability to communicate status and actions effectively PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS SPECIFIC TO THIS POSITION: Walking, standing, bending, lifting up to 50lbs, use of a computer, typing and ability to speak English.  EEO Statement  Pentair is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Return to Previous Page

Description:   PGT Industries, Inc. is looking for a qualified intern to join our Product Marketing Department. The Product Marketing Department manages the product portfolio in order to provide our dealers and their customers quality windows and doors that meet their needs. PGTå¨ is the nation's leading manufacturer and supplier of residential impact-resistant windows and doors, and aspires to develop innovative flexible solutions for all single family, commercial, and multi-family buildings. With a philosophy based on strength and functionality without compromise on aesthetics, we are successful because of our devoted employees.  This intern should be prepared to work in a fast-paced team environment, and will finish the internship having gained broad experience in various aspects of marketing, with a strong focus on Product Technical and Market Demand.   Students will have professional supervision and mentorship throughout the program. PGT will provide the student with a combination of hands on projects or tasks that relate directly to their field of study. PGT leadership will complete a performance evaluation at the end of the semester and will work with the school to make sure all internship or co-op requirements are met.   Responsibilities: Help manage the product line from strategic planning to tactical activities. Learn and help specify market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research. Assist in driving a solution set across development teams (primarily Product Management/Engineering, and Marketing Communications) through market requirements, product specifications and positioning. Learn about and assist with developing and implementing a go-to-market plan, working with all necessary departments to execute. Education, Experience & Skills Required: PGT Industries, Inc. is looking for an undergraduate who is majoring in a Marketing related degree (preferably with a concentration in Product Technical or Market Demand). This person should have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with technical knowledge of product life cycles. PowerPoint, Word and Excel experience is a bonus, and will be considered when choosing the best applicant for this internship position. Students MUST be declared in their degree. Preferred to have 45-60 Credit hours (Junior or Senior). Must meet minimum GPA standards. Student should include any letters of recommendation with their application and resume. Student will be required to bring a copy of transcripts, if offered internship. It is NOT just a summer time position. The student applicant must be able to work Monday-Friday year round.   Application Deadline: 03/01/2017 Employment Type: Part Time Hours per Week: 20-25hrs Work Hours (i.e. shift): 8AM - 5PM Period of Employment: Ongoing Type of Compensation: Paid Starting Salary Range: Not Provided College Credits Earned: No Tuition Assistance: No  Required Student Status: Junior Preferred Majors: Advertising, Business Administration, Communications, Marketing, Recreation Related Categories: Marketing - Graphics and Design, Marketing - Advertising, Marketing - Communications/PR Position/Internship Description Department:                 Site, Seating and Surfacing   Reports To:                  VP of Marketing   Hours Per Week:          20-25 hrs     Summary The Marketing Intern will support cutting-edge integrated marketing strategies, while learning fundamental marketing skills.  You will be working in an incredibly fast moving business, and gain broad experience in various aspects of marketing, communications, strategy, and product management.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities Assist in the creation of signage, sell sheets, product releases, e-mail campaigns, website merchandising, promotional activities, press releases, etc. Assist in the distribution of marketing materials Assist with execution of trade shows Assist with the preparation of dealer and account training materials Perform analysis of marketing and sales data Seek and analyze competitive research and sales materials both on and offline Prepare presentations Assist with search engine optimization strategies Assist with image library, identifying gaps and scheduling photoshoots Other duties may be assigned by Manager or Supervisor.  Competencies      Communication Learning & Development Planning & Organizing Teamwork & Relationship-Building Results Orientation  Education and/or Experience     Currently enrolled Junior majoring in Business, Marketing, Sales, Advertising, Communications  from an accredited college/university.  Travel Must be required to travel up to 15%   Language Skills Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Candidate must be able to effectively and professionally communicate in both written correspondences and verbally over the phone.   Reasoning Ability Must have the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.  Must be able to plan and manage multiple tasks and deadlines in a timely manner.   Computer Skills To perform this job successfully, an individual should have basic skills in Microsoft Excel, and Word; with extensive knowledge of Web and social media.   Other Skills To perform this job successfully, an individual should have a strong attention to detail, strong interpersonal skills, and be well organized and self motivated.   Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   While performing the duties of this job, the employee will frequently walk and sit; use hands and fingers, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or listen.   The employee will occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.   Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus.                                                                                                                                                                       Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.   The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet, except in the manufacturing environment where PPE may be required. Providing clerical assistance such as copying, composing; letters, reports and fact sheets, answering phone calls and handling details for the Marketing department. Assisting with implementing and coordinating promotions and events that drive attendance, revenue and attract new guests to the facility.   Maintaining knowledge of IRGC regulations and requirements.  Assisting with the implementation of player events and special events.  Greeting guests during live racing season. Relevant work experience preferred. Two or more years of customer service/sales experience required.   Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and written. Strong organizational skills and detail orientation.  Knowledge with computer, fluency in Microsoft Office (i.e. Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point, and Access) required. Highly motivated and comfortable working with the public. Competent in presenting facts and ideas in an organized and detailed manner. Strong internal/external customer services skills, ability to answer questions regarding Marketing special events and promotions.  Able to multi-task in a fast paced environment. Capable of working under the pressure of deadlines.   Both indoor and outdoor environment.  May require occasional travel.  Moderate physical demands in supporting some promotional events. column21: Progressive Mastery Learning - The Grid Method
column23: *Please note: This is an unpaid internship to start, with the opportunity for a future position.Progressive Mastery Learning, LLC has been created to foster innovation in the world of education. PML produces products and services to be offered to educators, educational institutions, and their governing bodies, to encourage the improvement and growth of success amongst students throughout the world. Most notably, PML is the creators of The Grid Method - Mastery Learning System. (www.thegridmethod.com)Developed by Teachers. Fueled by Passion.We are currently looking for 2 marketing interns for the Summer 2017 and Fall 2017 semesters.We are a small company. And while we are growing, we like the fact that we are not a huge corporation and we feel our size provides you with the opportunity to be involved in many aspects of the business and to really get your hands on important projects that are crucial to the success of our projects and our clients. This is not a "go file these papers" type of internship. You will play an important role and will contribute your ideas and opinions... and we will listen to them!RESPONSIBILITIES- Perform market research.- Perform an in depth SWOT analysis- Develop an in depth Marketing Plan- Work with our team to execute that Marketing Plan- Help to coordinate online marketing and advertising campaigns- Help to collaborate with our team and our clients on projects and assignmentsREQUIREMENTS- Must be majoring in Marketing or Advertising.- Ready and excited to work with a team that values creativity, flexibility, and variety.- Exhibit personal qualities, such as open-mindedness, enthusiasm, and adaptability.- Prefers challenges, fast pace, new ideas, future focus, and unstructured environment.- Self-motivated and ready to take the initiative to learn and grow.- Access to a computer and the Internet. Your work can be done 100% virtually. Although you will be able to work at either of our offices (Located in Canton, Ohio and Stow, Ohio) if preferred, you will be able to complete almost all tasks from your dorm room, apartment, school library, or your local coffee shop.Please provide files to any previous marketing and/or advertising campaigns you have worked on.SKILLSRequired - Marketing Basics, Basic Computer Skills, English, Marketing Campaign Monitoring/Tracking/AnalyzationPreferred - Marketing Analytics, Project Management, Content MarketingJob Type: InternshipRequired education:High school or equivalentRequired experience:Marketing: 1 yearOnline Marketing: 1 yearWorking with a team: 1 yearRequired language:English

Interest in community services, homelessness strongly preferred.SalaryThis is a paid internship. However, course credit may be available from your educational institution if desired instead.Job Type: Full-time

ProTilly, Inc. is a coaching and matchmaking service connecting ambitious, talented individuals with top companies seeking energetic talent. We commit our business to helping individuals and organizations break through barriers and accelerate their growth by understanding their strengths, weaknesses, and behaviors and creatively planning a path to achieve the desired results. With one-on-one coaching, group workshops, stress-free talent searches, and more, ProTilly guides their clients through transitions and sets them up for optimal success.We are looking for two digitally-savvy interns with interests in social media marketing, PR, and graphic design to join our team for a 6-month paid internship. At ProTilly, we can run our own errands. This internship aims to ensure that you have a real project you can take the lead on and own, resulting in a measurable, meaningful outcome you can add to your resume. We are looking for ambitious, creative individuals who want to use their skills and abilities to make an impact. You will work directly with our Director of Marketing & Business Development to build the ProTilly brand, raise awareness, and turn leads to clients through content creation, social media strategy, and public relations.Compensation & Commitment: $12 per hour, 8-15 hours per weekPerks:access to professional development tools and workshops;access to a trained professional coach and a certified life coach;flexible hours, with most work performed at home;eligibility to use this experience toward internship credit (not required)financial bonus opportunities available upon achievement of set goalsGraphic/Web Design Internship DescriptionLooking for a creative web & graphic designer with an eye for detail to assist in the continual development, troubleshooting, & optimization of the ProTilly website. Candidate must have a working knowledge of Wordpress and able to share suggestions for improvement.ResponsibilitiesWeb development, troubleshooting, & optimization;Research competitors and stay up-to-date with digital trends, new tools, & best practices;Designing and develop new features for our core site templates;Assists in the design and development of layouts for marketing materials, using appealing nd well-organized graphics;Responsible for incorporating current design trends into each unique layout to produce an up-to-date style for custom ads;Additional design as neededQualificationsKnowledge of Wordpress a must; HTML & CSS a plusSome graphic design experience (please provide examples)Experience working with Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesignIntermediate writing skills, excelling at punctuation & grammarStrong communication and organization skills are requiredPR/Social Media Internship DescriptionStudent or recent grad in marketing, public relations, or journalism major, or someone with strong interest in marketing, communications, new media, and social media. Looking for social influencers who are passionate about the digital and social media and are ready to start spreading, building engagement and transactional sales.ResponsibilitiesAssist in building a foundation for our social media accounts: performing competitive audits, gathering industry best practices, compiling existing assets, assigning KPIs and relevant analytics tracking, and developing the overall strategy;Manage the day-to-day upkeep of ProTilly social accounts, as well as creation of accounts on underserved platforms;Increase following and drive engagement on all social media platforms;Create/design social content as needed;Maintain monthly content calendar and brainstorm post ideas;Contribute to larger social brainstorms for more extensive activations/campaigns;Monitor and follow social media trends by sharing relevant content using appropriate hashtags and other means to increase online presence;Research media outlets including local and national newspapers, magazines, blogs, social media influencers within the industry;Communicate with editors, bloggers, and social media influencers to identify PR & publication pickup opportunities;Research strategic partnerships with organizations or communities in the industry to develop professional relationships in effort to access a broader audience;Update website content as needed;QualificationsFrequent user of FB, Instagram, and LinkedIn (please provide social media handles)Knowledge of Adobe Illustrator & Photoshop preferredPassion for & knowledge of all things social, with a creative mind for how to drive engagement and foster communityProven understanding of the digital space and current social trendsEnjoy writing and have amazing grammar skills; copywriting experience a plusSelf-directed learner with a passion for growing your careerIf either of these opportunities sounds like a perfect fit for you, please include your resume along with social media handles or examples of your work, and a short note describing why you are ideal for the role.Job Type: InternshipSalary: $12.00 /hourRequired education:High school or equivalentRequired experience:Graphic Design: 2 years

Welcome. You are not signed in. My Account Options My Job Cart Sign In Job SearchMy Jobpage Advanced SearchAll Jobs Return to the home page Printable Format     Marketing Intern - MAR03056 Organization - Pernod Ricard Travel Retail Americas Primary Location - US-Florida Job - Marketing Job Type - Internship Job Posting - Feb 3, 2017  Description  Pernod Ricard Travel Retail Americas (PRTRA) is the premium spirits and wine supplier throughout duty-free and domestic markets of the Caribbean and Central America regions and is part of the newly transformed Global Travel Retail division based in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.   Position Summary:  Under the direction of the Marketing Manager the Marketing Intern will be responsible for assisting in the implementation of marketing plans and promotional activities for key brands in the key markets of the Pernod Ricard portfolio.  Through this internship, the Marketing Intern will gain ‰ÛÏreal world‰Û experience in working with ‰ÛÏlive‰Û activities and key projects involving operations of marketing key brands in the Duty Free and Domestic markets.    The successful candidate must be a marketing major with interest in the spirits industry, Duty Free and/or International Domestic Markets.   ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Assist in special projects related to the adaptation of brand guidelines and global promotional platforms to local programs / initiatives in key markets. Assist in ensuring that all promotional activities implemented are in line with the agreed marketing plans and guidelines.    Provide support to Marketing Manager(s) in the process of executing marketing plans for the key brands in the key markets guided by the 4 year strategic plan. Assist in the preparation of tactical / promotional materials used internally and externally in the marketing of key brands. Assist Marketing Manager(s) in activities pertaining to POS/merchandising requirements. Perform market research; Monitor and various social media platforms, including but not limited to Twitter, YouTube, Facebook, LinkedIN and other social media platforms to support marketing objectives. Assist in the preparation of presentation materials and other informational documents. Assist Marketing Manager with all adhoc projects and marketing administrative tasks.   QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:   åá         Education:   BA in Marketing or Business required. Current MBA graduate student. Experience:   Strong business acumen and analytical skills.  Thorough and creative problem solving abilities and strong verbal and written presentation skills.  Strong proficiency in working knowledge of MS Office Suite.  Must be able to manage multitask and manage multiple projects.  Strong use of technology and social media.  All project activities of marketing and promotional activity must be handled with extreme professionalism. Start Date: Position open until filled, requires minimum 3-6 mo. commitment and/or ( 1 to 2 semesters) Hours: 4-5 Hours/Day, preferably 4-5 days/week Onsite‰ÛÒ No external work Compensation: Paid internship Languages: MUST BE BILINGUAL (Spanish / English)   Education Level - Bachelor's Degree

This experience includes, but is not limited to, marketing, market research, sales, meeting with clients, online media, publicity & PR, blogging, and face to face networking.You must be newly graduated from college or a grad student with marketing, customer service, communication or PR experience. Good communication and writing skill are a must. This is an exciting opportunity for those who strive for success.Overall Roles and Responsibilities:NETWORKING : learn how to convince others to partner with us.MANAGEMENT CONSULTING: learn how to get involved with luxury start-ups and the consulting world.PUBLICITY & PR: start building your network while seeking major clients/sponsors.DIGITAL & ONLINE MARKETING: learn to run digital promotions and connect with people through social media marketing.BRANDING: learn how to get connected with emerging designers who take part at our various events. Help recruit models, makeup artists, photographers, etc.You must able to dedicate 20-25 hours during normal business hours. Looking for a highly motivated individual who is comfortable working in an office environment and have excellent skills to help us help them. This is not a paid position however college credits can be given.To apply:Please send a cover letter with your resume and why you think you can contribute to marketing and branding. Please send resume (in word, PDF or RTF format).SERIOUS CANDIDATES ONLY! PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE TIME OR ARE NOT WILLING TO LEARN MARKETING, PR AND BRANDING.Job Type: InternshipRequired education:High school or equivalentRequired experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 yearMarket Research: 1 yearCustomer Service: 1 year

column23: Pulse 24/7 is a disruptive platform introduced by two visionaries who hold more than 35 years of combined experience in the service industry and technology automation. Empowering service providers is a passion we feel strongly about. Hence, Pulse 24/7 is not just technology to us, it's a simple lifestyle that we feel crosses many geographical boundaries, education levels, and socioeconomic classes. Every subscription to this platform unlocks tools and experiences that will make today's service providers more impactful. Proven management and creative marketing education are what we are offering all across the country and online at zero cost.This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the ground floor of an exciting app company that will Revolutionize the market for freelancers and small business owners and how they do business in a mobile economy.We are seeking an intern who can help us create requirement documents, help test and help us stay organized on our App and web development work. You need to have a passion in technology and great organizational skills, a quick learned and be quick on your feet.Skills and Tasks:- Knowledge of Google Docs, Slides and Spreadsheet- Photoshop (a plus)- Creating workflows (such as website links that we need to place in a website)- Good sense of design and user usability- Social media marketing and content developmentThis is a 20 hrs per week unpaid internship during the school year. A stipend of $1500 can be provided to the best candidate who is selected. This is a 3-month contract.Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Stamford, CTRequired education:High school or equivalent

Marketing Intern Summer Interns Austin, Texas Apply Q2 Software is focused on empowering returns on relationships for community-centered financial institutions and their retail and commercial account holders. We do this with the most comprehensive, secure and adaptable smart banking platform of its kind, designed to deliver a compelling, consistent user experience on any device and enable customers to deliver secure, innovative services and increasingly, to generate new sources of revenue.  Named as one of Austin‰Ûªs fastest growing companies and one of the best places to work, Q2 offers our employees a culture fueled by engaged, motivated and dedicated team members.  We have been named as Austin‰Ûªs Best Places to Work six years in a row.  Q2 offers an oftentimes hard to find dynamic work environment that welcomes innovative ideas, rewards hard work and commitment, exposes its members to growth opportunities, and encourages evolution of individuals, methodologies, processes, and systems.  Q2 is seeking a Marketing Intern to join our fast paced marketing team.  The Summer Internship Program is 10 weeks long and all positions are paid hourly, with an average work week of 40 hours. We are looking for energetic, innovative, ‰ÛÏout of the box‰Û thinkers who want to learn and grow with a successful and passionate Austin-based software company.  Read more about us at www.q2ebanking.com.  In order to be considered for the Intern Program, you must be currently pursuing a degree.    RESPONSIBILITIES:  Execute components of integrated marketing campaigns as required (email, social media, web) Support marketing programs to help banks and credit unions market to their account holders Manage Q2 online user group membership, working with our online forum vendor Support webcasts and programs to drive demand for Q2 products and services Support Q2 Culture efforts, serving on a team of employees to drive employee engagement and fun Responsible for ensuring that all security, availability, confidentiality and privacy policies and controls are adhered to  EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE:  Pursuing Degree in Marketing Interest in marketing Interest in online research Exceptional work ethic, highly efficient and accurate Excellent attention to detail Ability to operate independently and proactively with minimal up front instruction and take ownership of work product; driven, diligent, and self-motivated Excellent time management and organizational skills Ability to work independently or as part of a team Excellent communication skills with a customer service focus Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel Trustworthy and discreet with confidential financial and employee data  Apply Apply Later ‰  Back to Current Openings Share LinkedIn Facebook Twitter Email Similar Jobs Marketing Intern Powered by Jobvite

Home Job Search By Category By Location All Open Jobs Marketing Intern Back to Results Save this Job Refer this Job Apply Now Overview Date Posted: 1/24/2017 City: Atlanta State: GA Country: United States of America Category: Internship Description   The Marketing Intern is responsible for supporting the management and execution of marketing initiatives. This individual assists with various department project functions and needs, ultimately impacting the overall success of the team. In addition to marketing support, the Intern contributes to a specific Intern Group Project to gain company-wide perspective and develop a solution to enhance the business.    Duties and Responsibilities Include:  Completes short-term store training designed to gain experience and perspective in retail store operations. Departmental Duties (approximately 80% time dedication) Assists with the planning, execution, and analysis of the media planning and strategic and creative direction for mass-media advertising campaigns. Identifies and executes opportunities which drive sales and improve processes within the marketing group. Supports the execution of tactics for brand partnerships and volunteer programs. Carries out ad hoc project support functions to support the brand, promotions, creative, and communication teams, as requested by the hiring manager. Special Projects Intern Group Project (approximately 20% time dedication) Collaborates with other intern group team members to create and develop a business plan for a specific company-wide initiative determined by senior leaders. Utilizes internal resources and project sponsors to obtain strategic insight and gain buy-in from internal stakeholders.  Prepares a business presentation to showcase to senior management at the conclusion of the internship. Minimum Requirements   Current enrollment in a college or university with a major in Marketing, PR, Advertising, or a related field Knowledge of Microsoft suite (Word, Office, PowerPoint, Excel) preferred GPA 3.0 or higher preferred Previous internship experience preferred A group of talented professionals working in our Store Support Centers in Atlanta, Georgia, Orlando, Florida and Dallas, Texas, help make it possible for the RaceTrac front line to do their best! It's a team effort to give great service to RaceTrac's valuable customers. Please note RaceTrac Petroleum, Inc. will not initiate credit or background checks prior to an offer. Are you looking for an opportunity to mobilize resistance in this dangerous political moment? Do you have fire in your belly, ice in your veins and love in your heart? Is building a multiracial,cross-class movement for change the most important thing you could do in the fierce urgency of now? Then you might be the organizer Real Change is looking for.Real Change exists to provide opportunity and a voice for low-income and homeless people while taking action for economic, social and racial justice. The Organizer is a full-time, non-exempt position at Real Change reporting to the Director of Programs and Equity. The Organizer works with our allies to build powerful relationships across class and race and mobilize the community for social action.Primary Roles and Responsibilities:1. Organizing and Advocacy (40%)Analyze policy, help select campaign issues, plan and execute campaign strategies and tacticsOrganize public events, rallies and demonstrationsRepresent Real Change at community meetings and eventsHelp build formal partnerships with nonprofit, faith, public and private organizations and community allies; collaborate with partners and allies on broad range of issues that are cross-class and multi-racial.Direct logistics and coordinate volunteer involvement at public events, rallies and demonstrations2. Vendor Engagement (30%)Oversee Real Change's Vendor Organizing CommitteeEngage new vendors in Real Change's organizing workSupport leadership development and empowerment of low-income and homeless vendors through facilitation of ongoing engagement and trainingWork with Vendor Program to support the Homeless Speakers' BureauCoordinate vendor participation in legislative advocacy work and homeless voter registration efforts3. Communications (15%)Manage weekly program communications and engagement on social media platformsDesign outreach materials, fliers, posters to engage vendors and community members; work with Photo and Art Director as neededAssist in responding to media requests and speaking to media; assist in coordinating press conferences and media opportunities4. Administration (15%)Supervise intern and work with volunteers and vendor leadersTrack department expenses, including those related to lobbyingStaff strategic planning work group related to organizing goalsWrite monthly updates to staff and Board of DirectorsNegotiate advertising trade agreements for event and program sponsorship's and campaign endorsements with ally organizationsTrack participation and meeting attendance, manage member database and contact listsParticipate in training's and activities related to Real Change's anti-racism workQualifications:Minimum three years of experience in community organizing and legislative advocacyDemonstrated ability to build community relationships, alliances and coalitionsProven ability to connect with diverse groups of peopleAbility to take initiative and be creative in engaging volunteers and interns and providing the support needed to be successfulProficient in using social media as an organizing toolAbility to develop and carry out plans with sound independent judgment and minimum supervisionAbility to frame issues and articulate organizational values and prioritiesBi-lingual (English/Spanish) preferredValid Washington State driver's license and insuranceDemonstrated commitment to economic, social and racial justiceExcellent benefit package, including three weeks paid vacation, medical, dental and vision coverage, and a $600 annual professional development budget.To apply: Send cover letter and resume. Priority consideration will be given to applications received by March 1st. Please write “Organizer” in the subject line.People of color and those with direct experience with poverty and/or homelessness are encouraged to apply. NO PHONE CALLS.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $17.00 to $20.00 /hourRequired experience:community organizing: 3 years

Search for HomesBuy ‰Ð_Sell ‰Ð_Real Estate AgentsRedfin JobsENGINEERING & HQREAL ESTATEEARLY CAREERData Analyst Intern (Research)Communications | Seattle, WAApply NowRedfin is a well-funded technology startup that's revolutionizing the $60 billion real estate industry in the consumers' favor, and we've built a world-class team to tell our story. Newspapers, websites and broadcast media cover the housing market every day, and Redfin has the goods to be the go-to, authoritative real estate source. Redfin is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to delve into its data and identify trends that are interesting and newsworthy for the real estate industry, economists and consumers. This position will work directly with Redfin's chief economist, director of analytics and a team of talented senior data scientists and analysts. If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you.Who You AreSharp:  You should have strong analytical and quantitative skills. We're looking for a student working towards completing a B.S. in mathematics, statistics, operations research, engineering or one of the hard sciences. Students working towards Master's or PhD degrees are also encouraged to apply.Creative: You are able to build predictive data models and play with massive data set from various sources to find the best ways to turn data into research reports and insights. Your analysis will be used to write thought-provoking, compelling reports about the real estate industry, homebuyer and seller sentiment, Redfin business data and user behavior.Curious: Redfin is looking for an analytical juggernaut that doesn't stop at answering the "what" questions, we want someone who hungers for the "why" and "what if" questions.Concise: Communicating your ideas clearly to folks who don't share your passion for analytics is the mark of mastery.Inspiring: You are a brilliant writer and an influential conversationalist.  Take-charge:  You think like an owner and work to see your ideas put into practice.Technologies We Use & TeachExcel (required)Familiarity with SQL, R and Python is a plus and will be developed during the internshipInterns will receive exposure to machine learning, statistics, and big data: AWS (Redshift, S3, Spark), CassandraWe OfferAn amazing 12 week summer experience working on communications projects that matter to our businessAwesome start-up culture (snacks, lunches, office events, casual dress code)Smart and passionate co-workers and a manager invested in your growth and developmentLots of fun events with fellow interns and Redfin employeesSmall teams with great exposure to all levels of the companyCompetitive compensationRelocation stipend provided for eligible candidatesIND123Apply NowShare this job with your friends.Refer a CandidateRedfin is an equal opportunity employer.Individuals seeking employment at Redfin are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.Make a beautiful difference here.Redfin: About | Press | Research | Blog | Jobs | Referrals | Terms of Use | Privacy Policy | Feedback | Contact Us | Helpå© 2016 Redfin. Search for HomesBuy ‰Ð_Sell ‰Ð_Real Estate AgentsRedfin JobsENGINEERING & HQREAL ESTATEEARLY CAREERMarketing Intern - SeattleAnalytical Marketing | Seattle, WAApply NowRedfin is a well-funded technology startup that's revolutionizing the $60 billion real estate industry in consumers' favor. At Redfin, you'll be able to unleash your brilliance to improve the end-to-end real estate experience and make one of the most important decisions of a person's life faster, easier, and more efficient. You'll be diving headfirst into our award-winning website and mobile apps and be a part of solving unique and challenging business problems in a customer-friendly way. If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you. As a Marketing Intern, your job will be to help build and spread the word about the best home-buying and home-selling experience on the planet. You'll be working with a team sitting on the junction of marketing, analytics, technology, and real estate. You'll conceptualize, create, execute, analyze and optimize marketing campaigns that drive new business, re-engage dormant customers and stay in better touch with our happy clients who've already worked with Redfin.To be a marketing whiz, you must be able to:Be the customer and test relentlessly. What messages really resonate? How do we improve the home-buying or selling experience? How do we reach more people?  You'll be a testing fiend and figure out what works and what doesn't.Champion our agents. How do we help agents deliver great service to a huge and growing wave of customers?Work well across teams: You'll work with everyone from agents to product managers and analysts, designers to engineers to execs. Your mission? To run campaigns that increase awareness, improve customer satisfaction and drive new business. Who You Are:You're just starting a career in marketing and you're ready to roll up your sleeves and dive into this new work.You're creative. You get why customer service matters and you have a zeal for experimentation and building addictive, delightful user experiences and marketing campaigns.You take control. You start strong and you stay strong until the finish line is ten yards back.You love details. You get all the angles before you make a decision.You're a simplicity sensei, able to distill complicated info down to its essence, or give the full-bodied taste to those who crave every little detail. At Redfin, you?ll be able to unleash your brilliance to help us make sure the world knows there's a better way to buy and sell homes. As a part of Redfin's Analytics team, you'll query, filter, and group your way to the truth, crushing biases and side-stepping anomalies to guide the organization on decisions large and small. If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst Intern to join us this summer to delve into our data and find opportunities to grow our business and improve customer experience. The Data Analyst Intern will be responsible for providing actionable insights that help us tune-up our marketing strategies or real estate service to drive increased customer satisfaction and faster growth.  Who You Are Successful: These problems are tough!  You should have strong analytical and quantitative skills. We're looking for a student working towards completing a M.S. or PhD in analytics, statistics, operations research, mathematics, engineering or one of the hard sciences.  Sharp: These problems are tough! You should have outstanding analytical and quantitative skills and the confidence to stand behind your results under pressure Practical: We're moving quickly and we need rapid answers to business questions. You must be able to build models and design experiments that produce actionable results on the double Curious: Redfin is looking for an analytical juggernaut that doesn't stop at answering the "what" questions. We want someone who hungers for the "why" and "what if" questions Concise: Communicating your ideas clearly to folks who don't share your passion for analytics is the mark of mastery Take-charge: You think like an owner and work to see your ideas put into practice Qualifications: History of success: We're looking for a current student with an excellent academic record Technical chops: Very strong SQL and Excel skills are required; expertise in Tableau is preferred; comfort in either R or Python is a plus Passion: This internship is not for the faint of heart. Copywriter Intern (Part-time)About UsReverie is an industry-leading manufacturer, wholesaler and retailer of electromechanical furniture, mattresses, adjustable power bases and sleep essentials. Founded in 2003, Reverie operates its HQ in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan and another main administrative office in Buffalo, New York. At Reverie, we’re passionate about LIFE-CHANGING SLEEP! We believe that sleep is an essential investment people need to make to feel and function at their very best. A great night’s sleep is more than just waking up pain-free or merely rested. Real quality sleep helps us wake up feeling rejuvenated, refreshed and ready for our day that lies ahead. Reverie’s sleep systems provide customized support and comfort through some pretty cool propriety technology – meaning we got the goods!Why you should care about us – because we’ve created a culture of success through empowering our team members in a high-energy, fun, dynamic, and collaborative environment. We’re not all talk. We walk the walk – and ride around on scooters and hover boards. READ CAREFULLY – if you want to be another number, Reverie is not for you. If you want to make an IMPACT every-day, Reverie is the place for you and we want to hear from you NOW! Reverie provides all of the necessary resources to be successful and an environment that rewards performance. Reverie strongly encourages personal and professional growth, development and advancement. APPLY NOW to be a part of helping continue to build something special!What Your Day Looks LikeStuff you’ll be working on: trade ads, product descriptions, product naming, internet ads, print ads, video tutorials and more. At least to start. The more you can handle, the more we’ll give you. Unlike an ad agency, where you’ll only get a few scraps to work on, here you’ll get plenty of your own projects to do, plus learn a lot alongside a longtime ad agency copywriter/creative director. This is perfect for a student or recent graduate!Why You’ll Be a Rock-Star on our TeamYou are able to work up to 15 hours each week. We’re flexible on which days. We’ll work around a class schedule for the right person.You have have or are working towards your related degreeYou have impeccable (is that real word?!) communication skillsYou know how to prioritize your time and stay organized.What You’ll Love about being a Reverie Team MemberOur Culture – we all work hard, but we play hard too. Besides having hover-boards, scooters, a gym (in MI), a fully stocked kitchen and popcorn machine, we’re also always doing a lot fun things around here. We have contests often, catered lunches, quarterly events such as outings to sporting events, comedy nights, boat rides, and happy hours just to name a few …Rest and Relaxation – we have a nap room!Interested?! You MUST include 3 short-form samples (ads, instagram posts, emails, etc.) and 1 long-form (blog post, etc.). Feel free to put this at the bottom of your resume.Job Type: Internship
