Reverie provides all of the necessary resources to be successful and an environment that rewards performance. Reverie strongly encourages personal and professional growth, development and advancement. APPLY NOW to be a part of helping continue to build something special!What Your Day Looks LikeYou’ll be responsible for leading all global Quality Engineering and Quality Assurance activities, with a strong concentration on Continuous Improvement to improve quality, productivity, and cost of current manufactured products and new products in development for future production. You will develop a global approach to implementing quality and productivity improvement programs with outside suppliers to minimize the overall life cycle cost of Reverie products. In addition, check out the following responsibilities you will have:Supervises and directs the activities of Quality Assurance staff members to support all manufacturing operations both internal and outsourcedEnsures the development, maintenance, and regular review of Engineering and Quality performance metrics to identify productivity, quality, and cost reduction opportunitiesSets an ongoing manufacturing and supplied parts cost reduction and quality improvement agenda and leads cross-functional projects to continuously improve Reverie productsEvaluates the current state of the Quality Assurance System by leading the creation of technical and statistical investigations of quality problems, organizing data generated by Customer Service associated with product issues and services, generating regular reporting of the results, and providing improvement recommendations in a timely manner.Oversees the evaluation, validation, and implementation of new manufacturing technologies from a quality engineering perspective, and methods to build Reverie global manufacturing capabilities from a quality engineering perspective.Leads the development of Process FMEAsLeads Quality Engineering Projects to improve Quality System and Procedures (e.g.—root cause defect analysis, control charts, data analysis, Quality and Continuous Improvement Projects to prevent recurrence of quality problems)You may also engage in a game of ping pong, ride a hover-board or a scooter, take a power-nap, workout or take advantage of one of the many other crazy things we do around here.Provides technical, quality, and process development support to suppliers, the Engineering team and to the Customer Service department for the analysis of product returned from the field. Uses data to create and maintain processes by which suppliers have “skin” in the quality game and we can ensure constant improvement activity organically coming from the supply chain as well as internally.Develops, justifies, and supports strategic capital projectsDrives outside organizations and Suppliers to meet project goals and objectivesApplies excellent coaching, mentoring, and communication skills to develop and grow the Engineering and Quality Assurance staffPerforms Salary reviews, hiring, disciplinary actions, and other administrative responsibilities as necessaryOh, and did we mention you’ll have a lot of fun too!Why You’ll Be a Rock-Star on our TeamYou have working knowledge of Lean Manufacturing, Continuous Improvement, and Six Sigma principles is required as well as direct experience with facility layout, process design, FMEA, DFA, SPC, and DOE toolsYou have a high level of competence in Quality, Technology, statistical techniques, and six sigma tools including: sampling plans, process capability analysis, gage R&R, hypothesis testing, analysis of variance, regression, and design of experimentsYou have ASQ CQE certification (preferred), Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt Certification preferred, but not required and we will consider experience and other qualifications in lieu of the above.You have excellent and creative problem solving, interpersonal communication, presentation, statistical, analytical, computer, and project management skillsYou must have a positive attitude with excellent communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills to maintain a team oriented environment and maintain critical relationships with contractors, suppliers and investorsYou have the ability to thrive under challenging deadlines, in an energetic environmentYou have the ability to manage multiple projects, communicate updates, and meet milestones in a timely fashionYou have working knowledge of metal and wood fabrication, welding, finishing, and joining processesYou are able to develop creative solutions that will result in a technological edge over the competitionYou know how to prioritize your time and stay organized.You have a Bachelor’s degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Quality Engineering, or Industrial Engineering, or equivalent work experience. Master’s degree in an engineering field preferredYou have 10 to 15+ years of Quality and/or Engineering and Supervisory experience preferably in a manufacturing environmentYou have experience and understanding of ERP/MRP systemsYou have experience with Microsoft Office, SolidWorks, and AutoCadSupervisory ResponsibilitiesThis position requires the management of engineering and technical resources. The engineering personnel includes Senior Manufacturing Engineers, Quality Engineers and Technicians.What You’ll Love about being a Reverie Team MemberOur Culture – we all work hard, but we play hard too. Besides having hover-boards, scooters, a gym (in MI), a fully stocked kitchen and popcorn machine, we’re also always doing a lot fun things around here. We have contests often, catered lunches, quarterly events such as outings to sporting events, comedy nights, boat rides, and happy hours just to name a few …Rest and Relaxation – not only do we have a power-nap room, but you will get 10 paid holidays, 12 days of paid time off in your first year, and 15 days once you get into your second year as well as an occasional meditation session!Amazing Benefits Package – we offer three Health Insurance Plans to choose from with both H.S.A. and F.S.A. options and if you’re already covered, we offer a medical opt-out option, two different dental plans, and one partridge in a pear tree – we mean vision plan. We also offer short and long-term disability, life insurance and a thrilling 401K plan with an automatic company contribution of 3% - regardless of your contribution. So in short, you have options.What are you waiting for … APPLY NOW!Job Type: Full-timeRequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Quality Management: 10 yearsEngineering: 10 years

Privacy Policy Job Openings Marketing Intern Marketing ‰ÛÒ Dallas, Texas The Role:  We are looking for a creative, enthusiastic, business-minded individual to join the rewardStyle Marketing team to support the team to help achieve our goals. The Marketing team consists of Communications, Design, and Events. Responsibilities: Support the marketing team in daily tasks including but not limited to: -Client gifting logistics (tracking gift shop inventory, gifting assembly, errands to gather materials or prepare for events, scheduling pickups and deliveries) -Creating non-product inventory archives -Cataloging press, print and digital -Vendor sourcing Collect quantitative and qualitative data from campaigns and activations Write and research relevant, relatable content for rewardStyle newsletters and blog posts Format blog posts Assist where necessary including but is not limited to general creative ideation, marketing closet organization, errands, and event assistance Assist during photo shoots Contribute creative ideas during team brainstorms including but not limited to copy for invitations, swag, and client gifting Requirements: Marketing, PR or design experience required Hyper-organized Strong desire to learn along with professional drive Understanding of influencer marketing Excellent communicator with strong verbal and written communication skills Enthusiastic about marketing industry and best practices About Us:  In the last six years, rewardStyle has fueled the arrival of a new influence on the retail industry: professional content creators. By providing the technical tools, education and global partnerships necessary to empower a global army of 11,000 premium content creators, rewardStyle is now making a tangible impact on global e-commerce sales. In 2016, rewardStyle drove nearly $700M in retail sales to our retail partners; a cumulative $1.5B in retail sales since our 2011 inception. rewardStyle has redirected the style publishing industry and contributed to the professionalization and financial independence of thousands of influencers worldwide, enabling them to earn meaningful revenue on their digital content, ultimately empowering them to create and grow small businesses into international brands. In 2014, rewardStyle launched LIKEtoKNOW.it, our fastest growing platform, which allows Instagram users to receive ready-to-shop product links directly to their inbox after 'liking' a style influencer's Instagram photo, seamlessly creating a path to purchase for more than 2 million consumers worldwide.  Today, rewardStyle is a multi-national business. We have 200 team members who work from rewardStyle offices in Shanghai, New York, San Francisco, Dallas, London and Sao Paulo. Check us out on Instagram @rewardstylehq for a glimpse of what goes on in all of our global offices. Share | | Email this job PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER   About Futureforce: Futureforce is for college students or new grads wanting to experience life at Salesforce, one of the World‰Ûªs Most Innovative Companies 5å_-years-å_running and one of Fortune‰Ûªs ‰ÛÏ100 Best Companies to Work For‰Û 8-years-running. Futureforce interns work on live projects, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact that they can show to friends, family, and future employers å_å_if we don‰Ûªt hire them first (and, we hire 80% of our eligible interns)!   They have the chance to collaborate and connect with the Salesforce interns from all over the world. And, like all Salesforce employees, interns also have many possibilities to volunteer, making a lasting impact in the community.   Futureforce offers a collaborative work environment, which fosters innovation, provides flexibility and most importantly is fun!   About the PMM role: As a PMM sitting at the center of the business you will work to coordinate all facets of the business. You will craft the messaging and positioning for products and will conceive and execute innovative marketing programs that drive demand. You will become the expert on the buyers, how they buy and their buying criteria, and will create customer facing assets to meet your buyer at every point in the decision journey. This role requires creativity, strategic thinking, and leadership skills as you will be working cross-functionally with sales, marketing, creative, and product teams. In this role you will work on challenging projects that utilize your education and critical thinking abilities to have an impact on business initiatives.   The PMM MBA intern will own or have an impact on various projects that could include:   Defining buying personas and purchase paths to inform and create new content meeting buyers at every step in the decision journey Working with Product Management to build our pipeline of new features Working with partners to figure out how to help their GTM efforts scale Leading focus groups and market research on buyer needs Working with sales and customers to develop new customer case studies Creating and executing campaign and social media strategies Playing a key role in preparing for Dreamforce 2017 (October 2017)   Requirements: Pursuing an MBA degree Bachelor‰Ûªs degree from top undergrad 3-4 years of experience in marketing, technology or management consulting Proven ability to juggle multiple projects quickly Ability to be a self-starter, pick up projects and go Strong mastery of written English Passion for technology Good presentation skills Demonstrated interest in enterprise technology Would you like to apply to this job? POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES Sanford Health Internship Program aims to provide our interns with challenging, real-world projects specific to their career path. A Marketing Intern will contribute to Sanford operations and processes while obtaining first-hand experience that align with the mission, vision, and values of the organization. Interns in the Sanford Health marketing department have an opportunity to gain valuable experience and will learn from an award-winning team of public relations, marketing, communication, digital and media professionals in a fast-paced, challenging environment. This is a paid internship and students that are accepted will be expected to comply with all Sanford policies and procedures. Must be a junior or senior in good academic standing majoring in marketing, communications, public relations, advertising, graphic design, media or related field. 12 week Internship to start in May 2017. Every day, we show that commitment by delivering the highest quality of care to the communities we serve. We are leaders in health care and strive to provide patients across the region with convenient access to expert medical care, leading-edge technologies and world-class facilities. In addition to strong clinical care, we are also committed to research, education and community growth. We engage in medical research to not only discover innovative ways to provide care, but also cures for common diseases. We continuously seek new ways to achieve our vision of improving the human condition here in your community, across the region and around the world. The entire team at Sanford Health recognizes the value of healthy families and communities. We continue to gain momentum and expand our reach. Together, we can make a positive difference now, and in the future. Sanford is an EEO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vet. Sales / Marketing Internships at Santana EquipmentDeveloping the Skills and Knowledge Necessary for GrowthSantana Equipment is an industry leader which seeks to create a challenging, stimulating environment in which sales / marketing internship associates can thrive. We not only provide a wide array of resources to help you grow both professionally and personally but offer a fun challenges to make the experience memorable.The Sales Marketing Internship program is a 12-week program that will challenge you with varying tasks and projects. During this time, you will be given responsibility and ownership of your projects, in order to provide you with a deeper understanding of our Company and industry. These tasks are designed to help develop our entry level associates, as well as form a mutually rewarding internship at Santana Equipment. Based on the needs of the business and the opportunities available within the organization, successful internships may result in regular, full-time sales / marketing positions, as well as future roles in business, account management and leadership.Responsibilities:As a Santana Equipment intern, you will contribute as a member of our team, with several key responsibilities:Develop knowledge, awareness and understanding of the material handling industryUnderstand the consumersKnow our brands and the competitionLearn how to use a database and properly update recordsLearn and practice selling skillsExperience face to face contact with customers and vendors in the fieldLearn the bidding and buying processesLearn how to use Quickbooks – invoices, purchase orders, credit memosParticipate in customer events that strengthen our brands and market shareLearn how to create email advertisements for maximum returnAssist with our sales team on various business projectsWho we are looking for:When evaluating internship candidates, Santana Equipment looks for people who are:Available to complete a full-time or part-time 12-week paid internshipCurrent college students or recent graduatesEnergetic and outgoing with knowledge and/or desire for marketing / sales experienceAvailable to work M-F 7:30-4:30 / some part time slots also available

Local DC Food Company Seeks Part-Time Marketing Intern (10 hrs per week)Saysa Foods, a local DC food company, is seeking a part-time Marketing Intern. Our company launched in January 2017, and we’re looking for a driven self-starter as we ramp up our operations. This role would be ideal for an individual who wants to create a career in communications, social media and/or content marketing. We’re offering a flexible schedule (10 hours per week) if you are currently enrolled in classes or you wish to pursue other opportunities simultaneously. Though it is an unpaid position, it will give you the unique opportunity to shape the marketing and communications strategy for a new company and to experience the food industry from the inside.Marketing Intern responsibilities:Work closely with the founder and CEO of the company to prepare business development materials (e.g., powerpoint presentations, brochures, press releases) and shape the communications strategy.Take over content creation for all of our company social media accounts, including organizing cross-platform content strategies.Attend food-related events, including store launches, sampling demos, and other activities as needed-Identify DC influencers and food-related media for outreach.Support on creation of marketing materials for events and other outreach activities.Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Washington, DC

Outside Sales Representative – Marketing Consultant – Direct Mail Advertising and Digital Marketing - Chicago MarketSave On is now hiring experienced Outside Sales Representative for their Chicago Market publication.Our Outside Sales Representatives are responsible for securing new business while maintaining lasting relationships with current business client accounts. They prospect for new clients, qualify leads and develop relationships while representing Save On’s advertising and direct mail products. As you would imagine this individual will need superior networking abilities as well as a proven ability to achieve goals and drive for results. Exemplary interpersonal skills, a high ability to influence others and strong listening skills are all key to success in this position.We Offer our Outside Sales Representative – Marketing Consultant:First year guaranteed salaryAdditional monthly bonus opportunityMedical, dental and vision healthcare programsShort-term, long-term and life insurance plans401K planPaid time off and paid holidaysAnd more!Our Outside Sales Representatives are tasked with executing prospecting calls to territory businesses by phone or in person, sales presentations, creation of sample ads, coordinating customer ads, educating customers, customer service, attending sales meetings and personal development. This role will require travel throughout the territory assigned to them.Requirements of the Outside Sales Representative – Marketing Consultant position:One or more years of previous experience in an outside sales role, selling advertising, direct mail and/or digital marketing products and/or servicesExperience cold calling small businessesHigh School Diploma or higher education (degree is preferred, but not required)Computer skills needed: Microsoft Office, Outlook, CRMAbility/willingness to conduct business on iPad and cell phone (employees must have access to an iPad during working hours)Valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle (with insurance) during working hoursAdditional Attributes of our successful Outside Sales Representative – Marketing Consultant:Ability to leverage technology through the use of computers and the internetExtensive digital awareness of social media, SEO/SEM, mobile advertising and comfortable with navigating through the internetA self-motivated personality with a drive to succeedAbility to manage their time efficientlyAbility to demonstrate a consistent bottom line orientation and a drive to advance and achieveThe perfect candidate would understand how important digital marketing is to a local and national sized business.About Us:Save on Everything is a direct mail and digital marketing company. Our company’s headquarters is based in Troy, Michigan and have offices in Schaumburg, IL, Oakdale, MN and Wyoming, MI. The company was founded by Mike Gauthier in 1986.Only candidates with relevant industry experience will be considered.

column23: Description:SBA Loan Group is looking for a qualified and motivated intern with the ability and desire to sell financial services. This position will reach out to interested leads to determine whether SBA Loan Group can help them in obtaining government-backed SBA loans. The intern hired for this position will need strong critical thinking and verbal skills and be motivated to speak to potential clients. The person for this position should be an independent, self-starting person with the ability to manage and follow up on multiple business leads.Responsibilities:Observe and assist during sales calls with SBA Loan Groups principals and personnelCall prospective clients and gather information regarding loan eligibilityFollow-up with clients regarding sent retainersAssist in preparing sales presentations and preparing new client retainer agreementsAssist in preparing new campaign strategies’ including trade shows, email, and outbound callingAssess current campaigns to measure success and profitabilityRequirements:Students applying for this internship should be pursuing a degree in Marketing, Business, Advertising or Communication with experience on the Web and with social media marketing, as well as a basic understanding of financial markets.Majors:Pursuing or received a degree in Marketing, Business, Advertising or Communication. Other majors with business experience will be considered as well.Compensation:This position will require between 15 and 20 hours per week and you will receive an hourly wage of $10-13 – With the potential for bonuses.About SBA Loan Group:SBA Loan Group was formed in 2012 to be a value added packager of SBA loans, a $30 billion dollar a year industry. We assist companies in qualifying, applying and receiving government-backed business loans from $100,000 to $14,000,000. In the last four years, we have become one of the largest packagers in the country.Send us a cover letter and resume to be considered for the position. We look forward to hearing from you!ContactTonje TJ GjorvenSenior Loan ManagerSBA Loan Group, LLC(917) 593-5013(855) 722-3435 ext. 208http://www.sbaloangroup.com/Job Type: InternshipSalary: $11.00 /hour

Intern - Marketing - Summer 2017 College-University Recruiting | Morrisville, NC, United States Start your application Apply Send Jobvite Sensus, a Xylem brand, is a leading clean technology solutions company offering smart meters, communication systems, software and services for the electric, gas, and water industries. Sensus technology helps utilities drive operational efficiency and customer engagement with applications that include advanced meter reading, data acquisition, demand response, distribution automation, home area networking and outdoor lighting control big data solutions and cloud-based management. Customers worldwide trust the innovation, quality and reliability of Sensus solutions for the intelligent use and conservation of energy and water.  Imagine working for a team of industry leading professionals providing real world, proven solutions for water, gas, electric and heat utilities. Envision yourself in a startup-like environment growing its smart grid solutions portfolio; we are the only US based organization in this industry with global presence. Wouldn‰Ûªt it be cool to work with the largest Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) bases in the world, where there are no spectators allowed?  Read below on how this critical role will impact our business objectives while helping the world!  The Role: Sensus, a Xylem brand, seeks to hire a Marketing Intern for summer 2017.  The successful candidate will have demonstrated the ability to succeed in a fast paced, fluid environment, while ensuring that project initiatives are met. If you are excited and passionate to work on state-of-the art technology trends, we want to hear from you! We want someone who: Is attending an accredited University studying toward a Masters in Marketing/Communications/Journalism Has a strong sense of ownership and drive, a self-starter Has excellent written and verbal communication skills, and is comfortable with engaging others and asking questions Has good technical and organizational skills Has the ability to work collaboratively within a team environment An understanding of events management is a plus An understanding of marketing technology or digital asset management is a plus Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel  Contributions you will make to Sensus: Assist the Events and Marketing Communications Teams Assisting with special events process and logistics Maintain and keep up to date event documents and agendas Other tasks as assigned What you will gain from the experience: Experience working directly with marketing events managers, marketing communications managers and marketing technologists Gain an understanding of solutions and products in the utility market Experience in the expanding Smart Grid, Smart Gas, and Smart Water industries with the industry leader Exposure to and an understanding of marketing operations and execution of integrated marketing programs  EOE/Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled Apply åÇ Back to Current Openings

Sheinkopf Communications is a full service strategic communications company headed by Henry Sheinkopf.Sheinkopf Communications uses the raw materials of pinpoint, politically-savvy strategic planning and the tools of modern communications—among them, research and polling, direct mail, advertising in all media, public and governmental relations—and crafts them into winning strategies on behalf of a diverse group of clients. These clients include political candidates, corporations, interest groups and others.Our services encompass short-term and long-term strategic consulting; crisis management; high quality, cost-effective film, video, audio and new media production; media placement; phones and direct mail; and governmental relations.Our philosophy of service is rooted in the fundamentals: hands-on, personal attention; original and creative messages; quick turnaround; and cost-effective pricing.Practicing these core principles for over 25 years has earned Sheinkopf Ltd. the recognition of its peers numerous times with national and international awards for media production and strategy. More importantly, Sheinkopf Communications has earned the continued reliance and confidence of its clients to serve their strategic communications needs.------------------------------------------------------------We are currently searching for interns to begin immediately, preferably for college credits.An intern’s duties include, but are not limited to: assisting account executives with client work; researching candidates, races, and organizations; keeping track of communication with various clients; database management, script writing, and general office work such as answering the phone and taking messages.Applicants should be highly personable, detail oriented, and available at least two full days per week. Excellent opportunity to gain experience and insight into politics and communications.Job Type: Internship

This will include flyers, posters, direct mail pieces and other marketing material as needed.· Work closely with account executives to translate their messaging concepts into marketing materials.· Assist in brainstorming concepts for upcoming projects and marketing strategies.Skills and Specifications· Completed or working toward a college degree, preferably related in a related field (Graphic design, Marketing...)· Proficiency in Abobe InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and/or other common design layout application.· Prior experience in Graphic design preferred but not required.· Ability to meet deadlines, strong planning skills required.· Ability to efficiently work independently.Position DetailsPart-time internship: 10-15 hours per weekTime frame and Schedule: Flexible from 10 : 00 a.m. To 6:00 p.m. We will work with your class scheduleJob Type: InternshipJob Location:New York, NY 10016

Intern - Marketing (SHRM Foundation) Tracking Code 208632-075 Job Description Summary   Under the direction of the Senior Marketing Specialist, the Marketing Intern will contribute to the day-to-day tasks related to advertising, social media, content marketing, digital promotions and website updating. With a specific focus on digital marketing and website updating, the incumbent will ensure that marketing tactics of the SHRM Foundation are reviewed and executed on in a timely fashion. Intern will facilitate tasks such as creative design requests, in-print and digital advertising, email campaigns and website monitoring. Past office and administration experience. Job Location Alexandria, Virginia, United States Position Type Intern Summary of Department The SHRM Foundation is the 501(c)(3) nonprofit, philanthropic affiliate of the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM). The Foundation advances global human capital knowledge and practice by providing thought leadership and educational support, and sponsoring, funding and driving the adoption of cutting-edge, actionable, evidence-based research. Skedaddle is seeking an enthusiastic, creative and highly motivated Marketing Manager to join its growing team in its Boston office. Tasked with growing the Skedaddle brand across North America, the Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and implementing inventive marketing strategies across channels, and will play an integral role in the company’s development of strategic partnerships.Reporting into the Director of Marketing, the Marketing Manager will have the opportunity to shape our growing brand alongside the team.Key Responsibilities:Help refine the brand partnership strategy, identifying and executing against brand elevating partnerships and activations that align with Skedaddle’s brand visionDevelop and execute branded partnerships with likeminded partners to grow Skedaddle brandManage the end-to-end partnership experience from identification, marketing planning, execution and post-mortemContribute to Skedaddle’s Community Engagement team helping to identify and connect with special interest groups within the brand’s target audienceSupport Skedaddle’s college marketing efforts working with Skedaddle’s campus marketing interns to expand brand presence on key campuses nationwideAssist with Skedaddle’s overall marketing efforts contributing to strategies for paid media, email marketing, social media, branded content, influencer marketing and public relations, among other programsQualifications3 - 5 years professional experience in a marketing, sales or agency environment4 year college degree in marketing, communications or related fieldStrong written and verbal communications skillsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial work environmentCreative thinker who’s able to contribute cross-functionally to marketing strategiesAbout SkedaddleSkedaddle is reinventing mobility beyond city limits. Transportation within cities is relatively inexpensive and efficient, yet reaching destinations outside cities is still costly and inconvenient. We believe travel should no longer be hindered by renting expensive cars, hassling friends for rides, or piecing together public transportation. By pairing crowdsourced route demand with luxurious bus rides, we make affordable, direct, and comfortable travel available to all. We’re building the first mass transportation network and are backed by some of the most prominent investors.Job Type: Full-timeJob Location:Boston, MARequired education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Marketing: 3 years

This position is for an SAW Filter Design Engineer Intern in the Open Market Platforms (OMP) Division in Skyworks Greensboro, NC design center as part of a group of filter design engineers in support of high-volume front-end radio modules for cellular handset applications.  The successful candidate will possess a reasonable understanding of electromagnetics, microwave acoustics, and RF design, and be a driven, committed team player.  Our SAW filter design team is responsible for designing and simulating SAW filters and the surrounding RF module environment.  Detailed Description:  Our SAW filter design engineers design and simulate SAW filters and duplexers in a fast-paced team environment. Filter designers work closely with power amplifier (PA) designers, RF switch designers, systems engineers, and other module design engineers to co-design RF modules using a holistic approach.  The filter design engineer‰Ûªs responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:- Designing SAW-based duplexers, quadplexers, and other filters for cellular handset applications- Designing evaluation boards and RF modules or portions thereof for optimal filter performance- Electromagnetic modeling of filters in their module environment- Integrating multiple filters and duplexers together, in combination with RF switches, to facilitate carrier aggregation (CA)- Utilizing design of experiments (DOE) and other experimental methods to improve filter performance and model correlation- Laying out photo masks and completing necessary documentation for SAW filter fabrication- Assembling, measuring, deembedding, and reporting on the performance of filters and filter modules- Participating in and conducting design reviews  Software tools used include:- Ansys HFSS and Q3D- Keysight ADS and Momentum- Cadence SIP and Virtuoso- Matlab- Various custom filter design and modeling applications  The candidate must be currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering (or related) Masters or Ph.D. program.- Should have career interest in RF Engineering, filters, or microwave acoustics- Should have lab experience, including working with network analyzers and other RF test equipment- Must have experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook    Skyworks is proud to be an equal opportunity employer supporting diversity in the workplace.Nearest Major Market: GreensboroJob Segment: Engineer, Telecom, Telecommunications, Network, Electrical, Engineering, TechnologyApply nowFind similar jobs:Telecommunications Jobs in Greensboro, RF Engineer Jobs in Greensboro, Engineering Careers At Skyworks, Electrical Engineering Jobs in Greensboro, Design Engineer Jobs in GreensboroCAREER HOMESKYWORKSINC.COMTOP JOB SEARCHESVIEW ALL JOBSPRIVACY POLICYCopyright 2015 Skyworks Solutions, Inc.

Description : The social media intern will provide day-to-day support for SoCal Surf. This internship will offer a hands-on opportunity with San Diego’s local Premier Development League club. Applicants should have strong communication skills, teamwork skills, as well as a willingness to explore new and out of the box ideas. Applicants must be able to work independently as well as collaboratively within the marketing department. Reports to the Director of Marketing.Responsibilities:· Use photos, videos and web content to create interesting posts on a daily basis.· Assist in creating, launching, and executing company-wide and social-specific campaigns across social media.· Work with all areas of the club, including but not limited to creative services, ticket sales, and game day operations on how best to relay and use information.· Assist in real-time coverage during home matches; away matches are optional.· Assist in specific community relations, fan engagement, or promotional events.· Understand brand and the importance of brand standards, and be able to apply such standards to all formats when necessary.· General office duties as assignedRequirements:· Current undergraduate or graduate, preferably majoring in communications or marketing· Experience and a level of comfort in all current, new, and emerging social media platforms· Familiarity with TweetDeck, Buffer, Sprout Social or other social media scheduling platforms· Experience with Photoshop is a huge plus.· Ability to work flexible hours including nights, weekends and holidays.Please include a cover letter along with your resume (you may include the cover letter as the first page of your resume attachment). In your cover letter, please address the following:· Your experience with TweetDeck, Sprout Social or other social media scheduling platforms.· Links to your social media profiles whether it is your own account or other accounts you manage (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc).· Sample tweets: Compose each as if you’re tweeting from the club account. Assume each topic occurs in real time (may or may not include a link to photo/video). Feel free to include any ideas you have for images/GIFs/graphics in your cover letter.Your club’s star player scores a great goal.The club wins their 3rd match in a row.Club is promoting/anticipating a special event at their home match (be creative!)The club loses the match in the final minute*This is an unpaid, academic internship*Job Type: InternshipJob Location:San Diego, CARequired experience:Social Media: 1 year

Are you wrapping up a tour at one of the top strategic consulting firms and looking for an opportunity to apply your newly developed skills? Would you like to learn what it’s like to manage one of the fastest growing internet marketplaces in the country? Have you been desperately seeking a chance to work in the self-storage industry?SpareFoot needs a Strategy Manager who can help us answer our biggest strategic questions and plan for our continued explosive growth. You will work closely with our leadership team and have a direct view into (and influence on) our most important decisions, from market expansions to M&A. You’ll also help run our quarterly and annual planning processes and engage with some of our largest strategic partners. This is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a rapidly-growing, internet marketplace that is transforming a $30B industry.About UsSpareFoot is a growing, e-commerce marketplace that connects millions of consumers to thousands of storage facilities in the US.We operate a network of websites that help consumers easily shop for self-storage facilities (like Hotels.com for self-storage). Our top sites are sparefoot.com and selfstorage.com.We’re funded by top investors (Silverton Partners, Floodgate, Insight Venture Partners, Revolution Growth and Monkfish Equity) and have an awesome team!What you will do everyday:Evaluate new market opportunities and help craft our long-term growth strategyWork with leaders across the organization to build buy-in, deliver initiatives, and drive changesWhere possible, lead new market initiatives and help create/test MVPsPitch, engage, and manage major strategic partnersSupport, drive, and instrument our strategic planning process across the companySupport our Leadership team with reporting commitments to our leadership team, company, and BoardProblem-solve with, and lead special projects on behalf of our leadership teamWhat you need to bring to the table:2-3 years experience at a top-tier consulting firmComfort with ambiguity, and the ability to put structure and a strategic mindset around abstract problemsOutstanding communication, presentation, and conceptual synthesis skillsAbility to pitch and manage partnerships outside the organization from start to finishProven ability to collaborate across an organizationExcellent process management skillsStrong sense of personal accountabilityBachelor degreeBonus PointsFamiliarity with internet marketing metrics, conversion funnels, and channelsProduct or growth management experience: history of market entry or new product developmentInformal project management experience: managing side projects on a case, working with a multi-department client team, developing interns, etc.

Context:Spatial Networks provides high-fidelity, high-resolution geospatial data for various countries around the world. Our products are used by Government and Industry to make consequential decisions every day where failure is not acceptable. Our products provide a unique, competitive and business intelligence perspective, and we are the market leader in our space.Scope of Work:We desire a thorough and comprehensive market research study. This would include an exhaustive list of industry participants (competitors and potential competitors), analysis of price, methodology, strategy, sales, marketing, customer segmentation, social media assets, languages, feature matrix, geography, etc. Ultimately to include a complete SWOT analysis and strategic guidance document for Spatial Networks to leverage going forward as we grow.Compensation:We will negotiate this upon selection of the best candidate.ScheduleWe expect the project to be completed within 60-90 days and final deliverables, including supporting materials and presentation of results to be done by end of this time frame.References:Please provide samples of similar work done or references to work you were involved in as an example of your writing, analytical skills and end results.Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Saint Petersburg, FL 33701Required education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:Competitive Analysis: 2 yearsMarket Research: 2 years

About SplashLink.comExpediting Solutions in a Water Stressed WorldAs water shortages, regulatory scrutiny, and aging infrastructure challenge communities and industry alike, the need for accelerated response and innovation has never been greater. SplashLink.com is a start-up company that provides an online exchange service focused on connecting water challenges all over the world with expertise, solutions, and the tools to help manage projects from conception to deployment. SplashLink.com’s company culture is fast-paced, collaborative, adventurous and open-minded.Description and Other:SplashLink.com is seeking collaborative and driven Sales & Marketing Intern to assist our team with any and all activities related to acquiring new business on a full time, Monday through Friday basis. The role is to support the following:1. Help with all aspects of prospect research and client contact.2. Maintain contact databases and mailing lists, conduct research, and execute written and verbal correspondence.3. Review of marketing materials.4. Tracking and analysis of Sales and Marketing data.5. Trade show planning and logistics, and trade show attendance.6. Facilitate additional assignments as needed.Training will be provided. Associates may be given the opportunity to execute around projects and assignments that align with their specific areas of interest and/or expertise as our company needs evolve and grow.The ideal candidates will possess a basic knowledge of sales and marketing principles, excellent written and verbal communication skills, are energetic, good-natured, internet savvy, highly productive and extremely quality/detail-oriented. These positions pay a competitive hourly wage, offer some flexibility in schedule and a casual, interactive work environment. Possessing a sense of humor is a must.Compensation: $10 / HourJob Type: Internship

Home Jobs About Us Sprint Join Our Talent Community Careers Home >  Job Details 1 Marketing Intern Apply Now >>     Date : 2-7-2017 Location : Rocky Hill, CT US Req # : 214436BR Job Summary  Are you ready to put your education to work? Yes? Let's talk.  You're ready to join ground-breaking projects, bring fresh ideas and meet top executives. Our interns do real work, volunteer together and compete in team activities. Oh yeah, and they invent stuff. True story. Sprint interns have applied for patents. They're just that good. At Sprint, our progress is monumental, our acceleration is inspiring, and now is the time to put big ideas into practice.  As a Sprint intern you'll have the opportunity to gain practical experience in our 10-12 week internship program in a challenging, fun and fast-paced work environment. This includes entry level professional duties and project work in various capacities. And you'll get to work with our awesome technology solutions, systems, and processes. In addition to your manager, you'll also have a mentor to provide guidance and coaching along the way. In between solving real business problems and getting hands on experience, the Sprint internship program hosts networking events, development opportunities and community involvement activities.  Are you ready to Move Forward with us?  This internship will help you acquire marketing skills as well as learn various marketing strategies, while gaining an understanding of the wireless technology industry. Your responsibilities will include: event planning, coordination, staffing, and post event recaps & evaluations; support the marketing team in daily administrative tasks; assist in marketing & media promotional activities such as social media, radio, out-of-home, and direct mail campaigns; help with facilitating store POP projects; distributing marketing materials; perform market analysis & research, including secret shopping competitors & distribution; assist with preparing promotional presentations. Driving marketing vehicle to events as needed.  This position is not eligible for relocation. A passion for the marketing industry & interest in the telecommunications technology field. A solid understanding of marketing practices & techniques. Excellent verbal & written communication skills is a must. Must be proficient in MS Office (specifically Excel & PowerPoint), as well as social media platforms. Proficiency in Adobe Illustrator or other graphic design programs preferred. A take charge & great personality who can interact at events & represent the Sprint brand. Need to be willing to travel & flexible to work evenings & weekends when needed. Basic Qualifications Enrolled in college or college graduate within the last twenty-four months  Preferred Qualifications 3.0 GPA or above preferred  If you want to get your career started, Sprint's internship program is a great way to gain experience in a fun and innovative environment.  We know that technology is essential to our customers' lives. We're obsessed with creating awesome solutions that deliver amazing experiences. We believe mobile connectivity is the most powerful enabler of progress in the world. Connectivity helps bring families and friends more closely together, children to get a better education, and businesses to be more productive.  As a Sprint intern, you'll not only gain real world experience, but have an opportunity to drive real results that impact the lives of others. Are you ready to Move Forward? Marketing Intern Austin, TXPart-Time Apply To Position Apply Using LinkedIn About Square Root We are Square Root, an Austin-based tech startup, and a leading enterprise SaaS provider. CoEFFICIENT, our flagship product, is a cloud-based platform that leverages data to help large retail networks improve performance. Today, some of the biggest players in automotive and retail use our product to optimize their daily operations. Since 2013, we've received a number of awards for our business growth and unique culture, including being named an Inc. 5000 company, a best small company to work for in Texas by Texas Monthly, and a top local startup by the Austin A-List. Most recently, we were named one of the best small companies to work for in the U.S. by Fortune magazine. Role Description We‰Ûªre looking for a part-time marketing intern with a genuine interest in startup culture, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a strong desire to learn. Our intern will tackle all things marketing, including the fun stuff like external events and social media. At the end of the internship, this person should have a good snapshot of the sales and marketing functions plus have a sense for the day to day life at a startup. Each day here presents its own challenges, so, we need a go-getter, willing to jump into any task. Sound like you? If so let‰Ûªs chat! Style + Content Marketing Intern Portland, ORPart-time Company Description Sseko Designs is a footwear and accessories company based in Portland, Oregon.  All of our products are designed for the western market and are produced in East Africa through partnerships with local communities and businesses.  We are building a sustainable and profitable company in East Africa as a means to provide dignified, fair-wage employment, and scholarship opportunities for women in Uganda.  We are passionate about beautiful, well-designed footwear and accessories, and we are raising awareness of the importance of educating and empowering women in developing economies.   Job Description Have your own fashion blog? Love sharing your style on Instagram? We are looking for an intern with an eye for style and a creative spirit to join the Sseko team during their summer break! If you‰Ûªre looking for an opportunity to develop visual content for an established fashion brand, this is the gig for you! This entrepreneurial individual would be responsible for: Visual Content: Work with our Marketing Team to develop imagery and stories that tie in with our campaigns. Campaigns + Brainstorming: Assist Marketing Team in finding creative ways to engage customers with our product. Gain experience in campaign planning through key summer campaigns, such as 4th of July and our Birthday Campaign! Copywriting: Gain experience blogging and developing written content for social media and more.  Styling: You get the Sseko brand‰ÛÓour style and our aesthetic‰ÛÓand you have a natural eye for style! We're excited to have you on the team to help style our summer products for flat-lays and mini photoshoots. (It‰Ûªs a plus if you aren‰Ûªt camera-shy, either!) Qualifications Ideally pursuing an undergraduate degree in fashion, marketing or related field. Love of fashion and always stays on top of the latest style trends. Experience blogging and/or writing. Personal fashion blog or Instagram a major plus! Basic design and photography skills another plus! Additional Information Interns are expected to work approximately 20 hours per week and attend additional events as necessary. We‰Ûªre a small company and we share responsibilities, event work, and lots of various projects. Be ready to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty if needed! Internships are unpaid, but you may receive college credit if approved by your college or university. Interns are required to live within commuting distance of our office in Portland, OR. We have a small, lively office here in Portland -- and we are excited to welcome you into it! Some weekend or evening work at local events will apply.Update and maintain media and prospects listMaintain database records and files including mailing and publication distribution information.Feature writer for marketing blog posts covering special promotions, events, contests, media coverage, and more.Assist in developing marketing programs that use social media channels including Facebook and TwitterServe as a St. Louis Magazine advocate at local eventsPerform miscellaneousRequirements:Must have a positive “can do” attitudeExcellent written and verbal communication skillsDetail-oriented and organizedCreative, open-minded, outgoing, strong initiative as well as willingness to learnKnowledge of basic communication principles, media, and marketing techniques * Must have flexible scheduleBasic Microsoft Office skills/proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerpointExperienced in Social Media including Facebook and TwitterCompensation:College-Credit OnlyHow to apply:Cover Letter and ResumeJob Type: Internship

Standard Media Index partners with leading global media buying agencies to provide independent, accurate, and timely advertising expenditure data to clients to facilitate informed analysis of the media sector. Our data is sourced directly from advertising agencies’ billing systems and then aggregated to show the combined picture of direct agency ad spend across all media types. As a result, subscribers have the tools to monitor and analyze key data points that contribute to key media strategic and investment decisions.This data is now utilized as the industry standard in Australia. Subscribers to the data include Google, Microsoft, Goldman Sachs, and Morgan Stanley. In the United States Standard Media Index started marketing its data solutions in 2012, already counting with several relevant clients in both the financial and the media industries.In addition to Australia, New Zealand, and United States, media spend data has also been collected and aggregated for Canada, and Mexico for North America. UK, Germany, France, Spain, for Europe, China, and India for Asia, as well as LATAM markets like Columbia, Brazil, and Argentina.Position Overview:Standard Media Index is offering 3 months full-time and or part-time internship positions with the possibility of renewal and or full time employment thereafter.This data categorization internship is primarily a research role, assisting with media vendor research and data categorization for one or more international markets.Desired 2nd language skills: Spanish, French, Russian, German, Italian, Mandarin, Hindi.Responsibilities:- Research, input, edit, and organize media vendor information such as branding information, corporate ownership hierarchy, media type and ad type, etc. based on aggregated agency advertising invoicing data.- Periodically review and audit market data in order to find areas of improvement and or fix potential errors.- Contribute to the increasing level of innovation in our data.- Maintain permanent communication with the data management team and provide periodical reporting on the progress of the progress.Skills needed:At minimum a strong reading proficiency in one of the following languages: Spanish, French, Russian, German, Italian, Mandarin, Hindi.Please note: Candidates with no additional language skills are also welcome to apply, since there are positions available which will cover English-speaking markets, but will expect greater knowledge and experience in the Media / Advertising industry.Understanding of the Media and Advertising Industry strongly preferred.Strong research and analytical skills: comfortable assimilating, analyzing, dissecting, and categorizing large volumes of alpha-numeric data.Exceptional organization and attention to detail, and the ablilty to work independently, managing your own workload.Comfortable working with large datasets in Microsoft Excel. Intermediate techniques are a plus: Advanced Sorting, VLookup, Match, Text to Columns, etc. (No VBA Required).Other Requirements:Currently enrolled in a media/marketing related or analytical degree with strong academic standing (3.0 GPA or above);Eligible to work in the United States. as an American citizen or an international student eligible to work via CPT (Curricular Practical Training).Job Type: InternshipJob Location:New York, NYRequired languages:GermanSpanishFrenchRussianHindi

Sign In Career Opportunities: Marketing Intern - Starkey Hearing Foundation (22981) Req Id 22981 - Posted 02/15/2017 - 1st shift - Temporary- Full Time - Foundation - None - United States - Minnesota - Eden Prairie ”âª  Job Description Print Preview Apply Apply using LinkedIn‰ã¢ Save Job Email Job to Friend Return to List      Starkey Hearing Foundation is looking for an eager, passionate, Marketing Intern to join our staff for the summer! The Marketing Intern is responsible for supporting the marketing team within Starkey Hearing Foundation on various marketing activities, including but not limited to: branding, writing marketing content, digital media initiatives, assisting with events, public relations, etc.     Our Culture: A non-profit organization working towards a greater good A fast paced, ever changing environment Our success has as much to do with attitude as aptitude‰ÛÓwhat‰Ûªs in our hearts, not just our heads   You Will: Support the team in researching, monitoring and implementing social media Help with a specific marketing campaign for the Starkey Hearing Foundation brand Support for Marketing Team on various brand marketing projects and ongoing product support needs (e.g. website updates, material updates, etc) Support corporate marketing by assisting with blog content and social posts. Assist with foundation mission photo organization. Help with the 2017 So the World May Hear Awards gala projects, marketing initiatives and social media.   You will Need: Currently enrolled in a Bachelor‰Ûªs degree program in Communications, Marketing, Business, or related field Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills Willingness to immerse in hearing aid and nonprofit industry Ability to organize and execute plans efficiently Team player mentality Ability to manage multiple projects at once       *LI-AP1 William F. Austin founded Starkey Hearing Foundation in 1984 with the premise: "Alone we can't do much, but together we can change the world." At this year's Clinton Global Initiative (CGI) Annual Meeting, he reported on the So the World May Hear Commitment to Action: to give one million people hearing aids this decade to restore the gift of hearing, and to make a difference in people's lives in new ways:  Starkey Hearing Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Vet/Disabled. EEO is the law.   Our reward is in the faces and smiles of each person as we help them hear again. We truly live through what we give. Starkey Hearing Foundation's national programs and global missions add up to something larger: a movement that enables the world to hear, one by one and community by community. A movement that teaches. And one that believes hearing is the answer to many of the world's most intractable problems: isolation, poverty, and illiteracy. ENG SIGN IN Home Corporate Careers Contact Go To Job Search SHARE APPLY Posted On03/01/2017 Marketing Intern Atlanta Office, Smyrna, GA, US  Worker Category :Intern  Job ClassMarketing Services Company Overview: Summit Group provides innovative solutions through its three lines of business: Branded Solutions, Recognition Solutions and Marketing Solutions - all that support specific customer objectives and goals. Summit Group achieves approximately $80 million in sales annually. Clients include UPS, Allstate, Barilla, Jack Daniels, Sun Trust, Geico, American Diabetes Association, and many others. Internship Description: Summit Group‰Ûªs internship program provides students with hands-on experience at a national marketing firm. Throughout the internship program, students will have the opportunity to work with various departments within Summit Group and engage in a variety of assignments and projects to develop marketing and business skills. Summit Group is currently looking for a full-time intern within the Marketing Solutions (SMS) division. The Marketing Solutions team develops and manages integrated marketing campaigns, which include advertising, merchandising, promotions and events, for consumer and business-to-business brands. The internship will last 10-12 weeks.  Responsibilities may include:  Client services: Attend client meetings, handle various requests from sales managers, general admin and organization duties Client communication: Prepare status call recap communication documents, share update and reports as needed Online media: Web site analysis and management, contribute to e-mail marketing communications Business development: Conduct new business research and competitor analysis, participate in the creation of RFP responses on behalf of SMS team Social media: manage client social media accounts, contribute to monthly reporting process, help manage online advertising such as Facebook ads and Promoted Pins on Pinterest Creative services management and event planning: Coordinate creative development of event program Market research: Create trends research, including presentation of results Media buying/placement: Monitor print and online media placements Financial management: File invoices, proposals and PO‰Ûªs from client Throughout the internship program students will meet with a throughout the company, have opportunities to work on special projects of their choosing, and be given professional coaching.  Qualifications: - Must be currently enrolled in college (sophomore or above)  - Commitment to at least 30 hours work per week - Excellent verbal and written communication skills - Ability to work effectively with others and manage multiple deliverables at once - Strong organizational skills and attention to detail - Proficient in MS Office programs - Understanding of social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and YouTube) - Motivated self-starter - Minimum GPA of 3.0 - Letter of Credit (for credit-earning positions) Preferred Majors: Business, Marketing, Communications, Public Relations and related degrees Requisition ID1017 å© 2017, ADP LLC USA PRIVACYLEGALREQUIREMENTS Powered By

Young Living, doTerra, Avon etc is a plusKnowledge of the personal care, skin care, beauty, cosmetics industry is a definite plus1 to 3 years or more of experience in creative content in social media & blogging, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Youtube is a plusPhotoshop and/or graphic design skills is a plusExperience in digital advertising campaign management is a plusAttention to detail and demonstrated ability to multi-taskPositive “can do” attitudeStrong interpersonal and communication and skillsSolid organizational and project management skillsTeam playerTo apply, please include the following:Awesome marketing projects in personal care, skin care, cosmetics, beauty industry etc. you would like to share with usResumeJob Type: Full-time

column23: All jobs ‰ Õ Marketing Intern Marketing Intern New York, United States åá Intern DESCRIPTION Join Sweeten, a fast growing, award-winning tech company based in New York City. We're a team of super smart, driven and fun people who are fascinated by construction, design, and tech. We're building the go-to marketplace for home renovation by changing the way homeowners and general contractors find and work with each other. Sweeten interns have all-access passes to all elements of our business ‰ÛÒ you‰Ûªll sit in meetings with our CEO and COO and you‰Ûªll get to see what goes into growing a tech company. We‰Ûªll want to know what you love doing and what you want to learn, and you‰Ûªll be in an environment that allows you to explore both. We‰Ûªve had an awesome group of interns who have rolled up their sleeves to jump in on special projects including making sure that information on our website is easily available, evaluating industry data to understand home renovation trends and user experience, working on social media campaigns and community outreach, planning team events and pitching in with day to day office management needs, providing on-demand beatboxing (or other semi-relevant talents) for team-wide entertainment, and being all-around good-natured champions of our team and our mission.  RESPONSIBILITIES As our Marketing Intern, you‰Ûªll be helping out across the company to enhance our presence across all channels -- our blog, our social media platforms, and in person. In this role, you may: Contribute to new content development: Coordinate photo shoot scheduling with clients and photographers. Coordinate "during" photo shoots and visit work sites to take "during" photos. Evaluate historical Sweeten blog content to ensure updated references to general contractors, branding consistency, title search optimization, and photo quality. Track and report on content performance: Track newsletter open and click rates and provide analysis on performance. Track blog sessions, time on page, registrations, etc. and provide analysis on performance. Track press mentions and other big marketing initiatives. Build our brand reach: research and compile a shortlist of manufacturers featured on a regular basis, including their social media following, to recommend strategic partners. Help our contractors represent their work: update general contractor profiles by standardizing to help best convey our experts' skills, and optimizing for search. Create custom profiles for a segment of new experts to represent specialized skills. Research trending neighborhoods in new markets and narrow down sites and publications for us to consider for press and advertising. Pull together a potential advertising vehicles based on a list of target neighborhoods. Support contractor recruitment efforts. Support daily social media production. Support team and office needs related to reception, phone coverage, email inquiries, and team event planning. REQUIREMENTS available to join the team in two weeks college student or recent college graduate from any area of study highly organized and focused on details relentlessly driven with a collaborative spirit thoughtful about learning and building skills in a creative, professional environment able to work efficiently and intensely in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment BONUS POINTS IF YOU have a demonstrated passion for real estate, design, interiors, and/or renovation have experience using Wordpress, Adobe Creative Suite, any video editing programs, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, SproutSocial, and/or Google Apps can use a camera or take good (enough) photos on a mobile phone for publication BENEFITS We offer exciting growth opportunities, competitive pay, weekly team lunches and a team of smart and supportive people. Sweeten deeply values diversity and individuality, and is committed to creating a work environment where creativity, ideas, interests, and varied perspectives are clearly valued and central to the success of our team. If you have any interesting side projects or experiences beyond what might be evident in your resume, we‰Ûªd love to hear about them. If you're interested in joining our team, hit the "apply for this job" button below and fill out the brief form. Be sure to let us know why this opportunity sounds like a good fit. Apply for this job Sweeten website Powered by Workable

VIEW OUR WEBSITE VIEW ALL JOBS     Social Media Intern San Francisco, CA Internship Student (College) Come intern with us!   At TechSoup you'll find the raw energy of a start-up, an extraordinary vision, and a group of brilliant, talented, quirky people who believe fiercely that the benefits of technology should be available to everyone!  We are a nonprofit organization that believes that technology is a powerful enabler for social change. If you think changing the world sounds like a fulfilling way to spend your day, if you want to use your technical and organizational skills to help low-income and disadvantaged people, if you want to work in a fun, challenging, and creative environment, come work with us!   The role This internship supports the Social Media team for TechSoup. Intern will be mentored on social media, with a focus on how social is critical in meeting department community engagement goals and learn how to get important messages out to the masses. The intern will help grow our social media channels, support our targeted Community Broadcast outreach efforts and our goal to increase registrations from targeted verticals over internship period. The intern will build out our influencer lists, utilize our social listening tool to discover high-value organization and engage with these verticals using social media tools while supervised.   Duties Assist with creating and designing engaging social content on various channels: Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram and Youtube. Help curate content of top trending articles around Technology for Nonprofits, Museums, Religious Organizations, Libraries, and Foundations. Help brainstorm fun ideas to implement in social. Help engage online communities through our social platforms. Assist with identifying influencers. Assist with Facebook Lives, podcasts and other live experiences on social.   Qualifications   Education and Experience Must be actively and presently enrolled an accredited college or university at an undergraduate or graduate level. Preferred Degrees: Marketing, Communications, and Social Media Management, Nonprofit Management or related field. At least 1 year of experience in social media to meet organization or business goals. Knowledge Social networking and nonprofit knowledge preferred User of social media channels. Understanding of social trends and general marketing concepts. Skills Microsoft Office / Google Docs Diplomacy and teamwork. Technical/functional skills needed: Design (Adobe CC, Canva, or interest to learn) Tech-savvy - ability to learn new platforms. Video Photography Abilities Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. Interact in a professional manner with a wide variety of people. Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and meet requirements for timeliness and accuracy   This is a full time, paid summer internship. You are not signed in.|My Account Options My Job Cart|Sign In Job SearchMy Jobpage Basic Search|Advanced Search|All Jobs Return to the home page Printable Format   Description  Marketing Intern (May-Sept 2017) - 12700000145  Summary  Tetra Tech is a leading provider of consulting, engineering, and technical services worldwide. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees‰ÛÓ16,000 people working together across disciplines and time zones to provide smart, sustainable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development. Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in 400 locations around the world. We offer competitive compensation and benefits and are searching for innovative people to join our teams.   Our International Architecture and Engineering (A-E) unit has an opening for a Summer Marketing Intern to join the business development and marketing team in our Marlborough, Massachusetts office. This position supports Tetra Tech‰Ûªs growth in the international development services market, and offers an excellent opportunity to gain experience in a professional services environment.   Successful candidates will possess a strong passion for international development and excellent writing and communication skills.  Responsibilities Support marketing and technical personnel with researching international business opportunities; Prepare written proposal content (resumes and project descriptions) and marketing collateral (project success stories, web content, brochures, and presentations); Assist in maintaining library of resumes, project summaries, and past performance reports; Support proposal production by formatting documents, and assembling electronic and hard copies.  Qualifications  Qualifications Candidate must be currently enrolled in an accredited academic degree program, pursuing a bachelor‰Ûªs degree in a writing and research oriented field; Demonstrated interest in international development, international relations, engineering, public health, or a related field (coursework, study abroad, volunteer experience) a plus; Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with exceptional grammar and proofreading abilities; Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines; Available for eight to ten weeks during the Summer 2017; Attention to detail and motivation to assist team in capturing new business; Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook).   For more information on our company, please visit our website at www.tetratech.com. To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter on the Careers portion of our website at www.tetratech.com/careers or mail resumes to Human Resources, Tetra Tech Inc., 100 Nickerson Road, Marlborough, MA 01752. Please Reference Job Code: 12700000145.  We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Tetra Tech is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We invite resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities.  Tetra Tech is a VEVRAA federal contractor and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions. We invite resumes from all interested parties including women, minorities, veterans and persons with disabilities. Job OverviewDo you like Texas, live music, BBQ, and experiential events? Are you passionate about hosting or learning how to host the perfect event – paying attention to every detail to make sure guests are entertained and have a memorable experience? If your answer is yes, Texas Monthly is looking to welcome a new addition to the events and marketing team. Candidates must be highly-organized, hardworking, detail-oriented, and willing to roll up their sleeves to support a dynamic and creative team. To be a successful member, the Events & Marketing Coordinator must be extremely organized and excel at multi-tasking and taking initiative to streamline and “own” projects from start to finish. Excellent communication skills and the ability to organize workloads and establish priorities in a fast-paced environment with fresh ideas and innovation is a must.The History of the Texas Monthly BrandSince 1973, Texas Monthly has chronicled life in contemporary Texas, reporting on vital issues such as politics, criminal justice, the environment, industry, and education. Often referred to as “the National Magazine of Texas,” Texas Monthly is known for smart, literary journalism and in-depth investigative reporting that illuminates issues of public policy and drives the discussion of what’s important in the Lone Star State. Additionally, Texas Monthly continues to be the indispensable authority on the Texas scene, covering music, the arts, travel, restaurants, museums, and cultural events with its insightful recommendations across print, digital, and event experiences.Texas Monthly offers a strong benefits package, including competitive health, dental, and life insurance.Job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Provide administrative support and assist with daily tasks and projectsAssist with internal and external events and oversee select events from top to bottom (pre-event production; ticketing and website management; on-site logistics and execution; and post-event follow through)Manage execution of a variety of print, digital, social media, and direct mail merchandising programsCoordinate all online marketing department initiatives including content creation and sweepstakes fulfillmentAssist with proofreading, fact-checking, light writing, and trafficking for content, as neededManage and distribute promotional merchandise inventoryExecute marketing mailingsRecruit and supervise events and marketing internsSuccessful candidate will possess the following skills/abilities:Excellent organizational and time management skillsAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlinesProven track record of accuracy and attention to detailAbility to support multiple individuals in a fast-paced environmentTech-savvy with a strong understanding of social media and current practicesWork with a team as well as independently on various projectsRequired Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree1-2 years’ experience in an events, marketing or sales roleExcellent written and verbal communication skillsProficient in Microsoft Office suite (including Excel and PowerPoint) applications a mustKnowledge of Wordpress, HTML, and social media platforms preferredTravel: Some overnight travel and evening and weekend event support required.Education/Experience: College degree and one or more years administrative experience required.Application Process: If you are a qualified candidate and interested in this position we encourage you to apply. If you are interested in employment opportunities at Texas Monthly , please email a cover letter and resume with the job title in the subject line.NO PHONE CALLS OR WALK-INS ACCEPTED.TEXAS MONTHLY IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERJob Type: Full-timeJob Location:Austin, TX 78701Required education:Bachelor'sRequired experience:administrative: 1 yearEvent Planning: 1 yearmarketing: 1 year
