column23: Center for Court Innovation Research. Development. Justice. Reform. Communications Intern Back to Employment Type:  Internship Project/Site:  Center for Court Innovation Location:  Manhattan, New York The Center for Court Innovation, a project of the Fund for the City of New York, is a non-profit organization that promotes new thinking about how to reduce crime and incarceration while strengthening public trust in justice.  The Center creates operating projects, including the award-winning Red Hook Community Justice Center and Midtown Community Court, that have been documented to improve public safety and reduce the use of jail and prison.  Nationally and internationally, the Center performs original research on topics of justice reform and provides consulting services to criminal justice innovators. We are looking for a Communications Intern.  Reporting to the Product Manager, the Communications Intern would be involved in helping to shape the conversations and usage of technology in the criminal justice system. They would be responsible for editing written, audio, and video content, identifying interesting posts, assisting with interviewing experts, and helping to organize formal and informal convenings that will help support blog content.  The person would get to cover a vast array of technology topics and work with stakeholders including policy-makers, program implementers, activists, community members, technologists, researchers, and vendors. Responsibilities may include:  Working with the Center‰Ûªs communication staff as needed Writing and copy-editing blogposts and doing simple editing of audio and video interviews Identifying and building relationships with stakeholders in New York City and across the United States who have diverse perspectives on technology in criminal justice reform Curating blogposts from guest writers, with the opportunity to write some original posts if desired Researching current trends, including speaking to the Center‰Ûªs own program staff, to identify new topics of conversation Qualifications include:  Excellent written communication skills, with a focus on blog-style writing Familiarity with and interest in the criminal justice system Familiarity and interest in trends in technology Ability to work well with a multi-disciplinary team in a criminal justice setting Excellent organizational skills and self-driven Experience with, or interest in learning, editing audio and video Time Commitment: 5-10 hours / week, with some flexibility for interviews Salary:  $15 / hour How to Apply:  For interested candidates, please send your cover letter and the names and contact information for three references to Shubha Bala at sbala@nycourts.gov, with the subject line: Technology Communications Intern. The position will remain open until filled. Only applicants under consideration will be contacted. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Note: In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete an employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.   CONTACT New York 520 8th Avenue 18th Floor New York, NY 10018 phone: 646.386.3100 Syracuse 601 Tully Street Syracuse, NY 13204 phone: 315.266.4330 London Canterbury Court 1-3 Brixton Road London, SW9 6DE phone: +44 2076.329.060 BROWSE BY TOPIC Access to Justice Bail Reform Community Court Community Prosecution Diversion Domestic Violence Drug Court Families and Children Human Trafficking Juvenile Justice Mental Health New Directions Problem-Solving Justice Procedural Justice Reentry Restorative Justice Risk Assessment Sex Offending Technology Trial and Error Tribal Justice Violence Prevention Youth Court This Web site is funded in whole or in part through a grant from the Bureau of Justice Assistance, Office of Justice Programs, U.S. Department of Justice. Do you want to get your foot in the door of one of Central Pennsylvania‰Ûªs fastest growing companies? Clark Associates, a multi-divisional, multi-industry company focused around the Restaurant Industry, is currently looking for a bright and motivated student to join our team as a Marketing Intern! This competitively PAID position allows you to be part of our marketing and design team as you aid in the creation of content for our website & marketing materials, maintain social media presences, setup and analyze marketing campaigns, proofread marketing materials and much more! column21: The National Society of Leadership and Success
column23: GET AN ON-CAMPUS PAID INTERNSHIP TO DEVELOP LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT SKILLS THAT EMPLOYERS AND GRADUATE SCHOOLS ARE LOOKING FOR!Open to currently enrolled Freshmen, Sophomores and Juniors only at 4 year colleges/universities. This internship is conducted on campus. Please do not apply if you do not meet these requirements.The National Society of Leadership and Success is the largest leadership society in the country with over 470 Chapters nationwide and over 450,000 members. The Society provides success and leadership programming for college students. Society membership provides students with the professional leadership training to gain a competitive edge in the employment market. In an annual national survey, 97% of Society members indicated the Society has made it more likely they will achieve their life goals, and 97% indicated the Society has made them more likely to land the job of their choice. While many Chapters are established through an administrator or affiliated with a specific department, the Society provides a developmental opportunity for an outstanding student leader to establish their own leadership program on campus.This two-semester paid leadership internship is for students of all majors who want to develop real world skills in management, budgeting, communication, public speaking, marketing and event planning. Reporting to a Student Program Director, your role as an intern is to recruit and manage a team of student leaders to effectively plan a series of life-changing events on your campus. These responsibilities range from recruiting an advisor and executive board to researching and submitting any necessary paperwork to become a registered student organization or become affiliated with a specific department.The successful candidate will have strong communication skills and leadership skills.What are some of the benefits of being a Society Intern?Gain real world experience and receive a $1500 paid stipendAttend an all-expenses-paid leadership training retreatReceive an on-campus internship with flexible hours around your class scheduleDevelop the essential leadership skills employers and graduate schools are looking forLearn skills in the following: Management, Budgeting, Fundraising, Communication, Public Speaking, Marketing, Public Relations, and Event PlanningGet more students involved on campus and build a legacyResponsibilities:· Research the Society and its leadership program· Research and evaluate different leadership organizations and programs on your campus· Research and recruit an advisor(s) to sponsor your leadership program· Recruit, manage and delegate to a team of 5-10 executive board members· Research the process to become a registered student organization or become affiliated with a specific department· Build a network of leaders on your campus· Plan and coordinate social, fundraising, and community service activities to create a stronger community of leaders on campus· Plan and coordinate a series of events including a leadership seminar, networking team meetings, and video conferences featuring celebrities and best-selling authors· Participate in weekly coaching sessions with a Student Program DirectorRequirements:· High level of interpersonal and communications skills· One or more years of experience in a club or organization, in a leadership capacity, in high school or college· Self-motivated· Excellent time management skills· Must be a freshman, sophomore or junior to apply· Must commit 7-10 hours weekly during the academic year for a total length of two consecutive semesters· Applicant must be from a school that does not have a Society Chapter already in existence at your campus.If this sounds like something that you would like to be a part of, please visit our website at http://www.societyleadership.org/intern/IDS1216 to submit your resume and application.Only one intern is hired per campus, so please review the list of current schools on our website at https://www.societyleadership.org/listing to see if your school already has a chapter before applying. Please note that students at schools with existing chapters are ineligible for this opportunity.Job Type: InternshipSalary: $0.00 /yearRequired experience:Are you currently enrolled in college?: 1 year

We are currently seeking a summer Graphic and Web Design Intern to support the Marketing Department.Position OverviewThis individual will primarily assist with designing and preparing marketing and event collateral for print and web. The ideal candidate is creative, flexible, passionate, innovative, collaborative and looking for real world experiences. The hours per week are flexible depending upon the selected candidate’s availability.ResponsibilitiesDesign and prepare marketing materials, publications, promotional items and more while utilizing company brand standards to maintain identities for distinct subsidiariesMake changes and updates to existing creative materials as requestedDesign emails for internal, external and event communicationsCreate and update multiple websites to promote The Retirement Group brand.Help in the planning and execution of special eventsAssist with other projects in support of the Marketing Department as neededSkills/RequirementsPursuing or recently completed a degree/program in visual communication, graphic or web design or related fieldAbility to work in a fast paced environment with a demonstrated ability to accomplish multiple tasks and meet deadlinesAbility to write and edit content a plusStrong portfolio of both print and web projects demonstrating excellent typography, layout and creativityFamiliarity with industry-standard software, including Microsoft Office and Google based platforms.Experience with HTML and CSS codingExperience with web content management systems a plusStrong organization and attention to detailEnthusiasm to learn and use new skillsAbility to work independently and as a teamThis position is an internship and pays $10-12/hour based on experience. Please submit your information, resume, AND cover letter in Word or PDF format in the following link.Please fill out the information at the link below for consideration (replies to this posting will NOT be reviewed).http://www.clicktools.com/survey?iv=eniilvkrg8zq4Job Type: Part-timeJob Location:San Diego, CA 92121Required experience:graphic & web design: 1 year

Job Search Login / Register We are now hiring Req #1224 Intern - Advertising Digital Sales Support Intern Hourly Temporary Saturday, March 4, 2017 Intern - Advertising Digital Sales Support  Experience the fast-paced world of advertising sales first hand!  The Times Herald, Part of the USA Today Network, affiliated with Michigan.com, Michigan‰Ûªs Largest Media Marketing Company, which includes the Detroit Free Press and The Detroit News, seeks an Advertising Digital Sales Support Intern to work at our Port Huron location.  The Advertising Digital Sales Support Intern will represent the company in a sales support capacity, engaging and supporting clients through in-person calls or through a telephone based relationship. This is a developmental position for college students interested in pursuing a career in Advertising Media Sales Support You will also provide administrative support to the sales organization, utilizing deep understanding of the company's multimedia solutions.  In this position, you will have the opportunity to be involved in many aspects of the media advertising process working closely with our territory accounts sales teams.  A candidate for this position should be an excellent written and spoken communicator, possess digital/social media acumen, have effective phone and clerical skills, efficient time management skills, be proficient with Word, Excel and PowerPoint and possess the ability to do quality work under intense deadlines.   This is a paid internship. Previous digital sales or advertising internships or experience is helpful but not required.  Candidates must be at least a junior status in order to be taken into consideration.  The internship is expected to last approx. 6 months, working approx. 30-40 hours per week. The Times Herald will offer training and development opportunities throughout the internship period.  About USA TODAY NETWORK: USA TODAY NETWORK is one of the top 20 digital companies in the country, sharing the list with Google, Facebook, and Amazon.   And we have over 100 million unique visitors a month, which is more than Buzzfeed, Yahoo News, and Huffington Post. Because our team consists of over 110 local properties with USA TODAY at the helm, you‰Ûªll have the luxury of living in a community you love while making a national impact.   Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are a drug free, EEO employer committed to a diverse workforce. We will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation or veteran status.  Connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Glassdoor, Indeed & The Muse to learn more about our dynamic company culture! Intern General Administration Hourly Port Huron (1067) - Domestic Publishing-East Group, 911 Military St, Port Huron, Michigan, United States of America Map data å©2017 Google Terms of Use Map Satellite Apply Now Privacy Policy å© 2017

Are you interested in becoming a talent agent? Or perhaps the entertainment industry is what excites you? If that's the case then we'd like to meet you!We are a SAG-AFTRA franchised talent and literary agency in Los Angeles, CA looking for an enthusiastic, hard working intern to assist a talent agent within the kids and teens division.THIS IS AN UNPAID INTERNSHIP ONLY FOR THOSE WHO ARE MOTIVATED ENOUGH TO WORK WITH NO PAY - ONCE YOU MOVE INTO THE JUNIOR TALENT AGENT JOB IT IS COMMISSION ONLY!!!!NOTE: This position can lead to a Junior Agent Position as soon as the applicant shows efficiency in work and is able to quickly understand and learn all aspects of the job. This is an unpaid internship but is eligible for college credit.The candidate chosen will act as the right hand person for the talent agent, and must be completely reliable! Confidentiality is a must!! Please do not apply if you are interested in becoming an actor . Only serious applicants who are interested in the entertainment business/talent agency business. Social Media savvy individuals are wanted!Responsibilities include basic clerical and administrative duties (light bookkeeping, filing, maintaining client profiles and documents, scheduling meetings and appointments, greeting clients etc.), accompany agent on showcases, overseeing organization and update of office. Special projects from time to time (digital design is required). This position may lead to more crucial responsibilities! This position works within the kids and teens division and the applicant should be comfortable dealing with kids and their parents.Job Type: InternshipJob Location:Los Angeles, CARequired education:Bachelor'sRequired language:Excellent spoken and written English

column23: The Weekly Scoop (TWS) Graphic Design InternTWS is looking for creative and talented candidates currently pursuing a degree in Graphic Design. Qualified intern will help in the day to day activity in marketing, branding and promotion of TWS. Through this, intern student will work closely with the Creative Director and Business Manager to develop and create graphic designs that can be implemented to help drive TWS to the forefront of the New England scenery. Intern must be creative, tenacious, and hardworking. This is an internship based in Providence, Rhode Island. You must have an understanding of graphic design to be considered for this position.Responsibilities:To create and implement graphic designs for TWS marketing and promotion campaignsRequirements:Must have exceptional written and communication skillsExperience and knowledge of Photoshop is essential for this positionStudent must be energetic, fun and creative within a team environmentAbility to take direction and authority in a dynamic workfieldBeing inconsiderate of everyone's time will NOT be toleratedMeeting project deadlines is a must in this fast paced industryPerks:A clear understanding of what it takes to continuously grow and learn in a fast paced worldWorking with a bunch of creative and like-minded individualsWorking in a fun and relaxing environmentTake part in the overall planning and creation to market TWSDesign and implement graphics to be used to market TWSWork alongside team members to make sure video contents are promoted on all social media platforms**PLEASE SUBMIT RESUME TO EMAIL LISTED BELOW**Subject Line: Graphic Design InternExperience: Understanding of marketing and branding is a mustJob Type: InternshipSalary: $0.00 /yearJob Location:Providence, RIRequired education:AssociateRequired experience:Graphic Design: 3 years

Therapia Staffing is a national staffing company based in Coral Springs, FL specializing in placement of highly qualified healthcare staff in facilities all over the USA. We want to add more talent to our amazing staff and we are willing to invest in TRAINING YOU!Our office culture is filled with positive energy, tenacity, success, team work, and most importantly…fun! We are looking for self-starters, CURIOUS, focused, and organized, with a strong desire to learn, contribute to the bigger picture, and be a part of the success of Therapia Staffing.Can you pick up the ball and run with it? Can you think on your feet, be professional and take direction? If the answer is YES, this is the position for you!Primary Responsibilities:This position performs many of the duties of an entry level marketing professional including the execution of targeted marketing strategies and tactics to support the day-to-day needs of the company.Assists with creation of formal proposals for client engagementsManages data entry into CRM system for new opportunities, pursuit updates and client informationSupports recruiting and account management effortsPerforms other marketing functions, as directedThis individual will create consistently professional work and must be able to work with internet/email/phone systems on a regular basis for long periods of time.KEY PERSONALITY TRAITS:Creativity (can you think outside of the box?)Punctuality (arrive on time, be ready to work!)Professionalism (can you work well with a team, communicate effectively with strong GRAMMAR?)Accepts and Implements Feedback (are you open to constructive criticism?)Courage (can you learn how to be comfortable on the phone?)Critical Thinking (can you analyze, problem solve, evaluate, and reason?)A successful candidate will have:Excellent interpersonal skillsStrong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook; database experience a plusSuperior communication skills, both written and verbalAbility to develop rapport quickly with internal and external clientsTime Management skills a mustAbility to work and thrive in a team environmentMost importantly we are looking for LONG TERM team players! If you are a super star in your area & open to learning new things, then we urge you to apply!Benefits:National level training resources and technologyDevelopment of leadership and networking skillsExposure to multiple clients within the best industry to be in: HealthcareMentoring by Managers & DirectorsConnecting personal success with Therapia successHourly rate to start, with the strong potential for hire upon completion of successful internshipAmazing office culture and long term employee potential!Therapia Staffingwww.therapiastaffing.comTherapiaIND

As a result of this project, the Intern will: Gain experience working with multiple databases, customer relationship management (CRM) and marketing platforms. column23: Growth Marketing Internship SAN FRANCISCO, CAMARKETINGPART-TIME APPLY FOR THIS JOB WHAT YOU‰ÛªLL DO - You‰Ûªll be part of the growth team, which is responsible for our bottom line and aggressive weekly growth goals! - Analytics + Reporting. Dig into date using Google Analytics, Mixpanel and our internal database to develop insights to point the marketing efforts in the right direction. - Email Marketing. Strategize targeting, campaign concept and write copy for our emails campaigns alongside our email marketing experts. - Social Media management. Brainstorm concepts, write copy, schedule and post to Thistle social media platforms. - Launch Pinterest. Devise strategy for organic Pinterest and Pinterest advertising. Build out a marketing plan and execute. - Manage Affiliate Program. Scout relevant affiliates within the health and wellness space (especially in LA & SD), while also maintaining relationships with our current affiliates.  WHAT YOU‰ÛªLL BRING - You are passionate about healthy food, nutrition, and helping people feel their best via what they eat. Plus, you have an understanding for the meal delivery space and the types of competitors out there. - You are analytical and love diving deep into data. You‰Ûªre able to use Excel, Word, and Google Docs and Sheets. Familiarity with Google Analytics, Optimizely and Mixpanel is a plus. - You have a strong background in writing and are capable of editing for grammar, structure, and clarity. You are self-motivated, hard-working, creative, and willing to get your hands dirty- there is no task too big or small.  WHAT YOU‰ÛªLL GET - This is a paid internship. - Healthy + delicious Thistle breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, and juice while you‰Ûªre in the office. - Exposure to a high growth startup in the food tech space. - Plenty of room for growth and professional development across numerous marketing channels. You will gain experience in email marketing, social media marketing, PR, paid advertising, analytics, and partnerships. APPLY FOR THIS JOB Thistle Home Page Jobs powered by

Okay to Continue More Information DISCOVER THOMSON REUTERS DIRECTORY OF SITES LOGIN CONTACT SUPPORT Thomson Reuters Navigation Search JOBS AND CAREERS AT THOMSON REUTERS Careers Home Our Jobs What We Do Where We Are Recent Graduates & Interns Connect With Us Careers > Marketing & Strategy Intern- LMLF Proposition & Pricing Strategy - Eagan, MN Bring Your Passion Marketing & Strategy Intern- LMLF Proposition & Pricing Strategy Job Description As a member of the Large and Medium Law Firm Segment (LMLF) Proposition Strategy & Market Development Team, the Marketing & Strategy Intern will partner closely with Segment Marketing, Product Management, Sales and Finance to support the development of the growth strategy and product pipeline for the segment. This position will support proposition strategy, support the execution and measurement of marketing programs, campaigns, and incentives, and collaborate across the organization to define strategies to meet the needs of law firm customers. The Marketing & Strategy Intern also assists the team in developing new programs, and refining existing programs, to maintain the current customer base, and drive new business growth.  Key Responsibilities: Assist with analytical projects by completing data comparisons, account analysis and revenue metrics to formalize assumptions for model changes and recommendations on growth strategies Understand and share market knowledge and industry direction internally to help inform decisions around pricing design and development of tools to aide in revenue retention and growth Analyze the financial results to develop an understanding of product segment revenue and subscriber/customer trends Support process improvement in all pricing and sales processes; fully utilizing the segment and finance resources wherever possible Create ad-hoc analysis and special projects as defined by the needs of the business Understand corporate goals and practices and apply them when resolving a variety of problems Focus on priority product lines specifically for bundling, tool development and success metrics Qualifications Experience & Qualifications Bachelor‰Ûªs degree or currently enrolled in four-year college degree curriculum in marketing, finance, economics, statistics or business related field with strong academic performance required 0-2 years‰Ûª experience in strategy, marketing, market/business development, data analysis or related field Strong analytical skills Strong business acumen: understands the key financial drivers and dynamics related to growth and revenue goals of an organization Proven ability to drive projects and plans with minimal supervision Strong communication and presentation skills Expertise with PowerPoint and Excel Creative thinking, critical analysis, and problem-solving skills Ability to adapt well to change in a fast paced environment Aptitude for project management As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.  Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us.  To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers. More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com. We have designed an 11-week program that offers a full-time experience, where the intern is assimilated into a group to learn about and work under the guidance of an experienced manager. You will have the chance to attend senior management speaking events, participate in business networking, receive opportunities through scheduled events dedicated to the Intern population and gain invaluable professional experience through project-based work. Marketing Internship, Summer 2017 White Marsh Location TIC Gums is consistently ranked as America‰Ûªs #1 preferred supplier of hydrocolloids to the food industry. We are seeking students who are currently pursuing a business or marketing related degree for an upcoming intern opportunity for this summer. This position will work directly with our Associate Marketing Manager and Marketing team and will be located at our Texture and Innovation Center in our White Marsh, MD location. In this role, the intern will support tradeshows including preparation and post show follow-up, complete documentation and literature requests, update sales presentations, materials, and documentation, website updates, create a library of blog posts, data cleanup in our CRM software, and develop a marketing campaign list. Students should possess the following skills and experience: strong writing skills, strong computer skills, specifically MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word; ability to work independently and ability to multitask; must be detail oriented; ability to learn quickly; experience with Photoshop preferred; InDesign experience not required but a plus; pursuing a degree in marketing or business with a minor in marketing. This internship position will have specific goals and project objectives that the student will be responsible for accomplishing during the internship. Students will be assigned a department supervisor who will provide guidance on day-to-day tasks, as well as expose the student to the working environment of TIC Gums. Throughout the summer, HR will sponsor several seminars on resume writing, interviewing techniques and transitioning to the job world after school. Our internship program runs during the summer months ‰ÛÒ approximately the end of May through August. Students must have a minimum of 3.0 GPA in order to apply and be pursuing a degree in a related field of study to the position. Each internship is a paid position that offers a challenging opportunity. Positions are limited. Interested candidates should submit their resume to Michelle Magliocchetti @ internships@ticgums.com. Entertainment Group WB Business Unit WHV:Domestic Industry Film Production and Distribution Area of Interest Internship/Trainee Location United States - Washington - Kirkland Requisition # 156910BR Position Type Intern Posting Job Description Summary of Position: Warner Bros. Home Entertainment is seeking an undergraduate intern for our Field Sales team. This internship is intended to provide meaningful and practical work experience to an undergraduate student interested in Sales for the Home Entertainment Group.  The duration of the internship is approximately 10 weeks.  Job Responsibilities: Product Detail Page Updates: optimization of amazon product detail pages Collect all relevant information for a predetermined list of titles from our internal database and marketing teams: synopsis, cast and director bios, trailers, clips, still images, reviews, ratings, related facts and movies/TV shows. Check each of the product detail page on the site and audit that the changes have been implemented, report discrepancies. Work with Amazon to get QA approvals on all the new information. Merchandising Efficiency  Analysis Capture screen shots on a daily/weekly basis of all our Promotional and New Release features on Amazon and AIV. Create and log the merch. placement details and tie placement to promotional & New release activity tracking documents. Tie placement to sales performance : establish metrics and benchmarks to try and determine optimal promotional placement. Amazon Media Group (AMG) competitive tracker Capture competitive AMG activity supporting releases in the home entertainment window. Provide recap to the sale team.  Job Requirements: Must be enrolled as an undergraduate student in a college or university and in good academic standing (3.0 gpa or higher). Must have proficient computer skills; Proficiency in MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook preferred. Must have the ability to communicate effectively and tactfully with managers and other levels of personnel. Must have the ability to pay close attention to details. Must have the ability to organize. Must have the ability to work well under time constraints. Must have the ability to handle multiple tasks.  The Warner Bros. Term: Three months starting in March 2017Application deadline: February 28, 2017 at 11:59 PMTurkish Heritage Organization (THO) is seeking a part-time, paid communications and editorial intern for its Washington office.THO is a young nonprofit organization that was established to promote discussion and dialogue around Turkey’s role in the international community and to explore the importance of the U.S.-Turkey bilateral relationship across six issue areas: security, humanitarian aid, economy, energy, education, and technology. Through its portfolio of events, programs, and publications, THO seeks to expand channels of communication and bridge the gap between government officials, opinion leaders, and subject-matter experts.In supporting the work of a young, dynamic organization, the communications and editorial intern will acquire in-depth experience with the editorial and communications processes of a nonprofit. The intern will also have the opportunity to contribute original writing and analysis to THO and to meet with government officials and experts through THO’s activities and events.Intern responsibilities:Conduct research for written materials;Draft written materials, including op-eds, analyses, website content, and event materials;Contribute original writing and analysis;Help THO develop and execute its communications strategy, including conducting communications research and helping place articles in news outlets;Provide editorial support for THO’s written products;Help compile and draft THO’s weekly newsletters;Provide additional editorial and programmatic support as needed.QualificationsSuccessful applicants are generally undergraduate students, graduate students, or recent graduates with a demonstrated interest in international relations and political science. Applicants must have strong writing and editing skills, including an eye for detail, style, and organization. Applicants with previous editing, communications, and/or journalism experience are encouraged to apply.A familiarity with and interest in U.S.-Turkey relations is desired, but not required. Please note that applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.To apply, please send your resume, cover letter, writing sample, and at least two references.Job Type: Internship

Digital Marketing Intern Job Locations  US-PA-Malvern Category  Marketing More information about this job: Overview: Turn5, Inc. is seeking a Digital Marketing Intern to assist our Google pay-per-click marketing efforts with a focus on Google Shopping. This role is an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual to be challenged and grow in a fast-paced environment. The pay-per-click intern will assist with various account optimizations including keyword mining, data quality assurance, and account maintenance within Google Merchant Center and AdWords, directly impacting the overall success of Turn5‰Ûªs SEM initiatives.  Turn5, Inc. in a nutshell High energy, fast-paced yet a relaxed environment best sum up our work culture.  We are one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in the Greater Philadelphia area, owning and operating two award winning e-commerce platforms: AmericanMuscle.com and ExtremeTerrain.com.  Our team members are highly analytical with a desire to constantly challenge the status quo and think way outside the box. We foster an environment for employees to flourish and drive impactful results both for the business and themselves. Find Opportunities U.S. English Sign In Summer Intern - Marketing Marketing Apply with LinkedIn Apply now Posted: February 21, 2017 Full-Time Rate: $15 USD per hour Minneapolis, MN, United States TITLE Develop a Life Science Blog Strategy and Facilitate Content Development (IN/372) POSITION SUMMARY The world of Life Science marketing is evolving very rapidly. How researchers like to get information and how they use that information to make purchasing decisions is constantly changing and companies involved in this industry need to adapt quickly to increase awareness and relevance of the products and services they offer. One of the ways that companies stay at the forefront (and on the first page of Google search results) is to have high quality, meaningful content that is refreshed on a regular basis. A key component of marketing strategies is to have a Blog that features timely and focused information that customers want to read. There are multiple benefits to having an attractive, high traffic blog including that it provides a conduit to other portions of the company website and (usually) helps to improve search results. Our summer intern program is looking for a student that has a life science background, strong writing skills, and some experience with digital marketing strategies. Their project will be to put together a blog strategy including the creation of content along with a schedule of important topics for the months to follow the internship. Qualified candidates will need to be self-starters with the ability to work independently, be comfortable working in a highly matrixed environment, and be willing to thrive and grow in a positive, team oriented environment. DEADLINES The application deadline is March 10th, 2017. Finalists will be interviewed and notified of internship selections no later than May 12th, 2017. SCHEDULE This program will run eleven weeks starting Monday, June 5th, 2017 and ending Friday, August 18th, 2017. All positions are full-time, with the 40 hours generally worked between 8:00 AM ‰ÛÒ 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday. Students must be able to work full-time for the entire length of the program. WAGES $15.00/hour WHO YOU ARE All internship positions are designed to give Junior level college students an opportunity to apply techniques learned in an academic setting while obtaining new skills. All interns will be required to conclude the program by giving a formal presentation on their work. Eligible students must: Be a junior-level college student, as determined by the number of college credits completed by the application deadline. Must have a major in a field related to the internship for which they are applying. Hold a GPA of 3.0 or better in science courses. Successful applicants must have completed introductory courses and made progress in their required upper-division level of coursework. Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel are as well as computer entry and/or typing skills are desirable. Must be able to work in a fast pace environment, multi task, and have good communication skills, both verbally and in writing. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.   HOW TO APPLY Required application materials include: 1)      Internship selections (can chose up to four selections, list via Job Code) 2)      Cover letter 3)      RÌ©sumÌ© 4)      Official transcript(s) from all colleges attended 5)      Two professional or academic references, including names and contact information. A letter of recommendation is also preferred but not required. To apply, applicants should submit their selections, cover letter, rÌ©sumÌ© and references online on the Career Opportunities page of our company website. Official transcripts should be sent by standard mail directly to the company.   To complete the online portion of the internship application, student applicants should: ‰ÛÏSubmit Your Applications‰Û and include your selections, cover letter, rÌ©sumÌ© and references. Official transcript(s) and all other application materials should be postmarked no later than March 10th, 2017, and mailed directly to the company at the following address: Bio-Techne Attn: Internship Program 614 McKinley Place NE Minneapolis, MN 55413-2610   Questions can be directed to 612-379-2956 or hr@bio-techne.com Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor‰Ûªs legal duty to furnish information. Bio-Techne is an EEO/AA employer

column21: University of Iowa Community Credit Union
column23: University of Iowa Community Credit UnionPosition Summary:INTERNSHIP PROJECT SUMMARY:This project will focus on all of the procedures, contacts, and vendors of the Member Assistance Center and work towards developing an electronic document for cross training and back up procedures for all employees.UICCU's internship opportunity will immerse you into UICCU's fun and fast paced environment! As a valuable member of our team, you will provide direct support to your assigned team by owning the outcome for a variety of projects. We want your internship to be educational, meaningful, and exciting! As an intern, you will gain a better understanding of the roles in your department and be well prepared for work in the financial industry in the future. You will also have opportunities to work with UICCU members, other departments, and staff.Eligible candidates need to be entering their Sophomore, Junior, or Senior year of college before the internship period commences.Read more below to get a snapshot into our department's culture!The Member Assistance Center is a remote branch on the third floor of the North Liberty Financial Center that assists members primarily by phone and also by LiveChat and E-mail. Our group consists of MAC Specialists (lenders/support agents) and E-Specialists (support agents). About 15 years ago, it was decided that a group of individuals would take all of the incoming phone calls for the branches so we could more efficiently serve our members face to face as well as by phone, and the MAC was born. The MAC is now the largest branch, taking upwards of 30,000 calls a month between about 20 people. We have tremendous opportunities to serve our members with the use of DocuSign to complete new account openings, processing loan applications, and servicing existing accounts for situations that would normally require a visit to a branch. Technology is one of the driving factors that the MAC specializes in and offers support for, not only to our member base, but for our branches as well.Most of the time in the MAC, you will hear the constant buzz of business- there is very rarely any downtime, which is reflected in our successes. Most days consist of constant member contact with less than a minute of downtime, and once a new employee becomes acclimated to the culture that is the MAC, they don't want to turn back. Job ID 2017-1569Location US-IA-North LibertyCategory RetailEqual Opportunity Employment Statement:The UICCU is an EEO/AA Employer. M/F/Veteran/Disability. We strongly encourage minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for openings with the credit union.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Performs essential duties and responsibilities in the following areas which may include, but are not limited to those listed and are subject to change:Adheres to the Credit Union's core values in serving with truth, trust, mentoring, openness, risk-taking, communication, giving credit, integrity, caring, and respect in carrying out the UICCU's mission and vision.Demonstrates a positive member service (internal and external) focus at all times, greeting members and guests with a smile and eye contact immediately upon their arrival. Consistent usage of the members name during contact and always thanking them for their business.Demonstrates teamwork in all interactions with coworkers and in the completion of all duties and responsibilities.Ensures confidentiality of member information.Assists with planning, coordination and execution of department events as directed by the appropriate staff member.Provides a variety of administrative and clerical support regarding respective departmental and organizational projects and tasks.Interacts with both internal and external UICCU parties including, but not limited to, fellow employees, department leaders, members, and vendors in the pursuit of departmental and organizational objectives.Plays a vital role in enriching the community by participating in community service organizations and/or Credit Union sponsored events on an annual basis.Performs any other duties as may be required to meet Credit Union objectives.This job description does not list all the job duties. Intern may be asked to perform other duties by the staff or supervisor. Intern will be evaluated on performance of the projects listed as well as interaction with employees and clients. Work hours and project specifics will be negotiated with each candidate.Job Requirements/Expectations:Reports to work punctually, works all scheduled hours, and works overtime as necessitated by business demand. Job will require a non-traditional workweek with extra hours including evening and/or weekend duties.Must be a current student in good academic standing.Enthusiasm about knowledge acquisition and learning.Good oral communication skills and the ability to produce written communication.Ability to follow oral and written instructions.Good telephone manners and techniques.Ability to use and understand written material.Ability to work with minimal direction and exercise sound judgment.Ability to perform basic math calculations.Strong analytical, oral, and written communication skills.Proficiency with related computer applications, spreadsheets, word processing, and database applications.Must be an undergraduate student entering their sophomore, junior, or senior year, prior to the commencement of the internship.Must be bondable.Reporting Relationship:Reports to Department Leaders as assigned.Supervisory Responsibilities:This position is not responsible for the supervision of other employees.PI96945008

column21: University of Iowa Community Credit Union
column23: University of Iowa Community Credit UnionPosition Summary:INTERNSHIP PROJECT SUMMARY:Policy review implementationIn an ever changing industry, keeping up with standards and best practices is imperative to providing our clients with informed recommendations regarding insurance coverage, which ultimately protects their financial well being. The objective of this project will be to assist in implementing a 5-year client review program. The review program will be a stepping stone for the agency, giving them the opportunity to work with the client to identify additional policies that would be beneficial in building a comprehensive insurance portfolio with them.Key points of the review will include, but not be limited to:Checking for specific endorsements which may not have been available at policy inception.Verify agency standard coverage requirements and carrier underlying limit requirements forsupplemental policies such as excess liability.Updating home replacement cost estimates, taking into account age, square footage, added features,system updates, current construction methods as well as material and code requirements.Identify opportunities for additional policies such as excess liability, life insurance and commercialexposures.Job shadow opportunity: Prospecting, point of sale and policy reviews with a Customer Service Agent and/or Producer.This will also open dialogue with the client to determine if additional UICCU services, such as mortgage services, commercial lending and wealth management, would be of interest.A strong relationship is key to building a lasting relationship with a client.UICCU's internship opportunity will immerse you into UICCU's fun and fast paced environment! As a valuable member of our team, you will provide direct support to your assigned team by owning the outcome for a variety of projects. We want your internship to be educational, meaningful, and exciting! As an intern, you will gain a better understanding of the roles in your department and be well prepared for work in the financial industry in the future. You will also have opportunities to work with UICCU members, other departments, and staff.Eligible candidates need to be entering their Sophomore, Junior, or Senior year of college before the internship period commences.Read more below to get a snapshot into our department's culture!The goal of UICCU Insurance is to adequately protect our members' most valuable assets. This includes their home, auto, life and business. We act as risk managers to explain where exposures may be and provide solutions to mitigate the risks. We work with over 15 different carriers to find the best coverage and value for our members. All UICCU Insurance personnel are licensed to ensure a comprehensive and knowledgeable experience.There are currently two different departments within UICCU Insurance, Personal Lines and Commercial Lines. In Commercial Lines, there are Account Managers who handle the day to day processing and servicing of our current customers. There are Producers who write and sell new commercial business. In Personal Lines, there are Customer Service Representatives who handle the day to day processing and servicing of our current customers. There are Customer Service Agents who write and sell new personal lines business. Many agents are cross-trained and able to service and sell across both lines. Our experienced team works together to ensure a fantastic member experience at every turn. column21: University of Iowa Community Credit Union
column23: University of Iowa Community Credit UnionPosition Summary:INTERNSHIP PROJECT SUMMARIES:Project 1:Review the results of our Training Follow Up Meetings and analyze the following:Assess the efficacy of the questions we are using - is the feedback meaningful?What patterns emerge that we should examine/address?Data collection - is there a better way to collect the feedback that improves efficiency while maintainutility?Info Sharing - How best can we open up the data to others?Project 2:Learning Management System supportReview course libraries for topics suitable for release to All StaffReview existing custom courses for usabilityPotentially learn to build or assist with building a custom course or custom contentUICCU's internship opportunity will immerse you into UICCU's fun and fast paced environment! As a valuable member of our team, you will provide direct support to your assigned team by owning the outcome for a variety of projects. We want your internship to be educational, meaningful, and exciting! As an intern, you will gain a better understanding of the roles in your department and be well prepared for work in the financial industry in the future. You will also have opportunities to work with UICCU members, other departments, and staff.Eligible candidates need to be entering their Sophomore, Junior, or Senior year of college before the internship period commences.Read more below to get a snapshot into our department's culture!The Training Team is a tight-knit, positive, and highly motivated group committed to ensuring the success of all UICCU employees by providing high-quality, engaging, and interactive training. Most trainers work independently for a large part of the day but we have a strong sense of team and help each other achieve our goals. While we don't have a large number of different job titles, we work to leverage the strengths of each team member and set goals accordingly, so trainers with the same title often end up working on very different projects and activities. Trainers are not required to know everything but are often well-versed on many topics and become recognized as a great source of knowledge. As the organization continues to grow, we have seen trainers move into brand new roles within the department and also move on to other challenges in other departments. Turnover in the department is very low and hiring is very selective. CREATE A PROFILE|LOG IN UCI CULTURE UCI Careers Apply Now Or apply with these other sources Apply with LinkedIn  Refer Job:  Add to Saved Jobs Back REQUISITION ID req1508 POSTING DATE 3/2/2017 JOB TITLE Digital Account - SUMMER INTERNSHIP 2017 LOCATION New York - 605 3rd Ave - Room 12A BUSINESS UNIT Digital JOB DESCRIPTION As the leading company reaching Hispanic America today, Univision delivers premier entertainment, news and sports content to U.S. Hispanics through its television, radio and interactive platforms. Univision is looking to recruit top talent for our Internship program to join our mission of informing, entertaining, and empowering U.S. Hispanic consumers. The ideal candidate is at the top of their class, is a self-starter, and is eager to learn in a team environment. Our internship program strives to grow our interns‰Ûª knowledge of the media industry and expand their networking opportunities.     SUMMER PROGRAM DETAILS Starts: Monday, June 05                                     Ends: Friday, August 11 åá         Runs 10 weeks; maximum of 40 hours/per week åá         Projects designed to build knowledge, skills, and experience in the Media Industry åá         Exposure to various business    leaders and company initiatives åá         Additional training and development workshops to build transferable business skills åá         Deadline to apply is March 17th   DEPARTMENT INFO The DIG Account Team is responsible for managing the process by which branded content is sold & produced for ad sales clients. We work closely with UCI AEs to prepare proposals in response to RFPs for custom branded & social content, inclusive of video, photos/memes & social posts. Our team synthesizes the RFP for the creative team to develop custom solutions for our clients and packages and shares those proposals with the sellers, supporting the sales process. We handle client management for production of content, acting as the liaison between creative/production team & our clients to ensure all deliverables are accurate, approved, on time and performing well for our clients.   RESPONSIBILITIES åá         Tier 1 Responsibilities o    Campaign reporting trackers (excels) o    Set up reporting template deck (we‰Ûªll send info and they plug into deck ‰ÛÒ I.e. Grab screenshots of all content,etc) o    Updating pre-roll inventory tracker o    Sending Daily pre-roll pacing email o    Taking Notes in Meetings/Sending Recap o    Update Marketing Status tracker o    they would update our status tracker as we discuss status in marketing meetings åá         Tier 2 Responsibilities o    Campaign Support ‰ÛÒ I.e. transcripts for videos (translate as necessary), look for influencers o    Competitor/Industry Analysis ‰ÛÒ send a weekly email with links on cool campaigns brands/competitors are doing and a quick 1-2 sentence analysis o    Updating Targeting segments (in Reelio and in DFP) åá         Core Project: o    Campaign Reporting 50% o    Proposal Assistance  25% o    Campaign Execution 25% MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS BASIC QUALIFICATIONS åá         Must be pursuing a Bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising, Media at an accredited institution åá         Ability to multitask in a fast pace environment, strong communication skills. åá         Must be a rising Jr., rising Sr., or recent May 2017 graduate åá         Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above åá         Must be 18 years of age or older åá         Technical skills: Proficiency with Microsoft Excel & Powerpoint åá         Must have unrestricted authorization to work in the U.S åá         Must be willing to work from offices in New York, NY åá         Must be willing to submit to a background investigation DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS: åá         Prior work/internship experience in a corporate environment åá         Proficiency with Word/Excel/ PowerPoint åá         Demonstrate leadership and adaptability åá         Demonstrate civic and community service     About Univision Communications Inc. Univision Communications Inc. (UCI) is a top-tier multimedia company with 17 broadcast, cable and digital networks; 59 TV stations; 67 radio stations; online and mobile apps, products and content creation facilities. UCI focuses on delivering a branded experience everywhere its audience is, reaching 89 million unduplicated consumers monthly across its portfolio. As a mission-driven Company, UCI is committed to informing, entertaining and empowering Hispanic America.  Univision Communications Inc. UNLEASHED, founded by world-renowned jewelry designer, Kara Ross, is a women’s empowerment lifestyle brand which supports girls and women around the world from the arc of education to employment. All net profits are donated to fund programs that support these initiatives.UNLEASHED is seeking talented students with an interest in fashion and/or women’s empowerment in the New York area to be part of our Summer 2017 Internship Program . Our educational internship program gives interns a well-rounded view of the inner-workings of a small “profits with a purpose” accessories brand. The focus areas include social & digital marketing, ambassador & public relations and merchandising & retail management.The UNLEASHED team is small but mighty and each intern must possess a great attitude and willingness to contribute to the team wherever it’s needed.Qualifications:Must be able to work a minimum of 20 hours a week (three full days preferred);Located in or around New York City for the internship period;Strong computer skills including all Microsoft Office programs & Adobe Creative Suite;Great attitude and enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit;Team player.Daily tasks Include:Monitoring social media presence;Creating graphics for use on social media in PhotoShop;Contributing and writing company blog posts;Styling photos at direction of Digital Marketing Manager and/or executive team;Market research which includes identifying key influencers;Data Entry.Required Skills:Adobe Creative Suite – especially PhotoShop;Proficient use of social media including Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, and SnapChat;Organized, both online and offline, and able to multi-task;Positive attitude, willingness to learn and pitch in wherever needed;Clear and concise communicator;Junior or Senior level college student or recent graduate with a focus in marketing.This is an educational internship for which you will receive college credit, real hands-on experience, a project portfolio and references following completion of your internship; this is not a paid part-time position.Job Type: InternshipJob Location:New York, NYRequired experience:Social Media Marketing: 1 yearSocial Media: 1 year

It enables us to store our entire digital lives—our photos, videos, music, and documents—in a single place that’s always accessible, growing, evolving, and ready to share. Our team of engineers and designers have built industry-leading products at companies such as Apple, Google, Oracle, and VMware. Job Search Login / Register We are now hiring Req #1115 Marketing Internship - Corporate Communications - Summer 2017 -- NY Intern Hourly Temporary Monday, February 27, 2017 USA TODAY NETWORK is one of the top 20 digital companies in the country, sharing the list with Google, Facebook, and Amazon.  And we have over 100 million unique visitors a month, which is more than Buzzfeed, Yahoo News, and Huffington Post. Because our team consists of over 110 local properties with USA TODAY at the helm, you‰Ûªll have the luxury of living in a community you love while making a national impact. USA TODAY NETWORK is in search of a talented college student looking for an enriching paid marketing internship.      As part of our company, you will develop and apply skills and experiences to support our Corporate Communications team. United States Login +1 (857) 284 7000 SOLUTIONS PLANS PARTNERSHIPS RESOURCES ABOUT US BLOG Get Started Business Development & Marketing Intern ‰ÛÒ Phoenix Home åÈ Job Listings åÈ Business Development & Marketing Intern ‰ÛÒ Phoenix By vcatuneanu  Posted April 25, 2016  In Location 5555 East Van Burren Street, Suite 100 Phoenix Arizona 85008, Phoenix, Arizona Overview Ve Interactive seeks a digital media coordinator to develop and maintain B2B marketing and sales and growth efforts for our West Coast digital and ecommerce sales team. As the sales intern/coordinator, you will introduce our cutting edge technology to new brands and ad agencies, while learning the ropes of the industry. This position serves as a liaison to the field sales team, organizing and carrying out all necessary duties to ensure flawless communication with current and potential clients. As the sales intern/coordinator, you will be immersed at the cutting edge of digital advertising. Responsibilities This project-based role will include any of the following: ‰Û¢Develop sales territories by managing lead gen responsibilities for the team, including prospecting, appointment setting and growth via B2B marketing ‰Û¢Create internal and customer-facing materials that clearly explain the value and unique advantage of our product and services ‰Û¢Develop and maintain B2B lead lists, and assist with CRM and pipeline database ‰Û¢Coordinate closely with marketing, product management, sales, and account management ‰Û¢Assist sellers and ops with any tasks to improve the go-live experience for the client. Ie: Work with account management and with client to get tickets, creative approved etc. ‰Û¢Assist Sales Manager on live business and additional administrative support Qualifications ‰Û¢Pursuing degree in marketing, public relations or communications, or high interest in working in the digital or advertising space ‰Û¢A combination of education and relevant work experience may be substituted upon hiring manager‰Ûªs approval. ‰Û¢Ability to communicate effectively with outside partners, vendors and other contacts, clients and all levels of employees. ‰Û¢Proficient with Microsoft Office suite and Google Drive products, (Word, Outlook, Project, Excel, PowerPoint, and Publisher, Google Docs), social media platforms. ‰Û¢Familiarity with social media platforms for advertising and branding purposes. The Company Ve Interactive is a multi-award-winning technology company that offers a suite of apps across its VePlatform.  VePlatform is the e-commerce industry‰Ûªs No. 1 dynamic retargeting and re-engagement platform, designed to drive website conversions and incremental revenue. VePlatform provides you with comprehensive conversion analytics and instant access to Ve‰Ûªs award winning Apps, which are designed to acquire new customers, improve customer engagement, and increase conversions to grow your revenue with a one-time only attribution.  Ve works across 26 languages and has 34 offices worldwide supporting over 10,000 domestic and multi-national online businesses and retailers in the delivery of real-time marketing communications at key points within their customers‰Ûª journeys. The company provides investment management products and services through its affiliated managers and select subadvisers, each with a distinct investment style, autonomous investment process and individual brand. Virtus Investment Partners offers access to a variety of investment styles across multiple disciplines to meet a wide array of investor needs. Additional information can be found at www.virtus.com 2017 Summer Internship Program The Virtus Internship program is an opportunity for top students to gain relevant work experience in various aspects of the Financial Services industry.  The program offers interns challenging and meaningful work that allows them to demonstrate their abilities, apply knowledge acquired through college courses, and be evaluated for future employment opportunities within the Company.  Our internships create opportunities for interns to establish important relationships with experienced professionals. Assume challenging project assignments to support the growth of the business Get exposure to senior leaders in the organization Learn about the financial services business WHAT ARE SOME OF THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE POSITION? Work with the various functional areas at Virtus, such as:                                  Product management Marketing IT Investment management Mutual fund services                 Accounting Compliance Financial Planning and Analysis' Human Resources                   WHAT IS VIRTUS LOOKING FOR? EUC Go-To-Market Intern Palo Alto, California Apply Now Apply with Linkedin Profile Apply As An Employee Referral Job ID 75674BR The End-user Computing (EUC) Partner Go-To-Market (GTM) team is responsible for Partner strategy, planning and program execution across all Partner Route-to-Markets (RTM) in support of accelerating sales and Partner practice build for VMware‰Ûªs Digital Workspace solutions. Working cross-functionally, the GTM team plans, builds and executes enablement programs, demand generation and marketing campaigns, and service delivery tools to support partners in building out an end-to-end sales and services delivery practice. This position is ideal for a candidate who is interested in learning how a leading global IT organization leverages a channel model to expand reach to customers.  Applicants should have familiarity with some aspects of marketing, finance and corporate and/or business strategy or related course experience.  This opportunity will allow Interns to: ‰Û¢ Learn how VMware successfully scales its business through various Partner RTMs ‰Û¢ Understand aspects of overall channel business (not just one department) as our organization is highly-matrixed ‰Û¢ Learn valuable skills in process management, project resourcing and project tracking ‰Û¢ Collaborate with teams across all levels in engineering, education, marketing and sales ‰Û¢ Be part of an organization that delivers exciting, best-in-class EUC products and services  Duties & Responsibilities: ‰Û¢ Program and initiative development: Responsible for managing one or several cross-functional initiatives that touch EUC partners including the development and delivery of training programs, marketing assets, sales tools, communications and web projects.  ‰Û¢ Project management and tracking: Drive end-to-end projects from scoping, planning, to launch. Take and disseminate meeting notes, assign and follow up on action items to move a project forward. Develop and implement a weekly reporting tool to ensure projects are tracking to schedule and budget.  ‰Û¢ Author and produce sales tools in the form of presentations, briefs, white papers and web site content.  ‰Û¢ Create clear and actionable communications to internal partner-facing sales team and VMware Partners.  Desired Skills and Experience: ‰Û¢ Currently pursuing a Bachelor‰Ûªs or MBA degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, Communications, or related majors ‰Û¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite including Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel ‰Û¢ Excellent writing skills ‰Û¢ Flexible with the ability to change direction as new business needs arise ‰Û¢ People oriented and excellent communication skills ‰Û¢ Detail-oriented and eager to learn ‰Û¢ Comfortable with taking the initiative to solve problems Join our CareerHub SHARE THIS JOB Twitter Facebook LinkedIn Email Living and Working in Palo Alto Explore more about this opportunity's location. Intern, Marketing Research Location: San Francisco Job Code: 867 # of openings: 1 Description Intern, Marketing Research   Silicon Valley-based PR and influencer marketing firm Voce Communications (Vo-chay), a Porter Novelli company, is currently seeking an Intern to join the Strategic Planning, Analytics, and Research team. The ideal candidate will have a background in quantitative analysis, be able to effectively communicate strategic insights and collaborate on multiple projects simultaneously.   Tasks & Responsibilities:   Executes quantitative and qualitative research projects to support brand marketing goals Collect, manipulate, and analyze raw data from a variety of sources including social media, digital platforms, conversion data, or other first-party client data. Create easy-to-understand presentations and data visualizations in PowerPoint and dashboards. Generate weekly and monthly reports that synthesize data across multiple platforms. Maintain and document consistent data analysis methodology. Keep current on cultural trends and appropriate measurement techniques.    Skills & Experience: Demonstrated ability to think strategically and objectively. Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret a variety of types of data. Ability to clearly communicate insights from raw data internally and to external clients. Advanced Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint proficiency. Strong writing and presentation skills.   Education: BA/BS degree with quantitative experience or equivalent work experience.  Porter Novelli is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in any aspect of employment against any person on account of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, disabled veteran, veteran of the Vietnam era or other eligible veteran, age, marital status, veteran status, or physical or mental handicap unrelated in nature and extent to an individual's ability to perform a job or any other characteristic protected by the employment discrimination laws in any state or political subdivision in which Porter Novelli does business. Post A Free Job For Companies For Talent Jobs Log in Marketing Summer Internship (Atlanta, GA) Vonage | Salary not disclosed | Intern | Atlanta, Fulton County, GA, US Apply Save Job MarketingTechnologyInternshipVoIPsales forecastingchannel salesGeorgiaTerritory PlanningCloud CommunicatonsAtlanta Vonage is a leading provider of cloud communication services for consumers and businesses. Providing a robust suite of feature-rich residential and business communication solutions that offer flexibility, portability and ease-of-use across multiple devices designed to meet the needs of a wide range of customers. Our goal is to transform how people connect by challenging the status quo and finding a better way. We believe friends, families and businesses should be able to communicate easily and affordably. The purpose of this internship program is to provide a consistent ‰ÛÏOne Company‰Û internship experience across all locations during a 10-12 week period. Our interns are given real project-based work in order to gain real-life experience as well as develop their careers. The goal is to provide an environment where college students are not limited to learn but also to innovate. The Ideal Candidate Who You Are: Thinker Challenger Innovator Pioneer Do People Describe You As‰Û_: A person who has the ability to take direction but also able to make decisions A systematic thinker who has demonstrated problem solving skills A person who has the ability to effectively work under tight deadlines and manage multiple projects independently A hands-on, energetic and motivated self-starter possessing a keen attention to detail and follow through Goal oriented and focused on producing the best quality work at all times Be Part of the Innovation Project: All the interns act as if they are in a Start Up Company where you will work in groups across the globe to answer a question of tactical importance to the organization At the end of the program, teams have the opportunity to present to a panel consisting of our senior leadership team members Winner gets to win awesome prizes! Specific Requirements, Skills & Education Current undergraduate students with a GPA of 3.0 or higher Ability to work in our Atlanta, GA office between June ‰ÛÒ August 2017 Our Culture Working at Vonage is fun! If you are someone who likes to disrupt technology and problem solve, then you've come to the right place. Here at Vonage, we work in tightly knit teams at a rather fast pace environment. The technology industry is constantly changing which means we need to be ahead of the game in order to create new ways to communicate for our customers. The open environment enables our employees to be creative and resourceful when coming up with new ideas to make Vonage a clear leader in cloud communications. Help defend democracy by joining our team of dedicated staff working to create a political culture of transparency and facts. In this age of fake news, media bias, and political drama, Vote Smart ensures that citizens have access to the tools that they need to make educated political decisions.Vote Smart, a non-partisan/non-profit political research organization, is seeking a Membership and Outreach Assistant. This position entails primarily data management and communications duties.Vote Smart, founded by Presidents Carter, Ford, and other national leaders, is a non-profit national research center that collects accurate and factual information on over 40,000 political leaders. Our goal is to empower voters with access to a vast library of reliable, nonpartisan, factual political information. Watch our video to learn more: https://votesmart.org/about#videoDuties include:Daily data entry of incoming donations, assisting with depositing incoming moneyDaily, frequent correspondence with Vote Smart members & ambassadors over phone & emailAssisting with thank you mailings and fulfilling materials requestsMaintaining media contact database, monitoring press clips, making pitch calls to the mediaHelping write and edit external communications to members & publicMaintaining press clips and making pitch calls to mediaHelping create content for social media & email marketing; assisting with photography, graphic design as neededResearching and assisting with new outreach campaignsCreating weekly newsletter to current staff and internsWriting/ editing blog posts on current political/ legislative newsAssisting the Development & Communications Director as neededSkills desired:Attention to detail and accuracy , especially when handling incoming money & data entryStrong interpersonal skills and an ability to externally communicate courteously & effectivelyEffective time management skills; ability to keep oneself organized without supervisionStrong writing and editing skills; an ability to set politics aside & write in a non-partisan mannerAn understanding of structure of print, radio media; comfort in making cold-calls to members of the media when necessaryA basic understanding of design for creating social media and email marketing graphics.An interest and understanding of politics and current political issues; a commitment to nonpartisanshipPhotography, graphic design, and videography experience is a bonus; applicants are encouraged to bring any personal equipment & software with them.Benefits : Health Insurance after 60 days. Paid Time Off and a salary increase to $22,223 after 6 months.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $21,000.00 /yearRequired education:Bachelor's

Vyral Marketing is offering a full or part-time paid hourly marketing internship opportunity in San Diego, CA for college students or graduates that guarantees you learn key, real-world internet marketing and client building skills with a $50,000 base salary plus bonus and health insurance job offer upon successful completion.Includes a daily group intern breakfast Monday-Thursday @ 7:30 - 9am with the CEO to review your past day's work, a weekly one-on-one meeting for goal setting, three hours of classroom time every Friday morning with the CEO from 7:30 am - 12pm for training, and two hours a day of self-paced skills building.Learn more about the internship here: http://www.getvyral.com/internshipYou will also be assigned about one book per week to complete so you build a solid foundation of marketing knowledge. Hours are flexible but morning breakfast and Friday training is mandatory.You will be paid for all training . Successful interns will join our team on all-expense-paid trips including flights, hotels, and meals so you too can attend industry events and conferences to meet and network with clients. This is a six-month intense, learning-based paid hourly internship to fast track you as an internet marketing professional.Upon your hire, you will do the marketing for eight of our most valuable strategic clients to help them get new customers with Facebook, YouTube, email marketing, landing pages, and more. Applicants must have a 3.5 or higher GPA and demonstrate the necessary passion, work-ethic, leadership, and commitment to be successful.You’ll join three to four peers during your 6-month internship (3-4 interns per semester). Each of you will have a job offer upon successful completion (you are not competing).Fall/Winter Paid Marketing Internship - Applications are due by June 20th, 2017.The next 6 month paid marketing internship group starts July 10th, 2017 and ends December 22nd, 2017.ResponsibilitiesWork with our strategic clients to create messaging and offers their prospective customers wantDesign landing pages with features, benefits, testimonials, and an offer to make sales or generate leadsDrive traffic to the landing page with Facebook, YouTube, and Google Display advertisingWrite compelling email messages to get people in the client's database to visit the landing pageUpdate the client daily on the status of their marketing with your proactive adviceResearch and update potential future clients on your work to bring new business to the firmRequirementsPursuing or obtained a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or a related field (3.5+ GPA)Possess excellent written and verbal communication and customer service skillsPossess creativity, flexibility, variety, and growth potentialShould be open-minded, a fast learner, enthusiastic, and adaptable.Ideally have a 5 year outlook for the position upon hire and plan on staying in San DiegoWho We are Looking ForWe hire only academic achievers and people passionate about internet marketing, who are also “intrapreneurs”, meaning you ultimately want to build a big career and a big business inside Vyral Marketing. Ideal candidates have a grand vision for their career, high income goals, and know what they want to do professionally. Ideally you see yourself as future business leader and builder, indispensable to growth. Ideal candidates have a proven record of accomplishment and personality that’s results-oriented, decisive, and take-charge. You’re a fit for the job when you have the knowledge, skills, track-record, and personality to get the job done and you’re a cultural fit within our organization. You find solutions, share goals, know what you want (or are actively searching to know what you want), push those around you to do better, are continually raising the bar, demand to be associated with talent, and talk the language of action and results. During your interview, we are probing for patterns in your behavior and thinking, how you act, and how you process ideas and problems. If you are an assertive, people oriented, impatient, flexible, independent, intense, and optimistic person who takes a logical approach to problem solving, can rapidly deal with many problems at once, and can naturally hold, manipulate, and think about three dimensions in your mind (spatial visualization), you fill be at home here where you can be yourself every day and thrive.
